Title: US extends anti dumping duty on mushrooms
Content: NEW DELHI: The United States has extended the anti dumping duty on Indian preserved mushrooms for another five years. The move would impact domestic exporters as the US is a major export destination for India. Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, and Jammu Kashmir are the major states which are producing the commodity. Solan in Himachal Pradesh is popular as 'Mushroom City of India'. The US International Trade Commission (USITC) has " determined that revoking the existing anti dumping duty orders on preserved mushrooms from Chile, China, India, and Indonesia are likely to lead to continuation or recurrence of material injury within a reasonably foreseeable time. "
Intersection: Haryana, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, India, Chile, Indonesia, China, Jammu Kashmir
Union: US, NEW DELHI, Haryana, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, India, United States, Chile, Indonesia, China, Jammu Kashmir, Solan

Title: Civic survey in Kaushambi after HC order
Content: GHAZIABAD: Civic authorities and police conducted a survey of the Kaushambi area on Wednesday to ascertain the status of various public facilities and civic amenities. The survey was conducted by a team comprising officials of the Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation (GMC), the Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) and the Ghaziabad police, in accordance with an order of the Allahabad high court. A two judge bench of the high court, comprising Chief Justice DY Chandrachud and Justice Suneet Kumar, had on February 13 ordered the inspection of the public amenities while hearing a public interest litigation plea filed by residents under the banner of the Kaushambi Apartments' RWAs (KARWA). " The municipal commissioner shall, together with a team of officials, conduct a personal inspection in co operation with the secretary of the petitioner. During the course of the inspection, the team of officials, including the Municipal Commissioner, shall be apprised of the exact grievances of the residents in order that suitable instructions can be issued for necessary remedial steps," said the order.
Union: Ghaziabad, Kaushambi, Allahabad, GHAZIABAD, Kaushambi Apartments

Title: Diu: Disproportionate assets case against Diu municipal body chief
Content: AHMEDABAD: The anti-corruption wing of CBI-Gandhinagar registered a case of disproportionate assets against president of Diu Municipal Council Hitesh Solanki and his wife Yashwanti Solanki. CBI sources said that income of Solanki was found to be 133.32% more than his known sources of income. The acquired disproportionate assets are worth Rs73,60,220. CBI conducted searches on the premises of the accused which led to recovery of incriminating documents. Hitesh Solanki, who became a councillor in 2006, is president of Diu Municipal Council since 2011. He lives with his and brother's families at Ghogla-Diu.

Title: Good films make my day, says octogenarian film buff
Content: PANAJI: It s not 82 year old Kamla Patani's walking stick, but sheer determination that takes her ahead. A member of Prabhat Chitra Mandal, Mumbai, and a regular at Mumbai Academy of Moving Image (MAMI) festival and the Asian Film Festival, the film buff is attending Iffi in Goa for the second time. What's even more impressive is the fact that the grandmother of three took a train from Mumbai to Goa all on her own. I'm very fond of films and I know I won t get the opportunity to watch these films anywhere else, the retired social worker says, adding that one should not be conscious or have any fear while venturing out alone. Having lost her husband at a young age and moving to Mumbai thereafter where she raised her children against all odds, have taught her a thing or two about courage.

Title: No cheap power for Vid industries yet
Content: Nagpur: The state government seems strangely unable to decide on the question of providing cheaper power to industries in backward regions of Vidarbha and Marathwada. The matter came up before the state cabinet on Tuesday at its meeting in Mumbai and a decision was deferred again. After deliberations, the cabinet decided to refer the matter to another sub committee headed by energy minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule to study the matter further and to recommend rates at which power would be supplied to industrial units in the two regions. Bawankule told TOI it was a positive development and a step towards fulfilling the government's promise of providing power at affordable rates to industries in the two regions. He said a committee headed by Nagpur divisional commissioner had prepared a report after studying situation in neighbouring Chhattisgarh where cheaper power rates were attracting investors even from Vidarbha.

Title: Pak was born in a state of confusion: Hoodbhoy
Content: HYDERABAD: Pakistan is a nation that was born in confusion, is still in confusion but will move out of it in the future hoped eminent nuclear physicist and author Pervez Hoodbhoy who has, for long, been a champion of the secular state notion. Though I know that it is not welcome in my country and people who deviate from the notion that it is an Islamic state, are looked upon disapprovingly, I strongly feel that what we need to head towards, Hoodbhoy reiterated. He was speaking at a session on Reimagining Pakistan, organised as part of the ongoing Hyderabad Literary Festival. The Pakistani scholar was joined by Venkat Dhulipala, a US based professor, historian and writer, on the dais. The conversation about a secular Pakistan, took both the authors back in history to the time of partition and Jinnah fight for a separate Muslim nation.

Title: Provide information on corrupt officials: ACB
Content: Bengaluru: Realizing that corruption cannot be prevented without effective public involvement, the Anti Corruption Bureau has launched a Facebook page and a website to seek people's participation. According to the site (http://acb.karnataka.gov.in), the complainant's identity will be kept confidential and the person will be rewarded by the ACB for tipoffs. The complaints, however, will have to be filed in writing. The site contains details such as office addresses and contact numbers of district ACB officials. The ACB also launched its Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/AntiCorruptionBureauKarnataka.

Title: Infant, thrown by aunt, critical
Content: KANPUR: On Tuesday, the doctors attending 18 day old baby boy, who was, on Monday allegedly thrown off the high rise hospital building, stated that the infant is still undergoing treatment at the ICU of the hospital. " The next 24 hours are very crucial for the child. We are trying our best," said a senior doctor at Shyam Maternity and Childrens hospital in Kalyanpur. The baby was found entangles in iron net some 30 ft below the roof.

Title: Another student approaches Times Of India
Content: NAGPUR: Following TOI report on a BCA student losing an academic year over delay in revaluation results, a final year student of KDK College of Engineering approached TOI saying he is unable to appear for campus recruitment because his revaluation results are yet to be declared. The student Aniket Naukarkar said, Today, a good company came for campus placements but I couldn t apply for it. No student with a live backlog paper is allowed to take part in campus recruitment drive in our college. I need the revaluation result as soon as possible to get a good job. I had failed in two subjects in my fifth semester.

Title: M S University's Footprints X6 ends on a musical note
Content: Vadodara: Curtains fell on the three day Footprints X6 with audience being enthralled with musical performance of singer Ash King. Sunday was a final day for all the activities under the banner of 'Technotron', 'Quest' and 'Concorenzza'. A number of technical activities and online events related to various engineering streams were held as part of the fiesta. Every year, budding engineers of MS University's Faculty of Technology and Engineering organize a series of technical and non technical events in Footprints, the national level technical festival. Rolling squares was the entertainment segment of Footprints that witnessed musical and comedy performances on the closing day.

Title: Contemporary Malayalam fiction losing readers?
Content: KOCHI: If the Kochi international book festival 2016 is an indicator, it can be said that readers have lost enthusiasm for contemporary Malayalam fiction. The disregard shown by new writers in depicting prevailing socio cultural and political realities of contemporary Kerala has resulted in a situation where readers are moving away from fiction, said organizers. We have been observing that most writers in Malayalam are not keen on contextualizing routine realities. Instead they place characters in alien cultures. When writers in other languages can portray life around them in a better way , why would someone read a Malayali's book?

Title: Bhopal jailbreak: ADG prison removed, ex RAW officer Sudhir Shahi takes charge
Content: BHOPAL: Sudhir Shahi a 1988 batch IPS officer of Madhya Pradesh cadre, who spearheaded infamous Vyapam scam investigations as state s chief of Special Task force (STF) leading to more than 2,000 arrests in three years, has been asked to take charge as additional director general of police (ADG) as Sushovan Benarjee was shunted from the position following Monday's jailbreak incident by SIMI activists. Shahi was in RAW for several years before his return to the state as ADG STF. Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said former DGP Nandan Dubey will investigate the incident. Madhya Pradesh police and its Anti terrorist squad (ATS) had gunned down all eight SIMI members within eight hours after they escaped from Bhopal Central Jail killing a head constable and scaling the wall of the so called high security premises using bed sheets on Monday morning. They were cornered and gunned down 10 km away from the prison in city outskirts in a joint operation of city police, counter terrorist group (CTG) and an ATS team led by IPS officer Sanjeev Shami.
Union: BHOPAL, Madhya Pradesh, Bhopal, Bhopal Central Jail

Title: NMC to revive radio maxi cab project
Content: NAGPUR : Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has planned to revive the radio maxi cab project stuck for last 16 months due to various reasons. Now, the project will be known as taxi cab. The general body is likely to approve the revision in the meeting organized on March 4. Mayor Pravin Datke has organized the general body meeting for March in the first week itself. The city transport committee has tabled the proposal related to the taxi cab project.

Title: Foggy morning greets national capital, 42 trains running late
Content: NEW DELHI: The national capital today woke up to a foggy morning and poor visibility following which at least 3 international flights were delayed and one domestic flight from/to Delhi was cancelled even as 42 trains were running late and four were rescheduled from here. A Railway official also said that at least 6 trains were cancelled due to fog. Meanwhile, according to the Delhi International Airport Limited, which manages operations at the Indira Gandhi International airport here, flight operations were also affected on Friday. Atleast, 3 international flights were delayed and one domestic flight from/to Delhi was cancelled due to foggy weather.
Union: Indira Gandhi International airport, Delhi, NEW DELHI

Title: CPM seniors seek action against Bengal unit for tie up with Cong
Content: New Delhi: Over 70 of the CPM central committee's 101 members voiced their opposition to the electoral alliance with Congress in West Bengal at its three day meeting here that concluded on Monday. They said it was a clear violation of an earlier decision of the central committee, with some of the alliance's opponents even demanding action against the party's Bengal brass. Ultimately, the blame has fallen on the CPM politburo for failing to implement the committee's decision of not having any truck with Congress. Now, the politburo has been authorised by the committee to ensure that the political tactical line adopted at the party's Vizag congress last year is adhered to. A politburo team will soon travel to Kolkata to apprise the state leadership of the decision as well as ensure its implementation.
Union: West Bengal, New Delhi, Kolkata, Vizag, Bengal

Title: CM raps civic bodies over dengue menace
Content: Kolkata: Reacting to newspaper reports on the rising dengue cases, especially in the city's northern fringes, chief minister Mamata Banerjee on Friday sent out a stern message to the Bidhannagar, South Dum Dum and Dum Dum municipalities, ordering them to check the outbreak. TOI on Thursday reported the high prevalence of dengue in the South Dum Dum civic areas the incidence has been so high that 15 out of a 25 member family in the area have been diagnosed with dengue. " The number of dengue cases are increasing in those areas. I have read it in newspapers and you have to be careful about that. Why is it rising in these areas?
Union: Bidhannagar, South Dum Dum, Dum Dum, Kolkata

Title: Rau cracker unit blast: 2 arrested
Content: Indore: Police on Saturday identified the person who was charred to death in the major fire which took place in a cracker unit Rau on Friday. Deceased has been identified as Daya Ram, 40, and was working in the factory when the fire broke out. " Daya was disabled and died in the fire. His body was handed over to family members after post mortem examination," said Vijay Sisodiya, Rau police station in charge. Meanwhile, two of the accused against whom a case was registered under relevant sections of the IPC were arrested on Saturday. "

Title: Cong releases booklet on Modi govt's 'failures'
Content: AMRITSAR: National spokespersons of the Congress Jaiveer Shergill and Charanjit Singh Sapra released a booklet titled '2 Saal, Desh Ka Bura Haal' here on Saturday to counter the campaign by the Narendra Modi led NDA government at the Centre on completion of two years of its tenure. Talking to newspersons, Shergill alleged that the two year report card of Modi government was full of red lines as it had failed in each sector. " The government came with the promise of taking everyone along for overall growth, 'sabka saath sabka vikas'. but it has now adopted anti people and anti farmer policies. The slogan now seems to be 'Aapna Saath Baaki Sabka Vinaash'," he said adding that no segment of the society was happy with the Union government.

Title: Krishna bounty floors Anantapur farmers
Content: VIJAYAWADA: Gorla Keshava Reddy, a groundnut farmer from Yerragunta village in Rapthadu mandal of parched Anantapur district, had never seen so much water in his life. Standing at the Krishna western main canal near Prakasam barrage here on Monday, Keshava Reddy gushed, " So much water!" " It feels so good to see water. From where I come the land is parched. I am 48 years old and I have never seen this much quantum of water," Keshava Reddy exclaimed.
Intersection: Anantapur, Prakasam barrage, Rapthadu mandal, Yerragunta, Krishna
Union: Anantapur, Yerragunta, Prakasam barrage, VIJAYAWADA, Rapthadu mandal, Rapthadu, Krishna

Title: Another YSRC MLA joins TDP sixth cross over in a week
Content: Vijayawada: YSR Congress president Y S Jaganmohan Reddy suffered another setback today as one more MLA from his camp crossed over to the ruling Telugu Desam, this time from Prakasam district, taking the total number of MLAs who have crossed over in the last one week to six. Yerragondapalem MLA P David Raju met TDP supremo and chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu at the latter's riverfront residence here today and " returned" to the party. " I had served in TDP for 24 years previously. I have returned to the party in deference to the wishes of my constituency people," David Raju told newsmen, emerging out of Chandrababu's residence. David Raju had been the chairman of Prakasam Zilla Parishad and also an MLA when he was in the TDP.

Title: 7 armed militia members surrender
Content: Visakhapatnam: Seven armed militia members of Korukonda Area Committee of CPI (Maoists) surrendered before the Chintapalli police on Tuesday. The surrendered naxals were K Chnnabbai (32), K Ramamurthy (52), V Ganga Raju, (43), V Rambabu (31), V Krishna Rao (21), K Baddu naidu (36) and Korra Ravi (26) of Cheruvuru village in Balapam panchayat of Chintapalli mandal. They surrendered due to pressure by the village heads and counselling by the police. According to the Visakha Rural police, the surrendered naxals were involved in occupying coffee plantations of APFDC at Balapam panchyat in 2011, famine raid on Balapam MPTC house in 2013, and attack on the house of Gemmeli Sanjeeva Rao in Veeravaram village in 2015.
Union: Veeravaram, Cheruvuru, Chintapalli mandal, Balapam, Visakha, Chintapalli, India, Korukonda, Visakhapatnam

Title: LGBT film hits Censor Board hurdle
Content: Kannur: 'KaBody Scapes' the controversial Malayalam feature film by new York based film maker Jayan Cherian, has been denied clearance by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC), saying that it contained " sensitive gay scenes, use of derogatory words against women and vulgar dialogues" . But the activists belonging to the LGBT community in the state, with whose support the film was made, feel that the certification agency refused the clearance because the authorities are afraid of the politics projected in the film. According to the director, the agency did not give a rejection letter and instead they referred it to the revising committee. " Now I will have to wait for the convenience of the revising committee, and also I have to pay another Rs 9,000 apart from the Rs 30,000 I spent as fee and screening expenses," he said. This film, which gained international attention when it was premiered in the 'BFI Flare: London LGBT Film Festival' last month, is the result of the hard work of the people associated with the LGBT movement in Kerala and the authorities are afraid of their voice being heard, said Jayan, adding that the agency was hesitant because the film also criticized the Hindutwa politics.

Title: Let Tourist Taxi Owners Association control hotel room fares
Content: PANJI: North Goa Tourist Taxi Owners Association (NGTTOA) has slammed the Travel and Tourism Association of Goa (TTAG) president Savio Messias recent comments about moving the high court for implementation of digital meters for tourist taxis. Speaking to TOI, Calangute based vice president of the NGTTOA, Ravindra Vengurlekar, said the TTAG should first look into the functioning of their member hotels which hike up room tariffs arbitrarily. Messias should first control the hoteliers and then talk about taxis. They should also control the price of air tickets which also shoot up to unreasonable levels, besides the tour operators who charge exorbitantly for tours, Vengurlekar said. He said that they are ready to install digital meters provided all their pending demands are met.

Title: Nanjangud to New York, fest draws the new age puppeteer
Content: BENGALURU: They are the ancient storytellers. Aged 250 300 years old, these wooden dolls dip into mythology to narrate the tales of Sathya Harischandra and Gaya Charitra of Arjuna and Krishna, over the centuries. But their repertoire is not confined to history they also narrate the plight of women suffering from dowry harassment and family planning in modern day India. The Sri Rameshwara Krupa Poshita Yakshagana puppetry troupe, based out of Halkere village near Nanjangud near Mysuru, claims a rich background. It took part in the Dhaatu International Conference on 'Exploring the Classical Roots and Living Traditions of Puppetry'. "
Union: Halkere, BENGALURU, Nanjangud, New York, Mysuru, India

Title: Forex scam accused held
Content: Panaji: The economic offences cell (EOC) of the Goa police arrested Kamakshi Forex Private Limited owner Nilesh Raikar after he surrendered on Friday morning. For the last eight days EOC sleuths were on the lookout for Raikar for alleged duping over 384 persons of over 25 crore. PI Shivram Vaigankar told TOI that Raikar surrendered before the EOC at around 11am on Friday and he will be produced before the judicial magistrate first class on Saturday to seek police custody. During the initial investigation, the accused had said that he was in Goa and staying at Ponda. The accused was taken for medical examination at Goa Medical College and Hospital.

Title: Income tax department tracks 18crore black money in Jagraon
Content: LUDHIANA: The investigation wing of the income tax department, Ludhiana, unearthed undisclosed income of Rs 18 crore from a Jagraon based firm which is one of the leading manufacturers of rice bran oil in the country. The development comes in the wake of a raid which was conducted by the principal director of investigation Parneet Sachdev and joint director of income tax Rohit Mehra on the said firm and one more company about three weeks ago in which hundreds of income tax officers were engaged in the investigation. According to sources in the department, officials during the investigation came across many discrepancies in firm's accounts which pointed towards concealing of actual profits by the firm. Initially the owners had refused to accept the fact, but later made the disclosure themselves when the department found substantial evidence in support of their claim. Department will now initiate proceedings under the income tax Act under which penalty and taxes will be levied on the firm.

Title: AIFB to stay with AIADMK, but will seek more seats
Content: Madurai: All India Forward Bloc general secretary Debabrata Biswas has said the left party will stick to the alliance with the AIADMK in the coming assembly elections in the state, but will seek more seats this time. Addressing the press here on Wednesday, Biswas said the party had formed a team to identify constituencies where it can contest. Biswas participated in a state level meeting of AIFB here. The AIFB has chalked out plans to contest in the four states and the Union territory Puducherry where elections will be held this year. In the last assembly elections in Tamil Nadu, the AIFB allied with the AIADMK and won the Usilampatti constituency.
Union: Madurai, Usilampatti, Tamil Nadu, India, Puducherry

Title: Muhurat for govt, what about staff?
Content: Amaravati: Chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu's decision to have a house warming ceremony at Velagupudu village in the wee hours of Monday has put the local farmers on cloud nine as they are hopeful of more development in the capital city area. However, the explanation put out by the state government and it citing the absence of auspicious days for next six months as the main reason for such a hurried inauguration of the secretariat has sowed the seeds of doubt amongst the staff. Many employees are mulling whether to shift to the new location during an 'inauspicious period'. Even though they are all supposed to move into the new secretariat by June, the ruling dispensation has done precious little to motivate the lot who are already upset over unnecessary preference being given to irrational things such as Muhurat.

Title: Changes in film certificate norms soon: Arun Jaitley
Content: NEW DELHI: Information and broadcasting minister Arun Jaitley on Thursday said film certification norms will have to be liberal and " some very radical changes" will be announced over the next few days. The film 'Udta Punjab' was handed down 89 cuts by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) and its makers have appealed in the Film Certificate Appelate Tribunal (FCAT). FCAT is expected to hear the case on June 17 when the film was scheduled for release. The filmmakers have also approached the Bombay high court for relief. Speaking on the 'Udta Punjab' controversy, Jaitley said, " I won't say it is overboard.

Title: NGOs announce Rs 1 lakh reward to nab tiger poacher
Content: Nagpur: The Wildlife Protection Force of Vidarbha (WPFV), a federation of NGOs, has announced a Rs1lakh reward to nab dreaded tiger poacher Kuttu Chhiyalal Rajgond, who has been absconding for the past seven months. The WPFV has also demanded that CBI issue a red corner notice against Kuttu. A memorandum in this regard has already been submitted to chief minister Devendra Fadnavis and forest minister Sudhir Mungantiwar. Taking to newsmen, president of WPFV Mahesh Nimbarte said Kuttu had escaped from Bhandara police custody on January 21. Kuttu was arrested in April 2015 amid high drama from Biruhali in Katni (MP).

Title: History sheeter sets ablaze parents' houses, booked
Content: Rajkot: A 27 year old man was booked for allegedly torching two houses owned by his parents in Popatpara area of the city on Tuesday late night over an ongoing domestic dispute. Jiluben Dal (55), a resident of Krishna Nagar in Popatpara lodged a complaint against her son, Imran Dal, accusing him of setting ablaze her two houses in Krishna Nagar I and Krishna Nagar V. Imran is a history sheeter with about half a dozen cases related to bootlegging and rioting pending against him. In her complaint, Jiluben stated that on Tuesday around 11pm, she came to know that Imran had set afire her house in Krishna Nagar I society. " I immediately rushed there and called in fire brigade," she added. Jiluben further stated that when she was on her way to lodge a complaint against her son, Imran reached her other house in Krishna Nagar V society and set that too on fire. "
Union: Rajkot, Krishna Nagar, Popatpara, Krishna Nagar I, Krishna Nagar V

Title: Third, BJP finds comfort in stats
Content: NEW DELHI: While it got the highest chunk of votes among the parties contesting the municipal bypolls in Delhi, BJP still ended in the third position with just three seats after AAP and Congress took five each. But the party is optimistic because it seems not only to have retained its support base, but even improved it from 32.3% in the 2015 assembly poll to 34.11% now. Whatever the portents contained in the statistics, the party, as its fretting members will tell you, urgently needs a leadership that will see it through in the municipal elections that are just 10 months away. They blame the leadership for the party's gradual decline in Delhi: In 2007, BJP had won 9 of the 13 seats that had gone to polls on Sunday. This slid to 7 in 2012 and now to three.

Title: 9 day ritual to purify temple corrupted by Dalits
Content: DEHRADUN: The Silgur devta temple in Pokhri village of the Jaunsar Bawar region, which witnessed unruly scenes on Friday when a mob attacked Rajya Sabha MP Tarun Vijay with stones for entering the premises with Dalits, would now conduct a long purification ritual of nine days. A temple official said that they needed to conduct purifying poojas since the temple had been desecrated by the entry of Dalits. The dev doli of Silgur Devta that was brought after a gap of 36 years to our village was defiled. The devta is upset. We will now undergo a nine day purification rituals to appease it, said an official of the temple samiti.
Union: Pokhri, Jaunsar Bawar, DEHRADUN, Silgur devta temple

Title: Food vendor shot dead over personal enemity
Content: NOIDA: A 20 year old food vendor was shot dead in Dankaur area on Wednesday around 9pm. The deceased, Guddu, was returning to his village, Bilaspur, after selling his goods. S P Singh, SHO Dankaur, said that Guddu used to sell food in a local market. He had some personal enmity with another vendor named Danish. They fought with each other on Wednesday night.

Title: Govt seeks citizens inputs on Kelkar report
Content: NAGPUR: The state government has decided to seek input of citizens on Vijay Kelkar report on regional imbalance in Maharashtra. The decision was taken on Friday following the demands raised by legislators during discussion on the report held in the recently concluded budget session. The government had constituted a seven member cabinet subcommittee on January 17 to study the report and submit its opinion to the cabinet. The subcommittee's brief was to suggest to the cabinet the recommendations of the Kelkar committee that should be accepted. Following demands by MLAs and MLCs, the government has expanded the subcommittee by inducting five new members.

Title: Senior citizen killed in accident
Content: PUNE: A senior citizen died in a hit and run case on Thursday afternoon, while two other victims of identical accidents succumbed to injuries the same day. The senior citizen, Satyavan Sopan Bhujbal (76) of Bhujbal Vasti died after being knocked down by a vehicle at Wakad. The Hinjewadi police said the accident occurred around 12 noon when Bhujbal was walking towards his house. Bhujbal died on the spot. Another hit and run accident victim, Gaus Shaikh (28) of Latur, succumbed to injuries on Thursday.
Union: PUNE, Latur, Wakad, Bhujbal Vasti, Hinjewadi

Title: Sort out poll duty issue: HC to govt
Content: Chandigarh: Taking up a bunch of petitions filed by teaching staff of Haryana colleges against assignment of elections duty in the panchayat elections " below their status," the Punjab and Haryana high court has asked the state government to sort out the issue immediately. HC, while passing these orders on January 14, observed that since polls for first phase of panchayat polls were already over and schedule for second phase released, the state should take appropriate decision while assigning them duties for the third phase as per their status. The third phase of panchayat polls will be held on January 24. Justice Deepak Sibal passed these orders after disposing of a bunch of petitions filed by lecturers/assistant professors, working in various government colleges or government polytechnic colleges of the state. The petitioners informed the HC that they were assigned duties as presiding officers for the panchayat polls.

Title: Exploitation turns Chambal into a rivulet
Content: Bhopal: After unprecedented heatwave conditions and exploitation of water, Chambal River the lifeline of north western Madhya Pradesh has shrunk into a thin rivulet in Madhya Pradesh and can simply be crossed by jumping across the water. Home to endangered species of gharial (Gavialis gangeticu) and dolphins, the shrinking river has forced them to survive in deep pools in the downstream of the river. About 900 metre wide river has shrunk to just 12 feet, said Rishikesh Sharma, research officer at National Chambal Ghariyal Sanctuary in Morena. " This is a critical stage for any river. It is the result of intense heatwave in Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh leading to evaporation of water besides over exploitation of the the water body," Sharma who has been working for the conservation of gharial in the sanctuary. "
Union: Madhya Pradesh, Bhopal, National Chambal Ghariyal Sanctuary, Morena, Rajasthan, Chambal River, Chambal

Title: New MU Act to be cleared in Nagpur session: Vinod Tawde
Content: NAGPUR: In some good news for the state run universities, Maharashtra education minister Vinod Tawde assured that much awaited Maharashtra Public Universities Act, 2015 would be cleared in ongoing winter assembly session only. It would pave way for conducting Board of Studies (BOS) elections, which were not conducted since August last year. Speaking to TOI on first day of session, the minister also stated that joint committee of both houses comprising 25 members cleared the draft bill after suggesting some amendments. The amended draft bill would be tabled before the assembly within a couple of days, he said. Sources closed to the minister informed that the draft copy, after it was cleared by the joint panel of legislature, was available for studies to the members of both houses.

Title: Gujarat govt may include sarpanches in SIR authorities
Content: AHMEDABAD: To promote frictionless implementation of special investment regions (SIR), the state government has decided to include panchayat members and sarpanches of affected villages in SIR authorities. The state industry mines department has proposed a new bill to make necessary amendments in the SIR Act for this purpose. The bill will be tabled in the upcoming budget session in the state assembly. The move to give local village leaders a say in SIR is aimed at preventing confrontation with farmers at a later stage. Currently , farmers have moved court against SIR in Dholera.

Title: Dalit rights advocate Pravin Rashtrapal passes away
Content: Gandhinagar: Rajya Sabha Member of Parliament (MP) and senior Congress leader Pravin Rashtrapal (77) passed away in New Delhi on Thursday following a heart attack. Rashtrapal was known as a key dalit rights activist from Gujarat. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, senior Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi, Ahmed Patel, Bharatsinh Solanki and Shankersinh Vaghela expressed their condolence to Rashtrapal's family. His last rites will be performed at Ahmedabad after a brief condolence meet at Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee (GPCC) office on Friday. Rashtrapal, an Income Tax officer, joined politics after his retirement.

Title: Gurudev's connect with Sangam city
Content: Allahabad: The 'pocheesh Baishakh' date on Bengali calendar will be celebrated in the city on Sunday as 155th birth anniversary of Rabindrantah Nath Tagore, whose Nobel winning collection of poems 'Gitanjali' was first published here, besides around 90 other literary pieces. Tagore visited the city five times and even staged a play here. " Before he first visited the city in 1900, Tagore had penned his stories 'Aparajita', 'Jyatamashai', 'Shahjehan', 'Chanchala', 'Tajmahal', and 'Balaka Chhabi' and he met Chintamani Ghosh proprietor of Indian Press which published around 87 of his literary work," said Shankar Chatterjee, general secretary, Bengali Social and Welfare Association (BSCA). Tagore preferred Allahabad for good quality of printing. On his second visit in 1905, Tagore stayed at residence of Ramanand Chattopadhyay, principal, Kayastha Pathshsla.

Title: Gold, cash stolen from techie's home
Content: Cash and gold were stolen from a locked house at Madhichiyam in Madurai city police limits. The incident came to light on Friday morning when the house owner, an IT employee, returned home. Gold jewellery weighing seven sovereigns, an LED TV, a mobile phone, silver articles and 5,000 in cash were found stolen, police sources said. The thieves entered the house after break opening the front door, they revealed. Based on a complaint from the house owner, Dinesh Kannan, a case was registered at the Madhichiyam Police Station.

Title: RTI activist murder a message to silence city whistleblowers
Content: Chennai: The brutal daylight murder of RTI activist J Parasmal (59), who would target the Chennai Corporation and TANGEDCO, has shocked other activists in the city. They see the murder as a way to silence protesting voice and hence curtailing dissent. " The killing of activists is a warning to common citizens not to fight wrongdoers. The message is simple just be silent spectators to all the wrongs taking place right in front of your eyes," said RTI activists D Gopalakrishnan and R Vadivelu. Citizens are an integral part of democracy and it is their responsibility and right to point out flaws in the functioning of the government, the duo said.

Title: Farmer, son die as bus hits auto
Content: BENGALURU: A farmer and his son, who were on their way to sell coriander at the City Market, were killed after the goods autorickshaw they were travelling in was hit by a Telangana State Road Transport Corporation bus on Ballari Road on Friday morning. Nyathappa, 50 and Shivappa, 26, from Gollu village in Chikkaballapura district, cultivated coriander and sold them at the City Market. They'd transport the produce to the city in their goods vehicle. Shivappa was at the wheel when the bus from Telangana, which was coming towards Bengaluru, rear ended his autorickshaw at 4.50am near Vidyashilp Circle. The father-son duo died on the spot; the bodies were shifted to Yelahanka government hospital.
Union: Ballari Road, Telangana, BENGALURU, Yelahanka, Chikkaballapura, City Market, Bengaluru, Vidyashilp Circle, Gollu

Title: Heavy rainfall alert for AP
Content: VISAKHAPATNAM: Moderate rains ranging from 7.6 mm to 35.5 mm lashed many places in the coastal districts on Friday under the influence of the active southwest monsoon as well as the low pressure system that formed over the Bay of Bengal near the coast between north coastal AP and south coastal Odisha, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Vizag airport received rainfall of 60 mm. Similarly, the city (Waltair) received moderate rainfall of 42 mm. Similarly, the city (Waltair) received moderate rainfall of 42 mm.
Union: Bay of Bengal, Waltair, AP, VISAKHAPATNAM, Odisha, India, Vizag

Title: State, HPCL to sign reworked Barmer refinery MoU today
Content: JAIPUR: Rajasthan government will sign a reworked MoU with Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd (HPCL) on Tuesday for the Rs 43,129 crore Barmer refinery in the presence of Union minister of state for petroleum and natural gas Dharmendra Pradhan and state chief minister Vasundhara Raje. After junking the MoU signed by the previous Congress chief minister Ashok Gehlot on the grounds that the deal was in favour of HPCL, Raje renegotiated the terms and conditions. A source in the state mines and petroleum department said that as per the new mechanism, the state viability gap funding for 15 years will come down to Rs 1,123 crore instead of Rs 3,736 crore annually estimated earlier. He said the project has also gone through reconfiguration because of which the cost of the refinery along with a petrochemical complex has gone up from the earlier estimates of Rs 37,229 crore to Rs 43,129 crore. The Barmer refinery will be the first in the country to produce BS VI standard fuels.

Title: Jat: Opposition blames Haryana govt for its failure to deal with Jat stir
Content: CHANDIGARH: The opposition parties on Wednesday blamed the ruling BJP for its failure to deal with Jat protesters in Haryana. The third day of the state assembly budget session witnessed heated arguments over the stir adjournment motion. The INLD staged a symbolic walkout as chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar sought support from all parties and gave a detailed account of measures taken by the state government in dealing with the Jat issue. Independent legislator Jai Parkash, former speaker Raghbir Kadian (Congress) and leader of opposition Abhay Chautala (INLD) asked the government to set up a panel of MLAs for a direct dialogue with the Jat leaders. "This is a political issue, hence, public representatives too should deal with the agitators so that an amicable solution can be worked out", said Kadian.

Title: Man files plea in High Court to pave way for neighbour to donate kidney
Content: AHMEDABAD: A Rajkot based businessman who has suffered renal failure approached the Gujarat high court to clear the legal hurdles after his neighbour expressed willingness to donate her kidney to him. Ramesh Vagadiya suffers from end stage renal disease and urgently needs a kidney transplant. His immediate neighbour, Anjana Pandhi, agreed to donate her kidney out of compassion, he claims. Vagadiya made an application on January 21 to the authorization committee for permission to receive the organ from his neighbour, but the committee sat tight over his application. The norms for organ donation are more stringent, under section 9(5) of the Transplantation of Human Organs and Tissues Act, when the donor is not a blood relative of the recipient.

Title: KJ murder case: Cops to scan mobile data
Content: Mohali: After having made no progress even after nine days of the murder of veteran journalist K J Singh and his mother Gurcharan Kaur at their residence in Mohali, police is now checking all the phones that were active between 1am to 5pm in Phase 3B2, Mohali on the night of the double murder on September 23. Regular mobile phone users who had switched off their mobile phones or those who were talking to some unknown person during the said time period will come under the scanner depending on the circumstances, age group and other factors, said a senior officer of Mohali police while explaining that anybody's privacy in the area can be invaded as the investigations continue. Local police has claimed that someone had seen two persons scaling the wall of the house at the night of the double murder. The person would be asked to describe the faces for preparing a sketch. Police have ruled out robber as a motive behind the murder.

Title: PMC polls: Posters to introduce candidates to voters
Content: PATNA: In a first, the Patna district administration has taken it upon itself to introduce the Patna Municipal Corporation election candidates to the electorate. The administration will put up posters in every ward. The posters will contain a brief profile of the candidates of the ward, DM Sanjay Kumar Agarwal told TOI on Monday. The posters, to be put up two days after poll symbols are allotted, will have the name and the symbol besides details of educational qualification and criminal history, if any, of the candidates. Agarwal said the administration has taken this initiative because candidates are not allowed to put up posters after the implementation of model coded of conduct.

Title: NDA Commandant Kler tries his hand at camera at film institute
Content: Pune: Air Marshal Jasjit Singh Kler, Commandant, National Defence Academy, became the first Commandant of the prestigious academy to visit the Film and Television Institute of India on Saturday when he, accompanied by cadets and senior officers, laid a wreath at the replica of the Amar Jawan Jyoti India Gate at the institute. The construction of a replica of a national monument to mark Independence Day or Republic Day and to invite citizens to join in, is a recent trend. On Independence Day last year, a Jallianwala Bagh memorial was set up, while on the Republic Day this year, a replica of the Cellular Jail in Andaman and Nicobar Islands was the talk of the town, said a statement issued by the FTII. A team led by Ashutosh Kavishwar, head of the department, art direction and production design, worked on the project for over a month. Air Marshal Kler, Brigadier Bency P Jacob and Brigadier Zubin Minwalla visited the camera and sound departments and Prabhat Studio where they were briefed by department heads.
Union: Pune, India, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Jallianwala Bagh

Title: Clean Kushak nullah on war footing: Delhi HC
Content: NEW DELHI: Irked at the delay in desilting of a south Delhi drain despite repeated directions, the high court on Tuesday ordered authorities to take up the work on a war footing . The court ordered the AAP government's PWD to finish desilting of the Kushak nullah near South Extension part II and ensure there is no waterlogging in the area. A bench of Justices S Muralidhar and C Hari Shankar termed as unacceptable the September 2017 deadline given by the public works department (PWD) to complete the entire work, including wrapping up Barapullah flyover construction. The bench wondered why the PWD undertook desilting when monsoon is about to arrive, rather than finish the work much in advance. It decided to appoint a local commissioner to monitor the progress in the work and also inspect the area to verify various claims made by the PWD.
Union: NEW DELHI, South Extension part II, Barapullah, Delhi

Title: Ludhiana: Mystery shrouds 50 year old's death
Content: LUDHIANA: A day after a 50 year old woman died under mysterious circumstances in Malsiyan Bajan, cops are awaiting her post mortem report to act in the case. The police said no one from the family of Amar Kaur, 50, a resident of Malsiya Bajan, Jagraon, has lodged a complaint. Kaur was found dead on Saturday evening. As her family was taking the body for cremation, a villager called up the police, saying she was murdered. Ludhiana (rural) senior superintendent of police (SSP) Upinderjeet Singh said, " Civil hospital doctors conducted the post mortem examination on Sunday.

Title: Haji Ali trust slapped with Rs 1. 9 crore bill for cell towers
Content: MUMBAI: The city collector has asked the Haji Ali Dargah Trust to deposit Rs 1.9 crore as its share of half the income generated by allowing mobile towers on its premises. Abdul Sattar Merchant of the trust recently rushed to Bombay high court to challenge the demand. The HC vacation bench is scheduled to hear the plea for urgent intervention on Wednesday. The trust, established a century ago for religious and charitable purposes, obtained the land it occupies in south Mumbai from the collector on lease. In 1920-21 the trust became a lessee of over 4,000 sq yards of land, which included two pieces.
Union: Mumbai, Bombay, MUMBAI, Haji Ali Dargah

Title: One of 4 held for gold fraud duped bank similarly
Content: PUNE: A police probe revealed that a suspect who had duped a city based cooperative bank of Rs 4.59 crore by securing loans by passing off fake gold ornaments as genuine ones, had also borrowed Rs 4 lakh from a private bank using the same method. Following a complaint by the bank official from its Shankarsheth Road branch, the Khadak police booked 35 year old suspect Amar Bhosale of Undri, who is currently lodged in the Yerawada prison. We will arrest Bhosale after seeking his custody from the prison, said police sub inspector B V Chapaitkar. The police have already arrested Bhosale and three others for duping the cooperative bank. During the probe, the suspects admitted to borrowing loan from a private bank using the same method, Chapaitkar said.
Union: PUNE, Yerawada, Shankarsheth Road, Yerawada prison, Khadak, Undri

Title: Man stabs wife, 23, to death in Tambaram police station
Content: CHENNAI: A 26 year old man stabbed his wife to death with a screwdriver, to the horror of policemen and others, in the Tambaram all woman police station on Monday evening. Investigating officers said Ganapathy launched into the attack the first homicidal assault by a member of the public in a Chennai police station after the Tambaram police summoned him and his wife G Gowri, 23, for questioning in connection with a case the woman had filed. " The attack appears to be premeditated because Ganapathy carried a concealed screwdriver," an officer said of the contract sanitation worker with the Tambaram municipality. Witnesses said Ganapathy appeared to be calm till he saw his wife. When Gowri entered the station and headed toward staff in the reception area, he started shouting, pulled out a screwdriver and stabbed her on the chest and neck.

Title: Video shows man choke dog to death with his foot
Content: NOIDA: A video clip surfaced on Saturday showing a middle aged man choking a mongrel to death by pressing down on the animal's neck with his foot near a marketplace in Noida. All the while, the man had a smile on his face. His wavering gait suggests he was drunk. The man is believed to be in his mid 40s and was wearing a traffic marshal's uniform. This happened on Friday night near Sadarpur Bazar in Sector 45.

Title: Civic election 2017: High pitch campaign hints at fierce fight
Content: The Shiv Sena has thrown all its might into winning back the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) that it lost to Raj Thackeray led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena in 2012. In the February 21 battle of ballots, the MNS has faded but the BJP has turned from a friend to a foe. The BJP and the Shiv Sena, which still share ties at the Centre and the state, have decided to contest elections separately and are engaged in a fierce electoral battle to win a majority in the 122 member Nashik civic body. As the poll campaign concluded on Sunday, a vast section of voters seemed a tad inclined toward the Shiv Sena rather than the BJP. Unlike the Sena, the city unit of the BJP is fighting hard to cope with huge internal squabbles as a section of the leaders are unhappy with the manner in which the party leadership distributed tickets.

Title: Pavement on sale: Action rare, but hawkers don't care
Content: KOLKATA: Police drives against hawkers are rare. It is even rarer for police to slap cases against hawkers. But to file five cases in a span of three days against hawkers encroaching roads is unprecedented. Acting on a TOI expos on pavements and sections of roads around New Market being sold for lakhs, Kolkata Police conducted raids at Bertram Street, Jawaharlal Nehru Road and Rafi Ahmed Kidwai Road to drive hawkers off the carriageway , and has even registered FIRs. The five cases were filed between Wednesday and Friday , but that has not been a deterrent.
Union: KOLKATA, Jawaharlal Nehru Road, Rafi Ahmed Kidwai Road, Bertram Street, Kolkata, New Market

Title: Decide on flat buyer's cop cover in 24 hours
Content: MUMBAI: The Bombay high court vacation judge Justice K K Tated on Friday directed the Bandra police to decide, within 24 hours, if a plea is made for police protection by a flat buyer who alleged that he was receiving threats from persons claiming to be associated with a politician and being asked to vacate the premises. Rohit Kandhari, who said he had purchased a large flat last November in a building developed by Kamala Landmarc group had moved the HC. His counsel Rajiv Chavan sought directions to get the police to register a first information report (FIR) against the politician and two others who claim to be his associates. Chavan said, Kandhari had on December 26 received a call from his manager that many men from the office of the politician were attempting to enter his office and dispossess him . He was informed that they were recovering money for the politician whom Kamala Landmarc owned money.

Title: IT raids on Lalu's aide house, institutions
Content: PATNA: The income tax (IT) sleuths on Thursday raided the premises and educational establishments of former RJD MLC Anwar Ahmad, a close aide of RJD president Lalu Prasad, and unearthed around 50 bank accounts with transactions of nearly Rs1 crore. All the bank accounts have been frozen. Anwar, popularly known as Kebab Mantri during Lalu Rabri regime, owns two schools one at Phulwarisharif (Mother s International School) and another at Jagdeo Path besides one BEd college (Mother s Institute of Technical Academy) in Phulwarisharif area. He is also the chairman of Awami Bihar Co operative Bank situated at Sabzibagh. Raids were also conducted on the Jagdeo Path residence of Parvez Alam, one of Anwar's employees.

Title: Anti Romeo cops humiliate duo, suspended
Content: GHAZIABAD: An embarrassed Ghaziabad police has suspended three policemen who had on Friday detained a boy and a girl, both college students, during an anti Romeo drive at a park in Navyug Market. The harassment of the students showed why there is a fear that the campaign to stop sexual harassment of women on roads is being turned into a moral policing exercise by some policemen. The three suspended cops assistant sub inspector Mehtab Singh, constable Vineet Kumar and driver constable Pankaj Kumar face a departmental inquiry, a police officer said. The suspension came hours after a video of the students being detained was posted on social media and shared widely through messaging platforms. The three cops, in PCR van 1347, had spotted the boy and the girl sitting on a bench inside the park on Friday morning.

Title: garlic purchase: Government begins purchase of garlic in five Kota centres
Content: Kota: For the relief of farmers (garlic cultivators) and to defuse the proposed Congress demonstration in favour of farmers in Kota on June 16, the state government on Wednesday through RAJFED has begun garlic purchase at Rs 3,200 per quintal under Market Intervention Scheme (MIS) at Bhamashaha Mandi in Kota and four other purchase centres in Baran, Jhalawar, Bundi and Pratapgarh districts. The garlic purchase at MIS price will continue till July 12. Cooperative minister of the state Ajay Singh Kilak, in a press note released here said the purchase of garlic under Market Intervention Scheme has been kicked off today at purchase centre in Kota's Bhamashaha Mandi. RAJFED has set up five purchase centers Kota, Hjalawar, Baran, Bundi and Pratapgarh districts. Garlic in quantity of 3000 metric tons, 3500, 2000, 1000, and 500 metric tons of garlic would be purchased at MIS of Rs 3,200 per quintal at purchase centers respectively in Kota, Chipabarode of Baran, Khanpur of Jhalawar, Keshoraipatan of Bundi and Pratapgarh districts.
Intersection: Kota, Bundi, Jhalawar, Bhamashaha Mandi, Baran, Pratapgarh
Union: Pratapgarh, Keshoraipatan, Kota, Khanpur, Bundi, Hjalawar, Bhamashaha Mandi, Baran, Jhalawar, Chipabarode

Title: Sister boyfriend held for 12 yr old murder
Content: KHAGARIA: The Khagaria police have claimed to have cracked the case of murder of Sunny Kumar, son of Turo Ram of Nayagaon village under the Parbatta police station area, with the arrest of Avinash Kumar alias Meenu Kumar and Gautam Kumar of the same village on Friday. The 12 year old was killed on March 30. Khagaria SP Anil Kumar Singh said police exhumed Sunny body from a banana orchard in Baharkhal Bahiyar on April 27. Our investigations revealed Sunny sister had an affair with Avinash, and the boy had found them in a compromising position. Fearing he might spill the beans, Avinash along with Gautam kidnapped and killed the boy, the SP said.
Union: Baharkhal Bahiyar, Khagaria, Nayagaon, Parbatta, KHAGARIA

Title: Sports get a leg up in Jaipur district
Content: JAIPUR: In a bid to promote sports in the district, a multipurpose sports training centre will be set up in Jaipur and playgrounds developed in all gram panchayats of the rural parliamentary constituency. This was announced by Union minister of state for information and broadcasting Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore in the city on Sunday. He said a team from each panchayat would participate in Mahakhel Kabaddi Tournament to be held from January 29 to February 11 in his constituency. The tournament will inaugurated at Manoharpura under Shahpura block. Women s teams would also be encouraged to participate in the event, he said.

Title: GCCI sets up cell to tackle trade disputes
Content: Ahmedabad: The Gujarat Chamber of Commerce & Industry (GCCI) on Tuesday announced the establishment of the Arbitration, Mediation, Conciliation and Alternate Dispute Resolution Centre (GCCI-ADRC) that will provide quick and hassle-free redressal to industry disputes. The industry body plans to rope in a team of 40-50 including retired high court and Supreme Court judges, senior advocates, and technical industry experts. The centre will help in speedy redressal of conflicts, informally and confidentially without going to court, said Bipin Patel, the president of the GCCI. Apart from judges and advocates, industry experts will also be consulted to ensure fair redressal to all parties. Once a dispute is resolved, the decision of the mediation cell can be challenged in court, after necessary compliance.

Title: Consider 2012 TAT result for teachers merit list: HC
Content: AHMEDABAD: Gujarat high court on Thursday ordered the education department to consider 975 candidates who cleared Teacher's Aptitude Test (TAT), for teacher's eligibility in secondary and higher secondary schools, in 2012 while preparing merit list. These candidates have cleared TAT for three consecutive years 2011 to 2013. But when the merit list was prepared, their result obtained in 2011 was considered by citing rules framed on April 18, 2012 Teachers of Government Secondary and Higher Secondary Schools (Procedure of Selection) Rules. The candidates argued that they had appeared for TAT in May 2012 and result was declared in June 2012. This result, they said, should also be considered while preparing merit list because the rule says that TAT result is valid for five years.

Title: Drink driving deaths down 60 in Bihar
Content: NEW DELHI: Prohibition seems to have helped Bihar rein in deaths caused by drunk driving, with the number of such fatalities dropping 60 between 2015 and 2016. The liquor ban came into force in the state in 2016. Meanwhile, the number of fatalities caused by drunk driving almost doubled in Uttar Pradesh in the same span from 1,404 in 2015 to 2,716 in 2016 according to the government s latest report on road accidents. Bihar is one of three states that saw fewer deaths, injuries and accidents caused by drunk driving in 2016 than the year before, the others being Jharkhand and Haryana. However, West Bengal, Punjab, Puducherry and Odisha are among the states and Union territories where the number of deaths in drunk driving related accidents have gone up.
Intersection: West Bengal, NEW DELHI, Odisha, Haryana, Punjab, Puducherry, Bihar
Union: West Bengal, NEW DELHI, Odisha, Haryana, Punjab, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, Puducherry, Bihar

Title: Allegations of dowry are baseless, claims Hoble
Content: Panaji: BJP vice president Anil Hoble, who has been accused of harassing and assaulting his daughter in law Sweta for dowry, was questioned by police on Thursday. An FIR was registered against Hoble, wife Sandhya and son Milind following a complaint by Sweta's mother Suchitra Shirodkar, on Wednesday. Shirodkar alleged that her daughter was harassed and assaulted by the Hoble family for dowry. A case was registered against the trio under sections 498A (husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), 323(punishment for voluntarily causing hurt) and 506 (ii) (criminal intimidation) read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). Hoble has claimed that the allegations against him and his family are baseless.

Title: Punjab to shut down Khadi and Village Industry Board
Content: PATIALA: Punjab government has decided to shut down the Khadi and Village Industry Board (KVIB) under which it had facilitated setting up over 50,000 production units in the state over the last several decades. The entire staff of the board from all 22 districts has been asked to report in Chandigarh as the government contemplates shifting them to state industries department. There are 32 staff members, including clerks and peons, who are working for the board. Around 80 posts in the board had been lying vacant. Punjab is the first state to shut down khadi board constituted under the Parliament Act 1955.

Title: Parents move education department over autistic son's admission
Content: MUMBAI: Parents of a 16 year old student from a Juhu school have written to education minister Vinod Tawde alleging their mildly autistic son has been detained in Class IX and is being forced to either repeat the year or leave. The parents have alleged they were not allowed to see the boy s final exam report card on the basis of which the school took a re examination, which he failed. The boy, a student of Arya Vidya Mandir School since 2004, was recently detected with mild autism. The school did not allow us to see the report card but sent us a note that our son would have to appear for a re examination in April because he had not performed well. The child failed the re test.

Title: Sikh militancy: Punjab wants to give guard of honour to K P S Gill in Delhi
Content: CHANDIGARH: Punjab Police senior IPS officers have decided to request their Delhi counterparts to allow them to give a ceremonial guard of honour to 'Supercop K P S Gill, who died in Delhi on Friday. Gill, known for crushing the Sikh militancy in Punjab in the late eighties and early nineties, will be cremated in Delhi on Saturday. Even though Gill is a 1958 batch IPS officer of Assam Meghalaya cadre, for five years in early 90s Gill was the celebrated and revered hero of Punjab Police, often a supercop to his colleagues. A platoon of Punjab Armed Police (PAP) and a senior officer with a decorated hearse van have been kept ready to go to Delhi once all the clearances are granted. This is the full guard of honour we want to give to our hero.

Title: Bhartiya Kisan Union leader arrested: BKU leader arrested for disrupting CM's rally
Content: KANPUR: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Niranjan Rajput and his aide Vishakha, accused of creating ruckus with hundreds of activists at the chief minister s rally in Hamirpur on December 15 and clashing with police on December 18 at Lahurimau village in Ghatampur, were arrested on Wednesday night. The farmers led by Rajput have been demanding better compensation for their land acquired by the government for the thermal power plant and also a rehabilitation package. Union minister of state for power, coal and new renewable energy Piyush Goyal had laid the foundation stone of the 1,980 mw thermal power plant in Ghatampur on October 20. The power plant is scheduled to begin in 2020. Neyveli Lignite Corporation Ltd and Uttar Pradesh Rajya Vidyut Nigam have formed a joint venture for the power plant.
Intersection: KANPUR, Ghatampur, Lahurimau, Hamirpur, Uttar Pradesh
Union: KANPUR, Ghatampur, Hamirpur, Lahurimau, Uttar Pradesh

Title: UP elections 2017: To counter lotus in UP, Mohammad Azharuddin marigold flicks for Congress
Content: JAUNPUR: The collar of his kurta turned upwards and two buttons undone, when India cricket team former captain Mohammad Azharuddin touches his lower lip with his tongue, this eastern Uttar Pradesh town goes weak in the knees. With the same nonchalance that was characteristic of him during post ceremony speeches, he looks calm on the stage with Congress party Jaunpur candidate Nadeem Javed. The popular leader enjoys proximity with the party vice president Rahul Gandhi. The hysteria over Azhar is so much that he is forced to quip, Bhai araam se, mujhe roadshow se pehle run out mat kara dena . An uproar follows.

Title: Govt gives winter break till January 16, schools clueless
Content: GURUGRAM: A day after the Haryana government announced that all government and private primary schools in the state would remain closed till January 16 in the wake of intense cold weather conditions, schools in the city seemed to be clueless about any the directive. Most schools in the city are due to resume lower primary classes from Monday (that is January 16) at the end of the scheduled winter vacation, while several have restarted classes for students above 4th standard from January 9. Asked whether the government directive has reached the private schools in the city, Sunita Nagpal, principal of DPS Sushant Lok, told TOI on Saturday, We have not got any such direction from the government yet . Most importantly we don t even know if they have mandated us to close the school or just advised. If latter is the case, then I don t think we would be inclined enough because already the sun is out and the timing of lower primary classes is from 9am when cold is not that intense, she added.

Title: Kolkata Chinese vow fresh start on New Year
Content: KOLKATA: The first sound you hear as you head towards Bentinck Street are those of measured thumping. It is followed by co ordinated beats of drums. As the music reaches its crescendo, a giant lion mask springs to life and starts prancing to the beats. Welcome to India oldest China Town, which greeted the Chinese New Year on Saturday with the same gusto and spirit as it has been doing for several decades now. Only, there are not enough members of the community left to conduct the lion dance for the 20 odd clubs.
Union: KOLKATA, Bentinck Street, India, China Town, Kolkata

Title: Agni Sridhar: Agni Sridhar accuses police of assault
Content: BENGALURU: A day after getting interim anticipatory bail, underworld don turned social activist Agni Sridhar, who was detained for allegedly sheltering rowdy sheeters and suspects in an attempt to murder case, was discharged from a private hospital on Saturday. He was admitted last week after he complained of chest pain. During a raid on February 8, machetes and four illegal fire arms were recovered from Sridhar's house in KS Layout. Police have also arrested nine persons. On Saturday, a furious Sridhar spoke to the media outside the hospital, and accused police of manhandling him.

Title: Centre proposed MoU with Vedanta Foundation raises eyebrows
Content: NEW DELHI: A proposed memorandum of understanding between the Centre and controversial political donor Vedanta Foundation for the construction of 4,000 anganwadis in public private partnership (PPP) model has raised eyebrows. The proposed MoU is expected to be signed between the ministry of women and child development (WCD) headed by Maneka Gandhi and the foundation on Wednesday at the inauguration of one of the centres in Sonepat, Haryana. The Vedanta Foundation, run by London based Anil Agarwal, is not new to controversy. Agarwal has been subject to a probe by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in connection with alleged irregularities in the disinvestment of Hindustan Zinc Ltd (HZL). However, recent reports suggest that the CBI is contemplating closing the preliminary enquiry for lack of evidence.

Title: At Rs 4,070, safari in Pench, Umred costlier than Tadoba
Content: Nagpur: At Rs4,070 per entry for wildlife safari, Umred Karhandla, Bor and Pench seem to have become costlier than premium Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve (TATR). This is likely to create tourism imbalance in region as many would prefer to visit only Tadoba. All the tiger reserves, sanctuaries and national parks in the state are set to open from Sunday. A review of entry fee by TOI found that Pench has revised its rates and has made Bor Tiger Reserve and Umred Karhandla Wildlife Sanctuary as high end parks. At both places, tiger sightings are not regular like Tadoba.
Union: Umred Karhandla, Bor, Pench,  Tadoba, Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve, Nagpur

Title: Independence Day in campuses: Students ring in the chimes of freedom
Content: Freedom from fear is the freedom I claim to you, my motherland. Rabindranath Tagore's lines from the poem Freedom is still relevant as India approaches its 70th Independence Day. As every year brings its own set of concerns, be the patriarchal system or stringent norms of the society, we listen to the youth, who are the future of the country, for the kinds of freedom they are seeking. To voice our opinions Vijayasree RM, University of Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram. Freedom should imply the freedom for youth to ideate and express their views. We are more aware of what is happening around us and have clear opinions.

Title: MGNREGA must focus on poor regions
Content: NEW DELHI: Job guarantee scheme MGNREGA should be focussed more on poor areas where residents figure high on deprivation index, according to an expert committee of the rural development ministry. In its report on better targeting of welfare schemes, the Sumit Bose committee has recommended that MGNREGA should be tilted towards regions where there is a greater concentration of landless labourers or people are suffering from multi dimensional deprivations, in order to bring about change in the socio economic landscape of the poor regions of the country . The suggestion seeks to recalibrate the job scheme instead of letting it follow a uniform approach irrespective of development gaps between regions. According to the committee, the Cluster Facilitation Teams, which aid the scheme's implementation, should be strengthened to better capture the demand for work in panchayats with higher concentration of deprived households and landless manual labour. For observers, the recommendation is interesting as it treads the risky territory where it could be seen as seeking to limit the job scheme to poor areas by cutting out blocks identified as developed.

Title: Not so NEET: Only 1 from Tricity in top 100
Content: CHANDIGARH: Only one student from the Tricity has ranked in the top 100 in the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET), the result of which was declared on Friday. Panchkula resident Bhupin Thakkar, a student of Government Model Senior Secondary School, Manimajra, scored 671 marks to secure all India rank (AIR) 76 in the exam for admission to private and government medical colleges. He had secured AIR 1,081 in exams for admission to AIIMS. His father Ved Prakash is a serviceman in Bharat Electronics Limited and mother Krishna Devi a housewife. The family resides in Panchkula's BEL Colony .
Union: BEL Colony, CHANDIGARH, Panchkula, India, Tricity, Manimajra

Title: Manoj Khatri given charge of assistant estate officer
Content: CHANDIGARH: In a reshuffle in the UT administration, Manoj Khatri, joint commissioner, municipal corporation (MC), has been given charge of assistant estate officer (AEO). The post of AEO was earlier held by Virender Singh, who has been repatriated to Haryana. Khatri has also been assigned additional charge of secretary, State Transport Authority (STA), nodal officer of state agriculture marketing board and joint secretary. Saurabh Mishra, IAS officer, has been given the charge of additional commissioner, municipal corporation, in addition to his own duties relieving Khatri. The charge of the post of additional secretary housing, has been given to PCS officer Amit Talwar, who is also additional secretary estates cum urban planning /metro, with immediate effect relieving Rajiv Kumar Gupta, PCS officer, of the charge.

Title: Indian Navy: Jointmanship necessary among forces
Content: Chief of Naval Staff Admiral Sunil Lanba said in Pune on Tuesday that jointmanship among the forces was necessary as no single service can win a war on its own. He also asserted that the Indian Navy has increased its footprint in the Indian Ocean Region (IOR) and was ready to counter any contingency. Lanba, who was the reviewing officer at the passing out parade of the 132nd course at the National Defence Academy, advised the young cadets to cherish the true spirit of jointmanship that has been instilled in them at NDA. Remember, no single service can win a war on its own, he said. Later, speaking to media on the sidelines of the event, Lanba said the government was studying the report submitted by the Lt. Gen. D. B. Shekhatkar committee which has recommended, among other things, the setting up of an integrated command for effective functioning of the Indian armed forces.

Title: The hot debate: How smart is Pune?
Content: The past year has seen Pune undergo tremendous development as part of its Smart Cities Mission journey. It will soon have its own metro system, while the police will launch their CitySafe app, using which women can alert officials and share their location with the police control room at the push of a button. But what about the fact that Pune dropped by two ranks in the Ministry of Urban Development list of clean cities, this year? What about the fact that outstation students often get fleeced when they take rickshaws, because they cant rely on the public bus system?

Title: International Yoga Day: Over 100 farmers block NH in anger against government policies
Content: LUDHIANA: As International Yoga Day was being celebrated across the country on Wednesday, more than a hundred farmers from various parts of the state gathered under the banner of Bharatiya Kisan Union (BKU) Lakhowal at around 11. 45am on Wednesday to do yoga on the Delhi - Ludhiana national highway near Manjhi Sahib (close to Khanna) to voice their anger against the central government. The farmers also took off their shirts as a mark of protest against the anti farmer policies of the government. They raised slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the state government, and blocked the national highway, staging a protest sit in for around an hour before dispersing. On the one hand, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is encouraging people to perform yoga, but on other hand, farmers who do yoga throughout the year and produce foodgrains for the country are being killed.
Union: Lakhowal, Ludhiana, LUDHIANA, Delhi, Manjhi Sahib, Khanna

Title: Water meter in Cuttack a pipe dream
Content: CUTTACK: The state government had three years ago announced to install water meters in all households in Cuttack to ensure judicious use of water. But the project is yet to see the light of the day. The water meters were supposed to address the problem of loss of revenue due to wastage of water. The government had plans to install water meters in a phase wise manner in residential and commercial facilities. Meanwhile, public health engineering organisation (PHEO) officials claimed that they had floated tenders for selecting agencies to carry out installation of water meters in households in Cuttack, but authorities have asked them to suspend the work for the time being. "

Title: 1 held for kidnapping finance firm executive
Content: GURUGRAM: An staffer of a transport finance company was kidnapped and thrashed in Begampur Khatola on Thursday after he was called to collect payment. On Thursday, when Mukesh Kumar, an executive of Sri Ram Finance company, went to one Roop Singh's house to collect the payment, one Gaurav came there and took him to another house, where he was held hostage and threatened at gunpoint. An FIR under sections 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 342 (wrongful confinement), 506(criminal intimidation) and 34 (act by multiple people for common intention) of the IPC and sections 25,54 and 59 of the Arms Act was registered and Gaurav was arrested.

Title: Its united saffron VS muted Congress
Content: The Louis Berger International Inc bribery scam heated up the political stage in Goa and provided much needed ammunition to politicians and mainstream political parties during the last 10 days to whip up a storm and wrest political mileage. Just as the opposition was planning to put the Laxmikant Parsekar government on the mat in the Goa assembly from starting Monday, for its alleged acts of omission and commission, the BJP could not have asked for anything better to hit back at the beleaguered Congress showing signs of recovery. The opposition had lined a host of corruption related issues to expose the government, be it power, industries, tourism and approvals in principle and others for the golf course, marinas, or land for central organizations. The latest opposition salvo is aimed at industries minister Mahadev Naik over the alleged misuse of government funds. It is good enough ammunition for the BJP to embarrass the Congress if they try to raise issues of corruption, said a BJP leader.

Title: Partha: Partha felt he had failed his father, say officers
Content: KOLKATA: It was in December 2015 almost six months after the city got a peek into the Robinson Street horror house that Shakespeare Sarani police filed a charge sheet against Partha De. Fourteen months have passed in between, the charges have not yet been framed. But more than the grisly details and its incoherent protagonist, cops remember the case for volumes of forensic and psychological test evidences it involved. In the 220 odd pages of the chargesheet, 65 pages were the reports of Partha's psychological tests. He was a sober man.

Title: GRP personnel: No GRP at Charbagh railway station to man Holi rush
Content: LUCKNOW: Government Railway Police personnel have returned from election duty but have yet not resumed duty at Charbagh railway station. As a result, there was no security at the entrance and exit points or other places, and passengers expressed concern in the light of alert following recent terror attack in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, and encounter in Lucknow. At 3pm on Tuesday, TOI found a rush of passengers returning after Holi celebrations. There were so many passengers on all platforms but no GRP personnel was overseeing the area, not even at the three entry exit points fitted with metal and body detectors. Passengers waiting for their trains were also seen sitting in chairs meant for GRP personnel deployed at entry and exit points.
Union: Madhya Pradesh, Lucknow, Charbagh, LUCKNOW, Ujjain, Charbagh

Title: Another R amp B engineer caught with disproportionate assets
Content: GUNTUR: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) conducted simultaneous on properties belonging to Superintending Engineer of Roads Buildings department at various places in Guntur and Krishna districts on Thursday. Under the directives of Andhra Pradesh ACB DG, RP Thakur, ten teams were formed and they began the raids at around 6 am in the morning. Both movable and immovable disproportionate assets worth several crores were unearthed. The accused officer identified as Karampudi Veera Raghavendra Rao (54) works at the Guntur circle office. During his service, he purchased seven plots across Mangalagiri, Guntur and Machilipatnam towns.
Union: GUNTUR, Mangalagiri, Krishna, Andhra Pradesh, Guntur, Machilipatnam

Title: Save sparrow event in zoo today
Content: PATNA: The Patna zoo will be the place to be on Sunday for house sparrow lovers as several events are lined up to spread awareness about the bird, whose number is believed to be fast dwindling. House sparrow was declared Bihar's state bird on April 16, 2013. On the eve of World Sparrow Day, the Patna zoo administration in association with The Times of India has organised an event for flying a dummy sparrow through a drone in the zoo at 11am on Sunday. An ongoing photography contest will also conclude on the day. The photography competition began on March 13.
Union: Patna, Patna zoo, India, Bihar, PATNA

Title: Blue Whale: Tamil Nadu student ends life cops probe Blue Whale link
Content: MADURAI: A 19 year old college student hanged himself at his house on Wednesday, purportedly after taking up the dreaded Blue Whale challenge. Police said Vignesh of Mottamalai in Kalaignar Nagar had pricked his left forearm to draw the image of a whale and written 'Blue Whale' using blue ballpoint pen. A note in Tamil found near the body read: 'Neela thimingalam idhu vilayattu alla vibareetham. Oru murai ulle ponal veliye vara mudiyadhu', roughly translating into 'Blue Whale is not a game, it is dreaded. Once you enter, there is no escape'.
Union: Kalaignar Nagar, Tamil Nadu, Mottamalai, MADURAI

Title: Trader's body found hanging in Itaunja
Content: LUCKNOW: Body of a trader who had been abducted was found hanging in a room in the under construction railway colony in Itaunja on Thursday. The incident came to light when the victim's son reached the colony in search of his father and found him hanging with both hands tied behind and a roped tied around his neck. According to police, Ram Babu (40) of Newada village of Itaunja lived with his wife, son Ankit and other children. He left home after receiving a call around 5pm on Wednesday by did not return. The family contacted him on his cell number but failed to connect.

Title: ACB trap GHMC official for taking bribe
Content: HYDERABAD: Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) sleuths trapped a GHMC official while he was accepting Rs 30,000 bribe from a complainant at Kamat Hotel in Lakdikapul on Tuesday. K Kishan Rao, deputy director of Urban Bio Diversity,West Zone, GHMC, was caught red handed when he accepted the bribe from E Ashok Goud , a civil contractor, for recording details of park development work done by the contractor and forwarding it to the director for sanction of bill. Rao was arrested and he would be produced before the ACB court on Wednesday.
Union: Lakdikapul, HYDERABAD, Kamat Hotel, West Zone

Title: Youth stabs girl over unrequited love, commits suicide
Content: TRICHY: Upset over unrequited love, a 24 year old man stabbed a 17 year old Plus 1 student with a knife in Alunthalaippur village near Lalgudi in Trichy on Saturday morning. Fearing arrest, he ended his life by hanging from a tree in the area. The girl is receiving treatment at the Mahatma Gandhi memorial government hospital (MGMGH) in Trichy.
