M Vasuki from Alunthalaippur village had gone to attend nature's call early Saturday morning, when she was interrupted by C Manikandan from the same village. The youth forced her to accept his love.

Title: Army mistakes cracker for grenade, opens fire 1 killed
Content: SRINAGAR: A crowd of miscreants threw stones at an Army patrol in Beerwah, Budgam district, on Friday afternoon, and hurled a firecracker towards the Armymen. The soldiers, who mistook the bang of the cracker for a grenade, responded with gunfire, wounding two youths, Tanveer Ahmad and Ibrahim Wani. Tanveer, 22, succumbed to injuries at a hospital while Ibrahim was undergoing treatment, the police said. J K police have registered a case against the counter insurgency 53 Rashtriya Rifles unit in connection with the killing, police sources said. The violence was triggered by separatists asking people to observe a shutdown and march to the UN observers office to protest against frequent killings of civilians .

Title: Delhi budget: Infrastructure allocation 20 per cent less than last year
Content: NEW DELHI: In the past two years, the government focus has shifted away from roads and bridges to schools and hospitals. This is clear from this year allocation to Public Works Department, which is about 20 less than the amount earmarked in last year budget. Sources claim this fund is sufficient for ongoing projects, especially since last year allocation had to be revised midway after several projects were not accorded clearance. We have been given what we had asked for. PWD barely took up any new project last year or received clearance for future projects.

Title: Cop who made sleaze calls to woman constable transferred
Content: CHENNAI: The assistant commissioner of police who was caught on tape making sleazy comments to a woman constable has been transferred to the city control room as vacancy reserve (VR), considered an obscure posting. Commissioner S George issued the order on Monday after reports of the ACP behaviour appeared in the media on Sunday. The ACP, a 1987 batch direct recruit sub inspector on the verge of retirement, was considered clean until the victim circulated his comments among her friends and they went viral on WhatsApp. The matter was later posted on social networking sites like Facebook. A senior police officer summoned to his office the ACP who maintained that he was innocent and that the voice in the tape was not his.

Title: Sacked over nurse s death, AIIMS doctor cries foul
Content: NEW DELHI: The National Commission for Scheduled Tribes (NSCT) has written to the Union health secretary and AIIMS director for personal attendance on April 19 regarding sacking of a senior resident. A complaint was filed by the senior resident (SR) of anesthesia department after he was sacked for alleged medical negligence that led to the death of a nurse. The SR, who belongs to Angami tribe in Kohima, Nagaland, has alleged that the committee that probed the incident was biased against him, a charge denied by the institute. I have been discriminated for being a minority belonging to a scheduled tribe, and I was made a scapegoat in the whole situation to protect connected people who were at fault. How can I be held responsible for a patient that was shifted against my advice to an unauthorised OT and when my junior resident gave anesthesia against my advice?

Title: Noida to make rain response plan
Content: NOIDA: As the city faced flooding after Thursday morning showers, Noida Authority officials said they were planning to put an emergency response system in place for the next monsoon. The Authority will hire experts to design an urban anti waterlogging plan, which will ensure the city does not go under water again, officials told TOI. R K Mishra, ACEO, Noida Authority, said the plan would deal with any heavy downpour. Stormwater management and waterlogging prevention are inadequate and need to be addressed or else the city will incur losses from flooding and precious lives will be at stake, Mishra said. We will invite experts to help us draw up an emergency plan so that the city does not get waterlogged.

Title: Smrithi School For Children: A memorable cruise for special kids
Content: KOCHI: The students from Smrithi School For Children With Special Needs had an unforgettable day on the cruise ship Costa neoClassica that was docked at Kochi. The entertainment crew was moved to tears by the innocent cheers and appreciation they received from the children on Wednesday. The Italian cruise ship docked at Kochi for a few hours, as part of their tour package. When most of their guests had left the ship for sight seeing, the crew invited the students over for a special day at the ship, during which the entertainers performed for children before they departed for Maldives. Students, aged between 3 and 31, were shocked to see the massive ship which can accommodate as many as 1,700 passengers.

Title: No water for Rabi crops as dam storage at a low
Content: Nagpur: As the dry spell has brought down levels in dams of the region to a low, there may be no water for the Rabi crop in large tracts of farmland. After Kharif cultivation, which depends on the monsoon, some farmers also go for a second crop under Rabi, during winters. This depends on irrigation facilities, which includes dams and well on farms. The Rabi crop helps farmers get extra income or cover up for losses in Kharif. Water can be spared for irrigation if the level is above 30 in a dam, or else supply of drinking water takes priority.

Title: Swachh Survekshan 2017: Garbage dumps trash clean metro image
Content: HYDERABAD: Call it an irony if you will but on a day Hyderabad pipped the other metros like Bengaluru, Chennai and Mumbai to hit the 22nd spot on the Swachh Survekshan 2017 chart, scores of garbage dumps raised a stink across the city, putting a big question mark on the city's standing on the cleanliness ratings. Unattended garbage heaps at SR Nagar, East Maredpally, the lane near University College for Women at Koti and the 100 feet road near Madhapur stank to high heaven. Similar scenes were witnessed in the old city area where garbage dumps could be found on Mangalhat Road, Karwan Main Road and on the stretch connecting Puranapul to Ziaguda Mandi. Passersby at Karwan Main Road accused the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) of turning a blind eye to the city's garbage woes and putting the health of denizens at risk. " The rancid smelling dump can be hazardous for health.
Union: Madhapur, Karwan Main Road, HYDERABAD, Chennai, Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Mangalhat, East Maredpally, SR Nagar, Puranapul, Ziaguda Mandi, Mangalhat Road, Mumbai, Koti

Title: Dengue task force yet to act
Content: LUCKNOW: The health department is struggling to follow its own action plan to check vector borne diseases (VBD), despite the high court's strict directions, issued last year following dengue epidemic in the city. Though mosquitoes have started ringing in from every nook and corner and five cases of dengue have been reported since January, the Task Force Committee (TFC) constituted in November for VBD prevention has only met twice so far and not taken any concrete action. This, when the court in October last year had recorded the performance of the health department as a " complete failure of constitutional machinery" in preventing, controlling, managing and treating dengue epidemic which infected 1,020 persons and claimed 18 lives. Another 23 deaths were recorded as 'suspected dengue deaths'. When contacted, deputy CMO (Vector borne diseases) Dr Sunil Rawat said, " We have been taking inter departmental meetings around dengue constantly along with spreading awareness at all levels of the machinery.

Title: PMC elections 2017: PMC polls 2017: Puneites traditionally averse to dynasty politics
Content: PUNE: Several politicians in the city relentlessly tried to promote their heirs in politics and handover legacy to them, but a few succeeded because majority of the Puneites revulsion at dynastic politics. Once the centre of freedom movement, stalwarts like Gopal Krishna Gokhale and Lokmanya Bal Gangadhar Tilak led the national movement from Pune. While Gokhale's heirs failed in politics, Tilak's family members could not match his stature. Tilak's son, Shridhar, was not supported by his own followers. Jayantrao his grandson was considered as a prominent figure in the state politics.

Title: Pune based veteran to help shape future military leadership
Content: PUNE: Changes in the armed forces training and selection procedure may soon have a Pune touch with three books, written by city based veteran Col Vinay Dalvi (retd), being considered as the base module by Indian Navy and Indian Air Force (IAF) headquarters. In a letter to the veteran, Navy chief Admiral Sunil Lanba and Air Force chief BS Dhanoa have praised Dalvi's research work in the books. Col Dalvi, who has served extensively at the National Defence Academy (NDA), Indian Military Academy (IMA) and Officers Training Academy (OTA), has highlighted issues related to training and selection in the three books he has penned. Both services chiefs have said that concerned directorates are examining issues highlighted in the books, titled Victory India Trilogy. Admiral Lanba, who is also chairman of the chiefs of staff committee (CoSC), said, Specific recommendations from the articles published in the books are being examined by the directorates and I am sure that they will derive valuable inputs from them.

Title: Hackers target Malhar fest site, submit 12,000 fake forms
Content: MUMBAI: The website of St Xavier's College's annual youth festival, Malhar, has been targeted by hackers who submitted more than 12,000 bogus applications for volunteers on the portal. The event organisers initially tried to thwart the cyber attack, but when it persisted, they approached the Azad Maidan police. Ritbrata Ghosh (20), a student in charge of the IT systems for the festival, lodged the complaint. In his complaint, he said they invited applications from volunteers on http://www.apply.malharfest.org and started the process on June 13. The complainant told police they required around a thousand volunteers, so they made the announcement online.

Title: Cops nab 7 persons involved in 17 offences including Spiderman
Content: VISAKHAPATNAM: The city police arrested the main accused in several house break in incidents in the city as well as the buyer of stolen property on Friday and recovered 280 grams of gold ornaments out of 345 grams stolen and a 32 inch TV from their possession. The cops also arrested five persons including two juveniles for bike and mobile phone robberies and recovered 11 bikes from their possession. Addressing the media, additional deputy commissioner of police (ADCP) S Varadaraju said that the main accused in house break in cases, Konapureddy Naresh alias Spiderman (21) of Arilova, discontinued his studies after his father death and came to Vizag from Parvathipuram in Vizianagaram district. He began committing offences in 2012 and was arrested once and sent to Vizag central prison. After release in May last year, he again started commiting house break in offences in KRM Colony, Pithapuram Colony and CBM Compound.
Intersection: KRM Colony, VISAKHAPATNAM, Parvathipuram, Pithapuram Colony, Vizag
Union: Arilova, CBM Compound, KRM Colony, VISAKHAPATNAM, Vizianagaram, Parvathipuram, Pithapuram Colony, Vizag

Title: Fight for rights: Ragpickers want their role defined in new rules
Content: NEW DELHI: There is anxiety among waste pickers whether the draft waste management rules 2015 will include their services in the waste management process in cities. Till now, waste management was the state and the private contractors mandate but for the first time this draft mentions the role of waste or rag pickers as people engaged in collection of reusable and recyclable solid waste. But waste pickers are demanding that their right to collect, segregate and recycle waste be properly defined in the draft. The All India Kabadi Mazdoor Mahasangh (AIKMM), an association of close to 40,000 waste pickers nationally and 22,000 from Delhi and NCR have recently submitted their comments to the draft rules. There are more than 3.

Title: Recounting tales of suicide warriors
Content: CHENNAI: Loud music, colurful posters, food stalls galore the usually serene campus of IIT Madras wore a different look on Thursday, day two of the institute's annual cultural festival Saarang, brought by The Times of India. But there was more than music, fun and frolic when renowned writer Anita Nair held forth on a variety of subjects, captivating not only her fans but also history and literature enthusiasts. At Saarang to share her experiences as part of a series of lecture demonstrations, the author of such bestsellers as The Better Man (2000) and Ladies Coupe (2001), spoke about her shortsightedness, her dreams of becoming a writer at a time when writers received little encouragement and the challenges she faced. I have always been in love with the sea and the distant horizon and somehow I associate the horizon with all the things one can achieve in life, said Nair. She spoke about her love for words, her secret joys of reading the dictionary and emphasised the need to build a vast vocabulary to become a good writer.

Title: Summer break in Telangana board schools starts from April 24
Content: HYDERABAD: Schools affiliated to Telangana board will close for summer holidays from April 24. As per the academic calendar recently released by the school education department for 2017 18, all schools will open on June 12. The next academic year will begin from March 21 and go on till April 23. While the Dasara holidays are scheduled from September 20 to October 4, Christmas holidays will be from December 23 to December 27. Next year, Sankranti holidays have been scheduled from January 12 to January 16.

Title: BJP neta held for inciting violence in UP
Content: SHAHJAHANPUR: Six people, including a BJP member, were on Friday arrested for inciting violence in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri district which witnessed communal clashes on Thursday night after two local youths circulated an objectionable video. Curfew was imposed in the district on Thursday following communal clashes, in which two people had suffered gunshot injuries. All educational institutes in the districts have been closed till further orders by the district administration. Vinod Gupta, who switched over to BJP from Samajwadi Party about two months back, was held for making inflammatory remarks and has been booked under sections 146 (rioting), 147 (punishment for rioting), 148 (Rioting, armed with deadly weapon) of the IPC.

Title: Multiplexes may be asked to sell tender coconuts
Content: BENGALURU: After placing a cap on ticket prices at Rs 200, the government may allow farmers to sell tender coconuts at multiplexes. Replying to BJP's M K Pranesh in the legislative council on Thursday, municipal administration minister Eshwar Khandre said the objective is to help coconut growers reeling under drought. However, he did not commit on BJP members' demand to restrict the sale of soft drinks in multiplexes. The Tamil Nadu government recently banned sale of aerated beverages in multiplexes on health grounds and said only tender coconut water would be available for movie goers. Home minister G Parameshwara said the CM would take a call on selling of tender coconuts in 1,500 multi plexes in the state.

Title: Kalabhavan Mani's brother and family begin fasting
Content: THRISSUR: RLV Ramakrishnan, brother of Kalabhavan Mani, and his family began a fast on Saturday after unveiling the statue of the departed actor in front of Kalagriham, the art and cultural institution set up by Mani in the name of his father at Chenathunadu near Chalakkudy. Several friends and relatives of Mani offered floral tributes in front of the statue built by sculptor Davinchi Suresh. The fast is to protest against the delay in the arrest of those responsible for the death of Mani. According to Ramakrishnan the police inquiry into the death of Mani was a total failure and was only a calculated effort to establish that he had died due to consumption of excessive liquor. It is not clear whether Mani's wife Nimmy will participate in the fast.

Title: Now, international academics may teach at Indian universities
Content: PUNE: The Ministry of Human Resource and Development (MHRD) has initiated scholarship programmes in higher education to fund the entire course for deserving students in an effort to stop them from seeking options abroad. Union minister Prakash Javadekar said during the 100th convocation ceremony of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) that the ministry has established the Global Research Interactive Network through which international faculty would be invited to teach in India and share best practices. The MHRD has targeted to invite 600 international faculty members under the programme. The network was launched recently to attract the best foreign academics to Indian universities of excellence. During his address to students at the convocation, Javadekar said, The programme has been launched to facilitate a partnership between higher education institutions in India and other foreign universities.

Title: allotment cancelled: Assotech 4.5 acre allotment in Sec Pi cancelled
Content: GREATER NOIDA: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority on Thursday said that it had cancelled the allotment of a 4.5 acre group housing plot of Assotech Infrastructure Pvt Ltd in Greater Noida's Sector Pi. According to the Authority, the builder has not carried out any construction on the plot in the past 12 years. The allotment, for constructing residential units in Sector Pi, was made in September 2006. They were allotted 4.5 acres and the project was to be completed by September 2012, said Janardan, additional CEO, GNIDA. Fortunately, no third party rights have been created as the builder has not submitted its building plans so far, he said.
Intersection: Greater Noida, GREATER NOIDA, Sector Pi
Union: Greater Noida, GREATER NOIDA, Sector Pi

Title: Kalvettu' Ravi ARRESTED: History sheeter 'Kalvettu' Ravi arrested from Washermenpet
Content: CHENNAI: Notorious criminal Ravi Sankar alias 'Kalvettu' Ravi, 42, who faces over 20 cases including 6 murders, was arrested for the first time from Washermenpet on Saturday. He has always surrendered in all cases, this is the first time police arrested him. During 2003, he took to committing murders, said police. He had a close link with Balaji alias Kakkathope Balaji, a history sheeter in Muthialpet. Both 'Kalvettu' Ravi and Kakathoppu Balaji were engaged in extortion especially from lorry sheds in North Chennai.

Title: UP elections 2017: Martyr Abdul Hameed wife votes but rues political apathy
Content: GHAZIPUR: Government staff members stand up with folded hands to greet an elderly woman as she walks into booth number 169 under Jakhanian assembly constituency to cast vote. 93 year old Rasoolan Bi, resident of Dullahpur village, is a well known figure in eastern UP. Wife of Param Vir Chakra awardee Abdul Hamid, Rasoolan Bi is a strong headed woman who doesnt mind taking on politicians. Her strong Bhojpuri dialect, however, is better deciphered by Jamil Alam, her grandson. Around 1pm on Wednesday, Rasoolan stepped out of her house to vote at Dhampur government school which has been named after her husband.

Title: Stop clogging courts with frivolous cases, SC tells government
Content: NEW DELHI: "The couldn't care less and insouciant attitude of the Union government with regard to litigation has gone a little too far," the Supreme Court said and castigated the Centre for repeatedly filing appeals on identical questions of law despite being fined earlier for clogging the justice delivery system with frivolous cases. Ticking off the Centre for snail paced efforts to streamline its litigation policy, a bench of Justices Madan B Lokur and Deepak Gupta recently used the NDA government's reformist slogan of " ease of doing business" to make a sharp point. " Under the garb of ease of doing business, judiciary is being asked to reform. The boot is really on the other leg," the bench said. Pointing to the collateral damage the overcrowding of the judicial system caused other litigants, besides financial liabilities of the government, the court asked when the " Rip Van Winkleism" would end. "

Title: 35 tonne groundnut gutted in fire in Hapa
Content: RAJKOT: Over 35 tonne of groundnut procured at minimum support price (MSP) of Rs 900 per 20kg, by the government, was gutted in a massive fire in the warehouse of Central Warehousing Corporation (CWC) in Hapa at Jamnagar on Thursday. Some stock of groundnut was damaged as water was sprayed to douse the fire in the warehouse. Jamnagar municipal commissioner R B Barad, who is also in charge district collector said, According to our primary estimate, roughly 1,000 bags of groundnut was gutted in the fire. Counting is still on. Our people cant go further inside because of dense smoke from the fire. Chief fire officer of Jamnagar, K K Bishnoi, said "Four firefighters were used to control the blaze."

Title: The Fantastico Hunt held in Mumbai
Content: Fans across 4 cities reveal the name of the next big thing by Tata Motors in a massive online and on ground clue hunt Key highlights: A massive national digital campaign with on ground legs in 4 cities (Mumbai, Delhi, Bengaluru and Kolkata). Themed as The Fantastico Hunt to share a glimpse of the car's communication thought of It's Fantastico! Each city had one letter of the four lettered name of Tata Motors next passenger vehicle, hidden at a prominent location. Fans were actively engaged on Twitter and other social media channels and handed clues to the locations of the letters. The clues were strategically placed and worded so as to maximize intrigue and participation.

Title: Security beefed up in ECR for Republic Day
Content: PATNA: Security measures have been beefed up in all the five divisions of the East Central Railway (ECR) in the run up to the Republic Day. Railway Protection Force (RPF) IG cum ECR chief security commissioner Ravindra Verma reviewed the security measures at a high level meeting held at the ECR headquarters at Hajipur on Tuesday. All the five divisional security commissioners and other security officials attended the meeting. According to Verma , additional forces have been deployed in the vulnerable rail sections to keep a watch on the movement of miscreants. RPF men on train escort duty have been asked to carry out intensive search in every coach of the mail and express trains, he said and added the RPF and GRP were coordinating with each other at Patna Junction and other crowded stations of the ECR.

Title: kerala nun rape case: Kerala nun stays isolated, bishop Franco Mulakkal busy with visitors
Content: KOTTAYAM: Even as the nun who was allegedly raped by Jalandhar bishop Franco Mulakkal remained isolated in her room at the Kuravilangad convent, the arrested bishop continued to have VIP visitors at the Pala sub jail. A day after Kanjirappally bishop Mar Mathew Arackal visited him, K M Mani who represents Pala constituency in the assembly, called on Mulakkal. Visiting someone who has been incarcerated was a service according to the Gospels, Mani said. " I visited the bishop based on that call," said Mani. Sources said Mani made up his mind to visit Mulakkal after his political rival P C George MLA and Kanjirappally bishop called on him.
Union: KOTTAYAM, Kuravilangad, Kanjirappally, Kerala, Pala, kerala

Title: Strong community role pushes up slew of villages in panchayat ranking
Content: NEW DELHI: Villages that pull together forge ahead. A study seeking to establish reasons behind good and bad performance of panchayats has cited the example of two villages in Ahmednagar district in Maharashtra. Chandrapur and Dadh Khurd are so strong on social participation that they celebrate festivals together. Like, " one village, one Ganapati" one Ganesh idol for the whole village. The study says that avoiding the tradition of other villages, where every household performs separate idol worship, cuts down on pollution during immersion. "
Intersection: Chandrapur, Dadh Khurd, NEW DELHI, Ahmednagar, Maharashtra
Union: Chandrapur, Dadh Khurd, NEW DELHI, Ahmednagar, Maharashtra

Title: FIR against bus driver for flogging woman in Jaipur
Content: JAIPUR: A day after a video of a woman passenger being thrashed and flogged inside a city bus on suspicion of being a pickpocket by the driver went viral on social media, the Jaipur police on Friday registered an FIR against the driver and recorded statements of the conductor. Deputy commissioner of police (Jaipur East) Gaurav Yadav told TOI that Gandhi Nagar police station was directed to take a suo moto action in the case after the heinous crime came to the fore. The Gandhi Nagar police have registered a case against the driver, Het Ram, under Section 323 (Voluntarily causing hurt), 341 (Wrongful restraint) and 354 (Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty). In the chilling video, Het Ram, can be seen kicking a woman, who had just entered the bus from Narayn Singh Circle. The driver is then seen repeatedly flogging her with a belt before eventually kicking her out of the stationary bus.
Union: Gandhi Nagar, JAIPUR, Jaipur, Jaipur East, Narayn Singh Circle

Title: Youngest pellet victim in J&K: Youngest pellet victim in J&K: 19 month old girl
Content: SRINAGAR: Hiba, a 19 month old baby, had stopped crying after writhing in pain for several hours due to profuse bleeding in her eye. With a bandaged right eye, she was calmly sleeping on the bed in ward 19 of the ophthalmology department of the SMHS hospital on Monday afternoon. There are a dozen people admitted with pellet injuries in Srinagar's main hospital Hiba Jan who was born last year in March is the youngest pellet victim. She suffered the injury in the cornea of her right eye when security forces fired pellets to disperse a stone pelting mob on Sunday at Kapran in Shopian on Sunday. The killing of six terrorists in an encounter in Shopian district on Sunday had triggered violent protests in Kapran area where Masarat Jan lives with her two siblings and her two children, five year old son and 19 month old daughter Hiba."

Title: Bike borne youth tries to abduct 8 year old girl
Content: JAIPUR: A bike borne unidentified man allegedly tried to abduct an eight year old girl when she was returning to her house from a nearby shop in Gopalpura area of the city on Thursday morning. The parents of the minor girl told Bajaj Nagar police station that their daughter had gone out to buy milk and was returning when an unidentified youth riding on motorcycle asked the girl about her school. During the conversation, the man forcefully made her to sit on his bike and rode towards a different direction when an auto rickshaw driver had a quarrel with the suspect. The girl leaped out of the bike and ran towards her house. Additional DCP (Jaipur East) Hanuman Prasad told TOI that the minor girl alleged that she was jabbed by some sharped weapon and has sustained minor injuries which are examined.
Intersection: Gopalpura, Jaipur East, Bajaj Nagar, JAIPUR
Union: Gopalpura, Jaipur East, Bajaj Nagar, JAIPUR

Title: Minister opens adolescent cell
Content: PATNA: State social welfare department minister Kumari Manju Verma inaugurated an adolescent cell to mark the World Menstrual Hygiene Day on Monday. The newly opened cell will function under Women Development Corporation (WDC). It will provide linkage for better management of several government programmes for adolescents being run by different departments of the state government. The cell will also work towards creating awareness about menstrual hygiene among adolescent girls in the state. As per National Family Health Survey 4 data, only 31 of women in Bihar use sanitary pads.

Title: For unity, clerics settle for Aug 22 as Eid day
Content: Nagpur: Faced with an unwanted situation of observing two Eid-ul-Zuhas in the city, the two popular sects among Muslims. Barelvi and Deobandi have decided to celebrate the annual festival on August 22 (Wednesday). Lack of consensus over sighting of moon had led to lot of confusion within the community at large. As per the Islamic calendar, the 10th day (Eid day) of the month Zilhaj fell on August 22. But, when no shahdad(witness) came, the Shahi Imam of Delhi's Jama Masjid declared that the Eid would be celebrated on August 23. Last week, press releases mentioning different dates issued by several hilal committees from across the country too were circulated on social media, leaving members from both sides puzzled.

Title: Ladies toilets at Fergusson College for after hour use
Content: Pune: Fergusson College has constructed special toilets for those who stay back in college for various academic and cultural activities. The existing washrooms are locked after 6pm as security guards finish their duties and leave the premises. Students staying back for rehearsals of cultural activities or those who visit libraries on Sundays would face problems as these washrooms were locked. The management said the newly constructed washrooms would be located in the common areas on the college premises and will be open 24X7. About three months ago, a group of students led by Sandhya Sonawane from Fergusson College had raised this issue at the college development committee meeting.

Title: Dakshina Kannada government school gets PM Modi appreciation
Content: MANGALURU: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has appreciated the efforts of a government school in Malali village of Bantwal in Dakshina Kannada district for a special initiative successfully implemented by its students to conserve water and protect rainforests. A project was launched in 2016 with students digging up around 250 water percolation pits and also building five kattas (check dams across rivers and streams) in Gurupur village, about 20 km away from the city. K Padmashree, a science teacher in the school, was the inspiration for children, who after the completion of their project, wrote to the Prime Minister. The initiative in 2017 began right before the summer holidays, when 128 students were introduced to water conservation and rainwater harvesting. Students are motivated to dig at least one small percolation pit near their houses.
Intersection: Dakshina Kannada, Bantwal, Malali, MANGALURU, Gurupur
Union: Dakshina Kannada, Bantwal, Malali, MANGALURU, Gurupur

Title: Use of skin creams not risk free
Content: VADODARA: Dermatologists believe that some ointments have no business being in the open market, but topical steroid combinations are sold unrestricted to anyone complaining of itching, soreness, acne or any common skin complaint. Also, known for their skin lightening effect, these harmful steroids are widely used by many. In 2014 Indian Association of Dermatologists, Venereologist and Leperologists (IADVL) formed a Task Force Against Topical Steroid Abuse (TFATSA) to convince the Drug Controller General of India (DCGI) to ban the sale of these creams without prescription. While the DCGI earlier this month issued a directive to all the state drug controllers to maintain strict vigil on topical steroid combination drugs, doctors rue that situation remains unchanged. " For doctors prescribing corticosteroids is a daily practice.

Title: 3 day DAV national sports meet ends
Content: PATNA: The three day DAV National Sports Zonal Meet, hosted by DAV Public School BSEB, concluded with a prize distribution ceremony at BMP 5 ground on Monday. DAV - Gaya (boys category) and DAV - Bhagalpur (girls category) won the handball competition, while DAV - BSEB students emerged as the overall champions in both categories of the basketball and table tennis contests. Umesh Pathak of DAV - Dumrao and Urja Ojaswini of DAV - Ara received the overall prize in archery. DAV - Gaya (girls) and DAV - Muzaffarpur (boys) bagged trophies for winning the volleyball tournament. Boys of DAV - Ara got a prize in the badminton competition while Dr G L Dutta DAV Public School - Transport Nagar bagged a prize in the girls category.
Intersection: Bhagalpur, Ara, Dumrao, Gaya, Muzaffarpur, PATNA
Union: Bhagalpur, BMP 5, Ara, Dumrao, Gaya, Muzaffarpur, PATNA, Transport Nagar

Title: Goa's multi crore Smart City farce
Content: Considering that Panaji's power situation constantly fluctuates dangerously on the verge of total collapse, the latest announcements from the city's Smart City Mission come across as exceptionally cruel jokes, far distanced from any recognisable reality. Taking the absurd rhetoric another notch higher, we have been informed that the fancifully named Goa Intelligent City Management System will very soon blanket the tiny riverside capital with 450 highly sophisticated high definition CCTVs to make use of license plate and facial recognition technology that will capture any traffic violation and also capture any loitering and suspicious objects . The estimated cost of this extraordinarily misplaced and unnecessary technology? At least Rs 180 crore. Leave aside that no obvious need has been demonstrated or justified for even one such camera, let alone the patently ridiculous 450 that are proposed, there is much more that boggles the mind.

Title: 11 year old drowns, her brother battles for life
Content: NEW DELHI: An 11 year old girl drowned in the Yamuna on Monday afternoon while playing with her brother. The brother managed to came out of it alive, but was battling for life at a hospital at the time of filing of this report. Someone called up the police at 12.30pm to inform that two children were drowning near the Rajghat powerhouse. A police team was sent to the spot and rescue teams were formed too. A senior police officer said the two children were playing outside their house in Bela village.
Union: Rajghat, NEW DELHI, Bela, Yamuna, Rajghat powerhouse

Title: RSS worker shot by miscreants in UP's Firozabad
Content: FIROZABAD : Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker Brijesh Sharma was shot and looted by miscreants in Firozabad's Kaneta village in Uttar Pradesh. The incident took place on June 6 when Brijesh was on his way to home after closing his shop. The miscreants shot him near National Highway and snatched his money bag before fleeing from the place. The victim, who is a teacher in a primary school located in Madanpur Block, was rushed to a hospital in Agra for treatment. While the police have begun investigating the case, Superintendent of Police (SP) city Rajesh Kumar said that the victim is out of danger and four people who attacked Brijesh has been identified and would be arrested soon. "
Union: FIROZABAD, Madanpur Block, Agra, Firozabad, Uttar Pradesh, Kaneta, UP

Title: Congress intimidated by Raje popularity: BJP
Content: JAIPUR: The ruling BJP in Rajasthan on Monday said that the opposition Congress was intimidated by the popularity of chief minister Vasundhara Raje and was trying to disrupt her state wide Gaurav Yatra by using violence. Former Rajasthan BJP president and co convener of the Rajasthan Gaurav Yatra, Ashok Parnami said Congress national general secretary Ashok Gehlot was allegedly frightened by Raje's popularity, after a few miscreants pelted stones at Raje's meeting on Saturday in Pipar town of Jodhpur division. While Raje and other BJP leaders have accused the Congress of staging the incident, the opposition Congress has condemned the incident saying it does not believe in the politics of violence. " Congress doesn't want the yatra to proceed and is trying to disrupt it through various means, including by filing writ petition in high court and then pelting stones on CM's Rath in Pipar. Parnami at a press conference said that Ashok Gehlot is afraid of CM Raje's rising popularity.

Title: None to help, epilepsy patient suffers on road
Content: KOLKATA: Days after an accident victim lay bleeding on the Millennium Park pavement with no help coming from bystanders, another youth suffering from epilepsy lay pinned to the ground on Saturday morning in one of the busiest stretches of EM Bypass for around 12 minutes with passersby either busy clicking his photographs or just walking past him. It took two constables Ananta Roy and Suvankar Bhattacharya from the Beliaghata traffic guard to spot the victim and inform their superior, OC Pankaj Ghatak. Ghatak instructed sergeant Uday Pal to rescue the young man after permissions from Lalbazar control room and concerned IPS officers. The victim was later identified as Dipak Sharma (18). The cops arranged for an ambulance and admitted him at the Calcutta Medical College and Hospital, where he is stated to be recovering well.
Union: Beliaghata, KOLKATA, Millennium Park, Lalbazar, EM Bypass

Title: PWD to repair damaged Patradevi to Panaji road
Content: PANAJI: National Highway 17 (now NH 66), from Patradevi up to the twin Mandovi bridges, left battered by the monsoon, will be repaired by the public works department (PWD) at a cost of Rs 45 lakh. Tenders for the work are expected to be finalised this month. The damaged parts of the Patradevi to Dhargal and Dhargal to Karaswada stretches will be taken up at Rs 13 lakh each. The contractor will be asked to complete the work on urgent basis within the time frame of 30 days. On the other hand, repairs of the stretch from Karaswada to Betim will be taken up at a cost of Rs 14.
Intersection: Dhargal, PANAJI, Patradevi, Panaji, Karaswada, Mandovi
Union: Dhargal, PANAJI, Patradevi, Panaji, Betim, Karaswada, Mandovi, National Highway 17, NH 66

Title: Masked men open fire at handicrafts businessman
Content: UDAIPUR: Commotion hit at one of the busiest marketplace in Moti Chohatta under Ghantaghar police station area inside the Walled City on Wednesday evening when two masked men suddenly opened fire at a handicrafts businessman. Kundan Chauhan, the victim sustained bullet shot on his right palm and has been admitted in the MB hospital, he is out of danger, police said. The broad day light firing came as a big shock and panic hit the area for some hours after the incident. Shopkeepers shut down their establishments and gathered outside the police station demanding a quick action to nab the assailants. According to the eye witnessess, Kundan was sitting inside his showroom when two masked men suddenly arrived and opened fire.

Title: Telangana fails to attract foreign students
Content: HYDERABAD: The number of foreign students visiting Telangana for higher studies plummeted from 3,461 in 2016 17 to 2,877 in 2017 18, revealed the All India Survey of Higher Education report. Experts attribute the drop in number of foreign students to tightened visa norms by the Indian government for students from various prior referral countries that are on the watch list. " Students from countries such as Somalia and Sudan are being closely watched by the Indian government. The number of students from Iraq has also dropped over the years due to war like situation in the country," said an official from Osmania University, which attracts highest number of foreign students in Telangana. " The highest number of foreign students are enrolled in undergraduate courses, that is 77.

Title: Now, opposition grows against Maghi political conferences
Content: JALANDHAR: The strong opposition to rallies by political parties at Shaheedi Jor Mela at Fatehgarh Sahib, which ultimately ensured that none was held at the event last week, is now casting its shadow on Maghi conferences to be held at Sri Muktsar Sahib. During the last two assembly elections, political parties had used the Maghi mela occasion to hold conferences and as show of strength. While Congress and AAP have already announced that they would not hold any political conference on the occasion of Maghi in Muktsar, SAD (B) is still holding on to its plan. SAD (Amritsar) has also said that it will go ahead with a political conference in Muktsar. While Sikh activists are demanding that political conferences at other Sikh historical occasions and places should be also banned, some Sikh scholars and activists advocate a nuanced approach.
Union: Muktsar, Amritsar, Fatehgarh Sahib, JALANDHAR, Sri Muktsar Sahib

Title: MPDA to be invoked against illegal sand mining
Content: Nagpur: Revenue minister Eknath Khadse informed the lower house on Wednesday that state government would impose Maharashtra Prevention of Dangerous Activities (MPDA) Act, 1981, on those involved in illegal sand mining. He was replying to a query during question hour accusing the government of protecting sand mafia. The minister added that government had received accent from President Pranab Mukherjee for amendment in MPDA Act. Now police can take direct action on them and seize their property and vehicles as per rules. Care has been taken to preserve environment and only license holders are being permitted to carry on excavation, he said.

Title: Marredpally burdened by 50 year old sewage network
Content: SECUNDERABAD: After more than 50 years, the sewerage network in Marredpally continues to be in a shambles. Not less than 80 to 100 complaints flood the Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWS SB) metro customer care every day on problems pertaining sewer leakages and overflowing manholes. Though HMWS SB had prepared a detailed project report on a newer sewer apparatus costing Rs 275 crore in 2014, the DPR has gathered dust. Laying of sewer trunks, outlet and inlet sewer network and construction of manholes have been proposed in the DPR, water board general manager, O M division VII (Marredpally), D Sudarshan told TOI. The main problem facing this residential hub, a senior official said, is that the existing sewer network cannot carry the load of sewer water of burgeoning residential colonies .

Title: amarinder singh: Its political theatrics with eye on Lok Sabha polls: CM
Content: CHANDIGARH: Punjab chief minister Amarinder Singh on Saturday ridiculed Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leadership for indulging in political theatrics in the name of religion with their farcical display of regret over the misdeeds committed during their 10 year misrule. It was obvious that the Badals had their eyes on the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections and the apology drama had been enacted for that purpose, he said, adding that had they (Akalis) been sincere in their apology, they would not have chosen to give their misdeeds the garb of inadvertent errors but would have had the decency and courage to admit to their crimes of omission and commission . Amarinder accused the Badal clan and other Akali leaders and MLAs of misusing religion to garner public support, which they had completely lost over the past two years. The CM said he was shocked at the failure of former chief minister Parkash Singh Badal and SAD president Sukhbir Singh Badal to admit their mistakes even now, when they had approached the Akal Takht for forgiveness. He pointed to the timing of the so called apology to criticise the act of the Akali leaders.

Title: Pune cooler than Mahabaleshwar, minimum temperature dips to 14.1 C
Content: PUNE: The city on Monday morning was cooler than hill station Mahabaleshwar and several north Indian locations, including Jammu, New Delhi, Patiala and Ambala, with the minimum temperature dropping to 14.1 C a near three degree dip overnight. The minimum temperature, recorded at the Shivajinagar weather station, was the lowest of the post monsoon season. In Mahabaleshwar, the mercury fell to 16. Pune was also the third coolest among cities in the state after Nashik (13.3 C), Ahmednagar and Parbhani (both 13.8 C). While the minimum temperature at Lohegaon was higher at 16.8 C on the day, it was still a dip of around 1.7 C from Sunday's minimum of 18.5 C.
Intersection: PUNE, Jammu, Patiala, Mahabaleshwar, Pune, Parbhani, Ambala, Ahmednagar, Nashik
Union: PUNE, Jammu, Mahabaleshwar, Pune, Patiala, Parbhani, Shivajinagar, New Delhi, Ambala, Lohegaon, Ahmednagar, Nashik

Title: Gujarat Refinery workers go on flash strike
Content: VADODARA: Gujarat Refinery witnessed a ruckus on Monday as sanitation workers went on a flash strike. Some of the workers also threatened to immolate themselves if their demands were not met. The cops had rush to the spot and take control of the situation. The sanitation workers have been demanding equal pay for their work. The workers gathered at the gate of refinery and staged protests.

Title: There are many who now regret the things they told me
Content: A lot has happened since the day I decided to open up in 2015 during the queer pride march in Thiruvananthapuram. Many media houses reported how I mustered the courage to identify my sexual orientation, despite hailing from a small village in Kollam and belonging to an orthodox Muslim family. Last year, I posted on my online page how the film Chanthupottu misrepresented the queer community, and many might have thought that I was doing all this for publicity. However, after that I had to go through a lot of difficult situations. The acceptance here and in social media have unfortunately not seeped into the interiors, in my hometown where the people are not as progressive in their ideologies.

Title: ISL: A draw that tastes like defeat
Content: PANAJI: FC Goa and Chennaiyin FC played a draw for the first time in 10 matches but, like in most matches, there was a winner. Chennaiyin FC coach John Gregory was politically correct during the post match media interaction, praising Goa magical duo of Ferran Corominas and Manuel Lanzarote. I wish they were playing for us, he told reporters, but inside the away dressing room, he would have personally patted each of his player on the back. This was a draw with 90 minutes still left to be played in the second leg semifinal at home but nobody was left in any doubt that this tasted as good as a win for the visitors. A precious away goal gives them a healthy advantage and then there is their defence to bank upon.

Title: Take strongest possible action against Pak troops: Rajnath Singh to BSF
Content: NEW DELHI: Home minister Rajnath Singh has directed the Border Security Force (BSF) to take strongest possible action against the Pakistani troops, who reportedly mutilated the body of a BSF jawan after killing him in unprovoked firing along the International Border near Jammu. The home minister has conveyed this to BSF brass in no uncertain terms , a home ministry official, privy to the development, said. The jawan, a BSF release said on Wednesday, had received multiple bullet injuries to his torso including his neck . However, ground reports indicated the jawan body was mutilated, with his throat being slit. The trooper, who had gone as part of a team to cut elephant grass to clear the field of view along the IB, was killed due to unprovoked firing from Pakistani side.

Title: Thirsty forever, Sangam Vihar angry that water woes still persist
Content: NEW DELHI: Sangam Vihar, one of the biggest unauthorised colonies in the capital, is facing a major water crisis this summer. The scarcity of water is forcing many residents to use illegal borewells or a makeshift motor, often leading to disputes and even scuffles. On Thursday night, such a dispute killed a resident. When TOI visited the colony, it found widespread use of private tankers, with the houses and the narrow lanes filled with small tanks to store water. Many houses actually have more water tanks than furniture.

Title: paddy cultivation: Farmers told not to cultivate paddy due to water scarcity
Content: SURAT : Paddy farmers in and around Surat district have opposed the irrigation department's circular for not cultivating paddy in their farms during summer season due to water shortage in the Ukai reservoir because of scanty rainfall in the catchment areas. Farmers from Olpad, Choryasi, Sayan, Sachin and other parts of the city and district gathered at the Jehangirpura ginning mill compound under the aegis of the Gujarat Khedut Samaj (GKS) on Tuesday and tore the circular to mark their protest. According to the circular issued by the irrigation department, Ukai reservoir is having very less water compared to previous season due to scanty rainfall this season. However, this time around only four water rotation has been fixed for the rabi summer season from Kakrapar right bank canal. Last year, the cultivation of paddy in some of the areas in the district was very high due to which the water needs of cattle heads and vegetable crops was not satisfied.
Union: Choryasi, SURAT, Sachin, Jehangirpura, Sayan, Kakrapar, Gujarat, Olpad, Surat, Ukai

Title: State can't solve mining issue, up to Centre to amend act: CM Manohar Parrikar
Content: PORVORIM: The best solution to restart mining operations in the state was for the Centre to amend the Goa, Daman and Diu Mining Concessions (Abolition and Declaration as Mining Leases) Act, 1987 , chief minister Manohar Parrikar said on Thursday. "The state government cannot resolve the mining issue. The Goa government can only find some temporary solutions," Parrikar said in the House. Parrikar has sought a discussion in the assembly on the issue on August 3 after which he is expected to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi. He said the private member's resolution that Curchorem MLA Nilesh Cabral is expected to move in the coming week was the state's best shot at restarting mining operations at the earliest.
Union: PORVORIM, Goa, Delhi, Daman and Diu, Curchorem

Title: IFS officer's RTI query puts former boss in a spot
Content: NAGPUR: The otherwise neglected working plan wing of the forest department is again in the news for all the wrong reasons. This time a senior IFS officer has put his former boss in a spot by seeking information under the RTI Act about irregularities in procurement of geomedia software, high configuration workstation and satellite imageries worth lakhs of rupees. According to documents procured by TOI, TK Choubey, general manager with Forest Development Corporation of Maharashtra (FDCM), Nagpur, who was CCF (working plan), Nagpur, prior to his present posting, had in September 2014 filed an application under the RTI Act with the office of former boss M Karunakaran, who is APCCF (working plan east), Nagpur. Choubey sought certified copies of orders, vouchers, bills towards purchase of geomedia software, workstations and satellite imageries etc during the last six years from 2008-14 from Karunakaran. Of the information sought on nine queries, information on only three was supplied.

Title: Naga Vaishnavi's family fallen apart after her death
Content: Vijayawada: The murder of Palagani Naga Vaishnavi left her family devastated. While her father Palagani Prabhakar Goud suffered a heart attack soon after finding out about the murder, her mother and paternal uncle, who battled for justice, also passed away recently. She is survived by her two elder brothers. Prabhakar had married his sister's daughter Venktravamma. They had six children, all were born with birth defects and eventually died.

Title: Lawrence pledges support to Rajini
Content: Chennai: Choreographer turned actor Raghava Lawrence on Sunday announced his support for politician Rajinikanth and promised to be the guardian that the superstar wants his fans and supporters to be. When my thalaivar (leader) unfurls his party flag, political leaders will be left befuddled. Politics will soon be cleaned up and made simple, said Lawrence, who choreographed the superstar dance moves in Baba (2002). Meanwhile, actors Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan shared the stage on the occasion of the star event Natchathira Vizha in Kaula Lampur, Malaysia, where the two fielded questions on cinema, politics and spirituality. When actor and comedian Vivek quizzed Rajini if he felt he missed out on the political opportunity that came his way in 1996, Rajini replied, I have not worried about it even for a second.

Title: Will display jewels if shastras permit: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams
Content: TIRUMALA/VIJAYAWADA: The ongoing controversy between Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) and former chief pontiff AV Ramana Dikshitulu took a new turn on Sunday with TTD executive officer Anil Kumar Singhal announcing that if the Agama Shastras permit the temple body is ready for a public display of jewels to clear all doubts on their safety. The EO made the statement even as Dikshitulu demanded a CBI inquiry into the precious stones and ornaments allegedly gone missing in the last 22 years. Singhal told media that if the Agama Shastras did not permit public display of temple jewellery, the TTD would digitise them in 3D format and put the photos in a museum for the public. This is my personal opinion. Officials and higher ups should ponder over this, he said.

Title: Part of brain sneaks into man's ear doctors fix it
Content: Chennai: When 54 year old auditor Logananthan felt a pink, soft and insensitive mass inside his ear, he thought it was some growth that made him hear odd sounds. But after a peep into his ear hole, his ENT specialist suspected it to be a part of his brain. The neurosurgeon and a series of scans confirmed it. We have never seen the brain through the ear with naked eye, said Apollo Hospitals neurosurgeon Dr Joy Varghese. We waited for the scans, which confirmed it was a part of the temporal lobe.

Title: RP21 will open gateway for coal transportation
Content: PANAJI: Members of a voluntary organisation have demanded the scrapping of the Regional Plan (RP) 2021 and all outline development plans (ODP), and have asked for the preparation of a new RP 2031 in conformity with the people participation. Goencho Avaaz members alleged that cutting of roads to build expressways, river nationalisation, and implementation of the regional plan are being strategically done to open a gateway for coal transportation from Goa to other states. A coal mine has been purchased by a businessman for Rs 6,000 crores. That mine is estimated to contain about 150 million tonnes of coal. We have filed RTIs which reveal that the government has plans to build a jetty at Baina where this coal will be unloaded and supplied to power and steel plants in Maharashtra and Karnataka via an expressway, said co convenor of Goencho Avaaz, Viriato Fernandes.

Title: 50 year old NRG from Mehsana shot dead in US
Content: Palanpur: An Indian origin man was shot dead by some unidentified persons in Georgia in the United States. The deceased Praful Patel. Patel (50) originally belonged to Ganeshpura village, some 15 km from Kadi in Mehsana district. Patel was settled in the US for the last 22 years and had a grocery store in Georgia. Father of village sarpanch Babhuji Thakor said that Patel was shot dead on October 13 when he was preparing to go home after closing his store.
Union: Georgia, US, Mehsana, United States, Kadi, Palanpur, Ganeshpura

Title: 80 Tasmac outlets in dist to get CCTV cameras, burglar alarms
Content: COIMBATORE: If everything goes well, Tasmac authorities will soon install CCTV cameras and burglar alarms at its 80 outlets in the district as a pilot project to curb break ins and avoid incidents of employees, who now carry sales amount with them, being attacked by burglars. Two months ago, some miscreants had robbed Tasmac shop employees of more than Rs 4 lakh while they were taking sales amount with them at night. There are 237 Tasmac outlets in the district. Since some outlets do not have CCTV cameras and burglar alarms, Tasmac shop employees are forced to take the sales amount with them every night. If we keep the sales amount in the locker of the Tasmac outlet, chances of burglary are high.

Title: JNU dean of students alleges attack by union
Content: NEW DELHI: The administration of Jawaharlal Nehru University alleged that student union members attacked the dean of students while protesting near his office on Monday. According to the administration, the students went inside the office of the dean of students, Umesh Kadam, latched the door and physically manhandled him. Speaking to TOI, Kadam said he had invited all hostel presidents and four JNUSU members for a meeting to discuss the hike in fee and fines. We had a two hour discussion in which the students raised those issues. JNUSU demanded that the hike should be reversed but I told them that the varsity has to follow some procedures before they take any decision.

Title: Streamline collection of garbage from schools
Content: BENGALURU: Garbage disposal is a bugbear that has dogged the entire city and while the piles of rubbish on roadsides have often garnered focus, one issue that has slipped under the radar is collection of waste from schools. This issue was raised at the Times of India's Bengaluru Forward event on Saturday. Shobha Bhat, a resident of Rajarajeshwari Nagar and a volunteer on solid waste management, revealed that most of the waste from schools is paper. There are hundreds of schools in our zone, but waste is not collected properly from these institutions, she said. Paper constitutes 90 per cent of waste from schools and ideally it should be sent for recycling.

Title: No Rs 70k cr irri scam as much less spent: VIDC
Content: Nagpur: The Vidarbha Irrigation Development Corporation (VIDC) has stated that the much talked about irrigation scam is not worth Rs70,000 crore, as it is being alleged. The amount spent on different works since its inception in 1997 to 2015 itself stands at Rs27,828 crore, said VIDC in an affidavit filed before the Nagpur bench of Bombay High Court while responding to the PIL by NGO Jan Manch. According to the VIDC affidavit, from 1997 to 2014 15, it got Rs28,972 crore in funds. Out of this, Rs27,048 crore was from the state government, Rs1,678 crore were raised through bonds and Rs244 crore came from other sources. The VIDC spent over Rs27,000 crore out of the amount available.

Title: Legal welfare authority reaches out to commoners
Content: KOZHIKODE: In a bid to broaden activities of the judiciary in the society, the district legal services authority has begun to take a pro active role in social issues that warrant immediate attention. The authority has taken up the cause of legal aides to the needy, health concerns of the marginalized as well as creating awareness about the legal provisions available to different sections of the society. It was the authority that informed the outsiders the plight of a malnourished tribal woman at Pathipara tribal colony, who eventually died at Medical College Hospital here. We have recruited paralegal volunteers to assist the authority. One of our volunteers noticed the worsening condition of the tribal woman during a visit to the colony on the sidelines of the activities of the authority, said L R Byju, sub judge and secretary of the authority.

Title: Disha Patani: I dont have many friends in Mumbai, I dont think people still know about me
Content: After almost three and a half years, Disha Patani returned to Greater Noida recently. The actress was pursuing BTech from one of the colleges in Greater Noida, but after studying for a few months, she decided to move to Mumbai to try her luck in acting. And she was back in NCR as an actress to promote her upcoming film Baaghi 2. It was after years that I drove past my college. All I remember about my brief stay in Noida is my outings to Connaught Place with my best friend.
Intersection: Connaught Palace, NCR, Greater Noida, Noida, Mumbai
Union: Connaught Palace, NCR, Greater Noida, Noida, Mumbai

Title: 88 year old returns to Jorhat College to earn master's degree
Content: GUWAHATI: At the age of 88, exactly 50 years after becoming a graduate, octogenarian Rabindra Nath Das of Jorhat has enrolled himself into a master's degree course under Dibrugarh University (DU). Das says his life has been like a roller coaster, caught in a balancing act between earning his bread and his indomitable desire to spread the light of education. He set up several schools besides taking up several employments through the course of his life. However, he is as enthusiastic to earn his MA degree as he was when he achieved his bachelor's degree from Jorhat College night shift in 1968, he said. Das overcame chronic heart related ailments a couple of years ago, paving the way for enrolling himself into an MA in Education programme at Jorhat College this year.

Title: FDA can fine chemists: Now, FDA can fine chemists for violations
Content: MUMBAI: The legislative assembly on Tuesday passed a bill that empowers the state's own licensing authorities such as food and drugs administration (FDA) to slap a penalty on manufactures, sellers or distributors of drugs, cosmetics, homoeopathic, ayurvedic, siddha or Unani and those involved in operation of blood banks in case of breach of conditions. The existing rules provide only for cancellation or suspension of licences by the authorities if they believe that any of the licence conditions or rules have been flouted. The drugs and cosmetics Act, 1940, does not empower licencing authorities to impose penalty for minor contraventions of licence conditions. As a result, more than 5,000 cases relating to slapping fines are pending with the appellate authorities and the Bombay high court since five years, affecting businesses and the government machinery.

Title: After SC nod, government restores increase in minimum wages
Content: NEW DELHI: Skilled, semi skilled and unskilled workers employed in various government and private establishments will get enhanced wages from this month. The labour department implemented the order on Thursday, a day after Supreme Court restored Delhi government March 2017 notification hiking minimum wages for all categories of workers. Delhi high court on August 4 quashed AAP government two notifications effecting 37 hike in minimum wages of scheduled categories of workers by calling it completely flawed and a decision taken in a hurry . Delhi government had challenged the HC decision in the apex court. Labour minister Gopal Rai said the government has also decided to form a task force to act upon complaints of non compliance of the government order from December 10.

Title: ASI gives approval to Metro rail underground work
Content: AHMEDABAD: The Archaeological Survey of India has permitted the Ahmedabad Metro Rail Project to carry out construction of the underground corridor which passes close below the ASI protected monuments. The metro track passes at a distance of 106 to 289 metres from the monuments. The authorities expect to go in for trial run of the metro train from Vastral by first week of January. Managing director of the Ahmedabad Metro Rail Project, IP Gautam, said, We hope to get the first train by December end, and the first trial run by the first week of January. Gautam said that after detailed review, the National Monument Authority had approved the underground section passing through the regulated zone of 10 ASI protected monuments.

Title: BMC scam accused bought jewellery with money: Cops
Content: THANE: The prime accused in the Rs 54 lakh Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) job scam had purchased jewellery worth over a lakh for his girlfriend from money siphoned from 36 victims. "The parents of one victim passed away on hearing of the fraud," a police officer said. Alleged kingpin Datta Prasad aka Tushar Dhuri (22), Rahul Kelkar, Prakash Gaikwad and Aniket Rane were arrested by Thane crime branch last week. "Kelkar returned Rs 2.5 lakh, which he got as commission, Rane Rs 45000, while the girlfriend of the main accused returned four tolas gold," said the officer. Dhuri posed as a BMC human resource department staffer, claimed he was best employee and flaunted trophies and awards to convince the aspirants.

Title: My brother is my jaan: Lucknow born actress Aditi Sharma
Content: Actress Aditi Sharma, who can presently be seen essaying the role of Mouli in the serial 'Silsila Badalte Rishton Ka', is missing her brother badly today. " Today is Rakshabandhan and my brother Bhavya is in Lucknow. I am really missing him a lot," says an emotional Aditi, who in Mumbai owing to professional commitments. "Since I couldnt get an off from the shoot, my elder sister will be tying rakhi to him. This will be the first time when I will not be tying rakhi to my brother," adds Aditi.

Title: Realty major's director held for duping buyers
Content: NEW DELHI: A day after the arrest of three directors of the 3C real estate firm, the economic offences wing (EOW) of Delhi Police has arrested Atul Gupta, director at Earth Galleria, for allegedly duping buyers of crores. Investigations started a few months ago after over three dozen buyers approached EOW to report the fraud in the project called Earth Skygate located on Dwarka Expressway. Additional commissioner Subhashish Chaudhary said that the role of other directors is under investigation. Gupta will be produced before a court and taken on remand for interrogation. More arrests are likely.

Title: 3 day Bodh Gaya bandh against traffic ban ends
Content: GAYA: The three day long general strike called by the local residents and traders to protest against the new traffic regulations including ban on entry of all categories of four wheelers in a radius of about 1 km from the Mahabodhi temple (Buddha shrine) high on the terrorist radar for security and environmental reasons, concluded on Sunday. The ban came into effect on February 20. Initially two wheelers, motorised as well as pedalled, were on the ban purview. Officials subsequently exempted two wheelers, provided the vehicles were not parked in the prohibited zone. All activity is likely to be revived from Monday morning onwards, said traders.

Title: Free plastic bags may soon be a thing of the past
Content: PANAJI: As part of its plastic free Goa mission, the government has started out by banning the use of all plastic carry bags less than 50 microns thick. Officials, however, said that the prohibition which has been imposed in Panaji, Margao and Mapusa so far is only a stricter implementation of the central government Plastic Waste Management Rules 2016. The ban on sale of plastic bags below 50 microns is expected to increase the cost per bag for retailers and vendors, making it harder for them to hand out the bags free of cost to consumers. A hefty annual registration fee of Rs 48,000 for vendors seeking to continue dispensing plastic carry bags is expected to either deter them further, or pressurise them into passing the added cost to the customer. Under the central government rules, the aim of collecting a registration fee from retailers and vendors is to help municipal bodies invest in a more systematic process to dispose plastic waste.

Title: JU-bilation After Epic Struggle
Content: KOLKATA: After over four months of blood, sweat and tears, the Jadavpur University crisis ended just as dramatically as it started. The portico of Aurobindo Bhavan which was the scene of a midnight police assault on September 16 became a springboard for the agitation and turned out to be the very stage where the epic struggle ended. At 6.30pm, a hush descended on the usually noisy campus as chief minister Mamata Banerjee paused, microphone in hand. The VC has offered to resign, she announced. The next second, the crowd was on its feet, cheering and celebrating as Mamata and her VIP entourage walked through the throng to cries of hok hok hokolorob.

Title: Celebrate Bandra transforms suburb into a vibrant stage
Content: MUMBAI: A flourish of brass and wind symphonies offset with marching beats by uniformed men. A powerful display of the human voice box and a flashback to the American folk music scene from the 1960s. What could be a better way to celebrate one of the city's most popular suburbs than revelling in its existence while rejoicing its past. As the Saturday sun set on the city s curved coast, the queen of the suburbs morphed into one giant stage. People trooped into the balmy amphitheatre within the Bandra Fort for the opening act that was every bit as varied as the nine days of the festival promise to be in celebrating that feeling called Bandra.

Title: Commuters frown on UDAY Express timings, say they prefer overnight train
Content: Bengaluru: The Utkrisht Double Decker Air conditioned Yatri Express (UDAY Express), set to run between Coimbatore and Bengaluru, is swanky. It is fitted with bio toilets and boasts Wi Fi and dining space, automatic food vending machines and large LCD screens for infotainment. It is specially designed to cater to the business class, and yet, the business community is not particularly enthused. Southern Railway officials say the train, now parked in Coimbatore, has already completed tests. The launch has been delayed due to the election code of conduct.

Title: Youth held for rape, murder of 8 year old
Content: BHOPAL: A 23 year old man was arrested for rape and murder of an 8 year old girl in Chattarpur on Tuesday. The girl's body was found in a farm in Bhurwapura village on January 31. Superintendent of Chattarpur, Vineet Khanna said, the accused has been identified as Rajesh Hazari. He used the minor's leggings to strangulate her to death. The incident took place in Bhurapurwa village of Chattarpur.

Title: Need to criminalize marital rape: HC
Content: AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Monday observed there was a need to criminalize marital rape in order to provide protection to married women and said that lawmakers should not fear misuse of the provisions. The HC said, Marital rape is not an offence in our country as the belief is that it could become a potent weapon in the hands of an unscrupulous wife to harass her husband and become a phenomenon which may destabilize the institution of marriage. Marital rape is a widespread problem for a woman that has existed for centuries throughout the world. This problem has received relatively little attention from the criminal justice system and the society a whole. While quashing a charge of rape against a doctor levelled by his wife, Justice J B Pardiwala cited numerous laws such as those in 50 states in the US, three states in Australia, New Zealand and European nations where marital rape is illegal.
Union: AHMEDABAD, Australia, New Zealand, Gujarat, US

Title: BJP RSS meet takes stock of policies, discusses road ahead
Content: NEW DELHI: The need to build strong narratives to counter divisive political and social forces so that saffron mobilisation ahead of next year Lok Sabha polls does not lose momentum figured in a discussion between BJP leaders and RSS functionaries here on Monday. The meeting, described as scheduled and routine, saw a discussion on issues relating to the need to unify society, as the Sangh Parivar sees it, against caste based challenges and issues such as criticism that the government had failed to protect Dalits and harboured a monochromatic vision. With the debate set to intensify as the next round of state polls nears, the meeting discussed concerns aired by Sangh organisations whether the narratives the Parivar believed in were being adequately promoted. Senior RSS functionaries made several suggestions during the meeting of the Sangh, its affiliates and BJP. RSS joint general secretary Krishna Gopal chaired the meet in which BJP chief Amit Shah and five cabinet ministers were present to deliberate upon polices of the Modi government, including formulation of the much awaited new education policy.

Title: Just married hubby flees with cash and ornaments
Content: NAGPUR: A 35 year old post graduate woman paid the price for trusting a man she had met through a marriage portal. The man allegedly fled with three tola gold and around Rs 21,000 cash a day after marrying her in an informal ceremony at her home in Rana Pratap Nagar. The man, identified as Gurgaon based Jugal Kishor Sharma, also fled with banking and financial details of the victim. The woman, eldest of four sisters, not only lost her valuables and cash but her dream of setting up a home for the second time is also shattered. The victim had separated from her first husband after a bad marriage that lasted around five years.

Title: Leopard cub rescued from cable trap in Panchmahal
Content: VADODARA: A two year old leopard cub was rescued by the forest department near Ghusar village of Kalol taluka in Panchmahal on Sunday. The cub was caught in a trap outside a cave in the mounds. Forest department officials said that villagers found the cub caught in the trap when they heard its roar. As the news spread, large crowd gathered. Some miscreant had made gallows with clutch cable of motorcycle and kept it outside the cave which the cub was probably going to enter, said Vejalpur range forest officer Bhupendrasinh Matroja.

Title: Gemological labs wary of losing business, consumer confidence
Content: Surat: Some of the world leading gemological laboratories are rattled after a Hong Kong based diamond technology company argued that certain diamond detection devices fail to spot the laboratory grown diamonds created using high pressure high temperature (HPHT). In a trade alert last week to jewellers and diamond traders, Diamond Services argued that the treatment, generally used to alter the colour of a stone, can mask the phosphorescence effect when diamonds created using HPHT undergo scanning at room temperature. Research conducted by Diamond Services revealed that once an HPHT grown synthetic diamond is subjected to irradiation, it no longer will phosphoresce at room temperature, meaning that it is unlikely to be screened out by many of the popularly used detection devices available today in the industry. The gemological laboratories, including De Beers Group International Institute of Diamond Grading and Research (IIDGR) and Gemological Institute of America (GIA), have been selling millions of dollars worth of synthetic diamond detection equipment in the world, including Surat and Mumbai, every year. These gemological laboratories had launched a range of diamond detector machines worth thousands of dollars.

Title: Punjab government to provide jobs to outstanding players: Dharamsot
Content: LUDHIANA: Cabinet minister Sadhu Singh Dharamsot on Sunday exhorted the youth to embrace sports. While inaugurating a kabbadi tournament in Government Senior Secondary School (Girls) at Sahnewal, he said the Punjab government would confer awards and cash prizes, besides government jobs, to those players who earn laurels for the state by bagging medals in various international and national sports events. Dharamsot gave an example of woman cricketer Harmanpreet Kaur who had been inducted recently by the Punjab government as a DSP in Punjab Police for her excellent performance in Women World Cricket Cup this year. He appealed to the people to motivate the youth to take up sports in their lives, and they should fight against the drug menace collectively. He also announced a grant of Rs 1 lakh for the tournament from his discretionary funds.

Title: 500 farmers agree to give land for airport in Jewar
Content: NOIDA: Even as negotiations on land prices for the proposed international airport in Jewar continue, around 500 farmers have agreed to hand over their land for the project, the district magistrate said on Tuesday. This was after YEIDA chairman Prabhat Kumar proposed a rehabilitation package through an integrated township on August 25. About 500 farmers have agreed, talks are still going on. There was a section of farmers who wanted plots in place of flats that were being offered as part of the compensation package. The YEIDA chairman who is negotiating with farmers had agreed to that also, BN Singh, Gautam Budh Nagar district magistrate, told TOI.

Title: Six new Akash squadrons to give IAF missile muscle
Content: BENGALURU: Having seen it utility first hand, the Indian Air Force (IAF) is all geared up to raise six new squadrons of the Akash Air Defence System which is indigenously developed by the DRDO, Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) and private firms long before the nation launched on the Make In India campaign. Confirming this, top IAF officials said IAF already has two operational squadrons of the all weather, point/area missile system. It protects vulnerable points and vulnerable areas with a slant range of 25-30km at altitudes up to 20km. It can destroy high speed targets like fighter aircraft and UAVs, an official said. Barring the final action of firing the missile or pressing the estroy key, all major functions are done electronically by the computer running on the weapon system software.

Title: Auto stop: Why a free left is never free if youre driving in Noida
Content: NOIDA: Although the traffic police has asked the Noida Authority to free two left turns and and widen roads connecting Sector 16 with the NTPC underpass, many left turns across the city are facing serious encroachment issues either due to e rickshaws or auto rickshaws which stall traffic movement. The left turns, which experts say should be easily accessible without any hindrance, have not attracted the attention of the authorities. For instance, the left turns towards Sector 18 under the metro station, the City Centre metro station from the Women police station in Sector 39, the Sector 71 crossing, the Nithari Spice Mall route, and the one to reach Morna bus stand from Sector 35 are all facing encroachment issues, causing inconvenience to thousands of commuters daily. At the Sector 18 metro station road, most of the left turns have been occupied by auto rickshaws which keep on occupying a road to pick up the passengers or keep on waiting for them. Similarly, at the Nithari Spice Mall route, e rickshaws could be spotted occupying the roads on an everyday basis.
Union: Nithari Spice Mall, Noida, NOIDA, Noida, Sector 16, NTPC underpass, Sector 39, Sector 71, Sector 35, Morna, Sector 18

Title: Rajasthan assembly elections 2018: Minister faces voters scathing questions
Content: JAIPUR: Where was he for the past five years, asked the people in his constituency, as BJP minister Arun Chaturvedi started his campaign trail on a chilly Sunday morning after seeking blessings from Veer Hanuman Mandir at Shanti Nagar in Civil Lines. Perhaps, he would indeed require divine intervention to stay afloat as he was greeted with a barrage of questions during a meeting with the business community which included questions like, How will you change the perception of people which has been created, to counter the Congress. Chaturvedi didnt miss the opportunity to seek blessings from all the elderly persons in ward 27, as he went about door to door, requesting people to vote for him amid chants of Chappa Chappa Bhajpa , Jai Shri Ram and Bharat Mata Ki Jai by his supporters. Chaturvedi supporters distributed garlands to the residents of the locality as he trudged along the lanes of Shanti Nagar, only to be greeted with the same. Some residents didnt miss the chance of sharing with him the problems they are facing, which ranged from construction work to cleanliness and sewerage issues, and water supply.
Union: Civil Lines, Shanti Nagar, Veer Hanuman Mandir, JAIPUR, Rajasthan

Title: Ramdev: Centre failed to solve unemployment
Content: BHOPAL: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev on Thursday criticized the Centre for failing to tackle joblessness. Unemployment is a big question in the entire country and the Centre and state governments have not been able to do much to solve this issue, Ramdev told reporters here, adding that he has resolved to build a self reliant country through Swadeshi .
