Unemployment, poverty, hunger and scarcity are disgrace to Mother India. My aim is to wipe off this blot, he said. During the last month, our Patanjali group has provided jobs to 11,000 people in its sales department and will employ a similar number in the next five to six months.

Title: Security beefed up for Buddha Jayanti
Content: GAYA: Elaborate security arrangements have been made for the three day Buddha Jayanti celebrations beginning Sunday. The main function will be held near the shrine sanctum sanctorum on Monday morning. Governor Satya Pal Malik will be the chief guest. Buddha Jayanti symbolises the triple coincidence of Buddha birth, enlightenment and salvation (death) taking place on the same day of the summer full moon. Gaya SSP Garima Malik said about 400 police constables and 70 officers of different ranks would be deployed for the event.

Title: How Tamil Nadu court foiled cops' bid to invoke tough law against Nakkheeran editor Gopal
Content: An unusual complaint from the Tamil Nadu governor deputy secretary, invoking a rarely used penal provision against 35 journalists of Tamil biweekly Nakkheeran led to a dramatic arrest of its editor R Gopal. But equally dramatic were proceedings inside XIII metropolitan magistrate court from where a beaming Gopal strutted out a few hours later. Magistrate S Gopinathan refusal to send Gopal to jail was an embarrassment to the police and the Raj Bhavan, whereas activists and the media fraternity rejoiced and thanked the judiciary intervention to protect freedom of the press. It needed a lot of lung power for Gopal counsel P T Perumal to convince the court that the editor did not deserve a jail stay. For the prosecution, it was a two hour nightmare as it was seen fumbling for answers whenever magistrate Gopinathan confronted the police to justify the arrest, particularly under Section 124.

Title: Port labourers made Rs 2.5 lakh a month without toiling
Content: NEW DELHI: Labourers deployed at the government owned New Mangalore Port were living the dream life, taking home around Rs 2.5 lakh a month, and that too without doing any physical work. And then the bubble burst. This came to light when New Mangalore Port Trust chairman M T Krishna Babu held a meeting with all stakeholders after taking charge. Traders told him they were shifting to other ports in the region because of the exorbitant payment to labourers deployed with the four harbour mobile cranes (HMC). Babu said 10 labourers were deployed in each shift for each crane.
Union: New Mangalore Port, NEW DELHI, Mangalore

Title: Fort, Marine Drive set to get Unesco world heritage tag
Content: MUMBAI: The city cluster of Victorian and Art Deco buildings in the Fort and Marine Drive heritage precincts is just a step away from being declared a Unesco World Heritage Site. On Thursday, Unesco (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) technical adviser, the Paris based International Council of Monuments and Sites (Icomos), recommended the prestigious tag for the landmark south Mumbai enclave. Once Icomos gives its stamp of approval to a proposal, it is generally accepted by Unesco. The recommendation will now be tabled at Unesco 42nd World Heritage Committee meeting in Bahrain next month. The Victorian and Art Deco ensemble of Mumbai will become the city third World Heritage Site (the other two are CST and the Elephanta Caves).
Intersection: Paris, Mumbai, MUMBAI, Elephanta Caves, Marine Drive, Bahrain, CST
Union: Paris, Marine Drive, Mumbai, MUMBAI, Elephanta Caves, Bahrain, CST

Title: JD(S) K taka president quits, blames Congress for Tumkuru loss
Content: Bengaluru: Karnataka JD(S) president AH Vishwanath quit the post on Tuesday amid frantic attempts to salvage the party's coalition with the Congress that has come under new strain after their poor show in the elections. I am stepping down, owning moral responsibility for the party s defeat in the Lok Sabha polls and also for not being able to build the party the way I wanted to, said Vishwanath. After sending his resignation to JD(S) supremo HD Deve Gowda, Vishwanath (69) hit out at Congress especially former CM Siddaramaiah and claimed Gowda lost the Lok Sabha contest in Tumakuru because its leaders didn't provide necessary support. His resignation had not been accepted till late in the night. At the JD(S) legislature party meeting, Gowdaurged him to reconsider his decision.

Title: Goa police put over 125 drug dealers under surveillance
Content: PANAJI: Goa police has put 127 drug dealers under surveillance in an attempt to break the backbone of the drug trade in the state. The crime branch of Goa police has begun summoning drug dealers to its office for investigation to source more information about the drug trade network. The police have scrutinised data on drug related cases of the last five years from local police stations, the anti narcotic cell (ANC) and the crime branch and a team of police inspectors has been constituted to keep an eye on the drug peddlers. With this exercise, police are hoping to build intelligence to be used to weaken the drug mafia in the state. For foreign nationals who were arrested in drug cases but are now not traceable, the police have decided to call the individuals who stood as their surety to collect information on the accused.

Title: Extended weekend for govt employees
Content: The state secretariat and state government offices wore a deserted look as most employees seemed to have opted for a leave on Friday to avail of an extended holiday to celebrate Holi. Unlike central government employees who had only one day holiday on Thursday, the state government employees had two days holiday (Wednesday and Thursday). An employees union leader said, with model code of conduct in force, only routine works are on. So, the officials and employees have opted for an extended weekend before the hectic election duty begins.

Title: 'Indian women over 35 run risk of infertility'
Content: AHMEDABAD: Indian women should not delay pregnancy as probability to conceive after 35 years of age is much less compared to their western counterparts, concluded a study conducted by a city based fertility clinic. This was mainly due to poor ovarian response (POR), that is, the quality of eggs in Indian women deteriorates after age of 35 and women have to depend on donor eggs to conceive, the study explained. The study was undertaken by city based Nova IVI Fertility (NIF), a subsidiary of Nova Medical Centers, covering over 7,000 patients undergoing fertility treatment across all NIF centers across the country. NIF executive director Dr Manish Banker said that a significantly high number of women suffering from infertility in India were over the age of 31. " The study also raised concerns that the biggest cause behind the infertility was POR in women after 35 years of age," he said.

Title: Rahul may attend 15 Bengal rallies
Content: Kolkata: The West Bengal Congress is lining up star campaigners for the state as party president Rahul Gandhi's office has approved 15 meetings ahead of Lok Sabha polls. While Rahul's meetings will be held in March and April, Congress will start roping in campaigners such as Rajasthan deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot even before that. Rahul Gandhi's office has asked us to arrange for 15 rallies across the state where he will remain present. We may not organise a rally at Brigade, but there will definitely be a large rally in Kolkata, a Congress leader said on Friday. Party sources said apart from a few meetings in north Bengal, rallies would also be organised in Congress strongholds such as Malda and Murshidabad.
Intersection: West Bengal, north Bengal, Malda, Murshidabad, Kolkata, Rajasthan, Bengal
Union: West Bengal, Malda, Murshidabad, Kolkata, Rajasthan, Bengal, Brigade

Title: Merger won t hit services in Tricity
Content: CHANDIGARH: Banking services in Tricity will not be affected by the merger of Dena Bank and Vijaya Bank into the Bank of Baroda, said an official on Monday. Bank of Baroda regional head (Chandigarh) Sammita Sachdev said at a press conference here that the bank's customers in the region would increase from 10 lakh to 15 lakh with the merger and the number of branches from 12 to 20. She added that the biggest challenge the restructured bank faced was in technology integration. A press release issued by the bank said, IT integration is expected to be completed over a period of 12 18 months. With the move, the number of ATMs in the region has increased from 80 to 250.

Title: Curbs likely as air remains very poor, dust storm to raise pollution level in Gurugram
Content: GURUGRAM: The city authorities are gearing up to implement GRAP (graded response action plan) measures for very poor pollution levels, after air quality continued to deteriorate and its index (AQI) got stuck in the very poor level for the last 48 hours. On Wednesday, the city AQI deteriorated to 334 (very poor) from 303 on Tuesday (also very poor), after being in the poor level on Monday (230). AQI was not recorded on Sunday, but was 180 (moderate) on Saturday. Over the last two months, AQI was recorded between moderate and poor levels, necessitating implementation of GRAP measures appropriate for those levels. However, AQI in Manesar on Wednesday was 286 (moderate).

Title: Narendra Modi must be re elected to ensure national security: Sreeramulu
Content: MYSURU: B Sreeramulu, BJP vice president and former minister, on Thursday said it is vital to vote Prime Minister Narendra Modi back to power to ensure national security. Sreeramulu, who participated in the launch of Mera Booth Sabse Mazboot campaign, an initiative of the saffron party to galvanise workers at the grassroots, said, For us, the nation is more important than anything else. PM Modi must come back to power to ensure India safety and security. You must resolve to ensure Modi re election. Prior to Sreeramulu speech, Modi had addressed workers via video conference and had urged them to ensure a good show for the party in the state in the forthcoming Lok Sabha election.

Title: Drive against dumped vehicles set to resume
Content: Pune: The corporation would resume action against abandoned vehicles dumped on roads from Monday as a part of the Swachh Bharat Mission cleanliness programme, after a break of a year. Madhav Jagtap, the head of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC)'s anti-encroachment department, said, Notices would be pasted on the vehicles to alert the owners. The Regional Transport Office (RTO) will work jointly with us in this drive. The (PMC) will scrap the unclaimed vehicles. The PMC officials stated that the drive against abandoned vehicles was stopped because of space crunch.

Title: Soon, law to end nuisance on beaches: Michael Lobo
Content: PANAJI: Chief minister Manohar Parrikar has said that the state government will introduce an amendment to the Tourist Trade Act to stop the nuisance on the beaches and to ban alcohol consumption on the beaches, deputy speaker Michael Lobo said on Monday. Lobo met Parrikar during the business advisory committee meeting at the assembly complex. I have spoken to the chief minister to bring the amendment to the Tourist Trade Act that has not been listed as the business of the House. That amendment can easily come as it a small amendment, but it will bring discipline along the entire coastal belt, he said. The deputy speaker said that Parrikar had told the chief secretary to look into the matter.

Title: Environmental campaigner Avijit Michael support Save Bharat Van
Content: Avijit Michael, executive director, Jhatkaa.orgGreen Win The Bangalore based campaigning start up has spearheaded many crusades across the country for tree conservation. In 2016, it kick started a public agitation against a 6.7 kilometre proposed steel flyover for which about 800 fully grown trees were facing the axe. To draw public support, the group launched a missed call campaign. The campaign got an over-whelming response. Under public pressure, the Bangalore Development Authority called off the project.

Title: IIM Ahmedabad summer placements conclude
Content: AHMEDABAD: The third and final cluster of summer placement at IIM Ahmedabad (IIM A) concluded on Thursday for the PGP class of 2020. The third cluster had eight cohorts of banking, finance services and insurance (BFSI), consumer technology, core manufacturing, enterprise tech, food and dairy, analytics and IT consulting, pharma and healthcare, renewable energy and green technology. A total of 40 firms participated in the cluster out of which Microsoft was the top recruiter with eight offers, followed by FinIQ with six. Major participants in the placements included Adobe, Ola Cabs, OLX, Uber and Bajaj Auto, said an official.

Title: Bird with rare condition seen at city marsh
Content: CHENNAI: A few bird lovers trotting along the banks of the Perumbakkam marshland a week ago were in for a surprise when they spotted a partially pigmemented Plain Prinia (Prinia inornata) in the grass. A bird with the condition, leucism, is rare, they said. E Seshan and Lakshmikanthan, volunteers of Environment Monitoring and Action Initiating (EMAI) who spotted the bird, said they were able to identify the species only after detailed observation. Plain prinia nests in tall grass in wet lowlands, open woodland and scrub areas. Leucism, EMAI founder T Murugavel said, is a condition in which pigment is deposited in the feathers, making them of a muted colour.

Title: CBI books officer, house help for Rs 98 lakh worth disproportionate assets
Content: CHENNAI: The anti corruption branch of the CBI, Chennai, on Monday booked Ashok Kumar Yadav, joint controller of explosives in Petroleum Explosives and Safety Organisation, in a disproportionate assets case. The CBI has booked Saritha, a resident of Cuddalore and T V K Kumaresan, a resident of Choolaimedu as co accused in the case. CBI has stated that Saritha was the house help of Ashok Kumar Yadav and that he had bought several pieces of jewellery, vehicles and other valuables using his disproportionate wealth in her name. Kumaresan is said to have been a middleman of the officer. CBI said in the FIR that Yadav, from August 2015 to April 2018, amassed Rs 98 lakh in his as well as Saritha name.

Title: Jessica case: Court cancels non bailable warrant against Munshi
Content: NEW DELHI: A trial court on Monday cancelled the non bailable warrants (NBW) issued against Bollywood actor Shayan Munshi, who is facing prosecution for allegedly turning hostile in Jessica Lall murder case, after he appeared before it. Chief metropolitan magistrate Pooran Chand quashed the NBW on Munshi's appearance in the court and directed him to be careful in future. The court had earlier issued NBW against Munshi, who was out on bail, after he failed to appear before it during the proceedings. The court has fixed April 28 for hearing arguments on framing of charges in the case. Meanwhile, the court issued a notice to another accused Prem Manocha, who was then working as a ballistic expert, to clarify the position of stay which was earlier granted by the Supreme Court qua proceedings against him.

Title: IMD hints at hotter days next week, city's maximum temperature may soar to 41 C
Content: Pune: Brace for a scorcher next week with the India Meteorological Department predicting the uncomfortable heat to increase both in Shivajinagar and Lohegaon during the next four days. The day temperature is likely to touch 40 C in Shivajinagar after Sunday and soar further to 41 C. On Saturday, the highest temperature in Shivajinagar was 39.1 C. Lohegaon was a little hotter at 40.3 C. Officials said the day temperature in Lohegaon would be slightly higher than this after Sunday, considering the high vehicular traffic in the area. Anupam Kashyapi, head of weather, IMD, Pune, told TOI that the temperature was expected to pick up pace from Sunday.

Title: NU bans 1st yr admissions to 129 colleges, courses
Content: NAGPUR: The Nagpur University on Friday finally uploaded the list of colleges/courses operating without a single teacher or infrastructure and whose first year admissions are stopped for 2019 20 academic year commencing next month. Among them, admissions to 41 colleges are completely stopped as their managements miserably failed to remove these deficiencies for all their courses. In the remaining 88 colleges, which include some from the engineering faculty, admissions to few of their courses are banned for same reasons. Often referred as the blacklist by the NU officials, it included many well known names from Nagpur, Bhandara, Wardha and Gondia. From Nagpur, admissions to some courses in leading colleges like Shivaji Science, Hislop, Dharampeth Science, Dharampeth Commerce, Kamla Nehru, Dhanwate National College (DNC), GH Raisoni, PWS, Porwal, Matru Seva Sangh (MSS), Pandav Group and others were prohibited.

Title: Odisha, Chhattisgarh officials meet to manage Mahanadi water
Content: SAMBALPUR: Authorities of water resources departments of Chhattisgarh and Odisha held a meeting at Sivnath Bhavan (Atal Nagar) in Raipur of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday to discuss issues pertaining to dam safety and management of the Mahanadi river water. It is essential for us to know the condition of the dams in the upstream of Hirakud Dam Reservoir in Chhattisgarh. This apart, it is also essential for us to know the information on inflow and outflow of the water from those dams for proper management of water here in Odisha, said an Odisha official. The official informed that the meeting was held in a cordial atmosphere and Chhattisgarh officials agreed to continue sharing of information. The meeting of the interstate sub committee of National Committee on Dam Safety (NCDS) for Mahanadi river system to monitor the safety aspect of interstate dams across Mahanadi basin is held every year.
Intersection: Chhattisgarh, Atal Nagar, SAMBALPUR, Mahanadi, Odisha, Raipur, Sivnath Bhavan, Hirakud Dam Reservoir
Union: Chhattisgarh, Atal Nagar, SAMBALPUR, Mahanadi, Odisha, Raipur, Sivnath Bhavan, Hirakud Dam Reservoir

Title: Two held, hunt on for rest of the accused
Content: Kochi: City police have started the hunt for the accused who assaulted the passengers of the contract carriage of Suresh Kallada travels. Police on Monday arrested Jithin, 25, of Kodakara in Thrissur and Jayesh, 29, of Pallikkal in Thiruvananthapuram, both employees of the travels, and summoned a manager of the travels for questioning. Another office staff, Girilal from Kollam, has also been arraigned as an accused but he is at large. The bus driver, Anwar, is in custody, police said, adding that the bus has been seized. Police on Monday raided the office of the operator in Vytilla and seized hard drives, CCTV footage and other materials.
Union: Pallikkal, Kodakara, Kochi, Thrissur, Thiruvananthapuram, Kodakara, Vytilla, Kollam

Title: Maharashtra government deployed record 7,000 tankers on Thursday
Content: MUMBAI: Notwithstanding the BJP led state government's tall claims to make Maharashtra tanker free in five years, it deployed 7,014 tankers on Thursday to supply drinking water to 5,607 villages and 11,875 hamlets. As per data on the water supply and sanitation department's website, most tankers have been deployed in four years. On the same day last year, 1,733 tankers were pressed into service for 1,609 villages and 1,048 hamlets. Significantly, out of 7,014 tankers, 203 belong to the government, and the other 6,811 to private contractors. The monsoon started in some parts of the state from Friday, but its weak, and if its progress is slow, it will be the worst situation in view of an acute shortage of drinking water.

Title: Shahberi stir turns violent, 29 arrested
Content: NOIDA: A peaceful protest by more than 500 Shahberi residents outside the office of Greater Noida Authority (GNIDA) on Wednesday morning ended in a major showdown and a brawl between Authority officials, police and residents. Cops from Surajpur police station arrested 29 protesters, including 12 men and 17 women, on charges of rioting, violating IPC Section 144 and obstructing government work and public servant in discharge of his duties. The women got bail later. Residents blocked the entrance of the GNIDA office and didnt allow officials to go in, following which police and administrative officials were called in. All we wanted was for the officials to hear us out.

Title: IMA scam: HC tells Centre to issue notification for CBI probe
Content: BENGALURU: The high court directed the central government to issue a notification at the earliest to enable the CBI to take over probe into the multi crore IMA scam. A division bench headed by the chief justice noted that considering the nature of the controversy, the central government has to do the needful soon. The state government had entrusted the probe to CBI on August 19. As per the Delhi Police Establishment Act, 1946, the Centre has to issue a notification for handing it over to the central agency. Harsh Gupta to be competent authorityAdvocate general (AG) Prabhuling K Navadagi informed the court that senior IAS officer Harsh Gupta will officiate as full time competent authority under the Karnataka Protection of Interest of Depositors in Financial Establishments (KPID) Act, 2004 vis vis the IMA case.

Title: Metro to run every 15 minutes from today
Content: NAGPUR: Come Wednesday and Metro train service on Reach 1 (Khapri - Sitabuldi) would run every 15 minutes. Metro will also run at 80 kmph. The journey between Sitabuldi Interchange and Khapri would be reduced to almost half the existing duration of 45 minutes. At present, Metro service on Reach 1, the only segment currently operational, run every half hour and trains run at 25kmph. The service would simultaneously start from Sitabuldi Interchange and Khapri at 8 am.

Title: Cab catches fire on Mehrauli Badarpur Road, narrow escape for two
Content: DELHI: Two men had a narrow escape after the car in which they were travelling suddenly went up in flames on Mehrauli Badarpur Road near Saket on Tuesday. The driver, Mithilesh, told police that he is a driver partner with an app based cab company and was taking his passenger from Mehrauli to Badarpur. They were crossing Saket when smoke started coming out of the car. Mithilesh immediately asked his passenger to alight from the vehicle and jumped out. Soon, flames started coming out of the bonnet.
Union: Saket, Mehrauli, DELHI, Badarpur, Mehrauli Badarpur Road

Title: 448 realty projects miss filing RERA audit report
Content: AHMEDABAD: As many as 448 real estate projects across Gujarat have failed to submit mandatory annual audit reports required under the provisions the Real Estate (Regulation of Development) Act, 2016, popularly known as RERA. Some 1,418 projects, however, have successfully filed their audit reports online. Under the new realty act, every promoter of a registered real estate project is required to file annual reports within six months after the end of every financial year, failing which developers attract penalty. Among other things, the annual report contains details such as money collected from buyers, amount spent on the project and progress in terms of percentage of work completed. Of the defaulting projects, 374 are have project costs less than Rs 50 crore, 29 above Rs 100 crore and 45 have project cost between Rs 50 and Rs 100 crore, show data available on the website of Gujarat real estate regulatory authority.

Title: Deal to acquire French Rafale fighters hits rough weather
Content: NEW DELHI: India plans to take a final call, one way or the other, on the gigantic 20 billion MMRCA (medium multi role combat aircraft) project to acquire 126 French Rafale fighters before Prime Minister Narendra Modi visits France and Germany in April. Sources said the defence ministry is now hopping mad with French aviation major Dassault s continuing refusal to take ownership of the 108 Rafale fighters which are to be manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) in India with transfer of technology after the first 18 jets are delivered off the shelf to IAF. The MoD is also upset with Dassault s attempts to change the price line , which led to its selection over the Eurofighter Typhoon as the L 1 (lowest bidder) three years ago, by deciding the costing for HAL on its own. It will amount to a de facto hike in the L 1 price, said a source.

Title: Three Malay speaking men in auto spark security scare in Navi Mumbai
Content: NAVI MUMBAI/MUMBAI: On the eve of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the city, cops in Navi Mumbai went into a tizzy after the Mumbai anti terrorism squad (ATS) contacted them about a tipoff received from an auto driver about a conversation between three passengers he picked up from Mulund. Their exchanges indicated that the trio had some sort of terror links, the auto driver told the ATS. The auto driver told us that he had heard the passengers talking in Malay and Urdu about a job'. One of them wondered what would happen to his family if he carried it out. The others, in turn, tried to assuage his wor ries, saying that even Kasab's (2611 Pakistani terrorist) family was being looked after well, said an ATS officer.
Intersection: NAVI MUMBAI, Navi Mumbai, Mumbai, MUMBAI
Union: NAVI MUMBAI, MUMBAI, Mulund, Navi Mumbai, Mumbai

Title: To curb absenteeism, UP doctors told to send selfies with patients
Content: AGRA: In a unique prescription to deal with absenteeism at health centres, the health department has directed doctors on duty at 15 community health centres (CHC) and 43 public health centres (PHC) to send selfies with patients to mark their attendance. And, if a doctor fails to send a selfie on any day, his salary will be cut and disciplinary action will be taken against him. According to the officials of the health department, the move is aimed to ensure that doctors arrive on time for duty every day. The move comes after Agra divisional commissioner Anil Kumar received regular complaints of doctors at CHCs and PHCs taking unreported leaves and arriving late for duty. On several occasion, the chief development officer and the chief medical officer, during sudden inspection in rural areas, didnt find doctors during duty hours.

Title: Congress, BJP spar over action during CAA protests
Content: GURUGRAM: Haryana Congress on Sunday came down heavily on BJP and the Centre over the police crackdown in UP, alleging arbitrary use of force and attempts to implicate those protesting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) in fraudulent cases. On Saturday, UP police had been accused of manhandling Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, who said cops forcibly stopped her convoy in the middle of a busy road in Lucknow. The state Congress said government was bullying opposition leaders and using force to stifle voices. First they unnecessarily bulldozed a deeply flawed citizenship law. When every community is joining hands to oppose it, they are using state sponsored violence, said Haryana Congress spokesperson Ved Prakash Vidrohi said, adding that senior BJP leaders need to answer why top cops in UP targeted a particular community in Muzaffarnagar.

Title: Pakistan drone shot down: Sukhoi downs Pakistan drone on Rajasthan border
Content: NEW DELHI:An Indian fighter shot down a Pakistani unmanned aerial vehicle on Monday after it came across the international border in Rajasthan, in the third such incident amid heightened tensions along the borders since the February 26 air strikes on a major Jaish e Mohammed facility at Balakot in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan. Fighters were scrambled from the Suratgrah and Nal airbases after the airspace violation was detected by air defence radars in the Anupgarh - Bikaner sector around 11.30 am. The unidentified flying object, which was flying at the speed of a UAV(Unmanned aerial vehicle) or drone, was brought down by an air to air missile fired by a Sukhoi 30MKI. The wreckage could not be recovered since it fell across the border near a feature called MW Toba, a source said. Barely three hours after the pre-dawn air strikes on Balakot on February 26, a Pakistani UAV was shot down along the Kutch border in Gujarat around 6.30 am.
Intersection: Anupgarh, Bikaner, Suratgrah, NEW DELHI, Pakistan,  Gujarat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Kutch, Jaish e Mohammed facility, Gujarat, Nal, Rajasthan, Balakot
Union: Anupgarh, Bikaner, Suratgrah, NEW DELHI, Pakistan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Kutch, Jaish e Mohammed facility, Gujarat, Nal, Rajasthan, Balakot

Title: Rajasthan: Culture, cuisine and craft on Day 2 of Bundi Utsav
Content: KOTA: A large number of tourists, who reached Bundi to experience the authentic taste of Rajasthani tradition, art and folk culture during the 15 day long Bundi Utsav, were mesmerised with the hospitality and exuberance of the festival, on its second day on Saturday. The tourists relished the delicious Rajasthani dish Katth Bafale, amidst the natural surrounding of Sukh Mahal. While the men donned colourful Rajasthani turbans along with a tilak on their foreheads, the women experimented with mehendi (henna) on their palms and bought bangles. The collector and secretary of local Red Cross gave away tricycles to specially challenged persons. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Friday reached Bundi and inaugurated the handicraft fair.

Title: Wont accept less than five seats: Jitan Ram Manjhi
Content: PATNA: Amid the muscle flexing by Mahagathbandhan allies, Hindustani Awam Morcha (Secular) chief Jitan Ram Manjhi on Saturday said he would not accept less than five parliamentary seats in Bihar. The former CM said his party has been offered three seats and a decision on the remaining two seats would be taken by Sunday. Manjhi, however, said if the party demand was not fulfilled, it would decide its next course of action at the parliamentary board meeting of the party on Sunday. Manjhi, who held the parliamentary board meeting of the party even on Saturday, said they discussed about candidates to be fielded in the parliamentary constituencies sought by the party. We want five seats so that we can give representation to woman, dalit and other backward classes (OBCs).

Title: Kanpur: Tannery fined Rs 10 lakh for operating during Kumbh
Content: KANPUR: Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board (UPPCB) on Wednesday imposed a fine of over Rs 10 lakh on a tannery in the city for operating during the three month closure for Kumbh. UPPCB member secretary Ashish Tiwari said that the order had been dispatched to the tannery, which has been asked to pay the fine within 15 days in the board s account. If the tannery fails to comply with the order, the board will not only report the matter to the National Green Tribunal (NGT), but also initiate the proceedings of recovery of fine like land revenue recovery. UPPCB chief environment officer TU Khan told TOI on Wednesday that the state government had ordered closure of all tanneries of Jajmau during Kumbh for about three months. A team of UPPCB and district administration, which had conducted a random checking on April 9, found that the said tannery was operating during the closure period.

Title: Pala: PJ Joseph yet to join UDF campaign
Content: KOTTAYAM: Kerala Congress(M) acting chairman P J Joseph is yet to join the campaign of UDF candidate in Pala Jose Tom Pulikkunnel. Joseph and his supporters were expected to begin campaigning for the candidate along with the UDF on Thursday after the alliance leadership had pacified the leader, who had threatened to launch a separate campaign. District president of the Joseph faction Saji Manjakadambil informed that the decision regarding this will be made after holding the constituency level meeting of the party. The UDF sub committee, headed by convener Benny Behanan, had met here on Tuesday and assured Joseph that he will not have to face any unpleasant actions from the supporters of Jose K Mani during the election campaign. After the meeting, MLA Monce Joseph of the Joseph group had said that the group will take the decision regarding a joint campaign with the UDF instead of a separate one.

Title: Maharashtra assembly elections: BJP releases final list of candidates, drops senior leaders, ministers
Content: MUMBAI: The BJP on Friday released its fourth list of candidates for the upcoming assembly elections in Maharashtra, dropping several senior leaders and ministers. Today is the last day for filing of nominations. Minister for higher and technical education Vinod Tawde has been replaced with Sunil Rane from Borivali seat. In Ghatkopar East, former housing minister Prakash Mehta has been dropped. He has been replaced with his protege and Mumbai richest corporator Parag Shah.
Union: MUMBAI, Maharashtra, Mumbai, Ghatkopar East, Borivali

Title: At defence ministry, Rajnath seeks time bound action
Content: NEW DELHI: Formally taking charge as the country new Raksha Mantri on Saturday, Rajnath Singh directed the four departments in the defence ministry to identify achievable targets and the timelines for their completion in detailed presentations to be made over the next few days. This came after Singh held a meeting with minister of state Shripad Y Naik, the three Service chiefs (Air Chief Marshal B S Dhanoa, General Bipin Rawat and Admiral Karambir Singh), defence secretary Sanjay Mitra, secretary (defence production) Ajay Kumar, DRDO chief G Satheesh Reddy and secretary (ex servicemen welfare) S Kutty. After paying homage at the National War Memorial and then receiving an initial briefing at South Block, Singh tweeted that he had instructed the officers to prepare detailed presentations on all the divisions and set time bound targets to achieve the desired outcomes . Defence secretary Mitra, who was slated to retire on Friday after his two year term, has been granted a three month extension by the government to smoothen the transition. Apart from ensuring that there are enough ammunition stocks to last 10 days of intensive fighting or a full blown war, one of the first things on Singh table will be some measures to slash the non operational flab in the 15 lakh strong armed forces.
Union: National War Memorial, NEW DELHI, South Block

Title: Technical glitch: Out of 5,000 FASTag stickers, only 400 got activated
Content: JAIPUR: The slow server and technical glitch continue to delay the free distribution of FASTag stickers in the state. It may be noted that the Centre had extended the deadline for mandatory stickers from December 1 to 15. Till Friday morning, out of 5,000 stickers only 400 stickers could be activated with the main server in New Delhi. If this continues, the purpose of increasing the coverage percentage from 33 in the state gets defeated completely. M K Jain, chief general manager, NHAI regional office (Rajasthan), meanwhile, has expressed hope that the link will be established fully with the server by Monday.

Title: Vasundhara Raje: Rajasthan Khadi and Village Industries Board organises Rajasthan Heritage Week begins in Jaipur
Content: The Rajasthan Heritage Week began on a promising note on Thursday, celebrating a new chapter in the fabric of freedom. The week will feature the works of weavers and craftsmen, aligning with 18 leading designers from India and abroad, in a three day festival of fashion. Organised by the Rajasthan Khadi and Village Industries Board at Hotel Clarks Amer, the fashion extravaganza, under the mentorship of Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje, will be showcasing traditional textile arts of the state with designers, artisans and weavers. High on glitz and glamour, curator of the show is Prasad Bidapa, chief creative director of the project. The show opened with designer Bibi Russell's collection, which was all quintessentially khadi.
Union: India, Rajasthan, Hotel Clarks Amer, Jaipur

Title: BPSC can hire govt engineers: Nitish Kumar
Content: PATNA: Chief minister (CM) Nitish Kumar on Saturday said the state government would allow recruitment of graduate engineers through Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) instead of the Bihar Technical Service Commission (BTSC). The state government had decided to appoint engineers through the BTSC only to make the recruitment process faster. However, we have no problem if the graduate engineers want their recruitment through the BPSC, the CM said while addressing an event of the rural works department here. In July 2018, the state government had upgraded the existing Bihar Technical Employees Selection Commission (BTESC) as the BTSC through a legislation and decided to recruit doctors, graduate engineers and veterinary doctors through the new recruiting body. However, the Bihar Engineering Services Association (BESA), a union of graduate engineers, opposed the state government move and demanded their recruitment through the BPSC, as was the practice earlier.

Title: Hi Tec Metro works to end in 10 days: MD NVS Reddy
Content: HYDERABAD: Increasing efforts to make the service available to the public soon, Hyderabad Metro Rail officials inspected the 10 km Ameerpet - Hi Tec City stretch of Corridor III on Friday. The Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited (HMRL) MD NVS Reddy, inspected all the eight stations of the stretch with other senior officers and said that L T construction organisation would complete all pending works of the metro rail stretch within 10 days. It was decided that the designer sidewalks or footpaths developed by HMRL on Road No. 36, Jubilee Hills and elsewhere would be protected with bollards to prevent parking of vehicles. Bus bays, auto bays, e vehicle bays and electric charging facilities would be created at all Metro stations.
Intersection: HYDERABAD, Ameerpet, Hi Tec City, Road No. 36, Jubilee Hills
Union: HYDERABAD, Ameerpet, Hi Tec City, Road No. 36, Jubilee Hills

Title: 21 year old shot at by friend in northwest Delhi
Content: NEW DELHI: A 21 year old man was allegedly shot at by his friend in northwest Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday evening. Police said that Vinay was drinking with his friends when one of them shot at him. The bullet went through his left shoulder. Police said that investigation so far shows it was a case of accidental firing. The accused is absconding at present.
Union: Delhi, Jahangirpuri, northwest Delhi, NEW DELHI

Title: Madurai: Wife of man who set two kids, himself afire arrested
Content: MADURAI: The Usilampatti rural police have arrested the wife of the 37 year old disabled man, who set ablaze his two children and himself inside his tea shop in Thottapanaickanur in Madurai district on Thursday. The police had booked a case against seven people including K Geetha under the IPC Section 306 abetment to suicide. On Thursday, A Karupaiah took his daughters K Pradeepa, 8, and K Hemalatha, 6, to his tea shop near his house, where he doused himself and the children with kerosene and set fire. While Pradeepa and Karupaiah died on the spot, Hemalatha died after a few hours in a hospital. Police said that he took the extreme step after Geetha left him after he questioned about her extra marital affair with a man identified as Anandakumar from the same village.

Title: GDA withholds pay of 17 for failing to recover dues
Content: GHAZIABAD: The Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) has withheld two months salary of 17 officials for failing to recover dues under different heads. The move comes at a time coffers of the development agency are drying up and it is facing difficulty in funding projects. GDA vice chairperson Kanchan Verma said she had also fixed a monthly target for officials of the enforcement wing. If they fail to recover the amount specified by the VC, their salaries, too, will be held back. The development agency had been faced with dues amounting to Rs 720 crore under heads like development, compounding and property charges.

Title: Presidency University revokes suspension of 3 students, stir called off
Content: KOLKATA: Presidency University on Thursday evening revoked the suspension of three students ending a 50 hour long stand off. They had been suspended for a full semester after they were found guilty of shutting the varsity gates on September 10, forcing the authorities to shift the annual convocation out of the campus. Since January 19, six students went on an indefinite hunger strike demanding withdrawal of the suspension. The agitating students had been gheraoing vice chancellor Anuradha Lohia since Tuesday afternoon. They called off the fast after the announcement by the university on Thursday.

Title: Ayurved clinics to open at primary health centers
Content: AGRA: The state Ayush department is planning to open clinics that will provide Ayurvedic treatment at primary health centers. Following orders of the state government, the health department has started identifying centers where Ayurved clinics can be operated. The board of Ayurveda and Unani medicine currently operates 27 clinics and hospitals in Agra district. The Ayush department has planned to increase the number up to 50. However, after it turned out that the department had no land to build new clinics on, it approached the state government with the plan to use primary health centers in rural areas to provide Ayurvedic treatment.

Title: Pune: Burglars fire two rounds at cops near jewellery shop
Content: PUNE: A gang of five men fired twice at two beat marshals of the Khadki police during a burglary at a jewellery shop at Bopodi around 4am on Thursday. While the policemen dodged one bullet, the other one misfired. Police said the burglars came to Shree Vardhaman Jewellers at Raviraj Heritage on Bhau Patil Road around 3.45am in a grey multi purpose vehicle. Three of them entered the shop by breaking the locks of the safety door and then ripping apart the central lock with a device connected to the vehicle, police said. As they were putting trays containing ornaments in the car, beat marshals Madhav Gopnar and Swapnil Gholap reached the spot on their motorcycle and asked the driver why the vehicle was waiting there.
Intersection: PUNE, Bopodi, Pune, Shree Vardhaman Jewellers, Raviraj Heritage, Bhau Patil Road
Union: PUNE, Bopodi, Pune, Shree Vardhaman Jewellers, Raviraj Heritage, Bhau Patil Road, Khadki

Title: Mercury touches 39.8 C in Palakkad
Content: PALAKKAD: Though the southwest monsoon is expected to arrive in a couple of days, the atmosphere temperature in the district continues to rise in the district. The temperature touched almost 40 degrees celsius on Tuesday. According to IMD, the mercury rose to 39.8 degrees celsius on Tuesday and the atmosphere was partly cloudy with 53 humidity. On Monday, Malampuzha recorded 39.3 degrees celsius and Mundur 39 degrees celsius. Last month the district recorded 41.1 degrees celsius on April 16.

Title: Surat: Two of eight accused cops surrender
Content: SURAT: Two of the eight cops charged with murder of theft suspect 23 year old Omprakash Pandey in custody at Khatodara police station two weeks ago, surrendered before one of the six teams set up to arrest them in Vadodara on Friday. Chirag Chaudhary, police sub inspector, and Haresh Chaudhary, lok rakshak dal jawan, were brought to the city even as six other cops, including MB Khileri, police inspector, remain still at large. Haresh City police commissioner Satish Sharma said, The two cops, who had surrendered, were subsequently arrested. They will be produced in court by us and a request made for their remand. We will soon nab the other six cops, who are on the run.

Title: Staycation, the new getaway
Content: HYDERABAD: As an alternative to thumbing through dozens of glossy brochures or spending hours scouring the internet for best deals on package tours and flights, professionals leading over scheduled lives in the city's IT hub are now increasingly opting for a 'staycation' for that much needed downtime. 'Staycation', which essentially means taking a mini vacation in your own city, are now increasingly popular with many people opting to enjoy their time off by indulging in simple homegrown pleasures be it a leisurely day at the spa or a 'lazy' brunch by the poolside while dodging the hassle of a traditional vacation. Their destination the star hotels located bang in the middle of the bustling IT hub. And the not so modest price tag ranging between Rs 10,000 and Rs16,000 isn't a deterrent. " I had heard the term being used by a few friends who often checked into hotels, for a day or two, in the same city they worked in.

Title: Centre should bear entire cost of the bridge: Girish Chodankar
Content: PANAJI: The Union ministry of roads, transport and highways (MoRTH) should foot the entire bill for the cable stayed Mandovi bridge since it is part of NH17, the Congress party said here on Sunday. Goa Congress leaders Girish Chodankar and Chandrakant Kavlekar alleged that massive irregularities had taken place during the construction of the bridge, including the possibility of senior BJP leaders receiving kickbacks. Basic necessities of the state are still unmet and the state, instead of using money to reduce water shortage and resolve garbage management, has spent crores of rupees on a bridge that is part of the national highway network, said Chodankar. Let Nitin Gadkari (MoRTH minister) pay for the entire bridge. The party further alleges that a relative of the chief minister was given the contract to supply lamp posts and light fixtures for the bridge with the cost being inflated.

Title: Lucknow: 2 bodies recovered from Indira Canal
Content: LUCKNOW: Panic gripped Chinhat on Saturday after two dead bodies were recovered from the area. Some commuters spotted the body of a man floating in the Indira Canal and informed the police, who fished out the body. While police was trying to ascertain the identity of the man, some villagers reached the scene and informed about the presence of another body in the canal. During investigation, a family reached the scene and identified the first body to be of one Shiv Kumar (25) of Kursi police station area of Barabanki. " Shiv Kumar was mentally challenged and was missing for the last 4-5 days.
Union: Barabanki, LUCKNOW, Indira Canal, Lucknow, Kursi

Title: Delhi suffers season's first very poor air day
Content: NEW DELHI: Delhiites suffered the first very poor air day of the season on Wednesday, with the city s average air quality index touching 304, a clear deterioration from the AQI of 270 (in poor zone) recorded on Tuesday, according to the Central Pollution Control Board readings. Most of the 37 air quality monitoring stations in Delhi recorded AQI in the very poor category even as satellite pictures showed the region under a haze of pollution. The Centre run System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (SAFAR) said Delhi's air quality was likely to remain unchanged or deteriorate marginally over the next two days. It attributed the dip in air quality to slow winds that were preventing pollutants from dispersing. It said the contribution from stubble burning in neighbouring states was low at this time.

Title: Dharmajigudem sub inspector arrested on rape charges
Content: ELURU: A sub inspector of police was arrested on charges of raping a woman in West Godavari district recently. The police arrested sub inspector of Dharmajigudem police station under Lingampalem mandal in West Godavari, Lanka Rajesh on Sunday night and produced before the court. The magistrate of Chintalapudi has sent the accused on remand. A rape case was registered against the accused sub inspector on the basis of a complaint lodged by a woman at the Eluru police station. In her complaint, the woman had alleged that the sub inspector had raped her a number of times.
Intersection: Chintalapudi, Lingampalem, Dharmajigudem, ELURU, Eluru police station, West Godavari, Dharmajigudem police station
Union: Chintalapudi, Lingampalem, Dharmajigudem, ELURU, Eluru, West Godavari

Title: Andhra Pradesh cop arrested after gun goes off in RTC bus
Content: HYDERABAD: The service pistol of a head constable from Andhra Pradesh Intelligence Security Wing (ISW) posted at Telugu Desam Party (TDP) head office, NTR Bhavan, went off accidentally in an RTC bus at Banjara Hills on Thursday morning after an argument with a fellow passenger. The bullet pierced through the roof of the bus. Punjagutta police took him into custody in the evening. The head constable, V Srinivas, is an Armed Reserve head constable of Andhra Pradesh police. Srinivas was working with the Intelligence Security Wing (ISW) of AP police and currently posted as a security personnel at the rear entrance of NTR Bhavan in Road Number 2, Banjara Hills.
Union: HYDERABAD, Banjara Hills, Andhra Pradesh, Punjagutta, NTR Bhavan, AP, Road Number 2

Title: Cage with goat as bait put up to trap adult tiger prowling in Sharda Sagar dam reservoir
Content: Pilibhit: Forest authorities with the help of local police have launched an operation to save an adult tiger lurking into the bushes at 15th milestone inside the embankment of Sharda Sagar dam under Madhotanda police station in Pilibhit district. Forest department officials have put a cage with a goat as bait at some distance where the tiger was spotted and erected a net along the embankment to prevent the big cat from barging in villages close to the dam. Besides, as many as three teams of field forest force have been deployed with vehicles and motorboats to monitor the tiger's movement and four camera traps installed near the spot to capture the images of the tiger, said officials. However, they have, so far, ruled out the possibility of tranquilising the tiger, fearing the feline will fall into the reservoir water after losing its consciousness and may die. Officials suspect the tiger has strayed from the Mahof forest range of the Pilibhit Tiger Reserve situated on the other side of the dam.
Intersection: Sharda Sagar dam, Mahof forest, Madhotanda, Pilibhit, Pilibhit Tiger Reserve
Union: Sharda Sagar dam, Mahof forest, Madhotanda, Pilibhit, Pilibhit Tiger Reserve

Title: New Srivani trust to be used for temple construction
Content: TIRUPATI: The temple administration of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams floated a new trust Srivani, in a bid to boost up the propagation of the Hindu Sanathana Dharma and Sri Venkateswara bhati cult by constructing Lord Venkateswara temples across the country. TTD executive officer Anil Kumar Singhal held the first review meeting regarding Srivani trust at the administrative building in Tirupati. During the review meet senior officials of the temple administration led by Singhal elaborated upon the activities and objectives of the Sri Venkateswara Alaya Nirmanam trust. Addressing the media, TTD EO said, Srivani is the 10th trust floated by the temple administration and it has already received donations worth Rs 25 lakh from pilgrims, donors and also philanthropists. He also said that the contributions to this trust will be utilised for construction of temples, their management, archaka training etc.

Title: But Shakur Basti residents feel vindicated
Content: NEW DELHI: Runa Devi's face is animated as she makes her way to the small shop she has been running in a JJ colony in north Delhi's Shakur Basti for the past couple of years. She knows what awaits her there. These days, the people who come to her stall for groceries and, currently, colours and paraphernalia for Holi, have only one topic to discuss: the Delhi high court decision directing the state government to ensure the Northern Railways removes encroachments only after ensuring rehabilitation for the displaced people. It is a victory for us. We have been waiting for this moment for years, said Devi, 65, one of the earliest settlers at Shakur Basti.
Union: Delhi, JJ colony, NEW DELHI, Shakur Basti

Title: Ahmedabad: Insects in 66 of loose cumin samples, says CERC
Content: AHMEDABAD: Buying loose cumin from the local spice market in city? Beware! It could be infested with insects. A recent comparative study conducted by Consumer Education and Research Centre (CERC) revealed that some 66 of the total cumin samples tested were found to be infested with insects. Eight out of 12 samples showed signs of them being eaten by insects. The samples were tested for appearance, taste and odour, presence of moulds, insects, extraneous matter like lumps, stones, grit, other seeds.

Title: BJP to not push for simultaneous assembly, Lok Sabha polls in Haryana
Content: CHANDIGARH: BJP Haryana in charge and Rajya Sabha MP Anil Jain on Sunday said the party will not push for assembly elections in the state being held simultaneously with parliamentary polls. In a media briefing after the first round of a meeting of Haryana BJP election committee s core group, Jain admitted to the the Jind bypoll victory being discussed. Contrary to the denial by Jain, sources continue to assert that Haryana BJP leaders, especially MLAs, suggested for dissolving the assembly to hold simultaneous elections to encash on the interim Budget and BJP s victories in mayoral and civic polls and Jind byelection. At the time this report was filed, the core group had taken a break after the first round of meeting held at Haryana Bhawan, New Delhi. Since the party s victory in Jind, senior leaders of the BJP had been giving indications of early assembly elections.
Union: New Delhi, Haryana, Haryana Bhawan, CHANDIGARH

Title: Wetland survey reveals new bird rich areas
Content: PUNE: The wetland bird count conducted by the state forest department in areas in the vicinity of the city has revealed new spots that were visited by several migratory and resident birds. " Before we started the exercise we identified some of the important wetlands. We were surprised to come across some areas which haven't traditionally been thought of as important habitats for migratory birds," Kiran Purandhare, coordinator of the project for Pune, said. Citing an example, he said that there has been deposition of silt along the Mula Mutha riverbed and, over time, aquatic vegetation has come up here. Between the Khadakwasla and Panshet dams, several relatively unknown wetlands have come up, he added. "
Union: PUNE, Pune, Khadakwasla, Panshet dams, Panshet, Mula Mutha

Title: Uncool bus ACs in Kolkata turn up heat on passengers
Content: The AC buses in Kolkata are attracting record passenger 2.5 lakh a day, thanks to high discomfort index terrible heat and high humidity. Yet a large number of AC buses fail to cool to the comfort level. A lot of passengers complained that they keep sweating inside the bus and are often forced to alight the bus because it is better to ride a non AC bus than travelling in an air tight bus with dysfunctional AC. TOI takes a trip by a few of AC buses of different routes and find such complaint have solid basis. The cooling is ineffective particularly in buses with front engines. Cooling is much better in buses with rear engines, admitted a senior official of West Bengal Transport Corporation.

Title: NCR students go on climate strike
Content: On Friday, thousands of students and environmental activists from around the world came out for a global strike against climate change. It was the second global strike, with the first one being on March 15. Like the last strike, this year too, hundreds of students across NCR skipped school to participate in the movement. The young protestors told us that they are inspired by Swedish teenager Greta Thunberg, who started the movement last year by skipping school every Friday and protesting outside the Swedish parliament, demanding that they adhere to the Paris Agreement on Climate Change. She started the Fridays for Future movement, a network of young climate protesters.

Title: Charges framed against 2 in Gujarat Best Bakery case
Content: MUMBAI: A special court has framed charges against two men being tried separately in the Gujarat Best Bakery case. The charges were framed against Mafat Gohil and Harshad Solanki under Indian Penal Code sections, including murder, destruction of evidence and attempt to murder. The court last month rejected the bail pleas of the duo, who pleaded not guilty. Fourteen persons were killed by a mob during the Gujarat riots on March 1, 2002. Harshad was arrested by Rajasthan police in 2010, while Mafat was arrested from his home in Gujarat by NIA in March 2013.

Title: UP gang's run on loot spree in south India ends, 4 arrested
Content: MEERUT: A gang of four from UP's Saharanpur district involved in a spate of looting unoccupied homes across Hyderabad and cities in Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Madhya Pradesh was nabbed by a team of STF and Hyderabad special operations team (SOT) on Monday. The four arrested were identified as Aditya Kumar and Pradeep Chaudhary from Bulandshahr, Surendra Kumar Sharma from Saharanpur, all in UP, and Muniraj Rajora from Dehradun in Uttarakhand. They (accused) will be produced in a local court in Saharanpur and taken to Hyderabad on a transit remand, said STF DSP Brijesh Singh. According to STF sources, four accused were involved in two separate burglaries in Hyderabad on August 27. They then went on to loot a house in Kanchipuram in Tamil Nadu on September 30.
Intersection: Madhya Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand, Andhra Pradesh, Saharanpur, MEERUT
Union: Hyderabad, UP, Madhya Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Kanchipuram, Bulandshahr, Uttarakhand, Andhra Pradesh, Saharanpur, MEERUT, Dehradun, south India

Title: Gaya: Three cops hurt in attack by villagers
Content: GAYA: A group of people in Salaiyya village of Imamganj block in Gaya district on Friday attacked a police party that had gone for execution of arrest warrants against more than a half a dozen persons in connection with a land dispute. The attackers used hard and blunt wood pieces to attack the cops. Sources sad that a constable received serious head injuries and was referred to Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH). The injured cops have been identified as Sohail Salaiyya police station SHO Ajai Kumar Singh, sub inspector (SI) Sikandar Paswan and constable Pankaj Singh. Pankaj has been referred to PMCH.

Title: Ajit Pawar: Ajit BJP back channels opened a few days ago, operation began Friday evening
Content: NEW DELHI: As the Shiv Sena NCP Congress talks inched closer to conclusion, Ajit Pawar discomfort with the unfolding scenario grew. Not at ease about an alliance with Sena and increasingly anxious over his future in NCP in the light of corrosive family battles, the taciturn, rough hewn leader looked for a way out. The back channels had been at work over the past few days and on Friday, Ajit Pawar indicated that he might be ready to make his move. The operation that culminated in the swearing in of Devendra Fadnavis as CM and Ajit Pawar as his deputy early on Saturday, began to roll out about 12 hours before when Bhupender Yadav, BJP general secretary in charge of Maharashtra, reached Mumbai around 7pm. Yadav arrival was preceded by Ajit Pawar conveying through intermediaries to Fadnavis he was ready to cross over if he was given an honourable deal , and that he would get numbers that would help BJP reach the majority mark.

Title: Minister on poll drive dodges anti CAA protesters
Content: TRICHY: Following stiff opposition from the Muslim community across the country to the Citizenship Amendment Act, a group of Muslims from Needur village near Mayiladuthurai in Nagapattinam district staged a protest and raised slogans against the minister for handlooms and textile O S Manian. The minister was to campaign for his party candidates contesting for panchayat ward member and panchayat union ward members posts in the district on Tuesday. According to sources, Manian was engaged in a whirlwind campaign for his party as well as alliance party candidates in Mayiladuthurai union. After completing his campaign at Thiruinthalur, he started for Needur village which was the next spot via Jamia Masjid street. About 100 people from the Muslim community, who already gathered in front of the masjid, started raising slogans on coming to know that the minister was on his way there.
Union: TRICHY, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam, Needur, Thiruinthalur, Jamia Masjid

Title: Kuppam assembly election result: Chandrababu Naidu takes leads in initial trends
Content: VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh chief minister Chandrababu Naidu lead by over 1500 votes from Kuppam assembly constituency. In the assembly elections of 2014, TDP's N Chandrababu Naidu had defeated YRCP's K. Chandramouli. The voting for the high profile seat took place on April 11, 2019 along with the general elections. The ruling TDP has 102 MLAs in the 175 member state assembly while the opposition YSRCP has 67 MLAs. The BJP has four legislators while two seats are held by others.

Title: Cotton breaks five year record in Punjab
Content: BATHINDA: In a reversal of sorts, the area under cotton cultivation has crossed four lakh hectares in Punjab for the first time in five years. The last time cotton was sown on more than 4 lakh hectares was in the 2014 15 season. Primarily, the rise in area under the cash crop is seen as a reflection of its price crossing the Rs 6,000 per quintal mark at the end of the 2018 19 season. Though cotton is, ideally, sown till May 15 in Punjab, delayed harvesting of wheat due to untimely rain pushed sowing back to May 31. It was also being sown till Sunday.

Title: Six Keralites on board seized Iranian, British flagged tankers
Content: KOCHI/MALAPPURAM: At least six Keralites are learnt to be on board two vessels seized by Britain and Iran in the ongoing 'tanker war', as tensions escalated in the Persian Gulf following the standoff between Western powers and Tehran over the aborted nuclear deal. All six are at present reported safe. Three Keralites are believed to be aboard the Iranian oil tanker Grace 1 seized by British marines in Gibraltar on July 4 and the same number on the British flagged tanker Stena Impero commandeered by Iran as a 'reciprocal action 'in the Strait of Hormuz on July 19. Relatives of Dijo Pappachan (26) of Kalamassery, a messman with the British flagged Stena Impero, got a call from the Mumbai unit of the shipping company on Saturday night about the ship's seizure. His father T V Pappachan said Dijo had told them earlier that the ship s captain hailed from Fort Kochi and another person from Tripunithura is also on board the ship.
Union: Tripunithura, Kochi, Britain, Tehran, Gibraltar, KOCHI, Persian Gulf, Iran, MALAPPURAM, Mumbai, Gibraltar, Strait of Hormuz, Fort Kochi, Kalamassery

Title: Fire breaks out in high rise building under construction in Malad (East)
Content: MUMBAI: A major fire broke out at a 42 storeyed building which is under construction at Malad (East), in Mumbai on Friday night. No casualty has been reported so far. " The fire started at around 10.30pm on 37th floor which later spread to 42nd floor. The construction material stock was kept on the building terrace. Eight fire engines and three ambulances and eight policemen are at the spot,"  said assistant municipal commissioner of the P-north ward DP Jain.

Title: Man arrested in Pataudi for raping 9 year old daughter
Content: GURUGRAM: A 35 year old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his nine year old daughter in Pataudi on Saturday. According to the police, the incident took place in the afternoon when the girl mother was out for work. The accused allegedly attacked his daughter when she was alone at home and raped her. When the girl mother returned home in the evening, the she found the girl sobbing. When questioned as to why she was crying, the girls narrated her ordeal.

Title: Chennai Weather: No rain, Chennai to witness nippy mornings
Content: CHENNAI: There a nip in the air in the mornings as the city is getting chilly winds from the north but chances of rain are remote. Mornings and nights are likely to remain cool in the coming days. There is little chance for rain though the easterly wind pattern specific to the northeast monsoon period continues over the city. A forecast by the Meteorological department said, The sky condition is likely to be generally cloudy. Maximum and minimum temperature are likely to be around 30C and 22C respectively.

Title: CPI ML supports JNU students agitation
Content: GAYA: CPI ML general secretary Dipankar Bhattacharya on Sunday supported the ongoing agitation by the students of Jawaharlal Nehru University on the issue of steep fee hike. Bhattacharya, who is in Bodh Gaya in connection with the two day meet of the state executive of the CPI ML, also came down heavily on the Centre for denial of higher education to disadvantaged sections. On day one of the meet on Saturday, CPI ML took stock of the political situation in the country and in state, especially the outcome of the recent assembly byelections in Bihar. The CPI ML general secretary also criticised Maharashtra governor for what he called midnight murder of democracy in the state. Misuse of the constitutional office of governor is a matter of serious concern, he said.

Title: Swardeep singers perfect tribute to legendary Rafi
Content: Nagpur: Singers of Swardeep Group paid perfect tribute to legendary Mohammed Rafi by presenting his popular songs in musical programme Wo Jab Yaad Aaye at Scientific Society Hall in Laxmi Nagar on Saturday. In all 27 songs were sung by eight singers. Aaja tujhko pukare mera pyar was the opening song sung by Ganesh Chavan, which was followed by Khuda bhi aasama se by Ashish Hadke, who was also the anchor for the evening. Duets and singles presented by the artistes succeeded in catching the listeners attention. Other singers like Sunita Munjewar, Swati Gondhalekar, Manjusha Pahade, Shirish Suryavanshi, Anuradha Patil and Gaurav Gondhalekar connected well the audience with their fantastic voice.
Union: Laxmi Nagar, Nagpur, Scientific Society Hall

Title: NRI woman goes missing under mysterious circumstances
Content: Ferozepur: A non resident Indian woman, who was all set to fly back to Australia on March 22, reportedly went missing under mysterious circumstances from her in laws house at Bagge Ke Pipal in Ferozepur. Ravneet Kaur, 29, was visiting her in laws, was last seen talking over the phone to her husband. Kaur got the Australian citizenship on November 26, 2014, and was married six years ago. She has a four year old baby, who had also come along with Kaur to Bagge Ke Pipal. It is alleged that she got a phone call from her husband on March 14 and that she went to the street while talking and never returned back.

Title: No chairman in consumer forums of 18 dists
Content: Kanpur: Consumers of several districts of the state feel helpless because they are not getting instant remedy under the Consumer Protection Act. The reason being that the quorum of district consumer forums is not complete in several districts. Ragini Jaiswal, an information officer, state consumer protection commission, UP, in her letter, informed Praveen Jaiswal, advocate, who had sought information under the RTI Act, that as many as 18 district consumer forums in the state neither have a chairman nor a member. Even in Varanasi and Gorakhpur districts, which are the parliamentary and assembly constituencies of PM Narendra Modi and chief minister Yogi Adityanath respectively, the district consumer forums do not have presiding officers, she informed and added the other district consumer forums are Agra (first), Muzzaffar Nagar, Badaun, Shahjahanpur, Sultanpur, Gorakhpur, Padrauna, Meerut, Amroha, Gonda, Balrampur, Shravasti, Varanasi, Auraiya, Sant Kabir Nagar, Shamli, Hapur and Sambal. The information officer informed that 18 district forums which have no chairmen are Baghpat, Chandauli, Moradabad (second), GB Nagar, Bulandshahr, Bhadohi, Sonebhadra, Lakhimpur, Agra (second), Muzaffarnagar, Pratapgarh, Kaushambi, Basti, Barabanki, Kanpur Nagar and Kanpur Dehat.
Intersection: Lakhimpur, Hapur, Sant Kabir Nagar, Muzaffarnagar, Kaushambi, Kanpur, Shamli, Chandauli, GB Nagar, Sonebhadra, Bulandshahr, Gorakhpur, Muzzaffar Nagar, Bhadohi, Basti, Badaun, Barabanki, Gonda, Agra, Shravasti, Shahjahanpur, Auraiya, Amroha, Balrampur, Sultanpur
Union: Lakhimpur, Moradabad, Padrauna, Sambal, Hapur, Sant Kabir Nagar, Muzaffarnagar, Kaushambi, Kanpur, Baghpat, Shamli, Pratapgarh,  GB Nagar, Sonebhadra, Bulandshahr, Gorakhpur, Muzzaffar Nagar, Kanpur Nagar, Kanpur Dehat, Bhadohi, Meerut, UP, Basti, Badaun, Barabanki, Gonda, Varanasi, Balrampur, Agra, Shravasti, Shahjahanpur, Auraiya, Amroha, Chandauli, Sultanpur

Title: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds addict teenager commits suicide days before wedding
Content: NAGPUR: An 18 year old woman, who was a Player Unknown s Battlegrounds (PUBg) addict, committed suicide at her rented room in Saibaba Nagar on Friday, days before her wedding with her live in partner. Arpita Gupta, a 12th pass, committed suicide by hanging herself from the ceiling fan with a long scarf when her live in partner had gone to work. This is the second case of suicide by a PUBg addict woman. It is learnt that Arpita and her live in partner, Rajat Gupta, 24, had planned to tie the knot on Monday or Tuesday. After registering a case of accidental death, Wathoda police have begun an investigation.

Title: Only 276 households completed 150 days of work in drought
Content: The Odisha government's tall claim of providing succour to people in drought hit regions through job creation under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) appears to be mere lip service as only 276 households in the State could complete 150 days of work. As per reply furnished in the State Assembly on Tuesday, only 276 households in 139 drought hit blocks have been provided 150 days of work. The Union government has allowed 150 days of work in districts where water harvesting projects are being taken. Going a step further, the State government has announced to provide additional 50 days of works in 139 blocks identified to be hit by drought, said Panchayati Raj Minister Arun Sahoo in a written reply. As per drought mitigation measures announced by the State government, MGNREGA works will be taken up by the Panchayati Raj Department to establish water harvesting structures, de silting of field channels and diversion.

Title: Liquor menace
Content: Alleging that families are getting affected due to consumption of liquor by the earning members, women groups of Pamulaparthy village in Wargal mandal attacked belt shops and destroyed them. They warned that sale of liquor or its consumption would be not allowed. According to sources, a drunkard created some trouble in the morning. This led to women gathering at the spot and losing their cool over the nuisance being faced by them. Spontaneously, the women, about 60 in number, destroyed liquor bottles stored in shops and warned that selling of liquor would not be tolerated.

Title: PM's Bhagalpur rally rescheduled
Content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has rescheduled the Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bhagalpur rally to September 1 as earlier it was scheduled to be held on August 30. In the poll bound Bihar, the Nitish Kumar led grand Alliance on Wednesday too had declared to hold a massive rally on August 30 at Patna's Gandhi Maidan to counter the surge of BJP and also to respond Mr Modi's DNA barb allegedly made against Chief Minister Kumar. However, the BJP had finalized and declared PM Modi s fourth rally in Bhagalpur much earlier but the grand alliance apparently coincided the date of their Swabhiman (self respect) rally to stall his (Narendra Modi) Parivartan (for change) rally's impact. Mr Modi's two rallies earlier held at Muzaffarpur and Gaya were hugely successful while he is also scheduled to address the third one at Saharsa on August 18.
Union: Bhagalpur, Saharsa, Gaya, Patna, Gandhi Maidan, Muzaffarpur, Bihar

Title: No exigency to call grand assembly, says SGPC
Content: AMRITSAR: While maintaining that only Akal Takht jathedar can convene a Sarbat Khalsa (grand assembly of Sikhs), Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) president Avtar Singh Makkar warned the Sikhs against the 'so called' congregation convened by some groups allegedly for their own vested interests. In a press release issued here on Wednesday evening, Makkar said, " Sarbat Khalsa is a gathering of Sikh representatives from around the world, who gather on the call of Akal Takht jathedar to deliberate on Panthic issues. " Stating that there was no exigency to call Sarbat Khalsa, Makkar said the assembly was convened only when the Sikh community faced a serious Panthic issue and it results in major Panthic achievements. " There is no such Panthic exigency to call a Sarbat Khalsa," he said, adding that community had its representation in the form of SGPC members. Since 1920, Sarbat Khalsa has been convened thrice on November 15, 1920, September 2, 1984 and February 16, 1986 the SGPC chief informed.

Title: Periyar remembered
Content: Representatives of political parties, and other organisations observed the death anniversary of social reformer and founder of the Dravidian Movement late E. V. R. Periyar by garlanding his statues and portraits across the district on Thursday. DMK secretary of the Salem Central district unit R. Rajendran garlanded the statue of Periyar in front of the Collectorate in the city. Dravidar Kazhagam, PMK, CPI, MDMK, too garlanded the statue of the late leader. M. Manivannan, Registrar of Periyar University, garlanded the statue at the entrance of the campus.

Title: CRPF to adopt village in earthquake
Content: Extending a helping hand to the victims of the devastating earthquake in Nepal, paramilitary force CRPF has decided to adopt a village in the Himalayan country, a senior officer said today. The CRPF has decided to adopt Karikat village near Birganj in Nepal to provide people immediate relief and help in its reconstruction, said Inspector General of CRPF, Bihar and Jharkhand, Arun Kumar. We got information that nobody has reached Karikat village comprising 150 families so far after the deadly earthquake on April 25 and decided to adopt it, the CRPF IG said. He said CPRF personnel would reach out to every family in the village with relief and help in its reconstruction. Kumar said over 1,000 CRPF (Central Reserver Police Force) personnel have been deployed at Raxual on Indo Nepal border in East Champaran district of Bihar for relief work of quake hit people.
Union: East Champaran, Karikat, Nepal, Raxual, Bihar, Jharkhand, Birganj

Title: Remarks against soldiers
Content: Telugu Desam Party president and Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu has taken a serious note of the reported comments made by his party's Amalapuram MP P. Ravindra Babu against soldiers. Mr. Naidu has clarified that the controversial comments made by the MP were made in his individual capacity and not related to the party in any way. He is understood to have told the senior leaders to seek a written explanation from the MP for making such remarks. He is learnt to have expressed dissatisfaction that in spite of his repeated instructions, a section of leaders continued to air their views in the presence of the media which was having adverse impact on the party s image and caused embarrassment to the party leadership. He asserted that the party gave utmost respect to armed forces that were sacrificing their lives for the sake of the country.

Title: Ezhavas have always stood by the Left, says Kanam
Content: Communist Party of India (CPI) State unit secretary Kanam Rajendran has said that the official leadership of the Sree Narayana Dharma Paripalana (SNDP) Yogam has always been averse to supporting Communist parties, but the rank and file of the Ezhava community has always stood by the Left parties. Talking to media persons here on Tuesday, the CPI leader said Sree Narayana Guru was by birth and deed a Communist. But successive leaderships of the Yogam were never so. When R. Sankar led the organisation the leadership was with the Congress. It was the Left governments which had always protected the interests of Ezhava community.

Title: Constable, M. Tech. graduate commit suicide
Content: Two men, including a police constable, ended their lives by hanging in their homes in the city on Saturday. Constable Madhusudhan (28), attached to Sampigehalli police station from the past three years, allegedly hanged himself to death at his house in Chokkanahalli on Saturday night. Sources said he was depressed after his wife committed suicide in April. He was married for over a year. However, the couple had marital differences.

Title: Kalaburagi City Corporation council meeting witnesses noisy scenes
Content: The general body meeting of the Kalaburagi City Corporation held here on Friday witnessed noisy scenes, after councillors representing different political parties voiced their demands. The meeting was delayed by one and half hours as people from different wards under the banner of Gandagi Mukt Andolan gheraoed Corporation Commissioner Shrikant Kattimani outside the meeting hall at Indira Smarak Bhavan, accusing him of failing to take action against the pig menace in the city. Both the ruling Congress and the Opposition party councillors, supporting the protest, trooped into the well during the meeting and urged the corporation to put an end to pig menace in the city. The BJP councillors accused Mayor Aliya Shereen and Mr. Kattimani for not including their demands in the agenda. The councillors alleged that the city corporation had failed to provide basic amenities to citizens.

Title: Four storeyed building collapses in Delhi
Content: A four storeyed building collapsed in Gautampuri area of Northeast Delhi in the wee hours on Wednesday but no casualties were reported in the incident. A Delhi Fire Services official said they had received a call at 3.12 am about the collapse following which 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. Search and rescue operation was launched in earnest. We haven't found any casualties so far. The work is underway, a police official said.

Title: Schoolgirls strip searched in Gurdaspur probe ordered
Content: A day after 13 girl students of a school in Gurdaspur were strip searched by a lady teacher for alleged theft, the Punjab government has ordered a probe into the incident. Reacting to a report that the girls were subjected to humiliation after Rs. 500 went missing from the purse of one of the teachers, Punjab Education Minister Dr. Daljit Singh Cheema said strict action would be taken against any teacher found guilty. He said the District Education Officer (Elementary) of Gurdaspur has appointed the inquiry officers and would be submitting a report in a fortnight. The accused is absconding.

Title: Train students in cleanliness, says Mahatma's granddaughter
Content: Mahatma Gandhi's granddaughter Usha Gokhani on Monday appealed to the teaching community to teach children Gandhiji s principle of cleanliness of body and mind. Addressing a gathering of thousands of students here at the Swachh Avanigadda programme, she reminded the gathering on how Gandhiji believed in dignity of labour, by involving his family members in work at Sabarmati Ashram. Gandhiji s principle of cleanliness is relevant to Indian society forever, and hence the need of the hour is to train students in cleanliness, Ms. Gokhani said. The beauty of Mahatma was his strong desire to involve his family members in the activities of Sabarmathi Ashram, she added remembering her days spent at the ashram till she was eight. She also greeted the children who dressed up like Gandhiji.

Title: VIT extends UHET scheme to entire district
Content: The Universal Higher Education Trust (UHET) founded by VIT Chancellor G.
