Viswanathan with the objective of enabling economically weaker students who passed Plus Two in Vellore district to pay the fees and join higher educational institutions, has extended the scheme to all the remaining constituencies in the district. The scheme which was introduced in phases in Gudiyatham, K. V. Kuppam, Ranipet, Vellore, Katpadi, Anaicut and Ambur Assembly constituencies, has now been extended to the remaining six constituencies, i. e. , Arcot, Vaniyambadi, Tirupattur, Jolarpet, Arakkonam and Sholinghur, and to the tribal students in Jamunamarudur panchayat union in Tiruvannamalai district from 2015 16. Presiding over a meeting of government employees and government teachers associations held at the VIT campus here recently to discuss the implementation of the scheme, Mr. Viswanathan appealed to the members of the associations to contribute their mite to the trust in order to provide financial assistance to economically weaker students who get admission in colleges but could not join them due to poverty. This way, it was possible to ensure that all those who get admission in colleges join them. Meetings have been held already with philanthropists, industrialists and non governmental organisations to enlist their support to the scheme, he said.
Intersection: Katpadi, Arakkonam, Vaniyambadi, Arcot, Vellore, Ambur, Tiruvannamalai, Tirupattur, Jolarpet, Anaicut
Union: Katpadi, Arakkonam, Gudiyatham, Vaniyambadi, Arcot, Jamunamarudur, Ranipet, Vellore, Sholinghur, Ambur,  Sholinghur, K. V. Kuppam, Tiruvannamalai, Tirupattur, Jolarpet, Anaicut

Title: Seashore: No idea about graft CD
Content: BHUBANESWAR: Seashore Group chief Prashant Dash on Wednesday washed his hands off a controversial audio CD in which one of his employees reportedly claimed the company distributed Rs 550 crore bribe to politicians, mostly ruling BJD. "I do not know about the CD. The audio tape might have been manufactured by my rivals to defame me and my company. I did not distribute money to anyone", Dash said at Capital Hospital where he was brought from the Jharpada Special Jail for routine health check-up. The CD, purportedly containing 39.06 minute conversation between Seashore Group staffer Pradeep Samantaray and a social worker Pinak Mohanty, was sent to forensic laboratory in Hyderabad for examination.

Title: National seminar on sports today
Content: The two day sponsored national seminar sponsored by the University Grants Commission on personality development through sports will be held at Siddhartha Auditorium here on July 3 and 4. Prof. P. Chinnappa Reddy, former Director of Physical Education at Sri Krishnadevaryya University, will deliver the keynote address. Krishna University Registrar D. Suryachandra Rao, Sports Authority of AP Chairman P. R. Mohan and Chess Grand Master M. R. Lalith Babu will grace the function. The special guests will be Siddhartha Academy administrators Mr. Nalluri Venkateswarlu, P. Lakshmana Rao and Siddhartha Arts College convenor P. L. N. Prasad.

Title: MOS championship
Content: As many as 25,000 students attended a screening test conducted across the district by Brilliant Computer Education Institute on Sunday for the Microsoft Office Specialist World Championship. Institute Director Sk. Niyamatullah Basha said as many 250 shortlisted students from classes VIII to X would be provided coaching free of cost in Microsoft Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint for the state level online contest to be held in April and the national level contest in June. The cream of students will get a chance to visit, Orlando in Florida state in the US for the finals in August, he added.

Title: Collector upset over vendors occupying roads, pavements
Content: Collector Neetu Kumari Prasad has instructed the officials to ensure that vendors do not sell vegetables and fruits on the roads thereby obstructing smooth flow of traffic in Karimnagar town. The Collector along with Superintendent of Police V Shiva Kumar, Joint Collector Pousami Basu and others made a surprise visit to various busy streets and markets here on Thursday. Expressing concern over the footpaths being occupied by the vendors , she directed the municipal and police officials to form a team and move the vegetable vendors to the model rythu bazaar, which has been lying vacant. The Collector was also shocked over the parking of autos and RTC buses on the roads. She told the authorities to create separate bus bays for the RTC buses at the bus shelters so that they would not obstruct the traffic movement.

Title: Religious fervour marks Bonalu
Content: Residents of the district headquarters town celebrated Bonalu festival amid gaiety and religious fervour on Sunday. They offered bonam to Pedda Pochamma at Pochammagalli and at other temples of village Goddesses. Women and men alike went to the temple with the pots of bonalu on their heads. Several men also participated in the bonalu. Many people visited the temples and prayed the Goddess for bountiful of rainfall and bumper harvest.

Title: Bill runs the risk of falling between two stools
Content: State government following its nose on the draft Bill to cement Malayalam as the language for all official purposes and communications is a question that bothers language liberals. Following differences over certain clauses, the Cabinet recently returned the draft legislation proposed by the Assembly Committee on Official Language for further fine tuning, but the government has been urged to exercise extreme caution while passing such a piece of law for fear that it could foment language fanaticism. The Bill should have adequate provisions to protect the Constitutional rights of the linguistic minorities in Kasaragod, Idukki, and Palakkad districts. It would otherwise lead to widespread resentment in places such as Manjeswaram taluk where Kannada and Tulu are the lingua franca of a large population, cautions P. Karunakaran, MP, representing Kasaragod. One of the recommendations of the P. Prabhakaran Commission that recommended measures to address the backwardness of the region is the creation of a special cell to translate into Kannada government rules and regulations.

Title: Accused held 5 years after temple theft
Content: Nearly five years after stealing the idol at the Eriyal Kuruvayal temple, near here, the police arrested the prime accused. The arrest of Jonavas alias Asees, 29, by a police team led by Kasaragod circle inspector P. K. Sudhakaran, came after the youth was nabbed in a pick pocketing case at Pandeshwar in Mangaluru recently. During interrogation by the Mangaluru police, Asees confessed to have looted the temple on April 13, 2010. Three thieves involved in the temple burglary had been arrested by the police.
Union: Pandeshwar, Eriyal Kuruvayal temple, Mangaluru, Kasaragod

Title: ARSON CASE
Content: A branch committee office of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) CPI(M) at Kacherippara, near Azhikode, under the Valapattanam police station limits here was gutted in an alleged attack in the early hours of Sunday. The party office functioning on the upper floor of an old tiled roof building was destroyed in the fire. Furniture and other articles inside the office were burnt. Local CPI(M) leaders alleged that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh workers had set fire to the office. The police said that investigation was on.

Title: AP Police issues notice to news channel
Content: The Andhra Pradesh Police has issued notice to city based news channel T News for airing an audio tape containing purported conversation between Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu and Telangana MLA Elvys Stephenson. The notices that were served late last night evoked criticism from both the channel management and the media fraternity of Telangana. The channel has also called for a protest in front of AP DGP's office, Secretariat and all district headquarters on Saturday. Since the programme telecast on June 7 at around 8. 30 p. m. contained material disturbing the public tranquillity, affecting the maintenance of law and order as it in violation of Section 5 and Rule 6 of Cable TV News Network Act, as the programme is defamatory deliberate, false with suggestive innuendos and half truths, the notice read. Reacting to the notice, T News Channel CEO Narayan Reddy said the AP police had no right to issue notices even before verifying authenticity of the footage.

Title: MP journalist burnt to death says post mortem report
Content: The post mortem report of Madhya Pradesh journalist Sandeep Kothari's death has revealed that he was burnt alive, police said in Balaghat on Saturday. Sandeep was abducted from Katangi in Balaghat district of Madhya Pradesh on June, 19. Later, his body was found on the railway tracks in Wardha district of Maharasthra. While there is much speculation about Sandeep's death, the post mortem report on Friday has put an end to all doubts. Sandeep was smothered to death and when he was being burnt, he was unconscious but breathing.
Union: Maharasthra, Madhya Pradesh, MP, Balaghat, Wardha, Katangi

Title: Collector reviews steps for Courtallam season
Content: Collector M. Karunakaran chaired a meeting here on Monday to ensure tourist friendly measures at Courtallam during this season, especially during the Saaral Thiruvizhaa celebrations. The Madras High Court had to intervene last year and appointed an advocate commissioner for creating tourist friendly environment at Courtallam. The Collector asked the officials to ensure the implementation of all instructions given by the Madras High Court last year and ensure safety measures in all waterfalls. The Collector instructed the officials to remove encroachments in all places of Courtallam, strictly ban the use of shampoo, soaps and shikakai in the waterfalls. The Saaral Thiruvizhaa celebrations should be made attractive by involving all departments and the police should weed out consumption of liquor in open places.

Title: Partial relief for accused in Wadia deposition
Content: MUMBAI: The sessions court has in a conditional order rejected a plea made by Kirti Ambani for an in camera deposition by industrialist Nusli Wadia as a witness in a 25 yearold case of a murder attempt on his life. The court has imposed certain conditions on media reporting of the deposition. It has directed that any reference to business rivalry of the companies with respect to the present case made during the deposition cannot be reported when it takes place in the open court. The court will next month fix a date for Wadia's deposition as a witness. The case, which dates back to an alleged attempt made in 1988 89 on Wadia's life, has Kirti Ambani, then a senior executive at Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) as a prime accused.

Title: President to deliver convocation address at CUK
Content: President Pranab Mukherjee will deliver the convocation address second convocation of the Central University of Karnataka (CUK) to be held on July 28. CUK Vice Chancellor H. M. Maheshwaraiah, addressing presspersons here on Friday, said that due to delay in completion of the auditorium on the university campus at Kadaganchi village in Aland taluk, the programme would be held at the newly constructed auditorium on the premises of ESIC Medical Education Complex in Kalaburagi city. The President would also give away gold medals to 48 students, including 33 boys and 15 girls. Immediately after landing by helicopter at 11 a. m. , the President would straightway go to the ESIC Hospital Auditorium where the main event would be held. According to Prof. Maheshwaraiah, both Governor Vajubhai Vala the Chief Minister Siddaramaiah have consented to take part in the programme, which would be held after a gap of four years.
Union: Aland taluk, Kadaganchi, Kalaburagi, Aland, Karnataka

Title: Free space needed to stage art forms: Adoor
Content: Noted film maker Adoor Gopalakrishnan has called for a permanent free space for staging various art forms. He was speaking after inaugurating a meeting held here on Thursday in memory of venerated dramatist G. Sankara Pillai. The meeting was held at the Maavaveeyan Veedhi a road which is slated to become a permanent venue for cultural activities. Later, a sapling was planted by the Veedhi in memory of Sankara Pillai. It was the late dramatists close associates playwright S. Ramanujam and actor N. Rajan who planted the sapling.

Title: Cong. ZP member attends meeting with weapon
Content: Mild commotion prevailed in the Zilla Parishad general body meeting when a Congress ZPTC member attended the meeting carrying his licensed revolver at the ZP Conference Hall in Karimnagar on Monday. The ZP general body meeting was discussing the agricultural scenario in the district. Irked over denial of chance to speak over the issue, the Kataram Congress ZPTC member Narayana Reddy stood up and protested. During the period, the TRS ZPTC members noticed his revolver around his waist and lodged a protest for carrying a weapon into the meeting hall. Heated exchanges took place in the general body meeting between the TRS and Congress ZPTC members.

Title: Dollar Seshadri suffers heart attack
Content: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) officer on special duty P. Seshadri, also known as 'Dollar' Seshadri, suffered a heart attack here on Saturday. According to sources, Mr. Seshadri complained of severe chest pain around 4 pm at his official residence located behind the main temple complex in Tirumala. He was rushed to the Sri Venkateswara Institute of Medical Sciences (SVIMS) in Tirupati. Later, for better medical care, he was shifted to Apollo Hospitals in Chennai. Mr. Seshadri had suffered a heart attack during the Brahmotsavams last year and was administered treatment in SVIMS and Apollo Hospitals Chennai.

Title: LDF hopes for antigraft hope
Content: The Opposition Left Democratic Front (LDF) is looking forward to a favourable verdict in the Aruvikkara by election due mainly to the people's ire against the Kerala Oommen Chandy government's anti people policies and the corruption charges against most of the Ministers, front convener Vaikom Viswan has said. Briefing reporters after the LDF State committee meeting here on Sunday, Mr. Viswan said almost every Minister in the UDF Cabinet was tainted by corruption charge. Many of them were clinging on to their seats despite facing serious charges. The government's continuation itself was in breach of all rules of governance and ethical values. The resentment of the people of Aruvikkara against all this would get reflected in their poll verdict, the LDF convener said.

Title: 2,349 enumerators to participate in survey
Content: A total of 2,349 enumerators will be taking part in the Social and Educational Survey in Udupi district from April 11 to 30. Speaking at an interaction programme organised by the Department of Information here on Monday, Additional Deputy Commissioner Kumara said that these enumerators would work under 390 supervisors. The enumerators had been told to visit the houses from 7 a.m. to 9 a.m. during the period so that they did not miss anyone. If the houses were locked, the enumerators would visit the houses again. There were 55 columns in the survey form.

Title: Idukki farmers seek stable prices for oranges
Content: The orange season which provided a good harvest is nearing to an end. However, with a glut of oranges in the market, the prices crashed with farmers having to sell at as low as Rs. 20 a kg. A State procurement agency would have helped stabilise prices, feel farmers. There was no demand for the traditional variety grown by them which is smaller in size though sweeter and durable than the Nagpur orange. Chandran, a fruit farmer at Guhanathapuram, said that he sells the oranges to traders who reach his farm. He has both the Nagpur and traditional varieties of oranges, but it is the Nagpur variety that is preferred.

Title: Tour operator decries hartal call
Content: Kochi based tour operator Lotus DMC, agent of the cruise liner Aida Bella that's slated to call at the port here on Sunday, has approached the tourism department and the Minister to ensure that the tourists arriving by the cruise ship get to visit the Jew Town and the Paradesi Synagogue. The request was made in view of the hartal call given by the Jew Town Merchants Welfare Association, a grouping of 110 merchants, on November 17. The Hindu was the first to report about the proposed hartal. In a media release, Sanjeev Kumar, managing director of Lotus DMC, said the German cruise liner s would be the biggest in bound tour operation that the State would have in the calendar year. The vessel would turnaround the travellers in the city, taking on board a fresh crop of passengers arriving in three chartered flights and other scheduled flights.

Title: Qazis assure support to prevent child marriages
Content: Abdul Salam, chief qazi of Medak district, assured to extend complete support to prevent child marriages. The same promise was made by another 20 nayab qazis who attended a counselling session organised by the Legal Services Authority at the district court on Saturday. Community elders are ready to render their cooperation in spreading awareness about laws, said Abdul Salam. We have problems while performing marriages and parents did not come forward to provide age proof certificate. When we insist, they ask us to perform ritual and not to bother about these issues, said some of the qazis at the meeting.

Title: Jipmer to expand organ transplant programme
Content: The Jawaharlal Institute of Post Graduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer) will look to expand its multi organ transplant programme to include liver and heart transplants as part of a push for reaching super speciality facilities to the poor, its Director Subhash Chandra Parija has said. We are keen on extending the benefit of sophisticated health care to the poor sections. In line with this, we will increasingly focus on evolving super speciality departments and develop organ transplantation in a big way, Dr. Parija told The Hindu. Making available a procedure like liver transplant which is charged about Rs. 25 lakh in a private centre at next to no cost to the poor is a big challenge indeed but we believe that this is the direction for Jipmer to take, said Dr. Parija. Jipmer plans to commence liver transplantation by March 2016 and foray into heart transplants after that, he said.
Intersection: Jawaharlal Institute of Post Graduate Medical Education and Research

Title: Handicraft haat to come up next year
Content: NOIDA: A delegation of city RWA body met with the Noida Authority CEO to discuss essential civic issues and need for amenities in Noida. The meeting was held between members of Federation of Noida Residents Welfare Association (FONRWA), led by president N P Singh, and CEO Rama Raman, in Sector 6, on Monday. Among the issues up for discussion, foremost included development of a handicrafts haat on the lines of Dilli Haat in the city. " Tender for the haat has been done and results will be out soon. We are expecting it to be ready in six months' time," said Raman.

Title: State level highpoweredsteering committee constituted for AMRUT
Content: The Government has constituted a State level High Powered Steering Committee (SHPSC) with Chief Secretary Manoj Parida as Chairman for Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) in the Union Territory of Puducherry. Six other secretaries were made members while Director Town Planning is Mission Director cum Member Secretary. The committee will identify the gaps in infrastructure based on Service Level Benchmarks, need for individual and institutional capacity building, ways and means to achieve urban reforms, finalisation of the financial outlays, of the Mission cities/towns. It will prepare the State Annual Action Plan (SAAP) based on the Service Level Improvement Plan (SLIP) of the Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) of the State prioritising cities and projects based on available resources each year, as prescribed in the AMRUT Mission Statement and guidelines. The committee will approve the projects after they are technically appraised and sanctioned by the State Level Technical Committee (SLTC) and will plan the fund flow in short, medium as well as long term.

Title: Cash bag with Rs. 10 lakh creates flutter at A. P. Minister's house
Content: Two bags abandoned at Women Empowerment, Child and Disabled Welfare Minister Peetala Sujatha's house created a flutter in West Godavari District on Tuesday. The bags contained Rs. 10 lakh, a District Selection Committee (DSC) hall ticket and academic certificates of a woman Sri Lakshmi of West Godavari District. According to sources, a few women came to the Minister's house at Veeravasaram and left the bags on the premises on Tuesday evening. House keeper, Subba Rao, who noticed the abandoned bags, informed the police. West Godavari Superintendent of Police Bhaskar Bhushan said that a case had been registered under Section 102 of IPC.

Title: Zoo visit for kidney patients
Content: On the occasion of World Kidney Day on March 12, Indian Society of Nephrology (ISN) is organising a fun trip to Nehru Zoological Park for kidney patients, a statement said. In collaboration with the zoo authorities, the trip to zoo will also feature a mini train ride and talks on awareness on kidney ailments for patients and general public by experts. Close to 200 patients of kidney ailments are expected to take part in the event. Kidney Health for All is the theme for this year's world kidney day. Prevention of kidney disease is important because the treatment for kidney disease is very expensive.

Title: Rajkumar Hirani hospitalised
Content: Well-known film director Rajkumar Hirani was admitted to Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital in suburban Bandra, early this morning, after he fell from a bike and injured his jaw. Mr. Hirani is currently being treated under Dr. Jalil Parkar and his condition is said to be stable. The director is expected to undergo a plastic surgery later in the day. According to sources in the hospital, Mr. Hirani fell off from the bike in the wee hours of Tuesday. He has suffered injuries near his chin and likely a fracture at the mandible.

Title: Siddaramaiah to write to Modi about cut in grants for centrally sponsored schemes
Content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said he would write to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on the problems faced by the State due to cuts in financial grants for centrally-sponsored schemes. There has been a substantial reduction in allocation by the Centre for Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan, National Horticulture Mission, Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission and other schemes. An amount of Rs. 11,689 crore was expected from the Centre as grant for these schemes in the year 2015-16, against which Rs. 7,000 crore will be available. The State government has to bear an additional Rs. 4,689 crore owing to the decision taken by the Centre. The Centre will be apprised on the problems faced by the State in mobilising the additional amount, he told presspersons in Bhadravathi city on Saturday.

Title: SBH creates Cyberabad Zone, mobile app launched
Content: State Bank of Hyderabad (SBH) has carved out a Cyberabad Zone to enhance focus on attracting more business from some of the fast growing areas of the city, both residential as well as commercial, particularly the IT hub. Announcing the formation of the Cyberabad Zone to presspersons here on Monday, Managing Director Santanu Mukherjee said that by reorganising the branches in the Hyderabad network the zone has been formed. Created on September 1, the new zone comprises 107 branches with a business level of Rs. 16,228 crore deposits of Rs. 12,151 crore and advances of Rs.

Title: Plum job, perks for AAP workers
Content: Some of the Aam Admi Party volunteers have been rewarded with plum postings, handsome salaries, accommodation and other perks. The non elected members of the party are appointed as consultants to the Chief Minister, Deputy Chief Minister and Cabinet Ministers on co-terminus basis. While the ministers can appoint their people as consultants and advisors, the number of such appointees and their salaries, some running into lakhs, has raised questions. They can appoint as many consultants but they are being paid from public money. They can have people of their choice but appointments can be made only after Lieutenant Governor's approval, which they have sought.

Title: Don't panic, DC tells certificates seekers
Content: Deputy Commissioner A. B. Ibrahim on Thursday appealed to the people of Dakshina Kannada not to panic and visit Atalji Jana Snehi counters for getting income and caste certificates for various purposes, especially for student scholarships. Addressing presspersons, he said that long queues have been seen in front of the counters to get the certificates. He said that still one and half months are left for applying to the pre matric merit scholarships offered by the Directorate of Minorities for freshers. The last date for applying to the scholarships for freshers would be September 30 and the last date for applying for the renewal of pre matric scholarships would be November 15.

Title: 8 year onld raped by brother-in-law
Content: 8 An eight year old girl was allegedly gagged and raped by her brother in law in south east Delhi's Madanpur Khadar area on Tuesday night. The accused, 22, who lured the girl away from home on the pretext of buying her new clothes for Eid has been arrested after the victim's parents learnt of the sexual assault. The girl is currently receiving treatment for her injuries and her condition is stable. The accused works as a scrap dealer and has a one year old son. The victim is his wife's younger sister.

Title: Farmers forum against land acquisition bill
Content: The All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) should not support the Central government in the Parliament to pass the New Land Acquisition Bill that would facilitate acquisition of agricultural land directly from farmers, Tamil Nadu Farmers Association State president K. Balakrishnan said. Talking to press persons here on Saturday, he said that Finance Minister Arun Jaitley, during his recent meeting with AIADMK leader Jayalalithaa, had asked her to support the Centre for the smooth passage of the bill in Parliament. The proposed bill would wipe out the agriculture sector in general and affect small and tiny farmers in particular. The State government should not support the Centre on this bill under any circumstances. Most of the Centre's policies were against the interests of farmers.

Title: Chorus grows for Sushma Swaraj's resignation
Content: NEW DELHI: A day after Sushma Swaraj admitted that she had helped scam tainted former IPL chief Lalit Modi to obtain British travel documents, demands grew for her resignation. Senior advocate Prashant Bhushan on Monday called for Sushma Swaraj's resignation while also urging the authorities to look into the creation of a 'conflict of interest' law. " Sushma Swaraj interceded with the British government at a time when her daughter was Lalit Modi's lawyer," Bhushan said. " This was, in my view, totally inappropriate. And, in fact there should be conflict of interest laws in this country which make it a offence for a person who is a public servant to do an official act in favour of a person from whom you or your family are receiving any benefit.

Title: Liquor shops: 500 women take part in lucky draw
Content: Women of the nondescript village, Dubagunta, hogged limelight when they had forced the then government to impose total prohibition in the State in the 1990's. But the situation had changed now, with women now vying with men to secure licence for liquor shops in the State . More than 500 women have taken part in the draw of lots early this week for the 289 liquor shops offered to private players by the government in Prakasam district, an official of the Excise and Prohibition Department says. About 25 of them were lucky to get allotted liquor shops for the next two years. It's like any other business.

Title: Centre in a hurry to frame education policy, says SIO
Content: The Union government should not hurry while framing the New Education Policy (NEP) but take a decision only after thorough consultations with experts in the field of education, and social scientists, Talaha Ismail, member of State Advisory Council of the Students Islamic Organisation (SIO), has said. Mr. Ismail and K. M. Ashraf, secretary, Jamaat e Islami Hind, Karnataka zone, said here on Monday that the Centre had drafted an education policy way back in 1986 and revised it in 1992. The present government decided to formulate the NEP in December last year, without adequately eliciting the views of experts. They alleged that the government handed out an objective type questionnaire with possible answers that suited it best. This is not the way to implement a policy matter such as education which not only impacts every individual but also influences the growth and progress of the nation.

Title: Mobile phone theft suspect's hand set afire
Content: Sitting on a corner bed in the general ward of the Government Medical College Hospital here is a bucktoothed teenager. Pounraj holds out his right hand, charred badly from palm to wrist. Just before dawn on March 20, this mentally challenged 18 year old's right hand was set on fire by two of his neighbours on the suspicion that he stole a mobile phone in Velavelli village of Palacode block here, police and his family members said. The suspects, Raja and Govindan, dragged Pounraj, who was sitting unattended outside his house, tied him to a tree in the backyard and set his hand on fire. His hand was wrapped tightly with a piece of cloth doused in petrol before it was set on fire, said Chettiappan, a relative.

Title: State produces 28.20 lakh tonnes of sugar this crushing season
Content: Karnataka, the third largest producer of sugar in the country, has produced 28.20 lakh tonnes of sugar till February 15 during the current crushing season. This is 0.93 lakh tonnes more than the production (27.27 lakh tonnes) during the preceding season, according to an announcement made on the website of the Indian Sugar Mills Association, a premiere association of the country's sugar industry. The association said that 62 sugar mills were operational in the State as against 56 sugar mills last season. Across India, 518 sugar mills produced 167.08 lakh tonnes of sugar till February 15. This is an increase from the last season when 479 sugar mills had produced 145.28 lakh tonnes of sugar.

Title: Eleven arrested on charges of rioting
Content: Vadakkipalayam Police in Pollachi have registered a case against 13 persons and arrested 11 of them including a juvenile on the charges rioting and attacking villagers during a temple festival at Chellandigoundenpudur village near Vadakkipalayam in the late hours of Friday. Temple festival: It is learnt that a 16 year old boy from Angalakurichi teased a woman at the festival at Chellandigoundenpudur. M. Vijayan (20) of Chellandigoundenpudur and a few others warned him to refrain from such acts. A. Srikanth (23) from Angalakurichi supported the teenager. They formed as a group of 13 persons and assaulted Vijayan, his brother Ramasamy (24) and their father Murugan (40). The accused were booked under sections 147 (punishment for rioting), 448 (punishment for trespass), 294(b) (using abusive language), 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 324 (voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means) and 506(ii) (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code.

Title: Freebies distributed
Content: M. Thambi Durai, Deputy Speaker of Lok Sabha, on Sunday, distributed free electric fans, mixie, and grinder to 962 women of Manapparai. He said that the scheme aimed at assisting the economically weaker sections. The beneficiaries were from Manjampatti and Theerampatti areas of Manapparai town. K. Tharpagaraj, District Revenue Officer, presided over the function. Voters list revision at Kattur K. S. Palanisamy, District Collector, inspected the summary revision of electoral roll at a special camp at a few booths in Kattur falling under the Tirurerambur Assembly segment. He also verified the forms received at these centres.

Title: Foundries hope to ride Make in India wave
Content: As with the ones in the rest of the country, foundries in Kerala too are looking forward to tapping the business potential the Central government's Make in India policy offers. A survey by the Kerala chapter of the Institute of Indian Foundrymen found that out of over 6,000 foundries in the country, Kerala had 133. Two or three of these were major ones and the rest were small units, but with good potential to produce finished castings and made to order ones. At deliberations held as part of the National Foundry Day here, the stress was on cashing in on the emerging business environment in view of the government's focus on concepts such as Make in India and Ease of Doing Business. At the same time, the foundry industry itself looks for some of its equipment, such as sand recycling plant, getting manufactured in India, in keeping with the spirit of the Make in India policy.

Title: After 199 days, agitation against NTPC called off
Content: The indefinite agitation called by a section of farmers affiliated to the Karnataka Rajya Raita Sangha against the NTPC Kudgi thermal plant was called off on the 199th day after the intervention of Energy Minister D. K. Shivakumar on Wednesday. The Minister, who paid a surprise visit to meet the agitators, made it clear while the demand for the removal of the plant could not be met, the other justifiable demands of the farmers could be considered. During the meeting, activist Arvind Kulkarni, who was leading the agitation, presented a list of demands including the scientific assessment of plant regarding its effect on ecology and the withdrawal of cases against the farmers who were protesting against the plant. Mr. Shivakumar, who accepted the memorandum, promised to start the legal process to withdraw the cases and also promised to consider other demands. On the occasion, he said that with the increasing demand for electricity, the State and the country was in great need of power plants.

Title: Birth anniversary of Hegde to be celebrated
Content: The 90th birth anniversary of the former chief minister Ramakrishna Hegde Dodmane will be held at Siddapur on Saturday at the newly built Shikshana Prasaraka Samiti hall at 11 a.m. under the auspices of the R. K. Hegde Chirantana organisation. Minister of State for Primary and Secondary Education Kimmane Ratnakar will inaugurate the programme. The former Assembly speaker K. R. Rameshkumar will speak on Mr. Hegde and writer Vishnu Naik will be the chief guest on the occasion. Navalgund MLA N. H. Konareddy, social workers Ramanand B. Nayak Ankola and V. S. Goudar Vaddal Dasanakoppa, close associates of R. K. Hegde will be felicitated on the occasion.

Title: Rs. 1.87 crore for colleges in Mangaluru
Content: North Educational infrastructure in Mangaluru North Assembly constituency is set to get a boost with the government releasing funds for upgrading buildings, including those of Government First Grade College, Kavoor, and Government Junior College, Krishnapura. Mangaluru North MLA B. A. Mohiuddin Bava told presspersons here recently that the State government had released Rs.87 crore for the construction of five additional classrooms and toilets. The First Grade College at present has 175 students studying BA, B.Com and BBM courses and it intended to commence additional courses after the new infrastructure is in place, he said. Mr. Bava said due to his persistent efforts, the Minister for Higher Education R.V. Deshpande approved the sanction of funds for the college, the only important government college that was located in the constituency. He said the grant would help the college get more students. College Principal Tara said they planned to offer a few postgraduate courses in the coming days.

Title: Green nod notification for mid sea Shivaji memorial likely tomorrow
Content: MUMBAI: The final notification granting environmental clearance for the mid sea Chhatrapati Shivaji Memorial as a permissible activity in coastal regulation zone (CRZ) I area is expected to be received on Wednesday. Sources in the state government said that as the final notification is expected to be received only a day before Shivaji Jayanti (February 19), the bhoomipujan is likely to be held on May 1, Maharashtra Day. Mantralaya sources said that unless the final notification is issued, the government cannot move ahead with any activity (bhoomipujan) related to the memorial. The draft notification will also inform whether it is exempt from public hearing, said a source. We have already incorporated suggestions that we have received.

Title: Mumbai diamond export firm refuses Muslim MBA job
Content: MUMBAI: In a blatant case of discrimination, a young man with an MBA was rejected by a diamond exporting firm on the grounds that it hired only non Muslim candidates . Zeeshan Khan (22) applied for a marketing job to Hari Krishna Exports Pvt Ltd on Tuesday via email. Within 15 minutes, he received the reply: We regret to inform you that we hire only non Muslim candidates. Khan and his friends put out a screenshot of the mail on social media and it went viral. By Thursday, he was trending on Twitter.

Title: Rs. 25,000 crore infrastructure investment over 3 years
Content: A series of steps have been announced to help channelise investment in infrastructure to the tune of Rs. 25,000 crore in the next three years as part of efforts to boost development and investment in infrastructure. Announcing this in the Budget 2015 16, Finance Minister K. M. Mani said steps would be taken this year to tap the markets for financing some of the major projects in the State, and a vision document Infrastructure Master Plan 2030 would be prepared to identify the infrastructure gaps. The funds raised from the market will be tapped on need basis by the government, and will not be allowed to be used for meeting any expenditure other than for major capital projects. The Suburban Railway Corridor, Light Metro in Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode, upgrade of inland waterway system, airport projects including expansion, power projects, port development, water supply projects, and widening of highways into four-lane will benefit from the proposed funds. A sum of Rs.2,000 crore has been set apart for major projects, and the funds will be used by the Kerala Infrastructure Investment Board to leverage additional funds through new financial structures such as the Alternative Investment Bond, InVIT, Infrastructure Development Fund, and General Obligation Bonds.

Title: CCB sleuths nab cricket bookies
Content: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) police have raided two places and nabbed cricket bookies taking bets from punters for Cricket World Cup starting next month. Based on a tip off, a team of officials raided Manu Tyre Shop in Kalasipalya and nabbed Vinay, a resident of Shanti Nagar. According to the police, Vinay was receiving bets from punters of Bengaluru and Mumbai through Mobilebetting.com, an online betting website. The police have recovered cash amount of Rs 6.5 lakh and a mobilephone from Vinay for further investigations. Similarly, the police have raided a house in Banasawadi and arrested Anand (37). The police have seized Rs. 67,000 unaccounted cash from him.
Union: Shanti Nagar, Bengaluru, Kalasipalya, Banasawadi, Mumbai

Title: Chargesheet copies given to farmers
Content: Copies of charge sheet were given to members of the Desiya Thennindiya Nathigal Enaippu Vivasayigal Sangam, including its State president P. Ayyakannu, in connection with a case that was booked against them after they were arrested on the charge of attempting to picket the taluk office at Manachanallur a few months ago in support of their demands. The incident took place in April when a group of farmers led by Mr. Ayyakannu assembled near the Manachanallur taluk office to indulge in picketing agitation. Fifteen of them including Mr. Ayyakannu were arrested. The protesting farmers wanted the State government to announce Tiruchi district as drought prone and nationalisation of rivers among others. The Manachanallur police arrested the protesting farmers and booked a case against them under various IPC sections including 143 (unlawful assembly) 341 (wrongful restraint) and 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant).

Title: Governor issues ultimatum to VC
Content: Governor P. Sathasivam has given an ultimatum to Calicut University Vice Chancellor M. Abdul Salam to convene a special meeting of the Senate for the nomination of a representative to the Vice Chancellor Selection Committee. The ultimatum was faxed to the Vice Chancellor on Thursday after the university ignored earlier messages from the Governor's office. The Governor, who is the University Chancellor, had asked Dr. Salam twice before to convene a special meeting of the Senate for the nomination of a representative to the three member Vice Chancellor Selection Committee. The Vice Chancellor, in reply to the ultimatum, said the special Senate meeting would be convened on July 25. According to the university officials, the Senate will hold a regular meeting on July 25 morning and a special meeting in the afternoon.

Title: Ghar Wapsi to continue with renewed vigour: VHP
Content: The Vishwa Hindu Parishat (VHP) has reiterated its resolve to continue with renewed vigour its Ghar Wapsi programme of bringing back the converted Christians and Muslims throughout the country. Joint Secretary North Karnataka region of the VHP, Mahabaleshwar Hegde told presspersons in Kalaburagi on Monday that Ghar Wapsi was not a new programme, but has been followed from the time of Maratha Warrior Shivaji Maharaj and there was nothing wrong in bringing back those who had strayed away back into their parent religion if they come voluntarily without any inducement. He said that the programme was a continuous affair and the present government at the centre has nothing to do with the VHP programmes. In the past 50 years of VHPs existence more than seven lakh persons have been brought back to Hinduism through the programme. Mr. Hegde said that the entire Hindu community has accepted the Ghar Wapsi programme and a few political parties were making noises against the programme to retain their vote banks, and we are not unduly perturbed by the statements of these political parties.

Title: Congress warns of bandh
Content: Terming the arrest of a few Youth Congress volunteers as unjust, the Puducherry Pradesh Congress Committee has warned of holding a bandh unless the police gave an assurance of dropping charges against them. Last week the police arrested eight volunteers of Youth Congress for allegedly attacking the BJP office while protesting against Union Minister Giriraj Singh's remarks on Congress Party President Sonia Gandhi. The Congress leaders and cadres staged a demonstration in front of Senior Superintendent of Police. All India General Secretary V. Narayanasamy, Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly V. Vaithiilngam, Pradesh Congress Committee President A. V Subramanian also took part in the agitation. They submitted a representation to drop the cases.

Title: Dinner meeting widens rift
Content: A dinner meeting of over 15 Bihar Ministers on Wednesday has widened the rift between supporters of Nitish Kumar and Chief Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi in the Janata Dal (U). Mr. Manjhi's supporters were not invited for the meeting held at the house of Food and Consumer Protection Minister Shyam Rajak. Political circles see the meeting as an attempt by Mr. Nitish Kumar to replace Mr. Manjhi with Mr. Rajak, also a Dalit. Bijendra Prasad Yadav, Rajiv Ranjan Singh, alias Lallan Singh, Shrawan Kumar, P.K. Shahi, Ramdhani Singh, Jai Kumar Singh, Awdhesh Kushwaha, Lesi Singh, Binod Prasad Yadav, Dulal Chand Goswami, Samrat Chaudhary, Ranju Geeta and Shahid Ali Khan were among those who attended the meeting. Recently, when Mr. Nitish Kumar visited New Delhi to meet party president Sharad Yadav and Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad, Mr. Rajak was summoned there at short notice. These leaders later declared that Mr. Manjhi would remain Chief Minister, and they had not discussed his removal.

Title: Modernisation of schools gains impetus
Content: An idea generation workshop held at Government Vocational Girls Higher Secondary School here on Tuesday formulated action plans for 1,000 schools and 40,000 hi-tech classrooms in the State. The Additional Skill Acquisition Programme (ASAP) has been roped into come up with a sketch for the plan within 10 months. Education Minister C. Ravindranath said that the Kozhikode North, Puthukkad, Thalipparamba and Alappuzha Assembly constituencies which had shown good models of public education recently had been chosen as models for the project. The MLAs of these constituencies had been told to guide ASAP in the matter. A one day workshop would be held before September 10 for people s representatives and parent teacher associations in these constituencies while a special purpose vehicle would be formed for the project before August 31, he said.

Title: Basavaraj Horatti registers historical victory
Content: Senior Janata Dal (Secular) leader and former minister Basavaraj Shivalingappa Horatti registered a historical victory in the biennial elections from the Karnataka West Teachers constituency to the Legislative Council by winning for the seventh consecutive time. As the election campaign for Karnataka West Teachers Constituency neared its conclusion, Mr. Horatti's supporters and JD(S) leaders had appealed the teachers to help him create a record by getting him elected for the seventh consecutive term. This is a record in the electoral history where one person has been successfully elected seven times in a row to any Legislative Council, Mr. Horatti claimed and attributed the feat to his voters, who have supported him since his first election in 1980 from the Karnataka Rajya Madhyamika Shala Shikshakara Sangha. As far as the Karnataka Legislative Council is concerned, BJP's Ramachandra Gowda stands next to Mr. Horatti in the number of successive wins of five victories from Bengaluru Graduates Constituency. Mr. Horatti polled a total of 7,480 votes and defeated his nearest rival M. Nagaraj of BJP by a victory margin of 3,109 votes.

Title: Plots allotted to farmers of two villages
Content: THULLUR (Guntur Dt.): The AP Capital Region Development Authority (CRDA) has allotted lands to the villagers who parted with their lands under the Land Pooling Scheme (LPS) scheme for construction of the Capital city, Amaravati. The developed plots were allotted to the farmers of Pichukapalem and Dondapadu villages at the CRDA office here. The plots were allotted through lottery method. After conducting two trial runs of the lottery system, the officials allotted the residential plots to the farmers. As many as 498 farmers in Pichukapalem gave 767.97 acre land to the government. The CRDA allotted 674 residential plots and 442 commercial plots to them.
Union: Pichukapalem, Dondapadu, THULLUR, Guntur, Amaravati, AP

Title: Akola's firebrand police woman officer reinstated
Content: NAGPUR: Assistant police inspector (API) Naina Pohekar had made impact as head of the chirimaadi squad in Akola for around three years, leaving no stones unturned to show the road Romeos and lechers their place much before Bollywood's so called daredevil cops, like in Singham or Mardaani, wowed the audience with antics on reels. Feisty Naina's popularity among the masses in Akola was just on the upward swing when a case under Prevention of Corruption Act for a so called demand was registered against the daring woman cop and she was put behind bars in December 2012. The never say die Naina, also an athlete, swung back with much of her lost dignity restored when office of the state director general of police rejected proposal of State Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) to send charge sheet against her to the special court for want of evidence. She was reinstated in Akola city police's control room on Thursday. Naina would now have to undergo routine preliminary and departmental inquiry which has to be completed within three months.

Title: Stalin pays homage to Theepori Arumugam
Content: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam treasurer M.K. Stalin on Sunday led his partymen in paying homage to the party's platform speaker, Theepori Arumugam, who died here on Saturday. Accompanied by several former Ministers and party district secretaries, Mr. Stalin placed a garland on the body of Arumugam at his residence in Jaihindpuram. Party leaders I. Periyasamy, K.K.S.S.R. Ramachandran, Thangam Thennarasu, Suresh Rajan, R. Tamilarasi and G. Thalapathi were among those who paid their respects. Later, talking to reporters, Mr. Stalin said DMK president M. Karunanidhi was shocked to hear about the death of Arumugam and had sent him to pay homage on behalf of the party. Arumugam was known for voicing his opinion with all courage for which he faced several cases and was subjected to harassment, Mr. Stalin claimed. Rivals once even attempted to cut his tongue, Mr. Stalin recalled.

Title: Held on murder charge
Content: The Thiruvananthapuram Rural police have taken into custody a notorious goon and habitual offender, Shaji alias Pothu Shaji, 38, in connection with the death of a 65 year old man in Vithura. According to the police, Shaji has been held for allegedly murdering Krishnan Ashary, who hailed from Mekkumkara in Anapetti, near Vithura. He was found dead on Wednesday at another of the victim's residences at Thevanpara near Tholicode. The police said that Krishnan Ashary, who has been living alone for a few months, and Shaji were neighbours and they used to consume liquor at the former's house frequently. The sleuths were examining the statements of other neighbours of Krishnan Ashary that they could hear loud noises from his house in the late hours of Tuesday during one such booze session.
Intersection: Vithura, Thiruvananthapuram, Anapetti, Tholicode, Thevanpara, Mekkumkara
Union: Vithura, Thiruvananthapuram, Anapetti, Tholicode, Thevanpara, Mekkumkara

Title: HC to get six new judges
Content: All decks have finally been cleared for the appointment of judges to the Madras High Court, with the President's office clearing six names from the list of prospective candidates recommended by the High Court's collegium. Once the appointments are officially made, the strength of the Madras High Court would increase from 34 to 40. But still, the court would have a deficit of 35 judges, given its sanctioned strength of 75. Out of the six new judges, four are from the Bar and two are from the judicial service. V. Bharathidasan, S. S. Sundar, M. V. Muralidharan and D. Krisshnakumar are from the Bar. P. Kalaiarasan, the present Registrar General of the Madras High Court, and B. Gokuldass, retired Chief Judge of Small Causes Court, Chennai, are being elevated for the judicial service.

Title: 170 trees bear the brunt
Content: Trees bore the brunt of Friday's rains as nearly 170 were downed by gushing winds which touched 100 kmph in some parts of the city. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) claimed that 197 trees were uprooted and five complaints of wires snapping were received. While weathermen said winds gusted up to 60 kmph, GHMC commissioner B. Janardhan Reddy stated that winds touched 100 kmph in Banjara Hills. Though brief, the winds wrecked substantial damage to trees in many areas, most noticeably on Raj Bhavan road where vehicles were stopped from entering the stretch before removal. Besides trees, hoardings were also ripped by winds at a few places including Jubilee Hills and at Panjagutta.
Intersection: Banjara Hills, Jubilee Hills, Panjagutta, Greater Hyderabad
Union: Banjara Hills, Jubilee Hills, Panjagutta, Greater Hyderabad, Raj Bhavan

Title: All set for Kakinada Book Festival
Content: Arrangements are place for the second edition of Kakinada Book Festival scheduled to begin on Tuesday. State Telugu Publishers Association, in association with the Vijayawada Book Festival Society, is conducting the 10 day event on the premises of Raja Tank Park (Kulai Cheruvu) from 2 p. m. to 9 p. m. Literary meets, seminars on contemporary issues and several competitions for children will be conducted on the sidelines of the festival on all the 10 days. Association president B. Babjee and vice president K. Lakshmaiah, at a press conference here on Monday, said that noted writer and member of the Kendriya Hindi Samithi Yarlagadda Lakshmi Prasad would be the chief guest of the inaugural function to be held on Tuesday evening, in which Home Minister N. Chinarajappa and renowned poet Avantsa Somasundar would also take part. Books of Telugu, English and Hindi will be displayed in 55 stalls with publishers coming from different places. The entry is free and we are offering a special discount of 10 per cent on all the purchases, they said.
Union: Raja Tank Park, Vijayawada, Kakinada, Kulai Cheruvu

Title: Suicide case: CM promises action if evidence is found
Content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has said the State government will take action against the KAS officer, if his role was found in the suicide of K. C. Ramesh, a driver attached to the Revenue Department. Mr. Siddaramaiah told presspersons here on Thursday that the police had already registered a case based on the complaint filed by the driver's brother. The police will investigate the case and if evidences were found against the officer, the government will take action against him. Ramesh, who committed suicide in Maddur on Tuesday, had left a death note accusing the KAS rank officer L. Bheema Nayak and his driver Mohammed of being responsible for his death. He had also stated that the officer helped former Minister G. Janardhana Reddy convert Rs.

Title: Activists against widening Girivalam path
Content: As the Girivalam path widening programme gains momentum, environmentalists and activists are apprehensive that it could cause permanent damage to a sacred grove eco-system. It could also antagonise farmers who will lose their agricultural land. Implemented at a cost of Rs.65 crore, the widening project is creating a lane of 7 to 10 m width for pedestrians/pilgrims who take up circumambulation of the holy hill by walk. The first phase of the work started on Chengam Road section of Girivalam path just before the announcement of elections and has picked up pace now. Several tamarind trees and rain trees close to the road and forest were felled for expansion of the road which is only on the urbanised section till now.

Title: Nagayalanka ghat casts a spell on pilgrims
Content: Thousands of pilgrims witnessed the nava harati performed at the Nagayalanka ghat which was arranged at the confluence of one of the two channels of the River Krishna into the Bay of Bengal. People from across the State took a holy dip here where water level was good throughout the day. The 15 minute ritual of nava harati added beauty to the ghat, which makes it a must visit one in Diviseema. An estimated 5,000 pilgrims visited the ghat and a majority of them witnessed the evening ritual. Pilgrims offered special prayers to the statue of Krishnaveni on the bank of the river here.
Union: Bay of Bengal, River Krishna, Nagayalanka, Diviseema, Nagayalanka ghat, Bengal

Title: Drive against illegal hoardings causing revenue loss to BBMP
Content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is waging a battle on illegal hoardings and pulling them down, but this special drive could well be causing a huge loss of potential ad revenue for the civic body. According to senior BBMP officials, those who put up hoardings without paying the required tax, are not being penalised before removal of the hoardings. Last year, the BBMP advertising department had issued circulars stating that those who erect illegal hoardings have to be fined as much as the fee prescribed for a legal billboard and the hoarding should also be pulled down. But this is not happening, said officials in the advertisement department. Not served notices They allege that people responsible for installing the illegal hoardings are not served notices demanding that the fine be paid.

Title: Stress on breastfeeding
Content: The World Breastfeeding Week was celebrated here on Monday. The need to encourage breastfeeding among lactating mothers was stressed during a programme held at Government Ranee's Hospital here. D. Parimala Devi, Dean of the Government Medical College and Hospital, said that breast feeding was vital for promoting bond between mother and child. It prevented post partum haemorrhage, breast cancer, cervical cancer and acted as temporary contraceptive method. Women could maintain body mass. The breast milk was rich in vitamins, minerals which prevented diabetes, heart ailments and even cancer.

Title: Madhesi netas to arrive today for talks, India eyes end to stir
Content: KATHMANDU: Top Madhes leaders from Nepal will be in Delhi on Sunday and Monday to discuss with the Indian government the way to resolve the current political crisis in Nepal. Sanghiya Samajbadi Forum Nepal chairman Upendra Yadav, TMLP chairman Mahanta Thakur, Sadbhawana Party chairman Rajendra Mahato and Tarai Madhes Sadhbhawana Party chairman Rameshwor Raya Yadav are expected to meet foreign minister Sushma Swaraj, foreign secretary S Jaishankar and other politicians from different parties here on Sunday and Monday. Swaraj is expected to host a dinner for them. With India going back to taking a more proactive role in the talks between Kathmandu and the Madhes leaders, India is now looking to bring the negotiations to a successful conclusion in the coming days. The Kathmandu leadership, led by a reluctant Prime Minister K P Oli has agreed to pass three main amendments to the Constitution including on proportional inclusion of Madhesis in government position and on constitutional delimitation that would reflect representation more fairly.

Title: Photographers must embrace new ideas
Content: Photographers must embrace new technologies and mediums. Earlier, photographers did not want to accept digital photography. Now, however, it is the only thing that exists. The same case can be made for mobile phone photography, said T. N. A. Perumal, wildlife photographer, speaking at Venkatappa Art Gallery on Sunday. Mr. Perumal launched the website and Facebook page of the Youth Photographic Society on the occasion.

Title: How bidri artefacts are made
Content: Bidri artists make pots, boxes, hukkas and images of famous personalities using an alloy of zinc and copper. The items are then immersed in a chemical mixture that contains soil from inside the Bidar Fort, which gives them a permanent black colour. The jet black surface is then inlaid with silver wires or blocks to display a contrasting design. The value of an artefact is decided by the amount of silver used. The proportion of silver to the zinc copper alloy used in the pieces ranges from 1 to 5 per cent by weight.

Title: Dress code comes into effect in temples
Content: The dress code for devotees visiting temples that came into effect from Friday following the High Court's order was not enforced in a stringent manner when hundreds of devotees thronged the temples for New Year special prayers. Swamy Nellaiyappar Temple administration had kept a huge banner at the main entrance that explained in detail the dress code to be followed scrupulously while entering the temple for darshan. While almost all men came to temple either in pants or dhotis after carefully avoiding jeans, a few girls, who had come to the temple with leggings were also allowed with a warning that the grace period would not be extended beyond a week. Some of the devotees, particularly girls, are not aware of the dress code prescribed by the court We're sensitising those who fail to comply with the instruction. At the same time, the grace period will not get extended beyond a week, a temple official said.

Title: Mosquito breeding at AIIMS
Content: Much ahead of the dengue season, mosquitoes have been found breeding in over 200 prominent buildings in Delhi's VIP zone including those housing the offices of the Environment and Telecommunication ministries and AIIMS following which the civic body has served notices on them. The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has formed a surveillance team which is inspecting all buildings since last month as with onset of summer begins the season conducive for mosquito breeding. Lady Hardinge Hospital, AIIMS, RML Hospital, Paryavaran Bhawan, Meghdoot Bhawan, Sanchar Bhawan, Baroda House, Kashmir House, Red Cross Society, Shivaji Stadium and Delhi High Court have been served notices by the NDMC after vector carrying mosquitoes were found breeding in their premises. A challan has also been issued to the All India Radio. Our inspection team has already started field visits and surveillance work.
Intersection: Kashmir House, Red Cross Society, Baroda House, Shivaji Stadium, Sanchar Bhawan, Paryavaran Bhawan, Delhi, Lady Hardinge Hospital, RML Hospital
Union: Kashmir House, AIIMS, Baroda House, Red Cross Society, Paryavaran Bhawan, New Delhi, Meghdoot Bhawan, Sanchar Bhawan, Shivaji Stadium, Delhi, Lady Hardinge Hospital, RML Hospital

Title: New bus service to Kolhapur
Content: For the convenience of the travelling public, Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) has introduced a new Carona air conditioned sleeper service between Bengaluru and Kolhapur in Maharashtra. The bus will depart Bengaluru at 10.45 p.m. and reach Kolhapur via Tumakuru, Haveri, Hubballi, Dharwad and Belagavi at 9.45 a.m. the next day. From Kolhapur, the sleeper service will leave at 6 p.m. and reach Bengaluru at 5 a.m. the next day. The fare is Rs. 1,200, according to a KSRTC press release.
Intersection: Dharwad, Hubballi, Haveri, Bengaluru, Belagavi, Kolhapur, Tumakuru, Maharashtra
Union: Dharwad, Hubballi, Haveri, Bengaluru, Belagavi, Kolhapur, Tumakuru, Karnataka, Maharashtra

Title: Sunrise A.P. needs services of CA
Content: BC Welfare Minister Kollu Ravindra has said the large-scale industrial activity set to take place in Andhra Pradesh post-bifurcation requires the professional expertise of chartered accountants for achieving the best results in financial planning and management. Participating as chief guest in the inaugural session of a two-day sub-regional conference of Southern India Regional Council (SIRC) of Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) here on Saturday, Mr. Ravindra said A.P could achieve double-digit growth rate in spite of the heavy odds it faced on account of bifurcation. The national growth rate stood around 7.5 per cent. "The Andhra Pradesh government looks forward to availing [itself of] the services of ICAI wherever its knowledge is required for sound professional management of money and material," he said, adding that the help of chartered accountants would be sought for plugging the leakage of legitimately realisable revenues to the government. Raising the bar ICAI national president M. Devaraja Reddy said the ICAI was evolving accounting standards tailor-made for the Indian scenario while complying with the framework of international financial reporting standards.

Title: Minister defends decision to shift veterinary polyclinic to Arkalgud
Content: Minister for Animal Husbandry and Sericulture A. Manju has defended his department's move to shift the veterinary polyclinic from Hassan to Arkalgud. The polyclinic was more needed in Arkalgud as Hassan city already has a veterinary college with a good hospital. Addressing a press conference here on Friday, Mr. Manju said that he had taken a decision to shift the polyclinic as the well equipped veterinary college was already in Hassan. The veterinary college in Hassan has good infrastructure facilities. Owing to this, there is no need for the polyclinic in the town, he said.

Title: Report on sanitation project to be prepared shortly
Content: A team of representatives from the Indian Institute of Human Settlement, Bengaluru, conducted a survey of water courses, underground drainage system and other amenities prevailing in the city for the implementation of urban sanitation project. The project is to be implemented for a period of two years in Tiruchi city for augmenting sanitation, hygienic handling of septic tank waste and well designed drainage system. A preliminary study was conducted by the nine member team which visited Crawford, Edamalaipattipudur, K. K. Nagar, Ponmalai, Ariyamangalam, Tiruvanaikovil, Srirangam and Melur on Sunday. It is just a preliminary study and we will submit a report in course of time, said one of the members of the team. Tiruchi is one of the centres in the state selected by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF) for implementing urban sanitation project to tone up efficiency of sanitary management.
Intersection: Tiruvanaikovil, K. K. Nagar, Edamalaipattipudur, Tiruchi, Ariyamangalam, Ponmalai, Bengaluru, Melur, Srirangam, Crawford
Union: Tiruvanaikovil, K. K. Nagar, Edamalaipattipudur, Tiruchi, Ariyamangalam, Ponmalai, Bengaluru, Melur, Srirangam, Crawford

Title: Awareness campaign against smoking
Content: The Regional Cancer Centre (RCC) and the Directorate of Higher Secondary Education will be jointly organising CATCH (Crusade Against Tobacco Consumption in Higher secondary schools), an awareness campaign against smoking. The programme is being organised in view of a study conducted by the National Sample Survey Organisation (NSSO) in which it was found that 80 per cent of smokers get that habit before they are 18 years old and that this habit is more prevalent among children from coastal areas. The programme aims at creating awareness on the negative effects of smoking among students in government and aided higher secondary schools in coastal areas. The pilot programme will be launched in Kollam district. It will then be implemented in Alappuzha and Thiruvananthapuram districts.

Title: On a green mission
Content: Led by their Chairman and Managing Director N. Sridhar, workers, employees and officials of the Singareni Collieries Company Limited (SCCL) on Tuesday planted 10,000 saplings at Srirampur coal mine area in Adilabad. This formed a chunk of the targeted four lakh saplings to be planted in the area during the current plantation drive under Telanganaku Haritha Haram. Mr. Sridhar was joined by SCCL Srirampur General Manager Sd. M. Subhani, GM Coordination J. Nagaiah, GM Environment B. Vasanth Kumar, Telangana Boggu Gani Karmika Sangham general secretary Miryala Narayan Reddy and its working president Enugu Ravinder Reddy in the plantation drive. The SCCL has a target of planting 75 lakh saplings in all its areas. As part of the special drive, saplings of all varieties were being distributed in the respective coal mine areas across the State.

Title: Man attacks close relative and jumps off second floor
Content: PUNE: A 24 year old electronics engineer, who could not accept the rejection of his marriage proposal, first attacked the woman, a relative, with a sharp weapon and then tried to commit suicide by jumping off the second floor of a building in Shahu Colony in Karvenagar on Sunday morning. The woman, who sustained injuries on her shoulder, is undergoing treatment in a private hospital. The suspect, Sanjay Shivaji Mane, of Malshiras in Solapur district was badly injured after jumping off the building. " Mane's jaw, legs and ribs were fractured and he is being treated in a private hospital. His condition is stable," said P L Nalawade, assistant inspector of the Warje Malwadi police station.
Intersection: PUNE, Solapur, Karvenagar, Shahu Colony, Malshiras
Union: PUNE, Warje Malwadi, Solapur, Karvenagar, Shahu Colony, Malshiras

Title: Cauvery River Gallery to be set up in Mysuru
Content: The National Academy of Sciences, India (NASI) will establish the Cauvery River Gallery in Mysuru to showcase the life, culture and biodiversity supported by the river, at a cost of Rs.3.5 crore. Officials of the NASI and the State Tourism Department on Wednesday signed an agreement for establishing the gallery in Karnataka Exhibition Authority complex, Mysuru. It would be first river gallery in south India. Industries and Tourism Minister R.V. Deshpande said the NSAI would execute the project and take up maintenance for three years. During its maintenance, officials of the NSAI would train local government authorities on how to maintain and administer the gallery.
Union: Karnataka, south India, India, Mysuru, Cauvery River

Title: A school that drew many smart students
Content: The famous St. Anthony s High School and St. Anthony's Church that date back to pre independence era form a part of Anthony Nagar in Maharanipeta. One of the oldest schools in the city, on a five acre plot, St. Anthony s High School is an institution that drew children from all walks of life. Since there was limited choice available earlier, the school appeared to be the sole option for most professors, doctors, district judges and businessmen to admit their children. Interestingly, the school has churned out famous doctors including dermatologist G. Raghu Rama Rao. Even after a century, the infrastructure of the school is so strong and quality driven as it is hard to trace a single crack in the premises.

Title: TS reports Rs. 2,740 due to September rains
Content: The State Government has submitted a report to the inter-ministerial Central team, which arrived here on Sunday on a two day visit to the State, explaining the huge loss suffered during the heavy rain in September and put it at about Rs. 2,740 crore. A team of State Government officials led by Chief Secretary Rajiv Sharma and senior officers Special Chief Secretaries S.P. Singh (Panchayat Raj Rural Development) and M. G. Gopal (Municipal Administration Urban Development), Principal Secretary Sunil Sharma (Roads Buildings), GHMC Commissioner B. Janardhan Reddy, Metro Water Works Managing Director M. Dana Kishore, Disaster Management Special Commissioner Venkataram Reddy and others made a power point presentation explaining the huge loss suffered by the State during the heavy rains. The rains from September 21 to 27 had left a trail of losses in agriculture, infrastructure and other sectors, Mr. Rajiv Sharma told the visiting team. He explained that roads in both urban and rural areas were battered badly, and power transformers got burnt in large numbers at many places across the state.

Title: Malegaon accused Purohit gets documents from Army
Content: Lt. Col. Shrikant Prasad Purohit accused in Malegaon blasts has received documents related to his court of inquiry proceedings from the Army which are likely to help him prove his innocence. Informed sources said that the documents were handed over to his lawyer Neela Gokhale. Ms. Gokhale was quoted as having said that the papers were in respect of the registration of the sources and prove that Lt. Col. Purohit had kept senior Army officials in the loop on his intelligence activities. However, she could not be directly reached for comment. This development comes after Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar had directed the Army to issue the relevant documents to help prove his innocence as claimed by him.

Title: Biker killed in accident
Content: A 25-year-old rider was killed on the spot while the pillion rider sustained injuries when their bike lost control and hit the median on Nagawara Outer Ring Road near KBE Junction in Banaswadi traffic police limits. According to the police, the rider, Narsimha Murthy, was a cab driver. His friend, Anand T. (29), was also a driver. The police said that the duo was heading towards KR Puram from Hebbal around 9.30 p.m. when Murthy, in a bid to turn, lost control and rammed the median. Due to the impact of the collision, Murthy was tossed in the air and crashed on the road sustaining grievous head injuries. Passersby rushed them to Ambedkar Hospital, where Murthy was declared brought dead. A case is registered in Banaswadi traffic police limits.
Intersection: Banaswadi, Nagawara Outer Ring Road, KBE Junction, KR Puram, Hebbal
Union: Banaswadi, Nagawara Outer Ring Road, KBE Junction, KR Puram, Hebbal

Title: Dull response to e-auction of Marayur sandalwood
Content: The two day sandalwood e auction which ended at the sandalwood division in Marayur on Friday evoked poor response probably because of the high prices and reserve stock among major buyers such as cosmetic industrial units and Ayurvedic medicine manufacturers. Of the 38 tonnes of sandalwood placed for auction, only 3,853 kg was sold and an amount of Rs. 3,87,84,000 collected. This was against the Rs. 34 crore sale in the previous auction. The lowest sale of sandalwood was in 2012 when only 800 kg was sold in the auction. Marayur sandalwood is known internationally for its quality.

Title: Enter the trolls
Content: Kozhikode: The poll war gets back its virtual sting again, with platoons of quirky trollers hovering in cyber space to defend their candidates and attack their rivals. To the relief of most of the candidates, abusive content have been kept minimal this time, possibly fearing legal action, but acidic satire has a free run. Groups of trollers beholden to different political ideologies have created their own exclusive Facebook groups to circulate their content and measure response. One of them is Cyber Trollers CPI (M) Wing, an exclusive troller group in Kerala supported by a large number of Communist Party of India (Marxist) sympathisers or workers, to take on rivals in virtual space. The deliberate use of native slang coupled with humorous pictures matching the contest have won hundreds of Likes for the pages and prompted many to join the discussion in their own way.

Title: Site aspirants list to come under scrutiny
Content: The Mysuru Urban Development Authority's (MUDA) foray into multi storeyed apartment construction underlines the realisation that it cannot cater to all the site applicants, who have been awaiting allotment for many years. There are nearly 1.27 lakh pending applications before the MUDA, but a fresh scrutiny will be taken up to weed out those who already own a house or site. The fresh scrutiny will help eliminate at least 50 per cent of the aspirants, leaving around 60,000 genuine ones. Yet, it is a huge backlog to clear as the MUDA has not allotted more than 3,000 sites in the last 10 years. However, MUDA chairman K.R. Mohan Kumar said that at least 8,000 sites would be distributed in the next couple of years.

Title: Short term course on animal experimentation in nutrition
Content: The three day short term course on animal experimentation in nutrition organised by the Department of Food Science and Nutrition of Periyar University concluded on Friday. Experts from different fields described in detail on introduction to animal experiments, nutritional bioassay, animal experimentation designs, selection of animals, animal handling techniques, animal feeding process, safety and precautions, risk management, various routes of sample injection and blood sample collection, parameters to be assessed for best interpretation of results and animal ethical issues and regulations to enhance the student's skill on animal experimentation in nutrition. C. Swaminathan, Vice Chancellor, Periyar University, pointed out that animal testing remains a mandatory process and a very detailed skill based course on animal experimentation is needed for the Life Science discipline students, since non animal models in biomedical research are yet to be established. G. Archunan, Professor and Head, Department of Animal Science, Bharathidasan University, Tiruchi and K. Vasudevan, Associate Professor in Zoology, DDE Zoology wing, Annamalai University, handled the sessions.
Intersection: Tiruchi, Periyar University, Annamalai University, Bharathidasan University

Title: KASSIA to offer jobs to children of deceased farmers
Content: The Karnataka Small Scale Industries Association (KASSIA) has decided to provide jobs to children of farmers, who committed suicide in the last one-and-half years in Mysuru and Mandya districts. The KASSIA will provide a three-month skill oriented training before employing them in different industries. They will be given salaries as per the wages fixed under the Minimum Wages Act. The association will also provide compensation of Rs. 20,000 to the families of these farmers. It has identified over 190 families, of which 40 will receive the amount on Sunday at the Maharaja College grounds, where the Agro Tech expo-2016 is being held since Friday.
Union: Mandya, Mysuru, Maharaja College grounds, Karnataka

Title: UGC derecognizes KSOU's courses
Content: BENGALURU: Here's bad news for 91,000 students pursuing programmes in the Karnataka State Open University (KSOU): the UGC has withdrawn recognition for them. The UGC says the varsity has flouted its norms, guidelines and directives, besides advice from the Distance Education Council of the Indira Gandhi National Open University. In a June 16 notice, the UGC said KSOU programmes were not recognized beyond 2012 13. The UGC took the decision after hearing KSOU s response to a showcause notice issued on June 10, 2011. The notice says KSOU has offered professional and technical courses in violation of the regulators norms and without their approval.

Title: Clash between supporters of U.P. Forest Minister, nephew; 5 injured
Content: Five persons were injured as supporters of Uttar Pradesh Forest Minister Durga Prasad Yadav and his nephew Pramod Yadav clashed over some tiff in Ukraura village here. The supporters of the two factions had organised separate bhandaras in Ukraura mela on Saturday in which the Minister's son Vijay Yadav and nephew Pramod Yadav were present, the police said. Petty issue Both the sides fired in the air over some petty quarrel and also indulged in brick batting following which five persons were injured. The injured have been admitted to the district hospital, they said. Upon getting information about the incident, SP, Traffic Hafizur Rehman and other officials rushed to the spot with additional forces.

Title: Samiti to protest against atrocities on Dalits
Content: Condemning the recent atrocities on Dalits at Una in Gujarat, the Karnataka State Dalit Sangharsh Samiti (KSDSS) plans to stage a protest in front of the Deputy Commissioners offices in all districts across the State on September 1. State convener of the Samiti D. G. Sagar, addressing presspersons in Kalaburagi on Monday, accused the Union government of maintaining silence on the barbaric incident at Una in Gir Somnath district in Gujarat, where a group of youth belonging to the Dalit community who were skinning a dead cow were beaten up by cow vigilantes, alleging they had killed the cow. The silence of the Union government on the issue only goes to show its support for such criminal activities across the nation against Dalits in the name of protecting cows, Mr. Sagar alleged, and added that the BJP led National Democratic Alliance government and Sangh Parivar were playing a crucial role in carrying out such atrocities against Dalits. Dr. Ambedkar's vision for equality and annihilation of the caste system is still a dream, he said, and added that many make a living skinning carcasses of animals and cleaning human waste.
