Dr. Sagar strongly condemned the removal of plaque from a statue of Dr. Ambedkar in Kalaburagi last Tuesday.
Union: Gir Somnath, Una, Kalaburagi, Karnataka, Gujarat

Title: Girl dies after operation, police book case
Content: TIRUCHI: The Fort Police have registered a case on a complaint following the death of a girl student who expired in a private hospital here following an operation on Sunday. The girl A. Nalini of Keezha Valadi was a first year undergraduate commerce student in an aided college in the city. Police said as the girl suffered headache, her parents took her to a private hospital here. A medical expert upon examining the girl informed the parents after taking a scan that the girl had to be operated upon as there was presence of tumour in the brain. The operation was conducted in the morning and the girl died in the afternoon.

Title: Neighbour rapes minor
Content: A seven-year-old girl was hospitalised after she was allegedly sexually assaulted by a 45-year-old neighbour in Central Delhi's Baljeet Nagar on Tuesday. According to the police, accused Ram Chander Mahto picked her up when she was playing and took her to his house, which was empty. He sexually assaulted the girl, but when she started crying the neighbours were alarmed. The accused then left the house, abandoning the girl crying in pain, said a senior police officer. Neighbours informed the family, who took the girl to Lady Hardinge Hospital.

Title: December deluge may decide upshot of poll in Saidapet
Content: The sight of the Adyar river flowing over the Saidapet bridge following the deluge last December remains etched in the minds of most residents of the constituency, which was among the worst affected areas of the city. We watched helplessly as water flooded over 600 houses here and then had to run to an under construction building nearby for refuge. We stayed there for two days and nobody came to help us out, says K. Devika, a resident of the government farm area near Todd Hunter Nagar. The residents of Surya Nagar in Kotturpuram have similar tales of horror, and many are apprehensive about the resettlement process as they do not know how it will impact their livelihood. This is the first time we have faced such floods and we are now being asked to move to Semmenchery.
Union: Adyar, adyar river, Kotturpuram, Saidapet, Semmenchery, Surya Nagar, Todd Hunter Nagar

Title: Soldier's body recovered from Siachen, search for others continue
Content: Working against all odds and inclement weather, the army on Monday recovered one body, out of 10 missing soldiers in an avalanche, in Siachen Glacier, where a search operation is on for six days now. According to a Jammu based Defence spokesman, the army's rescue parties have reached the camp site where avalanche buried the 10 soldiers, including a junior commissioned officer. The mortal remains of one soldier was recovered, said the spokesman. The rescue teams are cutting through up to thirty feet of ice at multiple locations where our soldiers could be buried. The probable locations are identified by using specialised equipment, said the spokesman.

Title: Rosaiah releases compilation of speeches of Shabbir
Content: HYDERABAD: A transparent governance was the only factor that would drive all round development of the State, said Leader of Opposition in the Telangana Legislative Council Mohammed Ali Shabbir. He was speaking after a book actually a compilation of Mr. Shabbir Ali s speeches delivered in the House was released by former Governor of Tamil Nadu K. Rosaiah, who said it would be a record of proceedings that could be referred in future. The former Chief Minister of erstwhile Andhra Pradesh also recalled his association with the Council that lasted over 22 years. Mr. Shabbir Ali wanted democratic traditions in elected Houses to be preserved and said his own journey of two years in the Council of Telangana State was more dynamic and meaningful in serving the cause of the poor and downtrodden. In his second innings as Leader of Opposition, he said he was in a position to advise the TRS Government in welfare measures.
Union: Telangana, Tamil Nadu, HYDERABAD, Andhra Pradesh

Title: Station masters press for filling up of vacancies
Content: Members of All India Station Masters Association staged a demonstration pressing for a charter of demands, including filling up of vacancies, to ensure punctuality and safety of trains, here on Wednesday. Its divisional president, S. Sivagnanam, said that the protest was part of an all India agitation. Pointing out that several enquiry committees that probed into various accidents had recommended for additional station masters in stations with higher workload. This was defined as those stations served by single lines with more than 85 per cent traffic and all double lines. The railway board had agreed to implement it in 2012, he said.

Title: Varsity students continue strike for second day
Content: Students of Pondicherry University continued with their hunger strike for the second day demanding implementation of 25 per cent reservation for students of Puducherry in admissions to the institution. Students abstained from classes on Tuesday and took out a protest march to submit a memorandum to the Acting Vice-Chancellor Anisha Basheer Khan. However, they were prevented by security personnel. Students tried to push forward even as police tried to keep them at bay. They withdrew their protest after the acting VC assured to hold talks with the representatives of students council on Wednesday.

Title: Naidu forms four panels
Content: VIJAYAWADA: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu has constituted four committees to monitor issues relating to post demonetisation of Rs. 500 and Rs.1,000 currency notes. At a review meeting here on Thursday, Mr. Naidu said that a committee comprising of Reserve Bank of India (RBI), State Bank of India (SBI), Andhra Bank and the Finance Secretary would prepare a roadmap on rationalizstion of the service charges levied in mobile banking. Another committee comprising representatives of KL University, APSRTC, Labour, SBI, Andhra Bank would monitor the training programmes on mobile and online banking, he said. A seven-member team would monitor the installation of e-PoS machines in the State. And, the fourth committee would monitor seeding of Jan Dhan and Aadhaar to encourage mobile banking, he said, adding the committees would start functioning from Friday.

Title: Meghalaya man vanishes from airport
Content: MUMBAI: A 25 year old man from Meghalaya, Mouramswang Huzon Christian, who had come to the city to work with a BPO last month, went missing from the domestic airport while on his way back home on Friday. The airport police registered a missing complaint. A Cherrapunji native, Christian came to the city on November 28 to start his new job but he unexpectedly fell ill. He was staying over with a friend, who admitted him to Suchak Hospital. Christian's sister came down from Meghalaya to take him home, a police officer said.

Title: Naidu slams YSRC for seeking his resignation
Content: Condemning the hysteric behaviour of the YSR Congress Party members in the Assembly, Telugu Desam Party president and Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu has criticised the main Opposition for seeking his resignation from the post to mount pressure on the Central Government to accord special category status (SCS) to the State. This is not an instant decision and I am thinking in the longer term. Where is the guarantee that projects like Polavaram, which is a lifeline to the State, and the financial assistance assured to the State will be implemented if my party severs ties with the Central Government? he asked. Launching a broadside against Leader of the Opposition Y. S. Jagan Mohan Reddy at an interaction with the media, he said that in fact Mr. Jagan compromised on the State's interests during the bifurcation of the State for securing bail.

Title: Japanese delegation visit VTU
Content: The Visvesvaraya Technological University is taking measures to facilitate research studies for its students and faculty in Japan. A delegation from Japan, consisting of Satoru Kojima of Nagasaki Wesleyan University, Kiichiro Yamada representing Universities of Nagasaki Prefecture, Isaku Mori, and Vinay and Tej Kumar representing Silver Peak Japan, accompanied by R. Shivakumar, Chairman, ASSOCHAM, visited the Jnana Sangam campus of VTU here on Thursday to explore the possibility of signing a MoU for pursuing higher studies and research. They also discussed about employment opportunities for VTU students and having a joint MBA Doing Business with Japan Programme with industrial exposure in Japan. Also, Japan is looking for training its students in the IT sector and soft skills at VTU, said V. Sridhar, Acting Vice Chancellor of VTU. Mr. Sridhar, during an interaction with the visiting delegation, suggested that training centres could be established at the four regional centres of VTU with instructors from Japan to teach Japanese language to aspiring students.

Title: Plan to close Thuckalay reservation counter
Content: The Thiruvananthapuram division of the Southern Railway plans to close non railhead reservation counters across Kerala and Kanniyakumari district. A release said that with a view to serving remote locations outside railway stations, the Non Rail Head Passenger Reservation System was introduced. However, patronage to these facilities had dwindled as 80 per cent of the reservations were made online. A review revealed that there was poor patronage for 11 NRH PRS facilities, including the one in Thuckalay bus stand. These facilities would be monitored for three months and if there was no improvement in patronage, they would be closed down, the release added.
Union: Thuckalay, Thuckalay bus stand, Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram, Kanniyakumari

Title: Tenders for Smart Grid Project to open soon
Content: The tenders for the first phase of a Rs. 7,000 crore Smart Grid Project for the Millennium City will open on July 22. The information was given at a meeting of Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar with Union Minister of State for Power, Coal, New and Renewable Energy Piyush Goyal in New Delhi on Monday. The Smart Grid Project for Gurgaon Manesar Urban Complex 2031 has been divided into three parts. The first part, which is for Sectors 1-57, has been further divided into four phases. The first phase, for which the tenders will be open on July 22, includes the jurisdictional area of DLF Operation Subdivision of the Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (DHBVN).
Union: Gurgaon Manesar Urban Complex, Millennium City, New Delhi, Haryana, Gurgaon, Sectors 1-57

Title: Taking govt. schemes to people will be top priority: Collector
Content: T. N. Hariharan assumed office as the Collector of Coimbatore on Wednesday. He was earlier Collector of Dindigul District. He replaces Archana Patnaik. Mr. Hariharan had earlier served as Executive Director of Metrowater, Chennai, and Joint Secretary of Rural Development and Panchayat Raj and also as Collector in Ramanathapuram and Virudhunagar districts. He had also served as Collector in Coimbatore for a brief period during 2012. Talking to reporters, Mr. Hariharan said that fulfilling the basic needs of the people, fine tuning the service delivery mechanism to take the Government's schemes closer to the people will be his top priority.

Title: Smog causes distress to urban wildlife
Content: The smog that has engulfed the Capital since Diwali is causing distress not only to Delhiites but countless animals too. A peacock was rescued by the Wildlife SOS Rapid Response Unit from Siri Fort Sports Complex earlier this week. Authorities say the peacock had flown into the area from the nearby forest early in the morning and had bumped into a window because of poor visibility caused by heavy smog. Visibility in the area is very low due to smog. The peacock was unable to discern the glass barrier and hit the window.
Union: Siri Fort Sports Complex, Siri Fort

Title: MCD staff paid salaries till January, HC told
Content: The Delhi High Court was informed on Monday that sanitation workers of the three municipal corporations of the Capital, who called off their strike last week, had been paid salaries till January. The court, however, said that it will continue to monitor the matter. The submission was made to a Division Bench comprising Chief Justice G. Rohini and Justice Jayant Nath while hearing three writ petitions on the subject. The court had earlier observed that the payment of wages was the responsibility of both the municipal corporations and the Delhi government. After the parties, including safai karamcharis and workers unions, informed the Bench about payment of salaries, the court posted the case for further hearing on February 23.

Title: Gold, money missing from firm
Content: A burglary was reported from a private financing company in Mudavanmugal, coming under the Poojappura police station limits, on Sunday. Gold ornaments valued at Rs.5 lakh and nearly Rs. 1.9 lakh of cash were reported stolen from the firm. According to Poojappura sub-inspector Asoka Kumar, the incident came to light by 7.45 a.m. when the owner of a salon nearby noticed the shutter of the firm, Arakath Bankers, lying open and sensed something was amiss. The ornaments and cash that were stored in a locker were found to be missing during a subsequent inspection. The police registered a case on the basis of a complaint filed by the owner of the firm, Suresh, who hails from Vattavila.

Title: Commission acts on law students intriguing plea
Content: Resolving an intriguing issue of a huge gap between the judges and litigants, the Delhi State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has acted on a representation submitted by a group of law students who had invoked the statutory right of consumers to be heard and assured of protection of their interests. The Commission has reduced the gap between the Bench of presiding members and the place earmarked for parties to argue their cases. The students had pointed out that the big gap between the Bench and consumer applicants was creating hurdle for the latter, especially senior citizens, in putting their oral arguments while seeking relief. On their visit to the Commission last week, the students observed the impact of gap reduction in the shape of easy and hassle free hearing. The gap is now in line with that maintained at District Consumer Forums and the parties in person can represent their cases conveniently before the Bench, said Paras Jain, one of the students, here on Monday.

Title: Students want full-time VC for university
Content: A section of students of Pondicherry University affiliated to Akil Bhartiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) on Tuesday staged a demonstration in front of the main gate of the University campus protesting against the decision of the administration to allow the circulation of the magazine Widerstand on the campus after a week long freeze on its distribution. The students also raised slogans against the administration and demanded the Ministry of Human Resources Development (MHRD) to remove the Vice Chancellor (in charge) and appoint a full time VC for the post. Double standards A spokesperson of the ABVP alleged that the University administration was indulging in double standards in the magazine row. While the Registrar had promised to take action against those who had brought out the magazine, the authorities instead went ahead and handed over the keys of the Student Council room to the students. Most of the apparatus and instruments used by students in Science departments are not functional.

Title: What Urdu has, what it still needs
Content: When Intizar Hussain writes, everyone pays attention. The India-born-Pakistani writer, well-known even beyond the boundaries of the sub-continent, recently wrote about the Jashn-e-Rekhta--the two-day Urdu literary festival held in Delhi earlier this month. He said: " I am returning (to Pakistan) after witnessing the biggest literary festival. This festival of Urdu was celebrated under the title Jashn-e-Rekhta and held at the India International Center, a central place in the Indian capital." He added: " Friends and others believed that the tradition of Urdu has come to an end in Delhi."

Title: TRS not to support Bharat bandh
Content: HYDERABAD: The TRS will not support the Opposition sponsored Bharat Bandh against demonetisation on November 28 as the party had already asked the Central Government to see that the hardships faced by people were overcome. TRS Deputy Leader in Lok Sabha B. Vinod Kumar told a press conference that the party had taken a stand to give suggestions to the Centre as the demonetisation scheme was already under implementation. Mr. Vinod Kumar released a letter questioning the Centre's written reply to a question raised by TD Rajya Sabha member T. G. Venkatesh turning down the Telangana government's request to increase the seats of the Legislative Assembly in the State until Article 170 of the Constitution was amended. The TRS MP said the Constitution, while creating new States by reorganisation, conferred supreme and exclusive power on Parliament under Articles 3 and 4 of the Constitution to enact provisions for dividing land, water and other resources, distribute assets and liabilities of predecessor States amongst new States and make provisions for contracts and other legal rights and obligations. However, Section 26 (1) in the Andhra Pradesh Reorganisation Act was tantamount to an amendment of the Constitution and had an overriding effect over some other provisions in Article 170. The Section 26 (1), if interpreted correctly, was enough to enable increase in Assembly seats. At the most, a minor amendment to the section was required to remove ambiguity and clarify its intent.

Title: Location of district office creates controversy
Content: The government seems to have got into an avoidable controversy with its plans to build the district office complex away from the city. The plan to build the complex on a hill top in Mamankeri village has some organisations saying the location is too far away and difficult to access. Bidar is among the last districts to get a complex where all important offices are located. Earlier plan A piece of land near the Gurudwara was identified in 2014 and sent to the State government for approval. This formed the basis of the plan developed by the Karnataka Housing Board for the one lakh square ft building.

Title: Hartal near total in Kannur
Content: The dawn to dusk hartal called by the Left Democratic Front (LDF) to protest against the Central government's demonetisation drew near total response in Kannur on Monday. The hartal passed off peacefully, even as it affected normal life of the people here. Shops were all closed in response to the hartal call and vehicles were off the roads, except some two wheelers and private cars. Banks remained open as they were exempted from the hartal. No untoward incidents in connection with hartal were reported from any parts of the district, the police said.

Title: Auditors question validity of 2013-14 Corporation budget
Content: The callous approach of the civic administrators of Kochi towards its annual budget has come under scrutiny. An audit report has even questioned the very credibility and reliability of the document. It was the budget, presented by the then Deputy Mayor B. Bhadra, and passed by the Kochi Corporation during 2013 14 that has been pulled up by the Local Fund Auditors of the State government for giving a go for the crucial accounting procedures. On March 18, 2013, the date on which the annual budget was approved, no separate data and statements on the income and expenditure of the Kochi Corporation were compiled. It was not known how the local body added the income and expenditure statements to the annual budget without having prepared the income and expenditure figures.

Title: Young dancers steal the show
Content: Kuchipudi performance by promising young dancers was a feast to the eyes on the first day of the five-day Siddhendra Natya Mahotsav-2016 here on Sunday. Akhila Bharata Kuchipudi Natya Kala Mandali (ABKNKM) of Kuchipudi, in collaboration with Krishna University, is organising the annual dance festival, remembering the services rendered by great gurus of Kuchpudi, including Padma Bhushan Vempati China Satyam. Krishna University students Radhika, Tejaswini and Rajeswari presented the inaugural performance of Kuchipudi, while Kuchipudi recital by Hyderabad-based danseuse Sita Prasad left the audience spellbound. The ABKNKM has bestowed the Padma Shree Vedantam Satyanarayana award on Natyacharya Pasumarthy Rattayya Sarma and the P.V.G. Krishna Sarma memorial award on Natyacharya Sri Mahankali Suryanarayana Sarma. The awards were presented by Krishna University Vice-Chancellor S. Rama Krishna Rao.

Title: Suresh Prabhu must own responsibility for derailment, says Congress
Content: The Congress on Sunday said Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu should own responsibility for the Utkal Express derailment and accused him of setting a new record in laxity . It also said that no amount of conspiracy theory could absolve the BJP government of blame for the death of 21 passengers. The dismal safety record of the Modi government is reflected in 27 major railway accidents since May 2014 which have resulted in the death of 259 passengers and serious injuries to 899, AICC in charge of communications Randeep Singh Surjewala said here. He said it was time to reset priorities and allocate budget for railway safety protocols vis a vis the bullet train jumlas . Mr. Surjewala said initial reports suggested that a massive miscommunication led to derailment of at least 14 coaches of the Haridwar bound Kalinga - Utkal Express in Khatauli.

Title: Kadem receives copious inflows
Content: Heavy rainfall in the western parts of Adilabad district on August 19 brought copious inflows into Kadem medium irrigation project in Nirmal district on Sunday which would ensure water for paddy cultivation on 70,000 acres in both Nirmal and Mancherial districts. Neredigonda mandal received 160 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours ending at 8 a. m. on Sunday. Boath mandal recorded 96 mm, Utnoor 92 mm, Indervelli 73 mm while Kadem, Bazarhatnoor, Ichoda and Gudihatnoor received over 40 mm of rainfall during the period. The inflows into Kadem began late on Saturday night with the Kadem stream, the major contributory water body, in spate. At 6 a. m. , the inflows were over 43,000 cusecs having increased from just 217 cusecs the previous morning. At 8 a.m., the inflows swelled to over 70,000 cusecs and peaked at 10 a.m. to over 83,000 cusecs. The accumulation of water in Kadem reservoir eased towards noon when over 57,000 cusecs of inflows were recorded.
Union: Gudihatnoor, Adilabad, Ichoda, Mancherial, Nirmal, Indervelli, Utnoor, Kadem, Boath, Boath mandal, Bazarhatnoor, Neredigonda, Neredigonda mandal

Title: Too early to talk about BJP-TDP alliance: Venkaiah
Content: BJP Union Minister for Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation M. Venkaiah Naidu has said that it was too early to talk about a BJP TDP alliance in the 2019 elections. Addressing the media at the State party office here on Saturday, Mr. Venkaiah Naidu said the present alliance would continue. He, however, refused to comment on whether the alliance would remain intact for the 2019 elections. The BJP and the TDP are working together well. Our expansion in A.P. should not be an objectionable thing as it is natural for political parties to grow on their own.

Title: App comes as a boon for fisherfolk
Content: Fisherfolk from Prakasam like elsewhere in the country are, perhaps, one of the most vulnerable and isolated communities with no livelihood security. A mobile app developed by the M. S. Swaminathan Research Foundation (MSSRF) with the Indian National Centre for Ocean Information Services(INCOIS) as a knowledge partner can make all the difference to the lives of fishermen who have to grapple with a host of issues including fast depletion of marine resources and climate change, says Dr. Sourav Maity, scientist with the INCOIS of the Union Ministry of Earth Sciences. All that the fishermen should have is an android mobile phone with data pack on their hand while going for fishing in the sea. They could save on diesel, their main expenditure, by getting precise information on potential fishing zones, Dr. Sourav explained while making a power point presentation to fishermen in the district on Saturday. In collaboration with the Indian Meteorological Department, the INCOIS also provided information relating to sea safety including cyclone advisories, he added.

Title: Koyilandi remains shut as BJP observes hartal
Content: Kozhikode: The dawn-to-dusk hartal called by the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) protesting against the alleged attack by Communist Party of India (Marxist) workers on its local offices hit normal life in the Koyilandy Assembly constituency. While shops and commercial establishments remained shut, vehicles, except inter-district bus services, remained off the road. The CPI(M) also observed hartal in Payyoli municipality and Thikkodi, Moodadi, and Thurayoor grama panchayats. Party activists accused the BJP of trying to cover up attacks by its workers on the CPI(M)'s local offices at Payyoli. According to the police, tension began in the area after a group of unidentified men set a local office of the CPI(M) at Payyoli on fire.
Union: Moodadi, Koyilandy, Kozhikode, Thikkodi, India, Koyilandi, Payyoli, Thurayoor

Title: Tar balls: Team to visit affected beaches next week
Content: PANAJI/CALANGUTE: Tar balls continued to wash ashore on a few more beaches in Candolim and Anjuna in North Goa and the long Salcete coastline, as some locals and tourists tried to grab one last summer bath before the monsoon. The long stretch of the Salcete beach from Benaulim to Mobor, Cavelossim, was tarred partially by dark streaks of oily material. Though the substance was more filmy and not so heavy, visitors and tourists were disconcerted by the sticky material spreading with the waves. Tar balls also surfaced minimally in Betalbatim, Majorda, Arossim and Baina. The surfacing of tar balls on more beaches could be a signal that they may spread to other stretches, a tourism stakeholder said.
Union: Benaulim, CALANGUTE, Baina, Anjuna, Betalbatim, PANAJI, North Goa, Candolim, Arossim, Majorda, Mobor, Cavelossim, Salcete

Title: All villages in State will get a facelift: Lokesh
Content: All villages in the State will have CC roads and LED street lights in the next two years, Minister for Rural Development, Panchayat Raj and IT Nara Lokesh has said. For creating basic amenities in villages, convergence with Employment Guarantee Scheme would be planned, he said addressing a meeting after laying the foundation for PR and Rural Water Supply schemes worth 30 crore at Kasimkota on Friday. The Central government would sanction 4,000 crore to address drinking water problem in the State and of that 40 crore would be allocated to Anakapalle constituency, Mr. Lokesh said. For all villages with more than 5,000 population underground drainage would be provided. He assured the farmers that a decision would be taken soon on re opening the Tummapala sugar factory and payment of 12 crore arrears to farmers and employees. He inaugurated a modern bus stop at Raja Theatre Junction.
Union: Kasimkota, Anakapalle, Raja Theatre Junction, Tummapala

Title: Congress calls for strike over chit fund scams
Content: The Congress party has called for a general strike in Tripura on May 18 citing poor governance of the CPI(M) led government and failure to detain kingpins of chit fund companies which allegedly embezzled hundreds of crores of rupees . SIT probe: The ruling CPI(M) has opposed the decision to enforce the 12 hour bandh and made an appeal to the Congress leadership to withdraw it. In a statement, the CPI(M) said a Special Investigation Team (SIT) under the directive of the High Court was investigating the financial scams that the chit fund companies were allegedly a part of. It added that the State government will not spare anyone involved in duping people . CPM misrule: Congress leaders on Monday, however, rejected the appeal and said the strike call was part of their political campaign against the misrule of the CPI(M) led government and its reluctance to launch a thorough probe against the chit fund companies .

Title: File charge sheet in three months, HC tells EOW
Content: Mumbai: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday gave three months to the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Mumbai Police to file a charge sheet against erring Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) officials accused in the de silting scam last year. A Division Bench of Justices R. M. Savant and Sadhana Jadhav was hearing a public interest litigation (PIL) filed by activist Vivekanand Gupta about irregularities by the BMC in construction of roads and a scam in the process of de silting drains. The road repair and de silting scams were estimated to be worth 905 crore and 150 crore respectively. The PIL sought for the probe to be transferred to the Anti Corruption Bureau. In the last hearing, an affidavit filed by the EOW said it is still investigation the roles and responsibilities of BMC officials, and that the probe was of a technical nature as the officers had to collect documentary evidence.

Title: Assam, Bengal, Gujarat face deluge
Content: The flood toll due in Assam has gone up to 76 with the death of one more person in the Morigaon district on Saturday. According to the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA), the districts of Lakhimpur, Biswanath, Barpeta, Morigaon, Nagaon, Golaghat, Jorhat, Sivasagar and Karimganj are still affected by the flood. As of now 58,837 people have been affected by the floods in the nine districts. The number of affected villages stands at 224, State Project Coordinator of ASDMA Rajib Prakash Baruah told The Hindu on Sunday. He also said that 38 relief camps with 8,294 inmates are currently running in the State.
Intersection: Lakhimpur, Golaghat, Morigaon, Assam, Nagaon, Sivasagar, Jorhat, Barpeta, Karimganj, Biswanath, Gujarat, Bengal
Union: Golaghat, Morigaon, Lakhimpur, Nagaon, Assam, Sivasagar, Jorhat, Barpeta, Karimganj, Biswanath, Gujarat, Bengal

Title: Five Bangladesh nationals arrested
Content: Belagavi police continued to arrest Bangladesh nationals living in the district without valid documents. On Wednesday, five were arrested, along with two other residents of the city who allegedly helped them get shelter and forged documents. The Bangladesh nationals arrested include Javed Inamdar, Mohmad Husain Barpwala, Imran Khan Pathan, Navaz Khan Pathan, and Mobin Bepari. Belgaum residents Rehana Kattimani and Mehboob Noorahmad Sheikh have also been arrested and remanded in judicial custody.

Title: Jagan pays homage to YSR
Content: YSR Congress Party president Y. S. Jagan Mohan Reddy and his family members offered special prayers and paid homage at the YSR Ghat at Idupulapaya in Kadapa district on the 8th death anniversary of former Chief Minister Y. S. Rajasekhara Reddy on Saturday. Mr. Jagan, his wife Bharathi, mother Vijayamma, sister Sharmila, brother in law Anil Kumar, paternal uncles Y. S. Vivekananda Reddy, Y. S. Purushotham Reddy and Y. S. Manohar Reddy, MPs Y. S. Avinash Reddy and Y. V. Subba Reddy placed garlands and observed two minutes silence. Several party leaders and activists paid homage at the tomb. Later, Mr. Jagan said YSR lived in the hearts of the people.

Title: Yet another milestone for JSW Steel Limited
Content: JSW Steel Limited, a mega integrated steel plant in Torangal having many firsts to its credit, has added one more milestone. It is the first company in South India to acquire two rakes (railway goods wagons) of its own under the Liberalised wagon investment scheme of the Railways. One of the two rakes (each with 45 wagons) loaded with its steel products set off on its journey towards Hyderabad on Sunday, after Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu, through video link, formally flagged off the rakes at a function in Bengaluru on Sunday. Daily, around 28 rakes bring in raw material, while around eight to 10 rakes carry finished products such as steel, slag and cement from Torangal to various destinations making JSW Steels one of the major freight revenue generators for the Railways it was 3,700 crore in the financial year 2016-17 and the projection for the current year being 4,400 crore. The advantage of owning the rakes would not only reduce dependency/uncertainty in getting rakes for dispatch of products but would also ensure timely supply of products to customers.
Union: South India, Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Torangal, Bengaluru

Title: CM hits out at BJP for seeking votes on caste basis
Content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah described the recently concluded byelections to Nanjangud as needless and lashed out at the BJP for seeking votes on the basis of caste. Addressing a public rally at Nanjangud on Wednesday, the Chief Minister said the byelection was necessitated owing to the ego of the previous MLA (V. Srinivas Prasad). He did not directly refer to Mr. Prasad but alluded to him during his speech.The rally was held at Gundlupet and Nanjangud to thank the voters for ensuring a Congress victory. Mr. Siddaramaiah also thanked the Janata Dal (Secular) for not fielding candidates in the constituencies, resulting in a direct contest and consolidation of votes in favour of the Congress. "I thank JD (S) leaders, H.D. Deve Gowda and H.D. Kumaraswamy", said the Chief Minister who also lauded the work of DSS activists.But much of Mr. Siddaramaiah's criticism was reserved for the BJP State president B.S. Yeddyurappa for seeking votes on caste basis.

Title: BBMP weighed down by interest on loans
Content: Public Utility Building, K. R. Market, Malleswaram market and some other landmarks continue to be mortgaged to the Housing and Urban Development Corporation (HUDCO). Despite efforts to repay and restructure its loans, eight properties continue to be pledged. In an RTI reply to Wg. Cdr. (retd.) G.B. Athri, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) revealed that of the total 11 properties pledged, three were retrieved in 2016. The total market value of the eight properties mortgaged with HUDCO is 2,872.27 crore while the loan outstanding is 1,434.39 crore. The city is paying several hundred crores annually as interest for these loans. It is high time that the BBMP and State government work out a solution to clear the loans to save the interest and retrieve the iconic buildings, Mr. Athri said.
Union: Public Utility Building, Malleswaram, Bengaluru, K. R. Market

Title: Man held for posing as IPS officer at airport
Content: MADURAI: A 47 year old man, J. Hidhayathullah of Tahsildar Nagar here, was arrested at Madurai airport on Wednesday for posing as an IPS officer with a fake identity card. The police said Hidhayathullah went to the airport around 5.30 p. m. to receive one of his friends. He told the Central Industrial Security Force personnel deployed for airport security that he was an IPS officer. He was then asked to get a pass from the Airport Terminal Manager. Even as he went there to collect the pass, the CISF personnel got suspicious of his conduct and alerted the local police.

Title: Rs 11 lakh payout to 2 kids for mom's death in Thane
Content: THANE: The Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) here awarded a compensation of Rs 11. 02 lakh to two minor girls, whose mother died in an accident six months ago in Kalyan while riding pillion on a scooter. In their submission before the MACT judge K D Vadane on March 27, the girls Pratishta Shinde (7) Manali Shinde (4) residents of Shri Complex in Kalyan (west) were represented by their grandfather Ashok Shinde who told the court that the girls mother, Suvarna Shinde (27), a nurse, was riding pillion with her husband Rupesh Shinde on February 1, 2015, when the accident took place on the Manpada - Kalyan road. In his bid to save a pedestrian crossing the road who suddenly came in front of the bike, Rupesh lost control due to which Suvarna fell on the road and succumbed to her injuries. The scooter was owned by the uncle of the two girls, Ashish Shinde.
Union: Manpada, Manpada Kalyan road, Kalyan, Manpada, Thane, THANE, Shri Complex, Kalyan (west)

Title: In Karnataka, a river has disappeared
Content: The multiple hills of Chickballapur tower over the landscape where a series of tanks, named after nondescript villages, mark the formation of Arkavathi river. Less than 20 km ahead, the clear water gives way to thick sludge flowing between concrete layouts. The Hindu's check on the river, from its origin in the relatively-pristine Nandi Hills to the cesspool at Tippagondanahalli reservoir, showed a waterbody that seems not to have benefited from the rain. Currently, the city has seen over 800 mm of rainfall, while Bengaluru urban and rural districts have seen between 20% and 44% excess rainfall so far. But while reservoirs and tanks have filled up, the river itself seems to have disappeared.
Union: Tippagondanahalli, Arkavathi river, Bengaluru, Chickballapur, Karnataka, Nandi Hills

Title: Efforts on to find a lasting solution to garbage menace
Content: Soon, local bodies in Ernakulam will get a rough estimate of the daily waste generated in households. The lack of a proper assessment of waste generated in homes has often hampered efforts to introduce a scientific mechanism to process solid waste. Local bodies had received brickbats for buying equipment and waste moving vehicles without having any idea on the quantity of waste generated in households. Volunteers associated with the Waste free Kerala initiative of the Haritha Mission have now started collecting details of the waste generated and processed in each household across various municipalities and panchayats in Ernakulam. The survey is being held as part of the government decision to fix the models of solid waste management to be implemented in local bodies.

Title: Kodiyathur, Karassery regions gasp for breath
Content: Residents of Kodiyathur and Karassery panchayats in Kozhikode district are a worried lot. Dust from stone quarries located in the panchayats has caused lung and skin diseases among several people, they allege. Senior citizens, pregnant women and newborns are the worst hit. I was on medication for respiratory ailments for three years, but the symptoms still persist, says Jesna Nishad, 23, from Madambi in Kodiyathur panchayat. I was advised to discontinue medicines for fear of termination of my pregnancy, she adds.

Title: AIADMK supports Kovind as he is a Dalit
Content: DINDIGUL: Tamil Nadu Minister for Forests C. Srinivasan said the AIADMK was supporting BJP candidate for the post of President Ram Nath Kovind as he was a Dalit. Talking to press persons here on Sunday, he said it was the duty of the partymen to motivate and encourage people from Adi Dravida community. Reacting to the issue of NEET, he said the government had passed a resolution seeking 85 reservation for students from Tamil Nadu as they faced difficulty in taking competitive exams. It was up to the Centre to decide on this matter, he added. Later, kick starting distribution of alluvial soil removed from Athoor Kamarajar dam to farmers, Mr. Srinivasan said 2.88 lakh cubic metres of soil had been given to 3,201 farmers in the district.
Union: DINDIGUL, Tamil Nadu, Athoor Kamarajar dam, Athoor

Title: We didn't advise masking of Hindi letters at Metro Stations, says police
Content: A day after the Hindi letters in the signage at two stations, the Kempegowda interchange at Majestic, were masked, the Deputy Commissioner of Police West M. N. Anucheth on Monday in a statement said that, There is a news item doing rounds that police have advised BMRCL to mask Hindi signage at Metro stations. This is incorrect. I categorically state that we have not advised any such thing. Also, on our own we have deployed additional force in a few sensitive metro stations in light of the recent developments. While no decision has been taken officially on removing Hindi from metro signage, on Sunday Hindi letters were masked allegedly after the Upparpet police got a tip off that pro Kannada organisations were planning to enter Kempegowda and Chickpete stations and blacken all signage in Hindi.

Title: DMRC bags contract for Metro VI
Content: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) has appointed the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to execute the Swami Samarth Nagar Jogeshwari Vikhroli Metro VI corridor. We have appointed the DMRC on a deposit terms basis, said Dilip Kawathkar, joint project director (public relations), MMRDA. The DMRC will oversee the operation: from inviting bids to executing the civil work. The MMRDA will reimburse the expenses borne by the DMRC. The DMRC is also implementing the Dahisar D. N. Nagar Metro IIA corridor under the same model.

Title: Amid clamour over cows, who will save the Deoni?
Content: The debate and commotion over the protection of cows across the country has not rescued the Deoni, an important native breed of Karnataka, Maharashtra and Telangana, from complete neglect. Favoured by farmers for its resilience, disease resistance and docility, centres set up for the research and development of the Deoni are now closed or on the verge of closure. A farm run by the Telangana State Animal Husbandry Department (TSAHD) for the propagation of the Deoni at Zaheerabad was shut down early in 2017, with the 46 pure bred Deoni cattle at this facility given away to nearby goshalas. And yet, TSAHD has not applied for grants under the incumbent National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government's Rashtriya Gokul Mission (RGM), or any other scheme, for protecting indigenous breeds such as the Deoni.

Title: Green signal for allocation of Deputy Collectors between Telangana and AP
Content: The State Advisory Committee on allocation of State cadre employees met here on Friday, and decided to proceed with the allocation of Deputy Collectors based on the finalised seniority list. The committee comprising Chief Secretaries of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, State Reorganisation Cell secretaries of both the States, and headed by Ajay Mittal, Secretary, Department of Personnel and Training, GoI, took decisions regarding several pending issues. The allocation of Deputy Collectors, Deputy Superintendents of Police and Excise Superintendents had been pending for long. The employees went to court demanding finalisation of the seniority list first. When the seniority of Deputy Collectors was finalised, the SAC gave a go ahead for their allocation between the two States.

Title: One more panther caged
Content: One more panther, which was straying into the habitations close to the Western Ghats near Gadana Dam in the district giving sleepless nights to the residents, was caged by the forest personnel on Thursday night. This is the seventh panther to be caught by the forest personnel in this area in the past six months. Since the time a stray panther started hunting down dogs and goats in Peththaanpillaikudiyiruppu near Gadana Dam in Kadayam, farmers had been urging the forest personnel to keep a cage with bait to catch the big cat. Subsequently, the cage was kept in the jungle between Gadana Dam and the village last Tuesday. When the forest personnel checked the cage on Friday morning, they saw a 10-year-old female panther trapped in the steel enclosure.
Union: Gadana Dam, Kadayam, Western Ghats, Peththaanpillaikudiyiruppu

Title: Good returns prompt cotton to make a come back
Content: As expected, cultivation of cotton in Telangana is making a come back to its normal extent, what it used to be till the year before the last kharif, with the area of fibre crop sown covering over 63.5 of the total cropped area so far. Cotton is sown on 13.16 lakh hectares already, against only 7.23 lakh hectares in the same period last year. Interestingly, cotton accounts for nearly two-thirds of the total sown area of 20.72 lakh hectares so far this season. Advisory goes wrong: Following an advisory from the State Government discouraging the farming community not to take up cotton cultivation during the last kharif season, the extent of the fibre crop had come down to around 14 lakh hectares last year from the normal 16 lakh to 17 lakh hectares. The government had suggested farmers not to go for cotton citing the volatile market conditions for cotton across the world.However, it was not so encouraging experience to the farmers who took to alternative crops such as redgram, soyabean, maize, chilli and others on a large scale with redgram and chilli cultivated in record extents of 2.78 lakh hectares and 1.12 lakh hectares, respectively. Their prices remained low even after the market intervention done by the government forcing the farmers to rethink on cotton.

Title: Minority platform with 15 Muslim bodies on cards
Content: KOLKATA: In what could spell fresh trouble for the Mamata Banerjee government, a new minority platform, tentatively named Milli Ittehad Council, is being formed by 15 Muslim organisations with blessings from senior Muslim clerics and peers. Qari Maulana Fazlur Rehman, whose Eid message after the Red Road namaaz targeted the Trinamool government on its unfulfilled promises, is expected to head the council that will press for social upliftment of the Muslims. Over the past two days, senior Muslim clerics and leaders have been trying to give shape to this council deliberating in a Park Circus hotel. All Bengal Minority Youth Federation secretary Md Kamruzaman said, The Sacchar Committee report had brought to light the fact that Left Front had merely done lip service for the minorities in Bengal. A third of Bengal's population is Muslim.
Union: KOLKATA, Red Road, Park Circus, Bengal

Title: KK line to be restored on Dec. 11
Content: The railway bridge between Borraguhalu and Chimidapalli Railwy Stations, on the Kotttavalasa Kirandul line, which was badly damaged due to boulder fall on Oct 6, this year, has been restored. A trial run was conducted on Dec 8 and formal traffic will be resumed with effect from the midnight of Dec 11, according to an official release issued by the East Coast Railway (E Co R) on Friday. A 34 tonne rock breaker and capacity excavators of 300 tonne, 200 tonne and 75 tonne were used in the restoration work. The bridge was repaired at a cost of 7 crore by using 400 workers and completed in 58 days, which is record of any bridge work done. AP AC ExpressMeanwhile, train no. 22415 Visakhapatnam-New Delhi AP AC Express has been cancelled on Dec 11 and 12 and 22416 New Delhi - Visakhapatnam AP AC Express cancelled on Dec 9 and 10, to facilitate safety-related modernisation works(NI works) at Delhi Division.
Union: Borraguhalu, Kotttavalasa, Kirandul, New Delhi, Delhi, Chimidapalli, Chimidapalli Railwy Stations, Visakhapatnam, KK Line

Title: Work for development of villages, students told
Content: In India there are about 6.4 lakh villages and it is our prime responsibility to develop them. The onus is on the students of universities and colleges to design innovative ideas to develop villages for which networking plays a key role. This was the opinion of Vijay Panduranga Bhatkar, Chancellor of Nalanda University. He was delivering the convocation address at the combined 83rd and 84th convocation of Andhra University held here on Saturday. Dr. Vijay Bhatkar, who led a team to build the country's first super computer Param about three decades ago, was conferred the Honorary Degree of Doctor of Science by the university.

Title: Media barred from referring to Vinay as Eshwarappa's PA
Content: K. S. Eshwarappa, Leader of the Opposition in the Legislative Council, has said that the City Civil Court in Bengaluru has passed an interim order barring media from referring to Vinay N. S. as his personal assistant. Mr. Vinay had lodged a complaint alleging that a few persons had tried to abduct him in Bengaluru on May 11. Based on the complaint, the police had questioned N. R. Santhosh, an aide of BJP leader B. S. Yeddyurappa. The police had also issued summons to Mr. Yeddyurappa. Mr. Eshwarappa told presspersons on Sunday that Mr. Vinay was his acquaintance and not personal assistant.

Title: Women held for forcing minors into alms seeking
Content: The police have arrested two women for forcing minors to seek alms. The arrested have been identified as Suganya (21) and Mariammal (30), both from Coimbatore. The police said that Suganya was found seeking alms with her one-year-old daughter in front of Ranis Theatre near railway station and Mariammal was found seeking alms with her two daughters aged nine and two at Muthukumar Nagar near Rathinapuri. The women were arrested under Section 76 of Juvenile Justice Act. On Friday, the police had rescued 91 children of which 84 were involved in child labour with the knowledge of parents.
Union: Coimbatore, Ranis Theatre, Muthukumar Nagar, Rathinapuri

Title: Law Ministry hails Supreme Court verdict on Section 375
Content: The Law Ministry will not challenge the Supreme Court verdict that rules having sex with one's minor wife is rape, said a top Law Ministry official. The court order will act as a deterrent against child marriage, as the punishment will now be much stricter than the violation of the child marriage law, he said. On Tuesday, the apex court had delivered a landmark judgement where it criminalised sexual intercourse by a man with his minor wife, and it now attracts a jail term of 10 years under the India Penal Code (IPC) or a life term under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. The court's ruling amended Exception 2 of Section 375 of the IPC that earlier exempted husbands from being tried for rape or for sexual intercourse with wives of 15 to 18 years of age. Now, such cases would face stringent punishment.

Title: Issue caste certificate to student seeking higher education: HC to govt.
Content: Mumbai: The Bombay High Court recently quashed an order by a caste scrutiny committee that refused a caste validity certificate to a 20 year old girl from the Mannervelu tribe, who wanted to pursue higher education. The court directed the State government to issue one to her immediately. A Division Bench comprising Justices Shantanu Kemkar and G. S. Kulkarni was hearing a plea filed by Ankita Nimmalwar from Sindhudurg, challenging an order passed by the Scheduled Tribe Certificate Scrutiny Committee, Konkan Division, Thane that rejected her claim that she belongs to a Scheduled Tribe. In her plea, Ms. Nimmalwar said that by birth she belongs to the Mannervelu tribe, notified as a Scheduled Tribe under the Act of Parliament no.108 of 1976. The Deputy Collector of Sindhudurg granted her a caste certificate on April 7, 2007.

Title: 5 workers killed in blast at fireworks unit near Sivakasi
Content: A blast at a factory belonging to Nagamalli Fireworks at Vetrilai Oorani near Sivakasi on Saturday claimed the lives of five workers, including three women. The victims have been identified as Poulraj (45) of Vetrilai Oorani, Vijaya (35) of Kalaingnar Colony in Thayilpatti, Murugeswari (21) of Vetrilai Oorani, Shanmugavel (40) of Mela Ottampatti and Kalarani (38) of Vetrilai Oorani. Four other workers who sustained injuries in the accident were rushed to the Sivakasi Government Hospital, said District Collector of Virudhunagar, A. Sivagnanam. The distress call was reportedly made around 11 a. m. , following which fire tenders from Sivakasi and surrounding areas were rushed to the spot. Preliminary inquiries suggest that the firm's Petroleum and Explosives Safety Organisation (PESO) licence was issued from Chennai, and that the firm employed around 120 workers, which makes it a large scale unit, said a police official supervising the rescue operation.
Union: Vetrilai Oorani, Kalaingnar Colony, Virudhunagar, Sivakasi, Chennai, Mela Ottampatti, Thayilpatti

Title: Attack on varsity professor brings to fore safety issues
Content: The brazen attack on the Head of the Department of Journalism and Science Communication of Madurai Kamaraj University, S. Jenefa, in her office on Tuesday morning has highlighted the need for improving safety measures on the university premises. Highlighting that the assailant, V. Jothimurugan (32), a former guest lecturer of the university, had carried a knife with him to attack Ms. Jenefa, a section of faculty members and students said that no person should be allowed to enter the premises with weapons. The Chairperson of one of the Schools in the MKU highlighted that the entry to the campus, through the main gate and the gate near the guest house, remained unrestricted now. No registers on who enters or leaves the campus are maintained. The identity cards of staff members and students are also not checked, he said.

Title: 1000 year old idol seized
Content: A 1000-year-old panchaloha idol was seized by the police from a group of four people at Ariyaperumbakkam junction on Chennai-Bengaluru National Highway on Tuesday. According to the police, a team of police personnel in plain clothes went to the Ariyaperumbakkam junction at around 7 p.m. on Tuesday after they received a tip-off that an idol was about to change hands. Upon reaching, they found a mini-passenger van parked on the roadside with four people. A check of the vehicle led to the seizure of a 52-cm high panchaloha idol with a damaged portion on the back of the head. Subsequently, the gang members were brought to the Baluchettychatram police station, where they confessed that they had planned to sell the idol for a sum of 2.50 crore to buyers from Malaysia. The van and two motorcycles used by the gang was also impounded, police said.
Union: Chennai-Bengaluru National Highway, Ariyaperumbakkam, Malaysia, Baluchettychatram

Title: Long wait for kin of missing mining workers
Content: It has been an endless wait for relatives and family members of victims whose bodies are still trapped under the rubble as Rajmahal open cast mine collapsed on Thursday. Three days after the rescue operation, there is no trace of Gagan Singh, a supervisor, who was working in the evening shift when the hill of overburden in the mine came crumbling down. On Sunday, Ranjit Kumar Singh, Gagan's brother in law, said: So far, we have checked 14 of the 18 bodies recovered. We still don t know how long we have to wait. Angad, Gagan's uncle, wondered what will happen if the body is not found at all.

Title: Kumki elephant to be shifted from Chadivayal camp
Content: COIMBATORE: Forest officials are planning to relocate Pari, a Kumki elephants from Chadivayal elephant camp due to aggressive behavior and hostility towards Sujay, another kumki stationed at the camp. Officials are likely to send the animal to Kozhikamuthi camp in Top Slip and bring another kumki elephant, Cheran, in a few weeks time. The hostile behavior of Pari and Sujay was making it extremely difficult to deploy these elephants for joint kumki operations in and around Coimbatore. " Sujay and Cheran were earlier together at Theppakkadu elephant camp at Mudumalai in Nilgiris district. We expect them to have better mutual understanding," said a senior forest official.
Intersection: COIMBATORE, Kozhikamuthi camp, Nilgiris, Chadivayal elephant camp, Mudumalai
Union: Coimbatore, COIMBATORE, Chadivayal camp , Kozhikamuthi camp, Nilgiris, Chadivayal elephant camp, Mudumalai, Theppakkadu elephant camp

Title: Solar companies target markets outside Kerala
Content: KOCHI: Genuine solar power companies operating in the state are now looking for opportunities beyond the Kerala market, even to other countries, as part of their attempts to survive in the sector as the whole industry in the state is mired by controversies and cheating cases. While Kochi based Kraftwork Solar Power Ltd is all set to ship two solar fruit dryers to Afghanistan next week, another Kochi company N2N Ecosystem is developing markets in other states like Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Telangana and Jharkhand. The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) is sourcing the fruit dryers to give it to local communities in Afghanistan. " The first container will leave next week and we expect a couple of more orders from the US organization," said K N Iyer, managing director of Kraftwork. According to Sunil Ramakrishnan Nambiar, director, N2N Ecosystem, " the outside Kerala markets are a lot easier to operate in because of the availability of cheaper labour and easy sourcing of components" .
Intersection: Telangana, Afghanistan, Kochi, KOCHI, Kerala, United States, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand
Union: Telangana, Afghanistan, Kochi, KOCHI, Bihar, Kerala, US, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand

Title: NEET topper is already in JIPMER
Content: Even as the NEET controversy raged for over a year in Tamil Nadu, R. Santosh silently plodded with his regular CBSE syllabus of NCERT books. So, when the NEET ranking was released on Wednesday, it came as a little surprise for the family of R. Rengaraj and his wife Vijayalakshmi that their son Santosh had ranked first in Tamil Nadu and 226th in all India level. Santosh had scored 656 marks of the total 720 marks in the NEET. However, Santosh is already in JIPMER, pursuing his MBBS, for over a month now. His parents are both doctors and Santosh, who got 197.5 cut-off marks, is interested in clinical research to aid in medical advancements.

Title: Speed up probe against employees: Govt to secys
Content: NEW DELHI: The government has asked all secretaries and department heads to fast track probe into complaints against employees and complete investigation of pending ones within two months. Sources said a circular issued recently by the cabinet secretariat had also mentioned other steps that all departments must follow including the PM's flagship Swachh Bharat scheme. The departments have been asked to take exemplary action against employees involved in cases where charges are proven so that these act as deterrents for others. Though this should be the general practice, the message coming from top will have its impact, said a top official. He added now even a very small compliant is being taken seriously and these are disposed off quickly so that such cases don t pile up.

Title: MSEDCL trying to justify costly power
Content: NAGPUR: On one hand, the state government is taking efforts to reduce power tariff and on the other MSEDCL authorities are doing their best to make electricity costlier. Maharashtra Electricity Regulatory Commission (MERC) had disallowed power purchase from many units since their power was costly. However, MSEDCL has now filed a review petition seeking to purchase power from these units. The company had recently increased the fuel surcharge sharply, which led to an average increase in power tariff by over 75 paise per unit after considering electricity duty. The power tariff increased sharply because MSEDCL purchased power from costly units, from which MERC had banned power purchase.

Title: Shri Hari Diagems: Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh with owners of Shri Hari Diagems at Ambience Mall in Gurgaon
Content: Vinay Gupta and Anirudh Gupta, owners of Shri Hari Diagems, with the star cast of Bajirao Mastani Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh at Ambience Mall, Gurgaon. Jewellery designed by the brand, which has been used in the movie, is made of 22 24 carat gold in old Mughal style, with diamond polki Burma rubies and Columbian emeralds. They have stores in Green Park and Khan Market.
Union: Shri Hari Diagems, Gurgaon, Green Park, Khan Market, Ambience Mall, Burma

Title: Corporators ask civic body to come clean
Content: AURANGABAD: Corporators cutting across party lines have said that the municipal administration should remove the uncertainty regarding the completion of the water distribution project. The recent step of the civic body to serve a show cause notice on the company has raised concerns over the fate of the ambitious water supply scheme. The worsening water situation in the city has only added to the woes of the residents, who were hoping for some relief after the water distribution project started operations last year. The On the eve of a key general body meeting, the corporators said they would voice their anger over the alleged lacklustre attitude of the municipal authorities over the project. The corporators claimed that the work of the water distribution project was moving at a snail's pace.

Title: Dejected farmer kills self in Ambala
Content: AMBALA: A farmer committed suicide following severe damage to his paddy crop due to heavy rains that lashed Ambala district in last two days bringing life to a grinding halt here. Farmer Balbir Singh, 65, a resident of Machonda village, was found hanging from a tree on Wednesday morning by his family members. " We were discussing about the loss to crops on account of heavy downpour on Tuesday evening. My father, who was deeply upset by crop loss on account of heavy rainfall, moved out of the house telling us that he was going to the fields to take stock of the situation. He returned after some time and went to bed.

Title: Hindi Divas invokes Bacon
Content: RAJKOT: For a day, entire Mount Abu donned the raiment of Hindi. Right from streets to all government establishments, paeans were sung in the name of Hindi. Actually, the Hindi fever commenced at the eve of Hindi Divas. Television channels were fervently dishing out their commitment to the beleaguered national language. All the government and non government congregations eulogizing the national language with unction, only to leave her in oblivion soon after!

Title: BMW hits scooter on CG Road, 2 injured
Content: AHMEDABAD: A speeding car hit a scooter near Swastik crossroads on CG Road early on Friday morning, injuring the two youths riding the vehicle. Navrangpura police have arrested the car driver for rash driving. The two youths have been admitted to VS Hospital for treatment of their injuries. Navrangpura police said Manish Vaghela, 22, a resident of Prem Darwaja in Madhavpura, works with an online delivery firm in the night shift. On Friday, he along with his friend Hitesh Hadiyal, 17, had come to CG Road on his scooter to have early morning snacks and tea.
Union: Prem Darwaja, Madhavpura, Navrangpura, AHMEDABAD, CG Road, Swastik crossroads

Title: Turn compassion into action for children's sake: Satyarthi
Content: HUBBALLI: Emphasizing on collective efforts to tackle trafficking of children and child labour, Nobel Peace laureate Kailash Satyarthi on Saturday asked entrepreneurs to make that leap from compassion to action that betters the lives of children. At the inauguration of Development Dialogue 2015, organized by the Deshpande Foundation here, he stressed on the roles of entrepreneurs in bringing about social transformations. " Each entrepreneur is a changemaker and an innovator, and is brimming with creativity. But when it comes to connecting with others, we forget compassion. Your compassion is only confined to your biological children.

Title: Complete investigation in garrison death, HC tells Telangana govts
Content: HYDERABAD: The high court on Monday directed the Telangana government to complete the investigation into the suspicious killing of 11 year old boy in garrison area near Mehdipatnam, within four weeks. The bench was dealing with a writ petition filed by Ghulam Rabbani. He sought a direction to the government to hand over the case to CBI. It may be recalled that on October 8 last year, Shaik Mustafauddin, resident of Siddique Nagar near Mehdipatnam, succumbed to burn injuries. The bench said that the case needs expeditious investigation.
Union: Telangana, Mehdipatnam, HYDERABAD, Siddique Nagar, garrison area

Title: Health, education get Gujarat companies' 90 CSR spend
Content: AHMEDABAD: Gujarat based companies choose health and education when it comes to corporate social responsibility (CSR) programmes. These two sectors account for around 90 of the amount spent on CSR. In fiscal 2014 15, health and education topped the list of several Gujarati companies such as Adani Port and SEZ Ltd (APSEZ), Cadila Healthcare, Torrent Power, Cera Sanitaryware Ltd and Atul Ltd. " Following their global peers, all Indian companies, not just Gujarat based companies, mainly take up CSR activities in health, education, infrastructure and livelihood," said Sunil Parekh, advisor to Zydus Cadila Group. Of the total Rs 761 crore for CSR in 2014-15, Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) spent Rs 608 crore on healthcare, the company said in its annual report for 2014-15. As per the Companies Act, 2013 all companies are required to spend at least 2 of the average net profits on CSR fiscal 2014-15 was the first year of implementation. "

Title: Aaron: A ton up and only 14
Content: Panaji: Every parent believes their son can match and even better the best in business but the Barretos have evidence to back their claim. Fourteen year old Aaron Barreto has been scoring goals just for fun and when the Varca based parents of the Salgaocar SC junior footballer tallied his goals since 2012, they realized he has already hit a century. Aaron has scored most of his goals while turning up for Loyola High School, where he is a class nine student at the Margao school. At last count he was reported to have scored 77 goals for his school alone in various age group tournaments since he was in the fifth standard and was first spotted by physical education teacher Cajetan Fernandes. Salgaocar Sports Club (22) and Goa (9) has also benefited from his scoring prowess.

Title: 4 accused withdraw anticipatory bail plea
Content: CHANDIGARH: In a crucial development, four accused wanted in the case of laundering of crores of rupees withdrew their anticipatory bail application from a local court in Sector 43 on Saturday. Ajay Singh, Lal Chand, Parveen and Ashok Kanwar had moved the application in the court of district sessions judge S K Aggarwal. The development has strengthened the case of enforcement directorate (ED) that is on the trail of the four suspects for last few months and efforts were speeded up since January 19. Two of the accused have been extensively grilled for ascertaining their links with city based advocate Mukesh Mittal, whose house was searched in Sector 18 on January 19. Meanwhile, over hundreds of blank cheques undersigned by Ajay Singh and Lal Chand were recovered from the house of Mittal.

Title: Govt flayed for sugar mill closure
Content: BHUBANESWAR: Treasury bench on Wednesday turned the heat on government for not taking any action against defaulting Badamba sugar mill (also known as Laxmipathi Balaji Sugar and Distilleries Private Limited) in Cuttack district. Raising the issue during question hour, Athagarh MLA Ranendra Pratap Swain (BJD) said, " It is strange that the state government has taken no action against the company although it has violated the agreement signed with the state government. " In 2005, the state government handed over the plant to Laxmipathi Balaji Sugar and Distilleries Private Limited. According to the agreement signed between the state government and the company, the latter was asked to give Rs 8 crore within a year, official sources said. Since the company did not pay the amount within the stipulated time, the government issued show cause notice to it.

Title: GU invites proposals for research project
Content: Panaji: The centre for the studies of developing societies, New Delhi, and Goa University's political science department, in a new project, plan to capture the conflicts over the resources in Goa . A group of three to four chosen researchers will be formed to study the conflict over either the natural or cultural resources of Goa or both. The project, spanning over six months, will capture the conflict through any form of media print, audio recordings, video recordings or performances. During the course of their research, the chosen fellows will share their work, on a monthly basis, on an online platform, making a final submission at the end of the programme. Each will receive a small grant to meet his or her expenses during the course of the research.

Title: Jolted, people run out of homes, buildings
Content: CHANDIGARH: High intensity tremors were felt in all across Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana and Chandigarh on Monday as a result of a major earthquake in Afghanistan, officials here said. However, no loss of life or damage to property was reported from the region. "Tremors were felt in Punjab, Chandigarh and Haryana, lasting few seconds. So far, no loss of life or property or life has been reported," said an official of the meteorological department. In most towns in the region and Chandigarh, people panicked and came out of their homes and highrises.
Union: Afghanistan, CHANDIGARH, Chandigarh, Haryana, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh

Title: It's kissa kursi ka at RMC for YSRCP, TDP
Content: RAJAHMUNDRY: Rajahmundry Municipal Corporation (RMC) corporators from TDP and YSR Congress Party came to blows on Wednesday at the council hall here over seating arrangements disrupting the meeting for over an hour. In the free for all that ensued, even ruling TDP MLA Gorantla Buchaiah Chowdary and YSRCP MLC Adireddy Appa Rao flexed their muscles. Finally, the personnel on security duty at the council hall were forced to intervene to pacify the frayed tempers and restore order. The spat started when TDP corporators allegedly sat in chairs which were occupied by YSRCP corporators over the past few meetings. YSRCP corporators objected to this, resulting in heated arguments between representatives of both the parties that soon enough turned into physical bout.

Title: Immunization can save 1.5m kids per year in India
Content: Nagpur: Around 1. 5 million children's lives can be saved every year with the help of proper immunization. India alone accounts for 21 of vaccine preventable deaths among children below five years of age, totaling to 1.3 million kids a year. World Health Organization (WHO) has called for renewed efforts to reach all the missed children and close the immunization gap in the world during the world immunization week that ends on Thursday. In India, too, the government, paediatricians as well as private companies have made pledges to do the same through various means. Only four months ago, the union government launched Mission Indradhanush under which all children in the country are to immunized against seven most common vaccine preventable diseases "diphtheria, whooping cough, tetanus, polio, tuberculosis, measles and hepatitis B" by 2020.

Title: Central grants for Assam reducing
Content: GUWAHATI: Even as chief minister Tarun Gogoi expressed uncertainty over flow of central resources, the grants in aid from the Centre in 2013-14 was already 4.57 lower than that in the previous financial year. According to the CAG report, the grants in aid to the state was Rs 6,805 crore in 2009-10, which was reduced to Rs 6,733 crore in 2010 11, but was raised by 13.87 in 2011-12. It was further increased by 22.16% to reach Rs 9,366 crore in 2012-13. The grants-in-aid came down to Rs 8,938 crore in 2013-14. The grants-in-aid includes plan and non-plan grants.

Title: Death at Mecca mars Eid celebrations
Content: LUCKNOW: This year's Eid ul Zuha celebrations were special for Mohd Junaid because his father was on haj, the first in his family to do so. However, the happiness didn't last long as Junaid got a call on Friday morning that 67 year old Mohd Ahmed had succumbed to his injuries following the stampede. The feeling agony was clearly evident on the faces of the family members, as they were yet to come to terms with the loss of their friend, philosopher and guide, who has been guiding the younger members of the family over the past couple of decades. I along with other members of the family are still missing him, though he is yet to figure in the official list of those dead in the tragedy, said Junaid, and added that as the family was gearing up to celebrate the festival, the sad news arrived. Junaid also mentioned that for the next couple of hours, he was virtually speechless and only after gaining some composure narrated the developments to his mother and other family members, who virtually slipped into mourning, and all the festivities planned for the day were suspended.

Title: Navratra begins with a crimson flourish
Content: MUMBAI: The largest annual dedication to Goddess Shakti began with the onset of Sharadiya Navratra on Tuesday. A steady stream of worshippers prayed to Goddess Durga, beginning with the morning's ghatsthapna ceremony, where an oil lamp is placed inside a clay pot bearing holes, for the evening aarti and late night darshan. The Ambadevi shrine at Jamboree Maidan in Worli performed ghatsthapna at 8 am. Temple trustee Ramchandra Parab said, Navratri is held in honour of the Mother Goddess, so it evokes overwhelming fervour among women. Scores of female devotees from BDD Chawl and other localities have been offering coconuts, solah shringar (16 items of adornment) and brightly coloured chunris to the goddess.
Union: Jamboree Maidan, Ambadevi shrine, MUMBAI, Worli, BDD Chawl

Title: Interactive session to create awareness on IoT held
Content: INDORE: Aiming to spread awareness about IoT (internet of things) among internet users, an interactive session was held on Sunday. The event was held to give distinct businesses a chance to connect and explore the applications of IoT in various fields like logistics, e commerce, finance/banking, digital marketing, hospital, IT, real estate and many other sectors. Organized for experts and business intellects with the motive of bringing up the concept of IoT on a single platform for mutual benefit, session was headed by director, Walkover Web Solutions, Pushpendra Agrawal. Machines that communicate with one another have always existed. World has already seen M2M (machine to machine) communications in past.

Title: Four killed, two hurt as car hits two wheelers in Ajmer
Content: AJMER: Four persons died and two others were injured severely in an accident near Bijaynagar town of the district, about 70 km from Ajmer, here on Wednesday evening. The incident occurred when a car coming from Bhilwara hit a motorcycle and a scooter on road side. Police have registered a case and investigating it. According to police, the car was coming from Bhilwara. It hit a motorcycle and a scooter near footpath.

Title: Rs 1 lakh stolen from Mumbai BJP leader
Content: AHMEDABAD: General secretary of the BJP's industries cell in Mumbai, Jaymuni Dave, 62, was robbed of demonetized currency worth Rs 1 lakh in denomination of Rs 1,000 by four persons including an auto driver whose vehicle he had hired to go from Bapunagar to Rabari Colony on December 22. Cops have nabbed the four accused and have recovered the cash from them. Dave, a resident of Dahisar in Mumbai, has mentioned in his complaint that the money was to be deposited in the bank account of his mother, Dhirja Dave, who runs an old age home in Rajkot under the banner of Matruchhaya Charitable Trust. Inspector Paresh Solanki of Ramol police station said: According to the complainant the money was for the treatment of his mother who is undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Rajkot. According to the complaint, Dave had boarded a bus to Ahmedabad on December 21 and alighted at Bapunagar the next day.
Intersection: Bapunagar, Dahisar, AHMEDABAD, Ramol police station, Rajkot, Mumbai
Union: Bapunagar, Dahisar, AHMEDABAD, Ramol, Rabari Colony, Ahmedabad, Rajkot, Mumbai

Title: With 5 days to go, Attukal misses basics
Content: Thiruvananthapuram: With the ruling council and opposition ending the special council in a tussle, works related to the Attukal Devi Temple Festival continue to drag on. The streets around Iranimuttom near the Government Homeopathic College still remain in the dark with just five days left for the pongala ritual. Works are progressing steadily and will be completed in two to three days, said Beena R C, ward councillor, Attukal. Vattavila area near the temple has been experiencing acute water shortage for the past two years with water supply restricted to 1-2am. Though residents in the area are accustomed to the situation, the festive season here witnesses a surge in water consumption.
Union: Attukal, Attukal Devi Temple, Vattavila, Thiruvananthapuram, Iranimuttom

Title: Teenager knocked down by cow, dies
Content: VADODARA: Stray cows menace claimed yet another life in the city when a young boy died after being knocked down by a bovine in Mehsananagar. Siddharth Patel, who lives in the same locality, was returning home after getting milk from the dairy on Friday. As he tried to negotiate a herd of stray cattle on the Canal Road, one of the cows knocked him down from the scooter. Patel suffered serious head injuries and was taken to a nearby hospital by the bystanders. Patel succumbed on Tuesday.

Title: Protest: Chandigarh Manali highway blocked for 4 hrs
Content: SHIMLA: Daily commuters and tourists heading for Manali remained stranded for four hours on Wednesday as local residents blocked Chandigarh Manali national highway at Dhanotu chowk in Sundernagar near Mandi, agitated over the death of a local youth. Traffic was restored after deputy commissioner assured strict action against those found involved in the crime. Thousands of vehicles were lined up on both sides of blocked point. Protestors were demanding action against those involved in the crime. They said that after killing Joginder Kumar, the accused are roaming freely while administration and police has failed to arrest them.
Union: Chandigarh, Mandi, SHIMLA, Sundernagar, Manali, Dhanotu chowk

Title: Cops still clueless in recent shootout cases
Content: NAGPUR: Even after a week, crime branch and Tehsil police have failed to make any headway in the murder of Eknath Nimgade, who was shot dead on September 6. Though the cops have quizzed suspects Anil Nair, Umesh Gupta and Maqsood Ali Siddique, no one has been arrested yet. There were, however, rumours about cops arresting main suspect Siddique, who was under sustained interrogation. A former valuer, who was associated with Nimgade, was also questioned, said DCP Ranjankumar Sharma, adding the investigators are working on different angles to crack the case. Even as the investigators were clueless in the Nimgade case, another incident in which Mohd Yaseen Qureshi was shot at with countrymade pistol from close distance in Omkar Nagar on Monday has posed a challenge for the police.

Title: Margao cops arrest chain snatcher
Content: Margao: Salim Ansari, one of two motorcycle borne accused who were attempting to snatch a gold chain from a woman at Vidyanagar, Gogol, earlier this week, was caught by an alert passer by and handed over to the police. Police sources said that while one of the accused fled, the other was nabbed by members of the public. Ansari, placed under arrest by the Margao town police, is believed to be a member of the infamous Irani gang of chain snatchers.

Title: Gudalur MLA seeks Jaya's help to resume e-services in taluks
Content: Udhagamandalam: The Gudalur MLA, M Thiravidamani, on Wednesday wrote to the state chief minister, J Jayalalithaa, and the chief secretary P Rama Mohana Rao seeking their intervention to resume the suspended E services in Gudalur and Pandalur taluks in the Nilgiris.
