According to him, e services pertaining to chitta, adangal (transfer of land ownership documents in the revenue department) and community certificate have been suspended in these two taluks a month ago. In his letter addressed to CM, the DMK man stated that E services, including community certificate, chitta and adangal have been suspended a month ago in Gudalur and Pandalur taluks causing inconvenience to the public. He has sought her to fix the issue to facilitate public. He further pointed out that the government has yet to address the issues of Janmam lands in both the taluks and the lands falling under Tamil Nadu Preservation of Private Forest Act.
Union: Gudalur, Pandalur, Tamil Nadu, Udhagamandalam, Nilgiris

Title: On foundation day, DMRC renews demand for fare hike
Content: New Delhi: Delhi Metro's celebration of its foundation day came with a request for a fare hike. On Tuesday, Mangu Singh, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) chief, made yet another reference to a fare revision for Metro services as he pointed towards the increase in the costs of operation, which are not getting reflected in the fare. The Delhi Metro fares were last revised in 2009. DMRC has been asking for a fare hike for several years now, especially after costs of electricity which is a major component of the operational costs, have gone up in the past few years. However, the fare revision can only be effected on the recommendations of a committee on fare revision, set up by the ministry of urban development.

Title: Make campaigns effective by cooperating with police
Content: Lucknow: Dubbed a rabble rouser by the Opposition, former top cop of UP police and once known to be close confidante of BSP chief Mayawati, Brijlal was roped in by RSS backed BajrangDal to teach its activists how not to take law into their hands and help in nation building lawfully. The retired IPS officer, who joined BJP in January, 2015, was in Ayodhya on Saturday for a one hour lecture on Police work and law and order at Karsevakpuram, the Vishwa Hindu Parishad hub of activities during Ram temple movement in the early 1990s. Brijlal was roped in for a lecture during the 7 day training programme of Bajrang Dal activists from Awadh prant at Ayodhya. After joining BJP to be its Dalit face and entrusted with the job to woo the backward classes, Brijlal told TOI he had gone to lecture them on how police work and how members of the party can work effectively for success of their campaigns such as against illegal cow slaughter by cooperating on the law and order front rather than taking law into their hands. His lecture also focused on effective policing with examples of how police and public cooperation helped maintain peace in the state after the most awaited high court judgment on Ayodhya title suit on September 30, 2010.
Union: Awadh, Lucknow, Ayodhya, Karsevakpuram, UP, Ram temple

Title: Illicit liquor worth Rs 1. 12 lakh seized
Content: AURANGABAD: The state excise department on Thursday seized car carrying duplicate foreign liquor worth Rs 1. 12 lakh that was being smuggled to the city. Officials said two people have also been arrested for their alleged involvement in manufacturing duplicate foreign liquor. The accused have been identified as Appasaheb Pimphale, who claims to be a journalist, and Babasaheb Gavhane. The officials received a tip-off that the duo was driving a car and heading towards the city via Aurangabad-Mumbai highway. Acting on the information, officials of the state excise department laid a trap and tried to stop the suspects. However, the duo managed to give them a slip. After a brief chase, the duo was nabbed and five boxes of duplicate foreign liquor and 20 liquor bottles worth Rs 1.12 lakhs were seized from them.

Title: Central Jail: Telephone facility for Central Jail inmates hits post paid hurdle
Content: AGRA: The effectiveness of the public call office (PCO) facility at the Central Jail here has been hampered due to non availability of post paid connections with the family members of the inmates. According to the rules and regulations governing calls from jails, inmates can only call post paid numbers or landline numbers to talk to their family members from the prison. According to jail officials, the inmates' family members mostly have pre paid connections, due to which most inmates can't use the PCO service. " Some inmates have given post paid numbers for verification, and these numbers are being verified. The norms for calling from jail will be followed and no compromise will be made on security and safety," said Central Jail superintendent S H M Rizvi, talking to TOI.

Title: Sangeeta Nataka Akademi Award: Meet Telangana's first Sangeeta Nataka Akademi award winner
Content: 3,000 shows, a 100 countries and 40 years mdash that is what it took for Kuchipudi danseuse Padmaja Reddy to become the first dancer from Telangana to win the Sangeeta Nataka Akademi Award, the highest award given by the Indian government to practicing artistes. All set to recieve the award from President Pranab Mukherjee on October 4 at Rashtrapati Bhavan, the 48 year old dancer says "it's a dream come true". Sharing her joy on receiving this award, even as she reflects on the journey so far, Padmaja, who started dancing at the age of five, says, "I come from a Reddy business family that has absolutely no association with the arts. I lived in a village called Pamarru, which is about 15 kilometres from Kuchipudi village. During my school days, my day would start at seven in the morning."

Title: H1N1 threat looms large, health dept on tenterhooks
Content: INDORE: After 13 swine flu deaths in the city over the last seven months, the health department is on tenterhooks, apprehending that tackling H1N1 onslaught in the next couple of months may get tough. In view of last year H1N1 attack and prevailing erratic weather conditions, the health department officials are expecting that virus will turn more active by January end. In charge, integrated disease surveillance programme (IDSP), Dr GL Sodhi, said, Virus is still active, but not in a major way. In coming months, it is likely to become more active. Last year too, virus had claimed lives in January and February.

Title: Rs 2L reward on Tanzil's murderer
Content: Lucknow: Unable to lay their hands on Muneer the prime accused in National Investigating Agency (NIA) officer Tanzil Ahmed in Bijnore on April 2 police have increased the cash reward on his arrest to Rs 2 lakh. The police had earlier announced a reward of Rs 20,000 on any specific information leading to his arrest. Inspector general (IG) Rajeev Ratan said the police have already sent a report to the state government for increase in cash reward on Muneer to Rs 2 lakh. The proposal is with the state home department and expected to be cleared soon, he said. Police have claimed that Muneer was the person who opened fire at Tanzil while the officer was on his way home from a wedding in Sahaspur area of Bijnor district in UP some 125km from the national capital.

Title: Krishnappa will be inducted into cabinet
Content: BENGALURU: Vijayanagar MLA M Krishnappa, a big time land developer, will be inducted into Siddaramaiah's cabinet on Monday. According to Congress sources, Krishnappa's induction comes in the backdrop of pressure being mounted by Vokkaliga leaders to increase representation to the community in the government. " With two Vokkaliga ministers MH Ambareesh and Kimmane Ratnakar having been dropped from the cabinet during the reshuffle in June, there was hectic lobbying among Vokkaliga MLAs for these berths. Though Krishnappa was one of the frontrunners and was favoured by the chief minister during the previous cabinet expansion, his name was dropped at the last minute because of infighting among the community MLAs. Since then, the CM had kept one ministerial berth vacant," sources said.

Title: 3 Haryana Civil Services officers in dock over minister's trust land issue
Content: CHANDIGARH: Three Haryana Civil Services (HCS) officers, who had served as land acquisition collectors in Rohtak in 2005, may be in the dock for negligently acquiring the land belonging to a school run by the family trust of Haryana cabinet minister Captain Abhimanyu in Rohtak. These officers include Rajesh Jogpal, Ram Nath (now retired) and Sanjay Rai. The state government has initiated disciplinary action proceedings against them and to recover Rs 2. 5 lakh cost imposed by the Punjab and Haryana high court on the state government for acting negligently in land acquisition. Information regarding the role of these officers and action contemplated against them by the state was provided by Haryana chief secretary D S Dhesi on Monday before the high court.

Title: Govt plans mini fests
Content: BENGALURU: In order to take good cinema to a larger audience, the state government is considering holding mini film festivals across districts. The idea is to showcase a bunch of content films in Kannada and other languages in smaller towns. There has been a demand for similar fests from places like Gulbarga, Hubli, Dharwad and Mangaluru," said SV Rajendra Singh Babu, festival director and chairman of Karnataka Chalanachitra Academy. Asked if Biffes could be held during a specific time of the year so as to draw more crowds from India and abroad, Babu said formation of a directorate of film festival' could help streamline things. The CM has given in principle approval for the establishment of such a directorate.
Intersection: BENGALURU, Mangaluru, Gulbarga, Karnataka, Hubli Dharwad
Union: BENGALURU, Mangaluru, Gulbarga, Karnataka, Hubli, Dharwad, India

Title: After five year break, government to relaunch School Wiki project
Content: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: After a gap of five years, IT School project is all set to revive School Wiki project that was put into cold storage by the UDF government. Introduced during the former LDF government regime, School Wiki on the lines of Wikipedia aims to foster a culture of collaborative content deployment in 15,000 schools from Class I to Class XII in the state. The revamped School Wiki would be ready by November 1, on Kerala Piravi, in http:www.schoolwiki.in portal. Made completely in Malayalam, School Wiki features a unique content collection jointly undertaken by students, teachers, alumni, and public. By logging into School Wiki, all schools would be able to key-in and update all their basic elementary details as well as their historical references. Schools can also upload details such as their infrastructure data, renowned alumni, school websites, school map, blogs, various clubs and forums, class magazines, supporting images and videos in School Wiki.

Title: Fishermen urge govt to see the light
Content: Panaji/Margao: Nearly 600 canoes and fishing boats blocked the River Mandovi channel at Panaji and the Cutbona jetty at Betul, on Wednesday, in protest of the government's failure to impose a ban on the use of light emitting diodes (LED) while fishing. The state's traditional fishermen claim to have been struggling for decent catches since the introduction of 'unnatural' fishing techniques. Those residing in communities between Pernem and Cansaulim anchored their boats in River Mandovi, while others followed suit in Cutbona. Over 100 boat owners and several other stakeholders gathered before the office of the state fisheries department in Panaji, demanding the resignation of fisheries director Shamila Monteiro, for her failure to act quickly. " When 90 of Goa's fishermen have been opposing these methods of unnatural fishing, why is the department of fisheries taking so much time to act?"
Union: Margao, Betul, Panaji, Goa, Cutbona jetty, Cutbona, Pernem, Cansaulim, River Mandovi

Title: 4 Mumbai students in Turkey for sports meet are safe, kin relieved
Content: MUMBAI: Parents and schools of four city students, who are among nine from the state participating in the World School Sports Meet in Turkey, were relieved to find out that they were safe amidst the violence. Among them is Roslin Lewis, a class XI student of Father Agnel School, Vashi, who got in touch with her parents at 1 pm on Saturday. We tried to touch base as soon as we heard about the unrest in Turkey. Finally, we could get through an internet call and got to know that the team is safe. It was such a relief," said her father, Ruben Lewis.

Title: Farmer turns cane field a pyre, kills self
Content: MYSURU/ KALABURAGI: While a debt ridden sugarcane farmer immolated himself by sitting in his field and setting the standing crop afire at Ganada Hosuru village in Pandavapura taluk, Mandya district on Thursday, another farmer tried to commit suicide while protesting in front of the Bhusnur sugar factory at Aland in Kalaburagi. Ningegowda, a 60 year old physically challenged farmer who grew sugarcane on his 20 gunta plot, had borrowed Rs 1. 6 lakh from moneylenders. They had been harassing him for not repaying the money. This is the second such suicide in Mandya district. Earlier, Rajendra from Chinnenahalli village of Srirangapatna hanged himself from a tree.
Intersection: Chinnenahalli, KALABURAGI, Mandya, Ganada Hosuru, Srirangapatna, Kalaburagi, MYSURU
Union: Chinnenahalli, KALABURAGI, Mandya, Ganada Hosuru, Pandavapura, Srirangapatna, Kalaburagi, Pandavapura, Aland, MYSURU, Bhusnur

Title: Roads take a hit as river recedes
Content: Kolhapur: The incessant showers in the district have taken a toll on the roads in the district. The tar road near Ambevadi village on Kolhapur Ratnagiri national highway has weakened as its base and soil along the edges has become loose after being submerged in Panchganga waters for days. Also, the section of the road approaching major tourist destination of Panhala has caved in, but the public works department officials could not mend it because of the heavy showers. A senior officer from Kolhapur unit of public works department confirmed that there have been many phone calls complaining about the road conditions and demanding immediate action. " Compared to other road developments, the complaints of cave ins are serious because it is about the soil and its texture on which we have built the road.
Union: Panhala, Kolhapur Ratnagiri national highway, Kolhapur, Ambevadi, Panchganga, Ratnagiri

Title: Councillor accuses Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation of scam in buying solar lights
Content: Ghaziabad: Close on the heels of a ustbin scam', GMC is facing allegations of embezzlement in procuring solar lights. A councillor has accused the Ghaziabad civic body of buying solar lights to be installed in 100 locations across the city at an inflated price of Rs 42, 217 apiece while the market price is Rs 25,000. Kavi Nagar councillor Himanshu Mittal, who blew the lid off the alleged scam, has accused municipal commissioner Abdul Samad of clandestinely entering into a deal with a Meerut based company to procure 100 solar lights at a cost Rs 17,217 more than the market price around nine months ago. Subsequently, councillors demanded an inquiry into the allegation. Narrating the sequence of events leading up to his blowing the whistle on the alleged scam, Mittal said when he noticed that the solar lights installed in Kavi Nagar were not up to the mark, he had enquired about the price and was told that each piece cost Rs 42,217. "

Title: cash Crunch: Syndicate bank clerk in judicial custody
Content: HYDERABAD: The Saroornagar police on Tuesday arrested Syndicate Bank clerk Mallesh for illegally exchanging Rs 6 lakh demonetised cash at the bank's Kamala Nagar branch. Mallesh claimed he withdrew the cash for his niece's wedding. To avoid paying income tax, he exchanged the demonetised currency without furnishing any ID proof, Saroornagar inspector S Lingaiah said. Police arrested Mallesh and remanded him in judicial custody. Police, however, have not arrested the cashier, Radhika, who helped Mallesh in exchanging the currency.

Title: Tamil Nadu ICSE topper gives all the credit to her mother
Content: Coimbatore: Kailaeshwari N could not have been happier to have opted for the ICSE board when she learned that she had topped the board exam for Class 10 in Tamil Nadu this year. A student of Stanes School, Kailaeshwari had switched from the Samacheer Kalvi syllabus, which is the Tamil Nadu state board syllabus, to ICSE in Class 7. " I was not challenged by the state syllabus. I found that it did not cover many essential topics when compared to the ICSE syllabus. So I decided to switch to ICSE in Class 7," she said.

Title: After Modi meet, BJP ups anti BJD rhetoric
Content: Bhubaneswar: The BJP is scheduled to hold its two day state executive meeting at Sundargarh on June 18 and 19 against the backdrop of rising people's perception that conscious efforts are being made by the saffron party to shed its image of being soft towards its estranged ally, the BJD. In the Sundargarh meeting, the party would chalk out strategies for the impending panchayat elections. Earlier this week, the BJP announced to establish 'shakti kendras' in every panchayat. " These would act as the party's nodal points to reach out to the people and spread the success stories of Narendra Modi led government at the Centre," BJP leader Bhrugu Baxipatra said. After Modi's Balasore rally on June 2, the saffron party has suddenly upped its crusade against the Naveen Patnaik government. "

Title: Four held for murder of Shirur councillor
Content: Pune: The Pune crime branch arrested four persons around 4.30am on Monday, a day after the former vice president and member of Shirur Municipal Council, Mahendra Hiraman Mallav, was murdered. The suspects Pravin Prakash Kale (23), Vishal Sunil Kale (21), Sunny Sanjay Yadav (19) and Rupesh Hemant Luniya (19) all from Shirur were taken into custody at a truck terminus in Moshi, based on a tip received by assistant inspector Ansar Shaikh of the crime branch. The assailants, after hacking 47 year old Mallav to death, abandoned their two motorbikes as they ran out of fuel on Shikrapur Talegaon Damdhere Road. They boarded a truck from Chakan and reached the truck terminus. They were on their way to visit a person in Chinchwad as they were running short of money when they were nabbed.
Union: Pune, Damdhere, Shirur, Shikrapur, Moshi, Chinchwad, Shikrapur Talegaon Damdhere Road, Talegaon, Chakan

Title: 'Modi uses Twitter to bypass media'
Content: Washington: Thoughtful construction of messages on Twitter has helped PM Narendra Modi build a powerful online brand, allowing him to overcome a " problematic past" and emerge as a techno savvy global leader who speaks directly to his electorate, according to a new University of Michigan study that has analysed some 6000 Modi tweets over a five year period. The study says unlike in the US, where the head of government is expected to routinely show up at a news conference, Modi has circumvented the mainstream media by using social media, allowing him to control his message by creating positive, non controversial tweets. It cites Modi's most popular tweet " India has won" , posted on May 16, 2014 when his party was victorious in the general elections as one of the best examples of a well crafted tweet. It remains the most retweeted message in the history of Twitter in India, according to the study. " If you want to listen to Modi, please go to his social media feed.

Title: Rough ride for women behind wheels
Content: KOLKATA: It's been 12 years since actress Ushasie Chakraborty started driving across the streets of Kolkata. But if she is to be believed, society is still heavily biased against women drivers. From sledging to complete disregard of skills - women drivers in Kolkata have to face it all. The problem has been so acute that Chakraborty's MPhil paper at Jadavpur University was based on this issue of gender bias and drivers. "I had interviewed auto drivers for this paper and asked them should women drive autos, in an age when they are flying planes."

Title: Rape victim succumbs to injuries, JAC submits memorandum to CM
Content: Imphal: The minor victim who was raped by a juvenile on February 15 last in Chiningkhul village, today succumbed to her injuries at RIMS hospital, the police said. A Joint Action Committee (JAC) was formed soon after the news of the death spread, which later on submitted a memorandum to the Chief Minister's office. The JAC demanded the accused 14 year old boy who was earlier produced before the juvenile court be treated as an adult and punished as per law, Panti Golmei, secretary of the JAC, said. On February 15 the victim was found shivering after a massive manhunt at Chiningkhul village with injury marks and was admitted to District Hospital, Bishnupur, but was later shifted to RIMS.

Title: Police, banks to ensure ATM safety
Content: KOCHI: City police have issued alerts to all banks in the wake of the hi tech ATM theft that took place in Thiruvananthapuram. Officials here said that the theft in the capital was a serious case that was being reviewed by the department and adequate measures have been taken to prevent such incidents in Kochi. As per police estimates, there are nearly 500 ATMs within city limits. Special branch ACP Babu Kumar KG said that police have directed all banks in Kochi to review surveillance facilities and strengthen them further. " Following the theft in Thiruvananthapuram, the city police on Tuesday directed all police stations in the city to check the security of ATMs functioning within their respective limits.

Title: Cuttack Khannagar Durga Puja 2016 Indian Army at Tiger Hill
Content: The Khannagar durga puja committee in Cuttack paid tribute to the Indian soldiers by showcasing their difficult life at Tiger Hill and Siachen posts at its pandal. Atleast 50 artisans worked to create a replica on the welcome arch, which is 60 ft high and 40 ft wide and cost Rs 10 lakh. The replica was made from plaster of paris and held up by a structure of bamboo. At one end of the arch Siachen is recreated while at the other end the Tiger Hill post is replicated. The durga puja committee has also installed 14 fiber statues of soldiers, even fibre replicas of jeep and war tanks used by the Army and these statues installed on the welcome arch.

Title: Crime Branch takes over ASI death case
Content: Two days after an Assistant Sub Inspector was found dead inside South Rohini police station, the investigation of the case was transferred to Crime Branch on Saturday. Calls for high level probe Around 9.30 a.m. , the body of ASI Ramesh Singh, native of Bihar and resident of Narela, was brought to his house by the officers. However, the family got agitated when they enquired about the investigation and was told by the officers that it appears to be a suicide. Outraged and demanding high level probe, several family members and neighbours went to Sector A5 junction to stage a protest. We have also submitted a complaint with the senior officers demanding investigation by the Central Bureau of Investigation because we believe the Delhi Police will prove it the death to be a suicide, alleged Pradeep Kumar, 43, Singh brother in law.
Union: Narela, Bihar, South Rohini, Sector A5

Title: Businessman arrested on charge of attempt to murder
Content: Tiptop Basheer, a businessman from Sagar city, was arrested on Tuesday on the charge of hiring hitmen to kill Munavar, a member of the management committee of Jamia Masjid in Shivamogga city. The arrested is involved in hotel and real estate businesses in Shivamogga and Sagar cities and is said to have had a personal and business rivalry with Munavar. According to the police, Basheer had requested Sadiq, a resident of M.K.K. Road, who was arrested in October last year under The Karnataka Prevention of Dangerous Activities of Bootleggers, Drug Offenders, Gamblers, Goondas, Immoral Traffic Offenders and Slum Grabbers Act, 1985, to kill Munavar and had promised to pay him 10 lakh. After getting the money, Sadiq assigned the job to Bombay Saleem, a rowdy from Bengaluru, and promised to pay him 5 lakh for the job.
Union: Sagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, Shivamogga, Bombay, M.K.K. Road

Title: Ramanathapuram district stands third in State
Content: After making a stunning performance, securing the State second rank in overall pass percentage in plus two examinations, this backward district hogged the limelight again winning the third rank in class X examinations, results of which were announced on Friday. The district, disregarded as communally sensitive, has never been in the race for State level rankings when it sprang a surprise last week, securing the second rank in the State in plus two examinations with an overall pass percentage of 96.77. In a repeat performance in class X examinations, the district won the third rank in the State, with overall pass percentage of 98.16 and missed the second rank by a whisker. The district, which improved the pass percentage by 1.06 compared to last year and moved ahead from the fourth rank, missed the second rank this year by just 0.01 . Of the total number of 17,979 students, including 9,165 girls who appeared for the examination, 17,648 came out with flying colours.

Title: Fearing backlash, Maharashtra rolls back power cuts
Content: Mumbai: Fearing a backlash from consumers over prolonged power outages, the State government has announced withdrawal of load shedding from several zones, including affected areas in Mumbai. However, Opposition parties and activists were quick to lash out at the announcement on Friday, calling it an attempt to gloss over the state failure to manage the demand supply gap. Senior state officials conceded that the power situation is unlikely to improve until December in the absence of sustained supply of coal. The overall shortage is to the tune of 2,000 to 3000 megawatt every day and the situation is likely to persist, they said. On Friday, the government claimed that power cut schedules were being rolled back for several A and B zone areas, including Mulund and Bhandup in Mumbai and parts of Pune, Nagpur and Nashik.
Union: Maharashtra, Mulund, Bhandup, Nashik, Mumbai, Pune, Nagpur

Title: CIAL to help develop inland waterways
Content: The State government plans to complete the work on its inland waterways with the help of Cochin International Airport Limited (CIAL). The project is expected to be completed by 2020, said Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan at the 23rd annual general meeting of CIAL here on Monday. The Chief Minister is also the chairman of CIAL. The State government and CIAL will float a joint venture company for the Kovalam Kasaragod inland waterways project. Forty nine per cent each of the stakes in the company will be held by CIAL and the State government.

Title: Ganta's apology soughton library land issue
Content: Human Resource Development Minister Ganta Srinivasa Rao should tender an apology to the citizens of Visakhapatnam for his involvement in the District Central Library land issue, said former Union Energy Secretary E.A.S. Sarma, here on Sunday. Supporting him, former Vice Chancellor of Andhra University K.V. Ramana, Forum for Development of North Andhra general secretary A. Aja Sarma, former bureaucrat C.S. Rao and Poura Grandhalayala Seva Samiti president B.L.

Title: DCP rubbishes bribe allegations
Content: West Zone Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) A. Venkateswara Rao rubbished allegations made by IAS officer D. Venkareshwara Rao in an interview to a local news channel that some police officials sought bribe to hush up the murder case, in which the civil servant and his son D. Venkat Sukruth were arrested on March 21. B. Nagaraju, Sukruth driver, was murdered by the latter in the intervening night of March 17 and 18 at the terrace of an apartment building, after they went to drink alcohol, the police said. Addressing the media on Wednesday, the DCP said that legal action will be considered against the accused for making allegations. There is absolutely no truth in what is being reported. The IAS officer himself had come along with his son to the apartment at Yousufguda to take away and hide Nagaraju body to conceal evidence, he said.

Title: HC rejects helicopter plea
Content: Bengaluru: The Karnataka High Court on Monday rejected the plea of a 45 year old man, who wanted a direction to the city police to permit him to use a helicopter to shower flower petals on his newly built home during the house warming ceremony. Justice A.S. Bopanna, in his order, said that the petitioner has not stated which of his legal rights was violated by authorities in not considering his request while making it clear that the court cannot interfere in such cases. Petitioner M. Muniraju is a resident of Mullur in Varthur hobli, Bengaluru East taluk. His name was removed from the rowdy sheet about a year ago. He had pointed out that the police had permitted use of a helicopter for showering flowers on a newly built house of another person in the same village last year.
Union: Karnataka, Bengaluru, Varthur, Mullur, Benguluru East

Title: Praise for a centenarian
Content: Senior Metropolitan Philipose Mar Chrysostom of the Malankara Mar Thoma Syrian Church is a torchbearer of compassion and humanity, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has said. Mr. Vijayan message was read out in his absence at a public meeting organised here on Sunday to celebrate the birth centenary of Mar Chrysostom that falls on April 27. Mr. Vijayan said he steered clear of narrow ideas and refused to differentiate people on the basis of their religion or community. Rajya Sabha deputy chairman P.J. Kurien said Mar Chrysostom could be regarded a true secularist.

Title: 2 Lashkar militants killed in Pulwama
Content: Two Lashkar e Taiba (LeT) militants were killed in a gunfight with the security forces in south Kashmir Pulwama district on Thursday. Two civilians died in the clashes near the encounter site. The gunfight erupted at Padgampora village around 5 a.m. when the forces were throwing a cordon around a residential area where two local militants were hiding. The militants fired upon the search party. The fire was retaliated and two militants were killed in an eight hour operation, said a Srinagar based police spokesman.

Title: Dry days in Delhi from Friday evening
Content: In view of elections to the Capital three municipal corporations on April 23, the Delhi government has ordered that dry days will be observed in the city from Friday evening till the polling day. According to the order issued by the Delhi Excise Department, all liquor shops and bars will remain closed from 5.30 p.m. on April 21 to 5.30 p.m. on April 23. Dry day on April 26 Clubs serving liquor have been directed to comply with the order. Dry day will also be observed on April 26 when the counting is scheduled to take place.

Title: KAPV medical college gets 48 more PG seats
Content: The Medical Council of India (MCI) has permitted the K.A.P. Viswanatham Government Medical College to offer 48 more Post Graduate seats from 2017 18. With this, the number of PG seats at the college will go up to 65 from 17. Speaking to reporters, Marry Lilly, Dean of the college, said that it had got communication from the MCI and the State government to increase PG seats. It had enabled the college to increase the MS (General Surgery) seats from 4 to 16.

Title: Not a flood situation in Bengal, says Mamata
Content: Due to excessive rain over last 72 hours, the situation in certain districts are grim but not out of control Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Monday. I did a monitoring meeting today we are carefully observing the developments and sent relief to affected areas especially tents and blankets, Ms. Banerjee before leaving for one day trip to Delhi. She will attend the swearing in ceremony of Ram Nath Kovind and expected to meet Congress president Sonia Gandhi. Heavy rain has submerged many parts of the State but it is yet to be a flood situation, the Chief Minister said. There is water in certain low lying areas of Purulia, West Medinipur, Hooghly and Birbhum district, she said.
Intersection: West Medinipur, Delhi, Purulia, Birbhum, Bengal
Union: West Medinipur, Delhi, Purulia, Hooghly, Birbhum, Bengal

Title: Contractors seek payment of dues from government
Content: Alleging that their bills have not been cleared for months, contractors undertaking road and building work demanded that the State government immediately pay their dues. The members of Builders Association of India, Telangana chapter, on Wednesday said that the Telangana government owes 1,000 crore to the contractors. They said that the bills have been pending since four months and various development work would come to a halt if they were not paid their dues immediately. Road contractors affected B. Sugunakar Rao, Telangana State Chairman of the Association, said that the contractors were facing severe hardship which was demoralising them. He said it was mostly the road contractors who were getting affected as those involved in irrigation and other projects were being paid from time to time.

Title: Go for a spin in the sky
Content: It a joyride in the sky that gives a bird eye view of the city like never before. For 3,500, citizens can go for a spin in the sky. Taking off from Necklace Road near Sanjeeviah Park, the chopper makes way across the sky showing the real size of the Hussainsagar lake and as it whirrs away, the city urban landscape unravels warts and all. We are using a 12 seater Bell 412 twin engine helicopter which is rarely used for joyrides. The rides are available in two slots between 10 a.m. and 1 p.m. and again between 2.30 p.m and 5 p.m. We are following Civil Aviation Requirement guidelines and we have local clearances for operating the service for six days, informed Govind Nair of Thumby Aviation, which has brought the ride service to the city.

Title: At this cookery contest, nutrition emerges the winner
Content: A cookery competition held at Malabar House here on Saturday turned out to be unique in many respects. Unlike the usual contests for foodies, the competition organised by the Social Justice Department focused on making dishes with Amrutam Nutrimix, supplied by the Kudumbasree Mission. As many as 16 women selected from nine civic bodies under Malappuram Rural ICDS (Integrated Child Development Services), Malappuram Additional ICDS and Malappuram Urban ICDS took part the competition, organised in connection with National Nutrition Week observance. Using Amrutam Nutrimix powder, they made various dishes such as cake, payasam, porridge, ada, sweet roll, masala roll and noodles. The competition provided not only a platform for the women to showcase their cooking skills, but also an occasion for the Social Justice Department to drive home the nutrient value of Amrutam Nutrimix, said Geetanjali, child development project officer (CDPO) of Malappuram Rural ICDS.

Title: Two Hizb militants killed in Sopore
Content: Two Hizbul Mujahideen militants who were behind a grenade attack on Wednesday were killed in a counter militancy operation in north Kashmir Sopore on Thursday morning.A police spokesman said Aijaz Ahmad Mir and Basharat Ahmad Sheikh, residents of Sopore, were hiding in the house of Khazir Mohammad Mir. The house was cordoned off by a joint party of the police, the Army and the CRPF at around 2:45 a.m. During a search operation, the militants opened fire. Both the militants were killed in retaliatory fire, said the spokesman. Two AK 47 rifles and five magazines were recovered from their possession. The slain militants, according to the police, joined the Hizb in 2016.

Title: Folk artistes rediscovering self esteem in Telangana
Content: Folk artistes in Telangana are rediscovering their footing and role in the society, if one were to believe octogenarian Mothe Yadagiri and his 17 year old grandson Raghu, the eldest and youngest members of the Koyya bommalata or Chekka bommalata wooden string puppetry troupe from Burugupeta in Bhupalpalli Jayashankar district. There is no more the erosion of our self esteem as society seems to be accepting us for what we are, the elder and his 82 year old brother Ramaswamy nodded their heads as Raghu made the observation. The 10 member Mothe family troupe, which was in Adilabad to perform during the Ugadi mitra milan at Kala Ashram, has four youngsters belonging to its third generation who are practising the traditional livelihood and the lone youth from the fourth generation is learning the art of puppetry. This is proof enough to understand that the traditional folk art is on the path of revival after a long gap of about four decades. The Chekka bommalata is a form of puppetry through which the artistes entertained and informed the masses mainly about episodes in epics.
Union: Telangana, Kala Ashram, Adilabad, Burugupeta, Bhupalpalli Jayashankar

Title: TDB to construct new Bhandaram at Sabarimala
Content: The Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB) has decided to construct a new Bhandaram at Sabarimala with modern facilities. TDB president Prayar Gopalakrishnan told The Hindu that the Bhandaram would be set up beneath the Malikappuram flyover. The project had been approved by the High Power Committee (HPC). HPC chief engineer P.S. Jolly Ullas said the work on the new Bhandaram would begin this week.

Title: Nellore 16th in Swachh Bharat rankings
Content: With the active participation of villagers and local leaders, the Swachh Bharat programme has been implemented effectively in all villages and habitations in the Nellore district, which helped it secure the 16th place in the country wide rankings. In the past one year, special measures like awareness drives were taken up in beneficiary villages all over the district to ensure that the people in rural areas make use of the toilets constructed in their houses, to make the programme a success. In order to sustain these awareness programmes, the officials have used a specially designed vehicle with the Swachh Bharat message. It has moved around in the villages where videos were shown to the local residents on the need for avoiding open defecation as this would help promote health and hygiene in their surroundings. Stating that the entire district has been made open defecation free, Collector R. Mutyala Raju has instructed the officials at different levels to take it as their responsibility to keep up the commitment among the villagers and local representatives.

Title: Will behead those against Ram temple
Content: A local BJP MLA has allegedly said that heads of traitors opposing construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya will be chopped off.T. Raja Singh, who represents the Goshamahal constituency in Hyderabad, is heard saying this in a video where he is addressing a gathering as part of Ram Navmi celebrations on April 5. The day is not far. . .
Union: Ram Mandir, Ram temple, Ayodhya, Goshamahal, Hyderabad

Title: Milma to establish five marketing hubs
Content: The Thiruvananthapuram Regional Cooperative Milk Producers Union (TRCMPU), one of the three regional units of Milma in the State, will establish five marketing hubs during the 2017 18 fiscal to strengthen its network and enhance sales. TRCMPU chairman Kallada Ramesh said the proposed facilities would be in addition to the first such hub that had commenced functioning at Kandala in Thiruvananthapuram and another one that would soon be operationalised at Mannar in Alappuzha. Among the ongoing activities of the union, a project to the tune of 1 crore was under way to enhance the capabilities of the Pathanamthitta dairy with the goal of stepping up the production of ghee, thereby enabling its export, and that of Milma Lassi that had found much acceptance, Mr. Ramesh said. 816 cr turnoverHe said the union registered a turnover of 816 crore during the last fiscal. An increase of 3 in milk sales was also witnessed.

Title: Targeted by snatchers, woman falls from bike
Content: A 45 year old woman and her two sons fell off a moving bike after they were allegedly targeted by motorcycle borne snatchers in north Delhi on Tuesday afternoon. The woman alleged that the snatchers made off with her purse that had gold items and cash worth nearly 75,000. Gulzar Saifi and her two sons sustained injuries after the accused kicked their motorcycle near Geeta Colony flyover, the police said, adding that Ms. Saifi is out of danger. I was on the way home with my sons Abdullah 24 and Ubedullah 15 when two men on a motorcycle intercepted our bike around 12.15 p.m. The pillion rider kicked the motorcycle and we fell.

Title: CBI convicts five persons
Content: The Additional Special Judge for CBI cases, Chennai, on Wednesday sentenced Captain P. Mishra, Deputy Nautical Advisor of Mercantile Marine Department, and four others to undergo four years rigorous imprisonment. The CBI investigated a case against Mishra, the then Nautical Surveyor, on allegations that he abused his official position and issued watch keeping certificates to four applicants D. Rav, A. Ramalingam, Xavier Anto Kavasini and Justin Prabhakar. He had given it based on forged certificates submitted by them and had taken a bribe of 55,000 through Antony Pitchai, who had also arranged for the false experience certificates. A chargesheet was filed against the accused. The court convicted all the five.

Title: Congress confident of crossing 60 mark
Content: Even as the exit polls further confused the voters with wide variations in their projections and with independents likely to play a key role, the Congress party is already on the job to establish contact with the likely winners. In fact, independents who are projected to win are mostly from the Congress rebels, who contested after being denied the ticket. The party is making all efforts to keep them in good humour and leaders close to them have already got in touch with them. Despite the exit polls of national news channels showing either clear majority or an edge for the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samiti (TRS), the Congress party is confident of winning 60 seats on its own. Our feedback suggests that we will win 60 seats while our ally will get around 6 to 7 seats.

Title: U.P. sugar mills owe 6,500 crore to farmers
Content: The sugarcane farmers of Uttar Pradesh are yet to receive 6,499.22 crore arrears from sugar mills in the current crushing season. Private and corporate owned mills top the list of companies that are yet to pay farmers the full price. According to the Uttar Pradesh Sugar Mills Association (UPSMA), farmers sold cane worth 22,880 crore to sugar mills and received 16,380.78 crore till March 16. Overall, mill owners have managed to pay about 71.59 of the total money they owe to farmers.

Title: SCR proposes to build 100 RuBs/RoBs
Content: SCR was awaiting the consent of the State government for constructing 100 Road Under Bridges (RUBs) and Road Over Bridges (ROBs) as part of the overall safety plan at all level crossings. Steps have been initiated to establish the wagon workshop at Kazipet, SCR General Manager Vinod Kumar Yadav informed MPs on Wednesday. At a meeting held in Rail Nilayam, he said new railway line projects between Karimnagar Nizamabad, Jaggayyapet Mellacheruvu Janpahad, Devarakadra Jacklair, Bidar Gulbarga have been completed. MMTS Phase II project would be completed by the end of 2018 while the Cherlapalli, Lingampalli and Nagalapalli railway stations would be developed as terminal stations to decongest the existing stations. Some 20 MPs from Telangana, Maharashtra and Karnataka attended the meeting along with top railway officials.
Union: Maharashtra, Karimnagar, Nizamabad, Telangana, Bidar, Gulbarga, Kazipet, Lingampalli, Cherlapalli, Devarakadra, Jacklair, Karnataka, Rail Nilayam, Nagalapalli, Jaggayyapet, Mellacheruvu, Janpahad

Title: CM presides over meeting on final budget modalities
Content: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday presided over yet another meeting at the Delhi Secretariat related to final modalities pertaining to this year budget. Sources said the meeting was chaired in his office and commenced a little after 4 p.m. They added that it went on for an hour and a half, just like the meetings Mr. Kejriwal has been presiding over since the beginning of the month. The actual content of the meeting is strictly confidential. However, suffice it to say, the meeting revolved around firming up last minute formalities related to the budget for the following fiscal, said a senior government official.

Title: Week
Content: The Sumanasa Kodavoor organisation will organise a drama festival at the open air theatre at Bhujanga Park here from February 11 to 17. The fest will be held with the cooperation of the Department of Kannada and Culture, Udupi City Municipal Council, Union Department of Culture and Pejawar Mutt. Addressing presspersons here on Wednesday, M.S. Bhat, honorary president of the organization, said that the plays to be staged at 6.30 p.m. daily during the fest at the park are: Three Roses by Taksh Theatrics troupe from Bengaluru, directed by Akshay Karthik, on February 11 Shikari by Rangayana troupe from Mysuru, directed by Prakash Belvadi, on February 12 Kattale Belaku by Rangayana troupe from Mysuru, directed by B.V. Karanth, on February 13 Neralu by Sumanasa troupe from Kodavoor, directed by Viddu Ucchil, followed by Balidana by Chandrashekhar Pratisthana troupe from Bengaluru on February 14 a Yaksha drama Chitrapata Ramayana by Sumanasa troupe, directed by Bannanje Sanjeeva Suvarna on February 15 Gokula Nirgamana by Nandagokula troupe from Mangaluru, directed by Viddu Ucchil on February 16 and Rathayatre by Sumanasa troupe, directed by Gururaj Marpalli on February 17. Six people would be given Ranga Sadhaka Sanman awards.
Union: Bhujanga Park,  Mangaluru, Bengaluru, Udupi, Kodavoor, Mysuru, Pejawar Mutt

Title: A boost for scientific study
Content: Revolutionising science education at the secondary level, the State first state of the art Ideal Laboratory is all set to be opened at the Government Boys Higher Secondary School (GBHSS), Haripad. The high tech lab set up under a project of the Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA) and the State government at a cost of 50 lakh, will allow students to perform experiments mentioned in their textbooks in a sequential manner, and even take up advanced level experiments. It will be inaugurated by Education Minister C. Ravindranath on August 10. It is a project aimed at taking the science education in secondary schools to the next level. The Ideal labs will act as a science hub where students can conduct experiments in physics, chemistry and biology.

Title: Businessman dies on NICE Road
Content: A poultry businessman was killed and two of his friends sustained severe injuries in an accident on NICE Road in the wee hours of Friday. The deceased has been identified as Bharath, 28, a resident of Uttarahalli. His friends Jayanth and Uday are being treated in a private hospital. They are said to be out of danger. Bharath runs a poultry farm near Magadi.

Title: Tension at Pulvayal village
Content: Tense moments prevailed for some time at Pulvayal village near Kudimiyanmalai in Pudukottai district on Sunday after miscreants garlanded a photo of dalit leader Immaneul Sekaran embossed on a flex banner with some footwears. The banner was put up by the Puthiyam Tamizhagam party members in that village. Cadre of the Puthiya Tamizhagam staged a road roko at the village demanding the arrest of the culprits. Superintendent of Police, Pudukottai Selvaraj and senior police officers rushed to the spot and held talks with the protesters following which the stir was given up.

Title: Vaggeyakara utsavam begins
Content: The five day Vaggeyakara utsavam got off to a spiritual start at the famed Sri Sitaramachandra Swamy temple in Bhadrachalam on the occasion of saint composer Bhakta Ramadasu 385th Jayanthi on Sunday. Nagara Sankeertana, an impressive procession featuring kolatam performance by women devotees to the accompaniment of traditional music, along the main streets surrounding the temple complex, was among a host of other spiritual events that marked the beginning of the commemorative music fete. Chitrakuta mandapam abutting the temple complex reverberated with mellifluous kritis in praise of Lord Sitarama as noted musicians from Chennai and other far off places performed at a devotional music concert, leaving the audience spellbound.
Union: Sri Sitaramachandra Swamy temple, Bhadrachalam, Chennai

Title: Rumours about Andhra couples visit trigger protests
Content: A tense situation prevailed at Erumeli, the key base station of Sabatrimala temple, on Tuesday afternoon when members of the Sangh Parivar organisations staged protests against a woman from Andhra Pradesh on the suspicion of her proceeding to the holy hillock from there. The episode began to unfold around 1 p.m. when the woman, identified as Neelima Vijayalakshmin (40), had reached Erumeli along with her husband Kiran Kumar (45) on board a Pampa bound KSRTC bus. As soon as the bus entered the Erumeli KSRTC bus station, rumours spread about a woman under the age of 50 reaching the spot with an intention to visit Sabarimala. The couple had reached Kochi by a flight in the morning and boarded a Sabarimala special bus to reach Erumeli, which might have triggered the suspicion, said a senior police officer. As soon as they got off at Erumeli, members of the Sangh Parivar outfits converged at the spot and launched a protest. Alongside, women devotees who thronged the temples at Erumeli, also resorted to a flash protest.
Union: Erumeli, Andhra, Andhra Pradesh, Sabatrimala, Pampa, Kochi

Title: Pampa remains a changed river, post the flood
Content: Post the floods, Pampa is a changed river. It now flows forked from the Pampa Triveni, where it confluences with the Kakki and the Kullar rivers. One branch of it flows by the service road and the other by the mainland on the western side. The deluge has changed many other landmarks too. The portion of the riverbank that once used to house the Ramamurthy Mandapam is now an island with just the basement of the massive structure remaining.
Union: Pampa, Pampa Triveni, Kakki, Kullar, Ramamurthy Mandapam

Title: Gang robs family
Content: Unidentified persons entered the house of a cab driver in Nallathur near Kallakuruchi on Monday night and decamped with five sovereigns of gold jewellery and 70,000 cash. Police said Sakthivel, 52, was living with his wife Suguna, mother Kannagi, sister Dhanalakshmi and relative Ezhumalai. On Monday, when Sakthivel had gone out, a seven member gang entered the secluded house at Nallathur and threatened the three women at knifepoint to part with their jewellery. When Ezhumalai tried to resist, one of the robbers hit him on his head with a wooden log. They also gagged the three women and Ezhumalai in a room and fled the scene.

Title: Toxic Chinese cinnamon flooding South Indian market, finds study
Content: The cinnamon you just bought from the local grocery to spice up your dish may not be what the doctor ordered. Chances are the cinnamon bark you picked up from the shelf is a toxic version of the spice imported from China and passed off as the original. A study conducted by scientists at the Jawaharlal Nehru Tropical Botanic Garden and Research Institute (JNTBGRI) here has revealed that South Indian market is flooded with Chinese cinnamon (Cinnamomum cassia) containing high levels of coumarin, a hepatotoxic compound, raising food safety concerns. While the authentic Cinnamomum verum cultivated in South India is a safe food additive with a market price about 1,000 a kg, the Chinese version is available for 180 to 200 per kg, making it an affordable option, albeit one with a health hazard for consumers. The study conducted by K.B.

Title: Prevalence of tetanus in State is still a major concern
Content: Last month, Salman Pasha, a teenager from Ramanagaram, accidentally stepped on a nail while carrying a bucket of water outside his house. His family members, who noticed his sudden nerve spasms (similar to convulsions) and tightness in the neck, assumed it was another bout of fits as the boy was epileptic. They took him to a nearby government hospital as he was unable to swallow anything. His condition deteriorated as he was treated for only epilepsy initially. He was diagnosed with tetanus only after he was referred to the State run Epidemic Diseases Hospital on Old Madras Road.

Title: A Valley of pain and sorrow
Content: A slice of Kashmir angst is on display at the ongoing Kochi Muziris Biennale. In what termed Srinagar Biennale, 14 artists belonging to Kashmiri Pandit community that was forced to flee the State and the Muslim community have come together to give expression to the region pain and sorrow. Artist Veer Munshi has curated the segment, part of the infra projects conceived by the biennale curator Anita Dube. Showcased at TKM Warehouse in Mattancherry, the central work of the project features a structure shaped like a Sufi dargah. Mr. Munshi said that the nurturing structure borrowed elements from Kashmiri architecture, reinforced by secular values.
Union: Mattancherry, Kashmir, Kochi, Srinagar, TKM Warehouse

Title: A motherly meet
Content: Come Friday evening, the tabletop tourist spot at Kottakkunnu here will witness a gathering of mothers for the sake of the differently abled. There will be mothers of special children as well who will share their experiences with others. The District Administration is organising the get together in association with the Rehabilitation Institute for Cognitively and Communicatively Challenged (RICCCH), a service oriented non profit organisation offering care and expertise for the differently abled. District Collector Amit Meena said here on Saturday that the gathering from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. would be titled Amma Nilavu and will be an attempt to make May 11 the Special Mothers Day. May 13May 13 is International Mothers Day.

Title: Onshore casino operators in Goa seek cut in licence fee hike, live gaming
Content: Panaji: The onshore casino operators in Goa have sought a reduction in the proposed hike of annual licence fee. They also want live gaming permits on par with offshore casino operators. At a press conference here on Friday, Kundan Shetye, partner with Grand 7 casino, also demanded that the state government set up a Gaming Commission at the earliest to streamline the casino industry in the state. We are not opposed to the hike per se, but it should be proportionate. A four to five fold increase in the existing fee structure, will kill the onshore casinos.

Title: Woman, accomplice held for stealing from MTC passenger
Content: A woman with a child and her male accomplice were arrested on Thursday for stealing valuables from a passenger on an MTC bus. According to police, R. Vijaya, a flower merchant, was travelling in an bus from Poonamallee to Vadapalani. A 30 year old woman was sitting with a child in the seat next to her. At the Vadapalani bus stand, when the woman was about to get down, Vijaya noticed that the gold jewellery and cash in her handbag were missing and asked her to stop. But the woman and her male accomplice tried to walk away quickly.

Title: Veeranam lends a helping hand
Content: With the Veeranam tank reaching capacity, the city has started receiving 180 million litres per day (mld) for its drinking water needs. According to Metrowater officials, they withdrew 135 mld of water on Friday from the tank, located in Cuddalore district, about 225 km from the city. A 230 km long pipeline brings the water to the city. On Saturday, they stepped up the withdrawal to 180 mld, the maximum capacity, and it would continue till the onset of the northeast monsoon in mid October, officials said. With Veeranam lending a helping hand, Metrowater has reduced its offftake from Poondi, Chembarambakkam, Red Hills and Cholavaram lakes for the city water supply for now.
Union: Chembarambakkam, Cholavaram, Red Hills, Cuddalore, Poondi, Veeranam

Title: Plea against panel disposed of
Content: A division bench of Justices M. Govindaraj and G. R. Swaminathan of the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court on Wednesday refused to declare the Santhanam Commission probing the Madurai Kamaraj University audiotape scandal as null and void, while disposing of a public interest litigation petition. Activist S. Selvagomathi, in her petition, wanted the court to declare the Santhanam Commission as null and void and direct the MKU to look into the case and discharge its functions under the University Grants Commission (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal of Sexual Harassment of Women Employees and Students in Higher Educational Institutions) Regulations, 2015. The petitioner sought the formation of a Local Complaints Committee under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013 to question Devanga Arts College, Aruppukottai, where the alleged audiotape incident took place. The UGC should initiate action against MKU in accordance with law, she said.

Title: Delhi smog: NGT summons Chief Secretaries of 4 States over stubble burning
Content: Stating that State governments had failed to curb stubble burning, the National Green Tribunal (NGT) on Monday summoned the Chief Secretaries of Delhi, Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh. Officers have been directed to draw up a plan to execute the implementation of providing incentives to farmers. Observing that stubble burning is adversely affecting the environment and public health, a Bench headed by NGT Chairperson Justice Adarsh Kumar Goel said, It is a major problem in the state of Punjab and Haryana. NCT Delhi is certainly affected by it. The fact remains that the problem could not be fully tackled and the adverse impact on the air quality is affecting the citizen health and lives.
Union: Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, NCT Delhi

Title: Andhra Pradesh strikes gold in Chittoor district
Content: The A.P. government, apparently, is sitting on a gold mine all these days. The government recently found that Chigargunta and Bisanatham gold block in Chittoor district is likely to fetch 947 crore. After conducting many exploration studies, the Mines and Geology department has come to a conclusion that the Chigargunta and Bisanatham gold block will be profitable. The government recently auctioned the gold blocks wherein companies/groups, including NMDC, Vedanta, Adani, MSPL and Rengta participated.

Title: Govt. staff must sport ID cards at work
Content: The Madras High Court on Monday made it mandatory for all government employees in the State as well as those working for local bodies and other government instrumentalities to wear their identity cards during working hours. The First Division Bench of Chief Justice Indira Banerjee and Justice P.T. Asha issued the direction on a suo motu public interest litigation petition, taken up on the basis of a letter from a resident of Erode. In the letter addressed to the Chief Justice, M. Valli Narayanan had sought the implementation of a 1986 Government Order which required government servants to sport their name badges during working hours.

Title: Congress battle for Madhya Pradesh begins in Mandsaur
Content: Congress president Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday virtually launched his party campaign for the Assembly polls in Madhya Pradesh, scheduled for around November, by promising loan waiver to farmers within 10 days if the Congress is voted to power. To mark the first anniversary of the farmers protest at Mandsaur that killed six people in police firing, Mr. Gandhi addressed a Kisan Samriddhi Sankalp Farmer Prosperity Resolve rally at the Piplia Mandi ground in Mandsaur, where he accused the BJP governments across the country of being anti farmer. From this stage, I want to tell the farmers of Mandsaur and across the country. . .

Title: Woman killed in Pakistan ceasefire violation at J&Ks Rajouri district
Content: A woman was killed on February 10 when Pakistan troops resorted to unprovoked firing from across the Line of Control (LoC) in the Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir, a police official said. Parveen Akhter was killed when she was hit by a bullet fired by Pakistani troops along the LoC in Pkukherni and Lairan villages of Noushera around 10.35 p.m. IST, he said. The official said Akhter was hit inside her home at Lairan village. Indian troops guarding the border retaliated to silence the Pakistani guns, he said, adding intermittent firings and shellings were going on when the last reports were received. Earlier in the day, Pakistani troops launched mortars shells at civilian areas along the LoC in nearby Poonch district but there was no loss of life or injury to any one.
Union: Pakistan, Pkukherni, Rajouri, Lairan, Jammu and Kashmir, Noushera, Poonch, JK

Title: Case booked against Pawan
Content: Acting on a complaint filed by a member of the Telangana Union of Working Journalists against actor Pawan Kalyan and other persons over a video of actor Sri Reddy, the Banjara Hills police on Thursday registered a case against him. A case under Section 469 (forgery to harm reputation), 506 (criminal intimidation) and 504 (intent to provoke breach of peace) has been invoked against him, Banjara Hills police inspector K. Srinivas said. The complainant G. Rajesh claimed that Mr. Kalyan had allegedly shared a forged video clip purportedly carried by a regional language channel on social media which showed actor Sri Reddy using objectionable language against him. He said that the staff of the channel denied that they had broadcast any such video clip. He alleged that the channel has been receiving a barrage of calls from the actor fans who have been haranguing the staff.

Title: New roadblock for Manipur varsity
Content: Tribal students bodies have given a highway blockade twist to the Manipur University crisis. Three organisations have threatened to impose a five day economic blockade on all national highways connecting State capital Imphal if the authorities concerned cannot let normal classes and other academic activities in Manipur University resume by October 8. Separate university These organisations have also demanded a separate Hill Central University to ensure that the tribal students have an alternative to the disruption prone university in the non tribal dominated Imphal Valley. The All Tribal Students Union, Manipur, the Kuki Students Organisation General Headquarters and the All Naga Students Association, Manipur, had on October 2 served a seven day ultimatum to the University authorities to resume classes. The decision to go for a highway blockade was taken at their meeting on Thursday.

Title: Centre for new Bench in Manipur case
Content: Some Army officers, supported fully by the Centre, on Friday urged a Supreme Court Bench of Justices Madan Lokur and U.U. Lalit to recuse itself from monitoring the CBI probe into alleged fake encounters in Manipur. They said certain oral remarks made by the Bench at an earlier hearing questioning the non arrest of accused persons had spooked Army personnel operating in Manipur. Appearing for the officers, senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi said there was a genuine apprehension in the minds of the soldiers. Their morale was affected by the reported comments of the court.

Title: DMRC begins trial between Lajpat Nagar and Moti Bagh
Content: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Tuesday began test runs on a section of Pink Line between Lajpat Nagar and Sir Vishweshwaraiah Moti Bagh stations. The 8.10 km stretch is a part of the upcoming 59 km long Majlis Park - Shiv Vihar line. DMRC Managing Director Mangu Singh flagged off the test run. This line will be an extension of the currently operational Majlis Park - Durgabai Deshmukh South Campus section of the Pink Line. During these trials, the interface of the Metro will be checked to ensure that there is no physical infringement with civil infrastructure during the train movement, the DMRC said, adding that it will also test the various subsystems of the coaches.
Union: Shiv Vihar, Moti Bagh, Lajpat Nagar, Delhi, Sir Vishweshwaraiah Moti Bagh, Majlis Park, Durgabai Deshmukh South Campus

Title: Engineer chases snatchers, gets shot in the stomach
Content: A 42 year old engineer was allegedly shot in the stomach by two bike borne men who had snatched his wife gold chain in central Delhi Rajinder Nagar on Tuesday night, the police said on Wednesday. The incident happened outside B.L. Kapur Hospital, where victim Ashok Kumar wife Keerti works as a medical coordinator. Mr. Kumar works with a private firm in Gurugram. A hospital staff member said, Mr. Kumar is critical but stable and is currently in the ICU.

Title: Ottanthullal artiste Geethanandan dead
Content: Acclaimed Ottanthullal artiste Kalamandalam Geethanandan died during a performance at Avittathur, near Irinjalakuda, on Sunday evening. He was 58. The end of the artiste, who had performed on more than 5,000 stages in India and abroad, came during a stage performance at Mahadeva Temple, Avittathur. He was a teacher of Ottanthullal at Kerala Kalalamandalam for more than a quarter century. He collapsed on the stage during the performance.
Union: India, Avittathur, Kerala, Irinjalakuda, Mahadeva Temple

Title: Delhi HC extends interim protection to Chidambaram
Content: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday extended interim protection from arrest granted to former Union Minister P. Chidambaram in the INX Media case till August 1. Justice A. K. Pathak directed the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), which is probinf the case, not to take any coercive action against Mr. Chidambaram till August 1, the next date fixed for hearing. The agency has sought time to submit its response on Mr Chidambaram's anticipatory bail plea. Mr Chidambaram was given a similar relief by the high court on May 31 in the case. The high court had, however, told Mr Chidambaram to cooperate in the investigation as and when called by CBI.

Title: Bharathidasan University operationalises web app
Content: Bharathidasan University has operationalised its version of Digital India initiative BDU Mobile and Web App by creating user names and passwords for 180 faculty members and about 1,200 students of 39 departments. The app was launched on on October 31 by Vice Chancellor P. Manisankar. Developed under a memorandum of understanding between the varsity and Ulketz Learning Solutions, the app has enabled students access to course materials in the forms of e books, conceptual videos and exam centric study material and improve learning outcomes. Its effectiveness can be improved through flipped classroom pedagogy, G. Parthasarathy, Director, University Informatics Centre, said. Students can download books, power point files, videos and other documents with file sizes above one MB from NPTEL (National Programme on Technology Enhanced Learning, which is an initiative by seven IITs), NDL (National Digital Library of India) and other open sources, Mr. Parthasarathy said.

Title: CRPF man on Raj Bhavan duty among robbery suspects
Content: A Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) policeman, Kumar, posted at Raj Bhavan in Chennai, an Armed Reserve Police constable of Tirupur, N. Saravanan, and a dismissed police constable from Tiruchi, Radhakrishnan, are among the suspects in a daring robbery in which around 70 lakh was looted from the residence of a doctor at Melur near here recently. While the 10 accused, including Radhakrishnan, have been arrested, Madurai district police are on the lookout for other suspects. A total of 26 persons of three gangs were involved in the robbery. The CRPF man had given his pistol, bought in the black market, for the robbery. The AR policeman had come to the scene of crime the previous day for a recce, the Superintendent of Police, N. Manivannan, told The Hindu based on the statements from the accused.
Union: Melur, Raj Bhavan, Tirupur, Madurai, Chennai, Tiruchi

Title: Court seeks report on appointment of law officers
Content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court on Monday passed an interim injunction on law officers (criminal side) appointed in violation of Rules 4 and 5 of the Law Officers of High Court of Madras and its Bench at Madurai (Appointment) Rules, 2017. A division bench of Justices N. Kirubakaran and R. Tharani, hearing a petition seeking a stay of the Government Order on the appointment of Government Law Officers, directed the State government as well as the Registrar General, Madras High Court, to file individual reports on the eligibility and experience of the appointed advocates. The petitioner, Advocate A. Kannan, complained that for at least four decades, advocates with allegiance to the ruling party were appointed as law officers, without ascertaining their capability. Mr. Kannan contended that equal opportunity was not provided for advocates to apply and the current appointments did not satisfy Rule 4 (Eligibility) and Rule 5 (Method of Appointment) of the 2017 Rules. He claimed that some of the law officers appointed did not have the minimum prescribed years of practice and disciplinary proceedings were pending against some of them.

Title: AI flight from Goa gets stuck on runway
Content: Flight operations at the Mumbai international airport in Andheri had to be shifted to the secondary runway on Monday after an Air India flight from Goa remained stuck on the main runway following a hydraulic failure. The flight, AI 662, had declared an emergency at 8.36 p.m. An airport spokesperson said, The aircraft landed safely at 9.18 p.m. The main runway was shut till 9.40 p.m. when it was handed over for operations. At 10.30 p.m. , the airport reported a 32 minute delay in arrivals.

Title: Coming home to celebrate birthday
Content: The heritage village of Aranmula is all set to celebrate the 84th birthday of its famous native G. Sugathakumari, whose role as an environmentalist has received much attention and whose poetry has made a mark in the literary milieu of the State. Come Wednesday, Sugathakumari celebrates her birth star Aswathi that falls in the Malayalam month of Makarom. Ms. Sugathakumari will be reaching her ancestral home of Vazhuvelil Tharavadu, located close to the famous Sree Parthasarathy temple at Aranmula, on Wednesday morning. In her own words, she will be at the village to be in the lap of Mother Nature, once again. The poet, who was one of those who successfully steered an all party non violent popular movement to protect the puncha (paddy lands), sacred groves, and the Pampa from corporate invasion, is known for her commitment to protect the nature.
Union: Vazhuvelil Tharavadu, Aranmula, Sree Parthasarathy temple, Pampa

Title: Bhavanipet declared ODF
Content: The Collector N. Satyanarayana on Wednesday declared Bhavanipet in Lingampet mandal as an Open Defecation Free (ODF) village and appreciated the residents for the achievement. Addressing a public meeting at the village, he said that 1.14 lakh toilets were built across the district and only 16,800 were left incomplete. After the completion of these remaining toilets, the district would be declared as total ODF, he said, and disclosed that as many as 218 villages had become ODF as of now. Earlier villagers took out an honour rally in which the Collector and other officials participated. The Collector said, as per the World Health Organisation reports, children and women were most affected by ODF.

Title: Sreejith case: Magistrate deposes against SI
Content: The basic character of G.S. Deepak, the suspended Sub inspector of Police of Varapuzha and an accused in the custodial death of Sreejith, was to physically harass accused persons and create constant problems, according to a statement given by Smitha M. , former North Paravur Judicial First Class Magistrate before the High Court. She had alleged in her statement that there was an occasion when he had arrested an accused against the High Court directive. In another case, he had produced an accused with physical injuries despite her directive not to physically harass the accused when the accused was handed over to him. He used to ignore her directives not to physically harass any accused.

Title: HC seeks response of Centre, State, and CBI
Content: The Kerala High Court on Thursday sought the response of the Union and State governments and the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to a CBI probe plea by mothers of four youths jailed in Doha on charge of drug smuggling into the activities of the agents who had arranged them visas. The petition was filed by the mothers of Ashik Ashly, 22, from Angamaly, Kevin Mathew, 26, from Kottayam, Adithya Mohanan, 21, from Alappuzha and Sarath Sasi, 24, from Ernakulam. The petitioners pointed out that their sons were in the Duhail jail in Doha on charges of transporting narcotic products. Their visas had been arranged by Sahni, Rafees, Rashid, and Jayesh. These agents had struck a cordial relationship with these youths.
Union: Kerala, Kottayam, Doha, Angamaly, Alappuzha, Ernakulam

Title: Labourer kills wife, attempts suicide
Content: A daily wage labourer allegedly killed his wife before consuming poison near the Sri Venkateswara Swamy temple in Nelakondapalli town late on Tuesday evening. He is said to be critical. Sources said M Gangadhar (25), a resident of Guvvalagudem, strangulated Naveena (20) to death with her dupatta following a tiff over a prolonged family dispute at a secluded spot near the temple. Soon after, he consumed pesticide and collapsed on the roadside, added sources. The couple has two sons.
Union: Nelakondapalli, Guvvalagudem, Sri Venkateswara Swamy temple

Title: BJP threatens stir if HDK backtracks on farm loan waiver promise
Content: H.D. Kumaraswamy seems to be facing his first big challenge even before taking oath as the Chief Minister implementing the poll promise of complete farm loan waiver within 24 hours of coming to power. On the eve of his swearing in ceremony, Mr. Kumaraswamy was non committal on the promise, saying a decision can be taken only after deliberations with the coalition partner Congress. The BJP has already begun capitalising on the issue by threatening a State wide agitation if Mr. Kumaraswamy backtracks on the promise. Speaking to mediapersons in Sringeri on Tuesday, he said he had told the people that he would waive farm loans if he was given absolute majority.

Title: CM orders probe into Vidhan Bhavan flooding
Content: The Maharashtra government has ordered an inquiry into the flooding of Vidhan Bhavan here after heavy rains last week. The inquiry would ascertain loopholes in arrangements for the monsoon session and if problems were deliberately left unattended, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said in the Legislative Assembly here on Monday. The people affected due to heavy rains in the city would also be compensated, he said. The city is hosting the monsoon session of the State Legislature but on Friday both the Assembly and the Council were adjourned for the day, shortly after convening, due to a power blackout caused by rains. An inquiry will be done to find out whether there was a deliberate attempt not to fix loopholes, if any, and whether steps were taken to prevent flooding in the Vidhan Bhavan premises, he said.

Title: Nod to place amendments to Haryana Police Act
Content: The Haryana Cabinet on Friday approved a proposal to place amendments to the Haryana Police Act, 2007, for consideration and deliberation in the State Assembly. The decision was taken at a meeting held here under the chairmanship of Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar. The amendments are related to selection of Director General of Police and procedures related to removal of the DGP. A committee is proposed to be constituted under the Chief Secretary with the Additional Chief Secretary (Home) and Director General of Police, Haryana, as its members and Special Secretary (Home) as its Member Secretary, said an official statement. The Cabinet also decided to constitute the State Social Security Board for the socio economic development of unorganised workers in the State, which would be constituted under the Unorganised Workers Social Security Act, 2008.

Title: Nine hurt after vehicle rams into pedestrians
Content: Mumbai: Nine people, including a woman, were injured after a 26 year old taxi driver lost control of his vehicle due to an suspected epileptic attack and rammed into pedestrians at the J.J. Hospital junction in Byculla on Wednesday night. All the injured and the driver, Rizwan Khan, were taken to J.J. Hospital. A casualty medical officer said one of them has a severe injury to his head. At the time of going to press, all the patients were undergoing medical evaluation. The doctor said the driver lost consciousness for a while and was vomiting continuously.

Title: Man who cheated people after befriending them online held
Content: Mumbai: A fraudster who would allegedly get in touch with people online, take expensive gadgets like cameras and laptops on rent, and sell them to third parties before changing his number and location, has been arrested. The accused has a number of cases registered against him in Thane and Pune. According to the Thane Nagar police, inquiries were initiated in August after Thane resident Vishal Sanap registered a complaint. Mr. Sanap said he had been contacted by the accused, identified as Mahesh Bhogle (36), on Facebook, and after initial conversation, Mr. Bhogle allegedly told Mr. Sanap that he needed a professional camera on rent. As Mr. Sanap owned a professional camera, he agreed to give it to Mr. Bhogle on rent.

Title: Automatic water dispensers to be set up at 30 places in city
Content: Clean, ready to drink water will soon be available to the city residents at 30 places in the city. Facilitating the arrangement is Coimbatore Corporation, which has tied up with Kerala based Dharana Infrastructure Projects Private Limited. The objective behind the project is to provide potable water to the city residents and for the Corporation it comes at no cost because all that it has to do is provide access to the company to sink bore well and a place for dispensing water, says Corporation Commissioner K. Vijayakarthikeyan. The company will invest in the project, share a small sum with the civic body and operate and maintain the plant out of the money it will make by selling water. In the process, the Corporation will determine the price of water and the quality at which the company supplies, says City Engineer A. Lakshmanan.

Title: Family members, supporters bid Gurudas Kamat adieu
Content: Veteran Congress leader Gurudas Kamat was cremated with full state honours in Chembur in the presence of State and national leaders and close supporters on Thursday. The crematorium at Diamond Garden, incidentally, was recently refurbished with development funds provided by the Congress leader himself. Kamat body arrived for the final rites wrapped in the Tricolour on a flower bedecked vehicle. Among the dignitaries present to pay their respects were Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, State Cabinet ministers, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, and 25 party functionaries from all over the country. Close supporters and several corporators took the lead in making the arrangements.

Title: On-duty cop found dead inside Secretariat parking
Content: A 35 year old on duty head constable was found dead in the VVIP parking lot at the Delhi Secretariat on Friday morning. Stating that they found a note addressed to the Delhi Police Commissioner, the police said he was upset over being beaten in public by his in laws a day earlier.
