Content: A three year old child died while her parents (father Rajendra and mother Urmila) fell sick after they consumed wild mushrooms at Pav Talla Village, in Mori in Uttarkashi district on Friday night. They are admitted in Doon Hospital. The child died in course of treatment at the local community health centre at Mori. Police said that Rajendra, his wife Urmila Devi and his three year old child had consumed wild mushrooms on Friday night. Subsequently, the trio got stomach pain and later they started vomiting.

Title: ED moves court for Seashore assets attachment
Content: The Enforcement Directorate, probing the multi crore chit fund scam, on Friday moved court seeking permission to attach the Seashore Group properties worth Rs 9.60 crore here. The ED formally approached the Khordha District and Sessions Judge Court to this effect. According to sources, the seizure assets involve two plots in Bhubaneswar and Angul worth Rs 9 crore and bank deposits of Rs 60.57 lakh in name of Seashore chief Prashant Dash and his brother. Earlier, the ED had confiscated Rs 242 crore worth of property of the tainted money circulation company. The ED on March 31 had requested the Khordha District and Sessions Court, designated under the Prevention of Money laundering Act, 2002, to confiscate property worth Rs 242 crore of Seashore.

Title: Punjab finalises final draft of regulatory authority for pvt schools
Content: To sort out the problem of overcharging of fees and stopping the exploitation of any kind, the Punjab Education Department on Friday gave the final touch to the draft of the regulatory authority for private unaided schools of the State. The draft policy is finalised in a marathon meeting held with senior officials of the department. The draft would be submitted before the Chief Minister for his approval, said State Education Minister Daljit Singh Cheema. Cheema said that the department is very much concerned about the reports of the exploitation of the parents and students by some private unaided schools who were collecting heavy fee and also indulging other undesired activities like forcing the parents to buy books from specified shops and also compelling the parents to buy uniform as per the school instructions. Such undesired activities cannot be allowed to proceed unhindered.

Title: Haryana CMGGAs get warm response across country
Content: looking to involve youth in its State machinery by inducting 21 high calibre youngsters into the office of Chief Minister, Haryana Government has received good response across the country under Haryana Chief Minister Good Governance Associates (CMGGAs) programme. The applications from premium institutes like Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs), Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs), top medical colleges and universities have been received to work under CMGGAs programme. The programme will commence on July 1, said an official spokesman. The State Government had introduced the CMGGAs programme under which 21 high caliber individuals would be posted for a year in all the 21 districts of Haryana, representing the Chief Minister office (CMO). Applications from 21 States have so far been received and around 2300 registrations have been done.

Title: Well-educated representatives to Panchayati Raj has ushered in era of change: Khattar
Content: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar lal on Sunday said that the election of well educated representatives to the Panchayati Raj Institutions in the recently held elections has ushered in an era of change, which is quite visible in the form of changed atmosphere in the villages. The Chief Minister interacted with the newly appointed Chief Minister Good Governance Associates. The associates who have been appointed with the objective of ensuring good governance and transparency in the working of the district administration, recently completed 15 day training session at Ashoka University in Sonepat district. They would be posted in the districts with the objective of ensuring implementation and monitoring of big programmes of both Central and state governments. They would also offer advice on how to ensure better implementation of these programmes, and report to the Chief Minister Office.

Title: Golf winners presented awards
Content: The three day Governor Cup Golf tournament 2016, which began here on May 27, has concluded on Sunday. Winners of various categories were awarded by the Governor/ chairman of Rajbhawan Golf Club Dr KK Paul at Raj Bhawan, Nainital. The overall winner of the 14th tournament was Ram Jiwan Kutar and the runner up was Dinesh Panwar. 83 year old Col Sl Shah bagged the prize for the super veteran golfer. (list of winners is attached).

Title: UP CM to skip party rally for second time
Content: UP Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav is likely to skip the party rally in Bareilly on Wednesday. Samajwadi Party supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav will preside over the rally. The rally in Bareilly will be the second big political event to be skipped by the Chief Minister. Akhilesh Yadav had stayed away from the rally in Ghazipur on November 23. Samajwadi party sources also confirmed that Chief Minister will not be attending the rally at Bareilly.

Title: BHEl employees presented Vishwakarma Puraskar
Content: Vishwakarma Rastriya Puraskar 2014 award distribution ceremony was held at Siri Fort Auditorium in New Delhi on September 16. The awards were given by the Minister of State, labour Employment to four employees of BHEl Bhopal, namely, Maneesh Kr Tiwari, Deputy Engineer (FWM), Chandra Shekhar Yadav, Art. GR II (FYM), Alkar Singh Solanki, Art GR II (FYM) and Shamsul Haque, Art GR II (FYM), who won award in category C . Total 36 employees of BHEl were winners and won 8 awards in various categories. Bandaru Dattatreya, the Minister of State for labour and Employment (Independent Charge) gave away Vishwakarma Rashtriya Puraskar (VRP) and National Safety Awards (NSA) for the Performance Year 2014.
Union: Bhopal, Siri Fort Auditorium, New Delhi

Title: Two arrested for land fraud in Dehradun
Content: Stamping its foot down on the menace of the land frauds, Dehradun police have arrested two persons on Wednesday, charging the duo of duping the complainant of around 8.78 lakhs regarding sale of a piece of land by forged documents. The accused have been identified as Sushil Kumar, resident of Haridwar, and Vijendra Singh Rawat, resident of Ajabpur Kala, Dehradun. IG Garhwal Range Sanjay Kumar Gunjyal announced reward of 5,000 to the team of Patelnagar and SIT, for cracking the case. It is learnt that Jaidev Negi, resident of Pauri, had registered a complaint at SIT. In the written complaint, Negi stated that he had purchased a piece of land (188.19 square metres) at Mauja Sheesham Bara, from Sushil Kumar, resident of Haridwar in June 2012. later, he had applied for mutation of the land in the department concerned.
Union: Haridwar, Ajabpur Kala, Dehradun, Pauri, Mauja Sheesham Bara, Patelnagar

Title: Haryana not promoting Hinduism: Khattar
Content: President Pranab Mukherjee will inaugurate the International Gita Festival on December 6 and lay the foundation stone of the Rs 97.35 crore Krishna Circuit in Kurukshetra to give a massive face lift to Kurukshetra and the places associated with Mahabharata. The project will be a step forward in projecting Kurukshetra on the global tourist map. Addressing a press conference in New Delhi on Saturday, Chief Minister, Manohar lal, said that the central Government had released the first installment, 20 per cent of the amount, for the project. He said the grandeur and global scale of the first ever International Gita Mahotsav, being celebrated by the Haryana Government in Kurukshetra from December 6 to 10 will offer spectators a spectacle to watch, a memory to cherish, and make for a nucleus of attraction for the people from around the globe. The event will set a world record with the recitation of Ashtadash Shaloki Gita by as many as 18,000 students.

Title: TN civic poll notification null and void: HC
Content: The Madras High Court on Tuesday declared the notification for civic polls in the State, scheduled for October 17 and 19, as null and void, holding that it violated the Tamil Nadu Panchayat Election Rules. The court directed the State Election Commission to issue a fresh notification for holding local body elections and complete the poll process before December 31. On a writ plea filed by DMK leader and Rajya Sabha member RS Barathy, the court, in its interim order, declared the poll notification dated September 26 null and void. The DMK had sought adequate reservation to the Scheduled Tribes, and necessary rotation of seats in all the posts as mandated in the Constitution. Another plea of DMK related to the civic polls is pending in the Supreme Court.

Title: PM's insaniyat, jamhooriyat a rhetoric: J&K Min
Content: The separatist and pro India political parties on Tuesday sharply reacted to Prime Minister Narendra Modi belated statement on Kashmir situation saying the invocation of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee insaniyat and jamhooriyat (humanity and democracy) remark has never moved beyond rhetoric. Killing innocent people and imposing indefinite curfew in Kashmir is in no sense Insaniyat and Jamooriyat, JKPCC chief and former Minister Gulam Ahmad Mir said. He said the people of Kashmir have not seen any ray of democracy and humanity on ground as claimed by the BJP. It is better to implement the principles of democracy and humanity on ground rather than uttering the phrases in public rallies, he said. He said it is unfortunate that Prime Minister spoke over the Kashmir situation after 32 days and failed to utter a single word over civilian killings.

Title: India offers fully-funded courses to CW citizens
Content: India has started fully funded training courses for Commonwealth citizens across a range of areas, including rural development, renewable energy and IT, under a programme that aims to build capacity in member countries. The courses are sponsored by India and delivered by institutions through the Indian Technical and Economic (ITEC) Programme. ITEC is part of the Commonwealth Secretariat's Third Country Training Programmes, which aims to build capacity in member countries by providing specialist training in key areas of development work. " I would like to thank the Government of India for providing this excellent opportunity for Commonwealth citizens to develop and hone their skills and expertise in areas which are crucial for sustainable development," said Pauline Campbell, Head of Technical Assistance at the Commonwealth Secretariat here. She added: " This is a fantastic opportunity for those in the public and private sectors, as well those who work with NGOs.

Title: Over 240 pc increase in cases of suicide by students in State
Content: Statistics received from the National Crime Record Bureau (NCRB) show that students suicide cases have increased by over 240 per cent in the State with 4,700 students committing suicide. The figures show that there has been a steady rise in suicides from 199 to 645 in the year 2005 2014. One of the major reasons behind all these suicides cases is the fear of failure in examination. This was stated at a workshop organised here on Friday by the CII Young Indians at BSSS College by renowned psychologist Prof Vinay Mishra. It was also addressed by famous counselor Shweta Kataria.

Title: Killing in name of cow 'sentiment' not acceptable: Govt
Content: The government today asserted that killings in the name of cow " sentiments" was unacceptable and said the state governments should take stern action against those indulging in such violence. Finance Minister Arun Jaitley, who was speaking on the issue of lynchings in the Rajya Sabha on behalf of ailing Home Minister Rajnath Singh, made it clear that the central government could not be blamed for violence by " some people" . " The government's stand is clear. Nobody is allowed to do that (lynching in the name of cow protection). There is no rationalisation, no arguments of sentiments being hurt can be an explanation for this.

Title: Meeting of police admin, transport dept, school management of Shivpuri held
Content: With the view of children safety and security, the school management and representatives of transport department were informed about the safety rules of school children. After the incident of student murder in Gurugram, the police administration and transport department have become active, concerning the safety and security of school kids. Keeping this in mind, a meeting of police administration, transport department and school management of Shivpuri was held on Thursday. The meeting was held at local police control room which was presided by Superintended of Police Sunil Kumar Pandey. During the meeting SP Pandey gave certain instructions to the school authorities related to security of school children.

Title: 'Varsities should not restrict themselves to the academic works only'
Content: Minister for Higher Education Jaibhan Singh Pawaiya said that the Universities should not restrict themselves to the academic works only. We will not be able to achieve the target which we have set in higher education, if interest is not shown by the universities in the scientific research activities. Pawaiya was speaking at the International Science Seminar held at Harisingh Gour University at Sagar. Pawaiya mentioned that science is a name to discover the mysteries of nature. Word like victory over nature has put human beings in danger.

Title: Didi may join PM party to bargain hard
Content: In what is being seen as the beginning of melting of ice between the Centre and Bengal Government Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee would leave for Delhi on Friday to attend dinner hosted by President Pranab Mukherjee and more importantly a lunch hosted by Prime Minister Narendera Modi in the honour of visiting Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, sources in the State Government said. If Banerjee joins the party it would be after many months that she would meet the Prime Minister. The mutual chemistry between the two leaders had hit an all time low with the Chief Minister continuously attacking Modi on a host of issues beginning from demonetization, using CBI as a weapon to gag opposition. Apart from this the meeting if it takes place would be crucial internationally as Bengal is a necessary party in the Indo Bangla Teesta water sharing talks. Banerjee had repeatedly shot down proposal of sharing Teesta waters with Bangladesh arguing the arrangement would hurt the interests of the people of North Bengal.
Union: Delhi, Bangladesh, Bengal, Teesta, North Bengal

Title: Odisha BJP better pick BJD secular spirit to just survive
Content: Gauri lankesh was a secular minded crusader columnist and political commentator, a well known critic of the right wing and communal forces. They shot her dead at her Bengaluru house. She had been getting threat calls for long, but she wouldnt care. She had always imagined most threat calls are made by cowardly crooks only when vested interests and communal entities felt badly threatened. The most worrying factor is that Bengaluru is no more a safe place.

Title: Terrorism & graft-free India in 5 yrs Modi's target: Singh
Content: Union minister Jitendra Singh today said terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir was in its last phase as Prime Minister Narendra Modi had set a target to wipe it out from the country in the next five years. He said that just as the period between 1942, when the Quit India movement was launched by Mahatma Gandhi, and 1947, when India got freedom, witnessed important developments, the five years of the Modi government would free India from terrorism, corruption and poverty. " The prime minister has set a target to make India free from terrorism, corruption, casteism, imperialism and poverty .

Title: 'I believe in positive politics'
Content: Former Punjab BJP president and sitting Pathankot MlA, Ashwani Sharma is facing a tough electoral path to victory against his bete noire and three time MlA Master Mohan lal, who has also jumped into the fray as an independent from the constituency. With BJP prominent rebel Master Mohan lal having a substantial vote bank in Pathankot, Sharma is finding the going tough as he makes a pitch for a second successive term. Claiming to have brought a number of development projects in Pathankot, Sharma hopes to cash in over development plank in the Assembly polls. Development of my constituency has remained my priority during my term, says Ashwani while talking to The Pioneer. Sharma says, Solving the traffic problem in Pathankot would be my priority now.

Title: BJP expels dissident G'pati ZP nominee
Content: After being denied of a Zilla Parishad (ZP) election ticket from the BJP, Durga Prasad Subudhi, who filed nominations as an independent candidate, has been expelled from the party. Earlier, Subudhi of Rayagad block in the district had left the Congress and joined the BJP. After joining the BJP, Subudhi was an aspirant for the Rayagad block's Zone 13 ZP seat. On the other hand, Pradip Dalai, who for a long time has been with the BJP, had aspired for a ticket for the same seat. However, the party high command expressed their faith on Dalai and gave him the ticket.

Title: 'BJP glued to ground; Naveen flies in air'
Content: BJP national president Amit Shah targeted Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik more sharply on Thursday calling upon people to throw out the BJD Government in the 2019 elections to ensure fast track development of Odisha. Reiterating his allegation that Odisha is lacking the expected development tempo, Shah claimed that the State would really develop when the BJP comes to power. Shah was addressing a party workers meeting at Basantpur in the Dhauli area here on the last day of his current visit to the State. Notably, Shah has registered him as a voter from this area. Shah said he covered 400 km of road during his three day visit to the State to study the problems of people while Naveen Patnaik is flying in air by a helicopter.

Title: NTPC holds safety circle meet
Content: The NTPC Talcher Kaniha organised a safety circle meet here recently for the year 2017 18 with an objective to enhance safety culture at station level involving employees and workers. Inaugurating the meet Talcher Kaniha Executive Director Ram Kuber said, All functional departments should report near misses, take action to prevent accidents and moreover the accidents if any should be reported without delay to improve the safety standards in day to day operations of the power station. A total 15 teams participated out which 10 teams were represented by contracting agency workers and five teams were represented by NTPC employees from various departments. A deliberations and presentations programme was organsied in which teams showcased the best practices, innovative ideas which have been implemented as case studies for creating awareness among the audience and participants. The presentation team from Mgr Department won the first prize.

Title: Ganjam HMs to guide pass-outs for tech edu
Content: To provide timely advice to Matric pass out students for pursuing technical education, Headmasters of all high schools in Ganjam district discussed the matter in detail at a meeting held here on Monday. The meeting presided over by District Education Officer Sanatana Panda decided to appoint a Nodal Officer from among the teachers in each school for the purpose. Earlier, district Collector Prem Chandra Choudhury advised that high school teachers should give proper advice to Class X pass out students to pursue technical education as most of them stop continuing study after the HSC exam. Ganjam district has a large number of Government technical education institutions like ITIs and Diploma Engineering colleges in which students can take admissions and build good careers, he had said. It was decided that Nodal Officers would provide guidance to students to pursue technical education for good career instead of instead of stopping study altogether.

Title: Naik directs for selection of teachers as per UGC guidelines
Content: The State Election Commission (SEC) said that the Governor was out of the purview of Model Code of Conduct during the Urban local Bodies elections. The code came into force on Friday after the UlB poll schedule was announced by the Commission. The SEC in a communication to Raj Bhawan said that the Governor can participate in convocations in state universities. The SEC also said that if a programme for promotion of literature was organized by any party, it will also not be covered by the MCC. The Raj Bhawan had sent a query to the SEC enquiring whether the Governor could participate in various programmes including convocations of state universities.

Title: Centre to impart skill training to NE youths
Content: With an effort to bring North Eastern region to the mainstream and give a fillip to infrastructure, the Centre has decided to reach out to the region by skilling the local youth so that they can find employment in the infrastructure projects coming up in the area. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said the Ministry of Road Transport Highways (MoRTH) is also looking to set up drivers training schools to impart training to the local youth to enhance their employability and for tourism growth. Gadkari said since the roads are very circuitous in the region and weather conditions are different there is a need to have well trained drivers so that tourists travel in comfort zone. Gadkari said his Ministry is also engaging more and more local contractors in the North East, as also other remote and not so developed areas, so that they can, in turn, engage the trained, local youth on the construction sites. Further, in a bid to fast track projects, the Road Transport Minister asked Government bodies at the Centre and State level to source infrastructure material right from equipment to cement from the Road Transport Ministry upgraded Inampro web portal.

Title: Potable water to all by 2020-21: CM
Content: Chief Minister Raghubar Das on Saturday reaffirmed that by 2020 21 each household of the State will get pure drinking water. While laying foundation stones and inaugurating several schemes under distrcit mining funds in Ramgarh district on Saturday, the Chief Minister said that under the distrcit mining funds water supply schemes for rural areas were being started to provide pied drinking water to the rural populace. The Chief Minister said the piped drinking water schemes have been started in Ramgarh, Bokaro and Chaibasa. He also greeted the people of Ramgarh for the distrcit being declared the first ODF district in the State. Das, on the occasion, appealed to people to save and conserve water.

Title: Trump claims 'total, complete vindication' after Comey testimony
Content: US President Donald Trump has claimed " total and complete vindication" a day after former FBI Director James Comey testified on Capitol Hill regarding alleged Russian meddling in the 2016 US presidential election. Trump also called Comey a " leaker" in a tweet on Friday morning. He wrote: " Despite so many false statements and lies, total and complete vindication. . .

Title: Bid to reduce students' burden
Content: The HRD Ministry is working on a fresh norm for the schools to reduce the burden of bags on students. The Ministry is also in the process of formulating a curriculum for class projects for the students so they are not given projects beyond their capacity. HRD Minister Prakash Javadekar said while bulky school bags may soon become a thing of the past, the Ministry proposed curriculum will ensure that Rsprojects' are done comfortably by the wards and not by their guardians. " I am going to reduce the weight of school bags. .

Title: Marginalised sections still neglected in Odisha
Content: The Public Affairs Index 2017 report on governance in States of India by the Public Affairs Center, Bangalore, ranked Odisha, Jharkhand and Bihar at the bottom, while Kerala and Tamil Nadu are good performers and top the list. The Public Affairs Index has covered a wide range of themes such as essential infrastructure, support to human development, social protection, women and children, crime, law and order, delivery of justice, environment, transparency and accountability, fiscal management and economic freedom. This poor performances and governance failure of Odisha have been reflected in the contemporary social and economic life of the State and uninterruptedly revealed by various surveys and reports by private as well as Government organisations. It has wider impact over the State in general and its poor marginalized sections, SCs and STs, in particular. It has been observed that the Government of Odisha has been ineffective to ensure protection of SCs and STs against practices of untouchability, social discrimination and caste based atrocities.
Union: Odisha, Jharkhand, Bangalore, India,  Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Bihar

Title: JVM working committee meet
Content: JVM has called its working committee meeting on May 3. Informing about this party leader Bandhu Tirkey said that office bearers of the party would be elected besides passing several political resolutions defining future course of action for the party.

Title: Umashankar inaugurates Bhavantar Bhugtan Yojana
Content: Minister for Revenue, Science and Technology Umashankar Gupta, distributing certificates to the farmers in Pt laxmi Narayan Sharma Krishi Upaj Mandi, Bhopal, inaugurated the Bhavantar Bhugtan Yojana. Address of the Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan was given at Khurai of district Sagar was broadcasted live on the occasion. Gupta said that Bhavantar Bhugtan Yojana is not only a unique scheme of the country but also of the world. Gupta further mentioned that the State Government is constantly making efforts to double the farmers income. As a result, the state is being honoured with Krishi Karman award at national level constantly for the last 4 years.
Union: Khurai, Bhopal, Sagar, Pt laxmi Narayan Sharma Krishi Upaj Mandi

Title: No hurry, let BJP declare its candidate list first
Content: The Congress is not in a hurry. The party will wait for the declaration of candidates by the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). The Congress will declare the list of candidates thereafter, said All India Congress Committee, Screening Committee Chief for Chhattisgarh, Bhubaneswar Kalita on Sunday. Kalita, who arrived at state capital on a two day visit to the state on Sunday, while talking to some selected media persons here at State Congress Office Rajiv Bhawan, made the statement while answering on a query about delay in declaration of Congress candidates. With the statement of Kalita it is now quite clear that Congress has now moved towards to adopt the wait and watch policy.

Title: Decision on electoral alliance to be taken by High Command: Pb CM
Content: Punjab Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh on Tuesday made it clear that a decision on any electoral alliance in the state for 2019 lok Sabha elections would be taken by the Congress high command at an appropriate time. Chief Minister assertion came in reaction to a media query about the possibility of a poll alliance on the lines of the one forged by Samajwadi Party with BSP and Congress in Uttar Pradesh. Any decision in this regard would be taken by the party central leadership, said Capt Amarinder while talking to the media persons on the sidelines of the entrepreneurship and innovation convention. Capt Amarinder, in response to another question, hinted at a new Sports Minister being appointed in the state cabinet expansion, which is expected to take place soon. The new Sports Policy would be finalized thereafter, he added.

Title: Dhinakaran launches new party
Content: A new political outfit named after late Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa was launched on Thursday at Madurai. Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (Tamil for Progressive Party of Amma Followers) was launched on the first day of the Tamil month of Panguni which fell on Thursday. Panguni is the equivalent of Sanskrit month Phalguna. TTV Dhinakaran, the rebel AIADMK leader, told a mammoth crowd which had gathered at Melur in Madurai district that the launching of AMMK was not the end of his political journey. This is the beginning of a new political initiative.

Title: Capt approves upgradation of Mohali Govt hosp
Content: Punjab Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh on Thursday gave his nod to upgrade the existing Government Hospital Mohali from 200 to 300 beds, as a pre requisite for opening of a new Medical College as per the norms of Medical Council of India. Capt Amarinder, chairing a high level meeting to review the functioning of the Medical Education and Research Department, said that the new medical college at Mohali would be made functional at the earliest. To bring far more efficiency in the standard of medical education, the Chief Minister asked Baba Farid University of Health Sciences vice chancellor to crackdown on the non professional universities and institutions that were running medical courses by duping innocent students. He asked the VC to take stern action like slashing seats of courses being run by them, besides closing them down. Chief Minister also instructed the Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Satish Chandra to immediately take up the issue of opening of PGI satellite centre in Ferozepur with the Central Government, as 25 acre plot had already been identified in Mallwal Kadim village at Wazidpur for transfer after approval from the Central Government.
Union: Mallwal Kadim, Punjab, Wazidpur, Ferozepur, Mohali, India

Title: leT's Naveed Jatt, 2 others killed Bukhari: Police
Content: lashkar e Taiba (leT) terrorist Naveed Jatt along with two local terrorists murdered senior journalist Shujaat Bukhari here on June 14, police sources said on Wednesday. Naveed Jatt is a Pakistani who escaped from police custody from a Srinagar hospital on February 6 this year. " The other two terrorists involved in this terror murder are locals from south Kashmir areas," a sourc said. The Editor in Chief of English daily " Rising Kashmir" , Bukhari was shot dead by militants when he came out of his office in Press Enclave and was boarding his car. Two of his security guards were also killed in the incident.

Title: HP CM urges people to take part in Run for unity
Content: Himachal Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Sunday urged the people of the state to participate in large number in Run for Unity being organised on October 31, on the occasion of inauguration of the Statue of Unity, built in Gujarat as a tribute to iconic leader Sardar Ballabhbahi Patel. He said this while participating in a programme organised at DAV, New Shimla for the school children and general public to listen to the 'Mann Ki Baat' programme of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said that Mann Ki Baat is a unique initiative of the Prime Minister that is dedicated to the common people of the country. Through this programme, he raises various important issues concerning every section of the society and also gives honour to those people or organisations who had made even a little contribution for betterment of the society, Thakur said. He said this programme had gained popularity across the globe and people listen to it with great interest as they get a lot of inspiration from the words of the Prime Minister.
Union: Shimla, Himachal, Gujarat, Statue of Unity, New Shimla

Title: Cops told to give patient hearing to women victims
Content: The crimes committed against boys, girls and women should be dealt in a responsive manner. Whenever victims of these categories arrive at the police station, give them a patient hearing, said IG Bhopal Jaydeep Prasad while speaking at the daylong seminar on Prevention of Sexual Violence against Women and Girls organized by Jan Sahas and police at PTRI on Monday. He said that these are good opportunities in which police and social organization congregate and work for addressing crucial issue of crime against girls and women. It develops better understanding about the issue and coordination between police and social organization. Pointing to the time of reaction in handling these cases IG Prasad said that immediate action should be taken in such cases which could help in checking the increasing number of crimes against women and girls.

Title: BBMB inaugurates rooftop SPV plants
Content: Chandigarh: Bhakra Beas Management Board (BBMB) has planned to implement grid connected rooftop solar PV projects on the roofs of its buildings/offices, ground mounted and floating solar PV Plants as a part of its contribution to Renewable Energy initiatives of Union Ministry of New and Renewable Energy. BBMB installed Grid Connected Rooftop Solar Power Plant of total capacity of 100kWp at 220kV Substation, BBMB, Jalandhar and total capacity of 60kWp at 220kV substation BBMB, Jamalpur. Er. DK Sharma, chairman, BBMB inaugurated both these Rooftop PV Plants. Minimum annual generation expected from these solar power plants is 2.56 lakh units.

Title: Tereza Mihalikova wins ITF women Tennis tourney
Content: Tennis player Tereza Mihalikova of Slovakia won the trophy of singles match at the 15000 International Tennis Federation (ITF) Women Tennis Tournament. The semi finals of singles were played between Emily Webley Smith of Great Britain and Tereza Mihalikova of Slovakia here on Saturday at Arera Club court 1. The 15000 ITF Women Tennis Tournament Singles Final started with brief introduction of player to B.P Singh Chief Secretary of Madhya Pradesh and President of Arera Club, Bhopal. He was present as the Chief Guest of the tournament. To begin with the match, the toss was won by Emily Webley Smith (Great Britain) and she chose to receive the serve.
Union: Bhopal, Slovakia, Great Britain, Arera Club, Madhya Pradesh

Title: Mother's School holds Silver Jubilee fest
Content: The Mother Public School celebrated its Silver Jubilee function here with various events held from July to December. The silver jubilee logo, school merchandise and a commemorative postage stamp with special cover were inaugurated in July. Various events and inter school competitions were held which included school cinema screening, inter school short play competition, inter school quiz competition, inter school science exhibition and inter school rock band competitions. Students from schools all over Bhubaneswar participated in the events. Managing Director, Edumedia India and founder of School Cinema Syed Sultan Ahmed judged the entries for an inter school short movie competition in which several schools from all over the country participated.

Title: Women demand shifting of liquor shops
Content: Tension prevailed as hundreds of women on Wednesday blocked the Kendrapada - Orat road and staged a hunger strike demanding shifting of two liquor shops at Angulai, Chhak in the district. The shops have been established illegally and despite repeated appeals to the district administration for their shifting no action has been taken, the agitators alleged. The shops are located close to schools, temples and the Angulai panchayat office. People in general and particularly women are facing difficulties. The drunkards are creating nuisance and passing comments on women and girls.
Union: Angulai Chhak, Angulai, Kendrapada, Orat, Kendrapada Orat road

Title: Jawaharlal Nehru Agriculture University bags championship trophy at Agri Unifest
Content: Exhibiting an impressive show, the cultural team of Jawaharlal Nehru Agriculture University has bagged the Championship Trophy at the 18th All India Inter Agricultural Universities Youth Festival Agri Unifest 2017 2018. Notably, five day 18th All India Inter Agricultural Universities Youth Festival Agri Unifest 2017 2018 was held at Sri Venkateswara Veterinary University, Tirupati. Students from 54 agricultural universities from 23 States of across the country participated in the festival. The fest was held from February 12 till 16. Amazingly, competing with about 2,000 students from different universities, the students of Jawaharlal Nehru Agriculture University, Jabalpur won the championship trophy.

Title: Vedanta to set up 2 ultramodern patho labs
Content: The Jharsugada Vedanta management would establish two ultramodern pathology laboratory and diagnostic centres in Jharsuguda and laikera blocks in Jharsuguda district, as per a decision of an RPDAC meeting. The meeting was held on Saturday at the district Collectorate wherein it was decided that these projects would be inaugurated by the end of August this year. The meeting was presided over by Collector Bibhuti Bhusan Patnaik. Jharsuguda MlA Naba Kishore Das, who joined the meeting, said Vedanta should initiate construction work of the two projects on priority as per its Corporate Social Responsibility. Keeping proper coordination with the concerned tehsildars, necessary steps would be taken for early identification of land for the projects, said Das.

Title: Two youths missing in Puri sea
Content: Two youths went missing when they were taking bath along with their friends at the sea here on Friday afternoon. The missing youths were identified as Akash Khakka and Jadumani Sekhar Bachha. The duo along with six others had come to Bhubaneswar from Bargarh to play a cricket tournament. But as there was no match on the day, they visited Puri to have a darshan of the holy Trinity. later, all of them decided to bath in the sea near Chaitanya Chowk, but four of them went missing.

Title: Natl awardee teacher says, I believe in work
Content: Om Prakash Mishra, in charge headmaster of Government High School of Jeypore, who was the lone teacher from Odisha to receive the National Teacher Award, got a warm welcome from the denizens here. 48 year old Mishra received the award for the year 2017 from Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu in New Delhi on the Teachers Day. He was among 45 teachers selected throughout the country for the national award by the Ministry of Human Resources Development. Mishra said he began his teaching career from the remote Mathapada village high school under Boipariguda block of Koraput district in the year 1998. During his stay at Mathapada, he realised that practical classes were difficult to be conducted in rural areas as science equipment were not easily available.
Union: Odisha, Boipariguda, Jeypore, Koraput, Mathapada, New Delhi

Title: After decade on air, DU unplugs community radio
Content: The voice of hundreds of Delhi University student lost connection on Friday as the Delhi University Community Radio (DUCR) buzzed for the last time. Though the varsity did not officially announce the closure of the community radio but the in charge of DU Radio directed the members of DUCR to pack their bags and leave. DUCR 90.4 MHz was started under former Chancellor Deepak Pental and was inaugurated by the former Minister of Science and Technology Kapil Sibal in 2007. More than 1,000 students coming from different colleges of DU were associated with as volunteers. Though its reach was not as big as compared to the other radio stations but with a 50 watt transmitter within a 13 km radius it became a stepping stone for thousands of students to have career in broadcasting.

Title: Six killed in hooch tragedy in Barabanki
Content: A strong legislation handing capital punishment to those selling spurious liquor in the state, failed to improve the situation as six persons died and one other was battling for his life after consuming hooch in Barabanki on Tuesday night. District Magistrate Akhilesh Tewari ordered a probe to confirm whether the incident took place due to spurious liquor or some other reason. All three bodies were sent for autopsy. As per reports, villagers of Dewa area of Barabanki organised a liquor party on Tuesday night but soon, the condition of five persons deteriorated and they had to be rushed to District Hospital. Four of them Umesh (22) of Ratanpur area, Mata Prasad (52) of Jasanwara area, Satnam of Salarpur area and Naumi lal Gautam (28) of Devgaon area, died soon after reaching hospital.
Union: Ratanpur, Barabanki, Devgaon, Jasanwara, Salarpur, Dewa

Title: Bulandshahr incident  unfortunate: RLD
Content: Terming the Bulandshahr incident as unfortunate, Rashtriya Lok Dal state president Masood Ahmad demanded a CBI probe into the sequence of events leading to the violence. He said the incident was the outcome of misgovernance and irresponsible statement of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. " At the time of assuming power, Yogi boosted the morale of police officers by asking them to gun down criminals and this resulted in the killing of several innocents. On the other hand, the Chief Minister also encouraged workers of Bharatiya Janata Party and its frontal outfits like Hindu Yuva Vahini, Bajrang Dal and Vishwa Hindu Parishad, promising action against officers who did not listen to their complaints. This emboldened both the police and workers of the BJP and its frontal outfits and led to numerous showdowns in the past," Masood Ahmad pointed out. "

Title: Health Minister visits urology camp at Sewa Sadan
Content: Health Minister Rustam Singh visited to 89th Urology camp held at Sewa Sadan Eye Hospital of Sant Nagar on Tuesday. He took an account of performed surgeries and met the ailing and operated patients in the camp. Health Minister inquired about the services, facilities and quality of post operative care of the patients. He was very happy to know that all the patients were seen quite satisfied and happy. He said that the most of the patients have told him that the services of Sewa Sadan Eye Hospital are better than the heaven.

Title: JJP announces candidates in Haryana
Content: Days after alliance between Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and Jannayak Janta Party (JJP), the duo party on Thursday announced that AAP in Haryana will field its candidate from Ambala, Karnal and Faridabad. Meanwhile, on Thursday JJP announced names of its candidates Bhiwani Mahendragarh, Sirsa, Rohtak and Hisar seats. AAP and the Jannayak Janata Party (JJP) have formed an alliance in the State and they will fight the Lok Sabha elections on three and seven seats respectively. JJP founder Dushyant Chautala said he will seek re election from Hisar, while Pradeep Deswala will be the party candidate from Rohtak. Nirmal Singh Malhadi will contest from Sirsa and Swati Yadav from Bhiwani Mahendragarh, he said.
Union: Sirsa, Hisar, Haryana, Rohtak, Ambala, Faridabad, Karnal,  Ambala, Bhiwani Mahendragarh

Title: Onion to be dearer by Rs 6-10/kg: Min
Content: Even as consumers are already hit hard due to the hike in the price of onion in the State, Food Civil Supplies Minister Ranendra Pratap Swain on Tuesday said the rate of the vegetable would go up further by Rs 6 to Rs 10 per kg in coming days. Swain told reporters, We expect that the price of onion will further increase by Rs 6 10 as the domestic market completely depends on the price, availability, quality and quantity of onion in Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Maharashtra. The onion farming in these three States has been affected by rains this year, he said. On the question of the Odisha Government intervention in controlling the price, the Minister said, We will discuss with traders about the onion price hike and set up centres to provide the vegetable at a subsidised rate. The Government will take measures that will suit best to the people.

Title: Police close to solving armed robbery case, says Choubey
Content: In the armed robbery case at Dev Jewellers in Premnagar, district police have raided various locations in Jharkhand and Bihar to nab both the accused. Superintendent of Police (city) Shweta Choubey said they are close to working out the case and soon the robbers will be behind bars. According to officials, the victim Devendra, owner of the jewellery shop has also expressed his suspicion on some of his family friends, with whom he reportedly had an argument a fortnight before the incident. On late October 7 afternoon, two armed robbers looted nearly Rs 60 lakh worth of jewellery and Rs 2.5 lakh cash from Dev Jewellers in Premnagar. Dehradun Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Arun Mohan Joshi has also ordered Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Pallavi Tyagi to find out the reason behind the reported lapse on behalf of district police at checking points because of which the accused got time to escape.
Union: Jharkhand, Dehradun, Premnagar, Bihar, Dev Jewellers

Title: 2 women fliers held with Rs 1.75 cr foreign currency at IGIA
Content: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) officials have apprehended two women passengers with foreign currency worth Rs 1.75 crore on suspicion that the money was being smuggled out from Indira Gandhi International (IGI) airport in national Capital. According to a senior CISF official, the seizures were made over two days in separate cases. In the first case, that took place on Wednesday, Maryam Garba, a Nigerian national, was nabbed by the Central Industrial Security Force personnel at the Indira Gandhi International Airport for allegedly carrying currencies of different countries to the tune of Rs 1.61 crore. She was travelling to Dubai and could not explain the reason for carrying so much cash in multiple currencies like US dollars, Singaporean dollars and Swiss Franc, said the senior CISF official adding that the woman has been handed over to the Customs Department for further probe. In the second incident, that took place Tuesday evening, Saudi Arabia national Samar Amer Zanbaa was apprehended with a cache of USD worth Rs 14.25 lakh.

Title: National health forum requests Centre to ban e-cigarettes
Content: National Health Forum, an orgnisation working in the field of tobacco control, has requested the Centre to support Union Health Ministry decision to end manufacture, distribution, import and sale of e cigarettes and ensure that such products are banned.  All other Ministries must support this move and ensure that such products are banned and are not included as legal products under the COTPA (Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act) or the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, said Mandakini Sinh of National Health Forum.

Title: Sati Kund faces neglect despite HC orders
Content: A site of archaeological and religious importance, the historical Sati Kund located in Kankhal has for long been suffering from neglect. Following high court orders last year in June, some hope had arisen that the sacred pond would regain its original form. With the initiative taken by district administration, water supply was replenished in the pond (Kund) but due to lack of maintenance and proper water drainage system, it has again become a site in need of attention with mosquitoes and stink arising from the pond. Notably, following a PIL by a Nainital resident, the court had ordered the state government to remove encroachments from the Sati Kund area and restore it back to its original form. The dried up pond was again filled with water with water supply facilitated from the Ganga canal but with no provision to clean the pond and drain out stale water, has become a source of stench affecting even the surrounding residential area.

Title: Cartoon row: Left Govt asks akademi to review award decision
Content: The Left Government in Kerala on Friday asked a state run akademi to review its decision honouring a cartoon depicting Bishop Franco Mullakal as a rooster and alluding to the charge of rape against him. Cultural Affairs Minister A K Balan told the State Assembly that the Government is of the opinion that the cartoon has " hurt" the sentiments of the Christian community. " The Government has already taken a stand that the akademi should review its decision," Balan said. The cartoon titled 'Viswasam Rakshathi' (protection of faith) by K K Subhash of Chengalam and selected by the Kerala Lalithakala Akademi for this years award, had appeared in a Malayalam magazine last year after Mullakal was accused of rape by a nun. Showing Mullakal as a rooster, it also has a pink coloured lingerie in the crosier (staff), carried by a bishop as a symbol of the pastoral office, while a group of nuns is shown fleeing.

Title: AH IVF & Infertility Research Centre celebrates 15K IVF kids
Content: The AH IVF Infertility Research Centre, Ranchi entered in its 18th year celebrating the success journey of around 15,000 kids so far born through In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) technique here. The specialised research and treatment centre established under the supervision of Dr. Jayashree Bhattacharya and other renowned specialists in 2001 has been running successfully providing holistic treatment at an affordable cost to all those couples who need expert medical care. Dr. Jayshree Bhattacharya, IVF Specialist and Director of the centre while addressing the media on the occasion said, At Ranchi centre alone, 15,000 babies were born through IVF treatment since the inception of this centre. The conceiving rate in these special cases has gone up to 60 per cent now. Earlier, it was merely 20 per cent.

Title: Human chain formed to spread voting awareness
Content: A large number of people took part in forming a human chain aiming to aware voters to exercise their franchise to strengthen democracy here on Saturday. The human chain was formed under Systematic Voters' Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) programme. The eight kms stretch from ITI More, Chas to Bokaro Airport was to motivate people to exercise their franchise, informed Rahul Kumar Bharti DPRO Bokaro. The district administration succeeded in making a Human Chain with help of over thousands of people including Jharkhand Police and CRPF jawans, people from various social organizations, college principals, professors and students, teachers, Sakhi Mandal members, Sahia's, employees form PSU's and other plant units, the district administration officers and staffs, general voters, brand ambassadors from colleges, PWD brand ambassadors and others in order to create voter awareness. Cops and students holding placards sensitized voters about the importance of voting.

Title: Gangster Budda's interrogation lead to arrest of 15 criminals
Content: The arrest of dreaded gangster Sukhpreet Singh alias Budda, recently deported from Armenia by the Punjab Police, has led to the arrest of 15 of his criminal associates, along with seizure of a large number of weapons, drugs and foreign currency. The arrests include that of retired Deputy Passport Officer Bidhi Chand, who was posted as Public Relations Officer (PRO) in Chandigarh during 2007 08. He received Rs 50,000 from one Gaurav Patyal to prepare his Indian passport on a fake name and address and to deliver it by hand to him. Bidhi Chand retired as Deputy Passport Officer in 2011. Budda has been trying to get into US illegally from Armenia at the time of his detention.

Title: 5 held for kidnapping, killing GK businessman
Content: The Delhi Police Crime Branch have arrested five men for allegedly kidnapping and strangling a 64 year old businessman and a resident of posh Greater Kailash area to death. Police said that Arun Sharma was abducted and murdered by hired killers on November 15 and his body was disposed off the same day near Jhansi in Uttar Pradesh. Police said Arun had his own electronics business in South Delhi. The accused have been identified as Dr Rishi Rajpal Singh Chauhan, (64), Hitesh Chauhan (29), Amet Vikram Chhabra (32), Priyank Khanna (34) and Sahil (25), all residents of Gurugram. They were arrested on Wednesday.
Union: South Delhi, Delhi, Greater Kailash, Uttar Pradesh, Jhansi, Gurugram

Title: MPs, MLAs write to PM over MNREGA funds shortage
Content: Members of Parliament and State Assemblies from Karnataka, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Haryana, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Bihar besides activists have alleged that fund shortage under MNREGA is causing a grave situation of rural distress in the country. In a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, they urged him to renew his Government political commitment to the rural job flagship scheme. On Friday, MPs including Karan Singh Yadav, Rajeev Gowda and K Raju, MLAs like Jignesh Mewani and Prithiviraj Chavan and members of the Peoples Action for Employment Guarantee, NREGA Sangharsh Morcha, Samruddha Bharat Foundation and prominent economists and activists like Jayati Ghosh, Prabhat Patnaik, Aruna Roy and Harsh Mandar shared with media persons their concerns and measures needed for strengthening MGNREGA as a concrete response to the grave situation of rural distress in the country. They pointed out that as per the Management Information System (MIS), 99 per cent of this year allocation is already exhausted and no additional funds have been approved. With the lean agricultural season beginning, demand for work will increase but the programme is starved of funds.
Intersection: Maharashtra, Gujarat, Haryana, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Bihar
Union: Maharashtra, Gujarat, Haryana, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Bihar

Title: SER GM holds high level meeting
Content: General Manager, S E Railway Lalit Chandra Trivedi, held a high level meeting with all Principal Head of Departments and Divisional Railway Managers of S E Railway to review the performance of this railway on Wednesday. The GM was apprised of various key activities of S E Railway in area of freight loading, passenger performance, punctuality of train running etc. Trivedi laid emphasis on the ongoing projects, passenger amenities, safety and security of passengers etc. He discussed about curtailing of expenditure and austerity, reduce carbon emission and sound pollution by running train with HOG (Head On Generation), conversion of existing coaches to LHB coaches for passenger comfort safety and to carry more passengers. He specially maentioned to take all out efforts to increase non fare revenue and elimination of manned level crossings by construction of Road Over Bridge.

Title: SP-BSP gathbandhan on ventilator, says UP Dy CM
Content: With fissures apparently appearing in the alliance of Samajwadi Party and Bahujan Samaj Party, Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Dinesh Sharma Monday said the gathbandhan (of SP BSP) is today taking its last breath, and is on ventilator . Thanks to the developmental works of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, people have broken the barriers of caste and religion. The gathbandhan is today taking its last breath, and is on ventilator, he told PTI here. He added, Alliances of opposing ideologies are never successful be it the SP Congress or the BSP Congress. All experiments to forge caste based alliances in Uttar Pradesh have proved to be a failure.

Title: Indian Institute of Skills in Mumbai soon
Content: In a bid to take skill training and entrepreneurship development to the next level, the Union Government intends to set up the Indian Institute of Skills (IIS) in Mumbai. Talking to media persons after Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis for a discussion on the proposed initiative, Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship (MSDE) Dr Mahendra Nath Pandey said that the Government was working towards fulfilling Prime Minister Narendra Modi vision of setting up world class Skill Training Institutes in India and enabling the young generation to acquire skills at par with global standards. He said the first step was being taken in the form of Indian Institute of Skills (IIS). The idea was conceived by our Prime Minister during his visit to Singapore Institute of Technical Education. We will lay the foundation stone for IIS soon, the Minister said.

Title: Woman commits suicide
Content: A 30 year old woman committed suicide by consuming poisonous substance at Ibrahimpura on Wednesday Talaiya police have registered case and started investigation. According to the police, Suman Chourasia reported illness and started vomiting and was rushed to a nearby hospital where she died during treatment. Police said that the deceased was pursuing LLB from MLB College and consumed poisonous substance to commit suicide. The family members were not aware of the reason behind the death. No suicide note has been recovered.

Title: Hry CM seeks votes in his constituency
Content: Campaigning in Karnal Assembly constituency for the first time after filing nomination papers, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday promised to the people of his constituency that he would continue to work for their progress and development and also of the entire State. Khattar started his election campaign from Model Town, Karnal by offering flowerr at the Temple. He also took blessings at a Gurudwara. On the occasion, local residents and Party leaders and supporters welcomed him by raising slogans in his favour and the party. Addressing the gathering, the Chief Minister said that the people of Karnal have entrusted him with the responsibility of the head of the State by making him an MLA.

Title: Integrated Command and Control Centre inaugurated in Doon
Content: Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat inaugurated the Dehradun integrated command and control centre Sadaiv Doon built at cost of Rs 234.85 crore under the Smart City mission at IT Park on Wednesday. Addressing the gathering on the occasion, Rawat said that prime minister Narendra Modi had presented to the nation the plan for developing 100 cities across the nation into smart cities. Though Dehradun was selected in the fourth round, the city has managed to rise in the rankings to the 25th position. He said that Dehradun will be the nation first city under the project which will be developed as a fully smart city. Paying homage to former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his birth anniversary, he announced that the new collectorate building being built under the project will be named after Vajpayee.

Title: Online transfer policy for school teachers Okayed
Content: To make process of teachers transfers more rational and transparent, Punjab Cabinet on Wednesday approved Online Transfer Policy 2019 of School Education Department thus ensuring equal opportunity for all employees using online method for seeking transfers. At the same time, Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh had asked all departments to come up with performance based review policy for transfer of employees. The transfer policy would become effective from academic session 2019 20, that is April 1, 2019, and would be applicable to all teaching cadre posts ETT, HT, CHT, Master, C V, lecturer, vocational masters, principals and headmasters, except employees on extension of services after attaining the age of superannuation. Posts of ministerial cadre, block officers, district officers, principal DIETS shall not be covered under the policy. In the new policy, the Department has done away with the condition of teachers to be compulsorily transferred after seven years of service in a particular zone or school.

Title: Assam polls: Open to tie-up talks with Congress, says AIUDF's Maulana Badruddin Ajmal
Content: NEW DELHI: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) leader Maulana Badruddin Ajmal has said that his party main objective is to ensure the defeat of BJP in 2016 Assam assembly polls and to ensure it he " is ready to discuss with a positive mind the possibility of an alliance/understanding with Congress. " AIUDF is the main Opposition party in the Assam assembly. Speaking to ET in New Delhi on Thursday a day before Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi reached Assam for launching his party pre election campaign Ajmal who had a meeting with JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar, who is making efforts to help the Congress stitch a Bihar like broader anti BJP alliance, said: " So far, I have not had any talks with the Congress leadership on the issue of AIUDF and Congress entering into an alliance or understanding for the Assem assembly elections. At the same time, I would like to say if Congress takes the initiative my party is ready to discuss with a positive mind the possibility of an alliance or understanding with the Congress. " Ajmal, whose party has a significant support among Muslim voters in over twenty assembly segments in lower Assam, said AIUDF main objective in the Assam elections is to ensure BJP defeat. "
Union: NEW DELHI, Assam, Bihar, New Delhi

Title: Panel may call Amit Shah for finding weight to probe lift trap incident
Content: NEW DELHI: The commission of inquiry set up by the Bihar government to find out why BJP president Amit Shah and four others were trapped inside a lift in a government guest house in Patna on August 20, is set to summon Shah and his fellow travellers to place evidence before it. The commission could ask Shah, three other BJP leaders and his security officer who were in the lift, to step on a weighing machine to officially record their weights, according to sources. As per the Commission of Inquiry Act, the summons will be soon issued to those who were trapped inside the lift as well to those officials who were in charge of the maintenance of the government guest house and its facilities, including the operation of the lift, said the source. Since there have been two conflicting claims, with the BJP state leaders alleging a conspiracy behind the lift stranding incident and some officials maintaining it was due to overweight in the lift, the commission will, naturally, probe both angles, including whether the combined weight of the five people stuck in the lift was below or above the officially permissible limit of 340 kg, the source added. Amit Shah, along with his senior party colleagues Bhupender Yadav, Saudan Singh, Nagendra and a security officer were trapped in the lift for about 10 minutes before CRPF personnel forcefully opened the door and helped them come out.

Title: AK Antony gets clean chit on health
Content: WASHINGTON: Former defence minister AK Antony, who was in the US for a medical check up, has been given a clean bill of health by the prestigious Mayo Clinic in Minnesota. Antony, who turned 75 yesterday, was accompanied by his wife Elizabeth and son Anil during the trip. Doctors at Mayo Clinic gave a clean bill of health. The Chicago chapter of the Indian National Overseas Congress (USA) organised an event over the weekend to celebrate Antony's birthday. In his address Antony praised the non resident Indians for their commitment to their ancestral land and encouraged them to continue to build bridges between the US and India.

Title: Proposed odd and even formula for vehicles on Delhi roads is for short term: CSE
Content: NEW DELHI: Restraining explosive growth of vehicles on Delhi roads and rationing their movement were identified as key actions for improving the capital air quality months before Kejriwal government announced its decision to allow cars with odd and even numbers on alternate days from January 1. In the rounds of discussions the Delhi government had with various environmental organisations and urban planning experts over the last few months, rationalisation of car movement on high air pollution days was one of the recommendations as a most immediate measures to check deteriorating air quality, some experts said. Sometimes you need a certain shock in the system to get everyone top actually act on pressing issues, said Anumita Roy Chowdhury, executive director for research and advocacy at non profit Centre for Science Environment (CSE). She said it was suggested as a short term measure to supplement a host of medium and longterm action plans to improve Delhi air. This is not a plan for 365 days but a short term one to be implemented with a full fledged plan and strategy and we support the move fully, she told ET.

Title: Hit & run case: Doctor's 2 versions on whether Salman Khan was drunk
Content: MUMBAI: A doctor today told a local court hearing the hit and run case allegedly involving super star Salman Khan that the actor smelt of alcohol when he was brought for a blood test soon after the incident though during clinical examination the same day it appeared he was not under the influence of liquor. " The patient's (Salman) pupils were slightly dilated, speech was coherent and walking steps were normal during clinical examination," Dr Shashikant Pawar told Special Public Prosecutor Pradeep Gharat in the court. According to police, Khan's car had rammed into a roadside shop in suburban Bandra killing one person and injuring four people who were sleeping on pavement on September 28, 2002. The actor was taken to Government run J J Hospital soon after the mishap for necessary examination. Pawar at that time was attached to the hospital.

Title: Major fire in South Mumbai's Crawford market
Content: MUMBAI: A major fire broke out in South Mumbai's busy Crawford market in the wee hours today, gutting over 60 shops. Fire officials said there was no casualty reported in the blaze. " Our control room received an alert at 5:23 AM that a massive fire broke out at Crawford market. Soon 10 fire tenders and eight water tankers were pressed into action," a fire brigade official told PTI. The official said the blaze has been brought under control but efforts to douse it completely was still on.

Title: CM Vasundhara Raje launches colourful autos to display state's art, culture
Content: JAIPUR: Ahead of Rajasthan Resurgent Partnership Summit slated later this month, Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje today launched scores of colourful auto rickshaws displaying state's rich art and culture. Raje also took a ride in one such colourful auto from her residence here, an official said. About 100 autos have been painted colourfully to display the state's culture. These autos will promote folk art, he said. These autos would move around the venue of the investment meet to give travellers a feel of change, the official said.

Title: Non-registration of marriage no ground for rejecting FPS: Madras HC
Content: MADURAI: Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has ruled that non production of marriage registration certificate cannot be a ground for rejection of family pension to the wife of a government employee. Allowing a petition by 54 year old Thavamani, Justice S Vaidhyanathan held as unacceptable the argument of concerned officer that marriage registration certificate was mandatory and that unless or until the same was produced by the petitioner the family pension could not be extended. " The officer's order is set aside. The officer is directed to extend the family pension to the petitioner without insisting upon the certificate," the judge said. Petitioner had applied for family pension after her husband Raju, who had worked as Revenue Supervisor in Tamilnadu Power Generation and Distribution Corporation (TANGEDCO), died last year.

Title: Bihar polls 2015: BJP chief & senior leaders going extra mile to pacify dissenters
Content: PATNA: With BJP national president Amit Shah camping in Patna, the party has started adopting a conciliatory approach towards its leaders who are sulking after being denied tickets to the upcoming assembly polls. Senior BJP leader Radha Mohan Singh on Tuesday evening visited the house of Dilmani Devi, who has been denied ticket to contest from Brahampur assembly seat in Buxar district. Devi, daughter in law of late Kailashpati Mishra, BJP most prominent face and one of its founders, had won the seat in 2010 assembly polls. " Even today, the state organisational secretary Nagendraji came to meet me. I have requested him to field me from my seat as BJP nominee," Devi told ET on the phone.

Title: Congress Working Committee meet on Tuesday, likely to discuss roadmap to revamp party
Content: NEW DELHI: A crucial meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) will be held on Tuesday which is expected to deliberate on the roadmap to revamp the party in the wake of its worst debacle in the Lok Sabha polls. It is also likely to come out with an action plan to take on the Narendra Modi government on issues like the controversial land ordinance which is emerging as a rallying point for opposition parties. The meeting convened by party chief Sonia Gandhi will discuss the current political situation at a time when the Congress is sensing an opportunity to reach out to farmers on the issue. AICC has already asked state units to launch agitations on the matter before February 15 when the Budget session of Parliament is expected to begin. The meeting has also come at a time when party chief Gandhi has asked PCC chiefs to hold a series of consultative meets with party leaders to elicit views and coalesce consensus on core issues and has underlined the need to redraft its socio economic policies.

Title: PM Narendra Modi has raised India's profile on the world stage: Lord Swraj Paul
Content: NEW DELHI: Leading NRI industrialist Lord Swraj Paul today praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for " raising" India's profile on the world stage and his efforts towards educating the girl child. Paul, the chairman of UK based Caparo group, said that the last Indian leader to have the stature of Modi was Indira Gandhi and called upon the businesses to treat this moment as an " opportunity" . " Modi government has promised delivery. The first majority government after 30 years. He has given hope and raised the profile of India. "

Title: Herald case: Judge recuses from hearing Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi plea
Content: NEW DELHI: A judge of the Delhi High Court today recused himself from hearing the Congress President Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's pleas for stay of the trial court order summoning them and three others in the National Herald case. Justice V P Vaish said he will not hear the matter as his roster of cases has been changed and directed that the petitions be listed before an appropriate bench. The judge, had on August 6 stayed the summons issued against the Gandhis and others, and on December 15, 2014 had listed the matter for today, to be heard on day to day basis. The court on December 15, 2014, had also stayed the summons till final disposal of the petitions. BJP leader Subramanian Swamy opposed the judge's recusal and requested that the matter be heard by the same court which has been largely dealing with it, as a fresh hearing of the case would further delay the issue.

Title: 4 MCD staffers, private firm honchos convicted in CWG street-lighting scam
Content: NEW DELHI: Four Municipal Corporation of Delhi employees and two directors of a private company have been convicted by a Special CBI Court here in a case of corruption in a street lighting project undertaken by the civic body during the Commonwealth Games of 2010. A CBI spokesperson said here today that the then Superintending Engineer DK Sugan, Executive Engineer OP Mahla, Accountant Raju V and Tender clerk Gurucharan Singh, all of whom were with MCD, have been convicted in the case along with the business entity Sweska Power Tech Engineers Pvt Ltd and its Managing Director, TP Singh, and Director, JP Singh. She said the quantum of the sentence will be pronounced tomorrow. CBI had alleged that the MCD officials had entered into a conspiracy while awarding the tender to the private firm for upgrading the street lighting on roads in Delhi under the jurisdiction of the civic body. They manipulated the tender documents of L 1, causing pecuniary loss of Rs 3.62 crore to the government and corresponding undue pecuniary advantage to the private firm. "

Title: OROP: AAP MLA urges President to intervene on behalf of ex- servicemen
Content: NEW DELHI: AAP MLA Col (retd) Devinder Sehrawat, who skipped the President's at home reception on Independence Day over the 'One Rank, One Pension' (OROP) demand, has written to Pranab Mukherjee seeking his intervention on behalf of the protesting ex servicemen. " I have to inform you with a heavy heart that the ex servicemen are languishing on the road, undergoing shabby and disgraceful treatment at the hands of police and municipal authorities, as they protest for their rightful demand of OROP. " Pardon my audacity, but they do expect your intervention in the matter," Sehrawat said in his letter yesterday to the President who is the Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces. The AAP legislator from Bijwasan constituency, Sehrawat also said he will " actively" participate in a dharna called by ex servicemen over the OROP demand as no firm time frame has been declared for its implementation. Ex servicemen are holding a protest at Jantar Mantar and in other parts of the country for two months demanding early implementation of OROP.

Title: Delhi elections 2015: In Janakpuri, Jagdish Mukhi to contest against son-in-law
Content: NEW DELHI: He stood by his father in law, Jagdish Mukhi, who is the BJP candidate from Janakpuri, during most of his election campaigns in the past. But this time, Suresh Kumar has decided to take on Mukhi from a rival camp. Congress' decision to field Suresh from the constituency will make the contest exciting. While some residents say Mukhi will bag the seat once again as he has represented the area since 1979, others say it is time for a change. But Mukhi and Suresh don't consider each other a challenge. "

Title: Lalit Modi controversy: Sushma Swaraj hits back at journalist who raked up propriety issue
Content: NEW DELHI: Under attack for helping fugitive former IPL boss Lalit Modi obtain travel documents in UK, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj today hit back at a TV journalist who had raked up the issue of propriety in the matter. " Look who is preaching propriety of all the persons. . . ," Swaraj tweeted. Swaraj has been under attack by political parties and others for helping scam-tainted Modi to obtain British travel documents after the disclosure of emails showing that she had spoken to Indian-origin British MP Keith Vaz and its High Commissioner here James Bevan seeking favours for the former cricket administrator, who had to go to Portugal, purportedly for his wife's cancer treatment in June last year. After the reports surfaced, 63-year-old Swaraj said in a series of tweets that she had taken a "humanitarian view" and conveyed to the British High Commissioner that they should examine Modi's request as per their rules and "if the British government chooses to give travel documents to Lalit Modi - that will not spoil our bilateral relations". She has been strongly supported from the government and the BJP which rejected opposition demands for her resignation over alleged "impropriety".

Title: Police to record Radhe Maa's statement in dowry case
Content: MUMBAI: Police will record the statement of self styled godwoman Radhe Maa in connection with a dowry harassment case only after recording the statements of other accused against whom summons was issued today. Summons was issued against six persons, excluding Radhe Maa, who are accused in the case, a senior police officer said. Pointing out that summons was not served on the godwoman, senior inspector of Borivali police station, Mukund Pawar said, " We have not issued any summons or have not initiated any kind of police procedure regarding the godwoman. " " Once the statements of the six accused are recorded by police, the police will call Maa for (recording of) her statement," he said, adding that statement of the six accused will be recorded from Monday. The summons was issued after police registered an FIR against Radhe Maa and others earlier this week, including in laws of the 32 year old complainant who has accused them of " mental and physical harassment for dowry" .

Title: India expresses deep concern over firing incidents in Birgunj, Nepal
Content: NEW DELHI: India today expressed deep concern over firing incidents in Birgunj in which an Indian was killed on Indo Nepal border and asked its freight transporters to exercise caution and not put themselves in danger, an advisory which may deepen the supply crisis to the Himalayan nation. The government also said that it was monitoring the situation carefully. " We are deeply concerned at reports coming in of firing today in Birgunj. An innocent Indian was also killed in the firing. Issues facing Nepal are political in nature and cannot be resolved by force.

Title: Environment cases to be disposed of in a year: National Green Tribunal
Content: JALANDHAR: Chairperson of National Green Tribunal Justice Swatanter Kumar today said the tribunal has set a deadline of one year for disposing of cases pertaining to environmental problems, as he cited Delhi's example where he said children were facing a number of health problems due to " ever increasing pollution" . Addressing a function organised by Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) to mark the World Environment Day here today, Justice Kumar said the tribunal was making all out efforts to make the country free from environmental pollution. He said that one year deadline has been set to ensure quick justice to petitioners in such cases of immense public importance. The NGT chairperson said that even in Delhi, small children are facing " a number of health problems due to the ever increasing pollution, which is a cause of worry for all of them. " Kumar categorically said that till now, 82 per cent of cases filed in the NGT have been disposed of. "

Title: Delhi elections 2015: Rahul Gandhi votes
Content: NEW DELHI: Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi was among the high profile people who turned up early to vote for the Delhi Assembly elections in which his party is facing a herculean task as the contest is seen confined largely between AAP and BJP. Clad in a white kurta, blue jeans and a half jacket, the 44 year old leader cast his ballot at booth number 88 in Aurangzeb Lane in New Delhi constituency. There was no queue when he arrived at the booth at around 10:10 AM. After casting his vote, Gandhi flashed his inked finger for the shutterbugs. Gandhi did not respond to any question by the waiting media.

Title: Flipkart content objectionable for Telangana
Content: NEW DELHI: What does Flipkart, an ecommerce major, have in common with Iambesharam.com, Thatspersonal.com and Ohmysecrets.com? Nothing, it would seem. But all four are on a list of websites the government of Telengana wants blocked for objectionable content. A senior government official told ET the state government feels some websites need to be blocked to avert crimes against women as there is a strong concern that viewing porn sites is leading to crime against women. The state government has sought our help in directing various internet service providers (ISPs) to set up appropriate software tools which will block content violating the provisions of the IT Act of 2000, as amended by amendment ACT 2008, the official told ET.

Title: Government's social media campaign claims investors spellbound, women safe & NDA better than UPA
Content: NEW DELHI: The government has unleashed a social media campaign titled NDA government in Action to highlight how Modi magic has spellbound investors and how the BJP government performance has trumped UPA basically saying Ache Din are here. The campaign also claims women have started feeling more independent than earlier and now contribute more to society. ET has accessed the complete 60 slide bilingual presentation prepared by the New Media Cell of the Information Broadcasting Ministry in consultation with the Prime Minister Office.
